code of ordinances city of titusville florida ____________ volume i ____________ ____________ adopted  effective  ____________ published in 1992 by order of the city council ____________ officials of the city of titusville florida at the time of this codification ____________ thomas r mariani mayor ____________ hector figueredo vern jansen l v woody rice terry tolbert city council ____________ randall h reid city manager ____________ dwight w severs city attorney ____________ janet camacho city clerk ____________ karan j rounsavall deputy city clerk preface this volumes i and ii constitutes a complete recodification of the general and permanent ordinances of the city of titusville florida source materials used in the preparation of the the 1963 as supplemented  and ordinances subsequently adopted by the city council the source of each section is included in the history note appearing in parentheses at the end thereof the absence of such a note indicates that the section is new and was adopted for the first time with the adoption of the use of the comparative tables appearing in the back of this the reader can locate any section of the 1963 as supplemented and any subsequent ordinance included herein the chapters of the volume i have been conveniently arranged in alphabetical order and the various sections within each chapter have been catchlined to facilitate usage notes which tie related sections of the which refer to relevant state law have been included a table listing the state law citations and setting forth their location within the included at the back of this land development regulations are printed in volume ii numbering system the numbering system used in this volume i is the same system used in many state and local government codes each section number consists of two parts separated by a dash the figure before the dash refers to the chapter number and the figure after the dash refers to the position of the section within the chapter thus the second section of is numbered 12 and the first section of is 41 under this system each section is identified with its chapter and at the same time new sections or even whole chapters can be inserted in their proper place by using the decimal system for amendments for example if new material consisting of one section that would logically come between sections 31 and 32 is desired to be added such new section would be numbered 315 new chapters may be included in the same manner if the new material is to be included between chapters 12 and 13 it will be designated as care should be taken that the alphabetical arrangement of chapters is maintained when including new chapters new articles and new divisions may be included in the same way or in the case of articles may be placed at the end of the chapter embracing the subject and in the case of divisions may be placed at the end of the article embracing the subject the next successive number shall be assigned to the new article or division indexes the indexes have been prepared with the greatest of care each particular item has been placed under several headings some of which are couched in lay phraseology others in legal terminology and still others in language generally used by local government officials and employees there are numerous cross references within the indexes themselves which stand as guideposts to direct the user to the particular item in which the user is interested looseleaf supplements a special feature of this publication is the looseleaf system of binding and supplemental servicing of the publication with this system the publication will be kept uptodate subsequent amendatory legislation will be properly edited and the appropriate page or pages affected will be reprinted these new pages will be distributed to holders of copies of the publication with instructions for the manner of inserting the new pages and deleting the obsolete pages keeping this publication uptodate at all times will depend largely upon the holder of the publication as revised sheets are received it will then become the responsibility of the holder to have the amendments inserted according to the attached instructions it is strongly recommended by the publisher that all such amendments be inserted immediately upon receipt to avoid misplacing them and in addition that all deleted pages be saved and filed for historical reference purposes acknowledgments this publication was under the direct supervision of alyce a whitson supervising editor and ron mclaughlin editor of the municipal tallahassee florida credit is gratefully given to the other members of the publishers staff for their sincere interest and able assistance throughout the project the publisher is most grateful to dwight severs city attorney karan rounsavall cmc deputy city clerk and the other members of the city staff for their cooperation and assistance during the progress of the work on this publication it is hoped that their efforts and those of the publisher have resulted in a ordinances which will make the active law of the city readily accessible to all citizens and which will be a valuable tool in the daytoday administration of the citys affairs municipal code corporation tallahassee florida adopting ordinance ordinance no 311992 an enacting a new charter and the city of titusville florida  providing for the repeal of certain ordinances not included therein  providing a penalty for the violation thereof  providing for the manner of amending such   and providing when such this become effective be it enacted by the city of titusville florida as follows the charter and the in the ordinances city of titusville florida published by municipal consisting of the charter and chapters 1 each inclusive is adopted all charter provisions and ordinances of a general and permanent nature enacted on or before  and not included in the charter and recognized and continued in force by reference in the charter and in this section are repealed the following sections appearing in the ordinances 196 and any ordinances amending such provisions are hereby saved from repeal marinas new streets a2 titusville environmental commission established a location of mobile homes and parks  mobile home parks building permit requirement travel trailers camper trailers cargo trailers boat trailers offsite improvements real estate sales offices trailers mobile homesspecial exception outdoor recreation and entertainment flea markets temporary auto sales or shows parking large trucks and heavy equipment principal building on a lot permitted building area subdivision of lots the following sections had been saved from repeal subsequently these sections have been recodified as follows a4 13a5 13a713a9 as sections 5941059415 a3 13a6 have been deleted a as j as as as b as as as has been deleted by arthur dunn airport minimum setback from centerline of streets a b business districts special usespublic it is the intention of this to repeal all ordinances not presently codified and all zoning and rezoning ordinances and comprehensive plan adoption ordinances and each shall remain in force and effect the repeal provided for in hereof shall not be constructed to revive any ordinance or part thereof that has been repealed by a subsequent ordinance that is repealed by this  unless another penalty is expressly provided every person convicted of a violation of any provision of the any ordinance rule or regulation adopted or issued in pursuance thereof shall be punished by a fine not exceeding five hundred dollars $50000 or a term of imprisonment not exceeding sixty 60 days or both each act of violation and each day upon which any such violation shall occur shall constitute a separate offense the penalty provided by this unless another penalty is expressly provided shall apply to the amendment of any whether or not such penalty is reenacted in the amendatory ordinance in addition to the penalty prescribed above the city may pursue other remedies such as abatement of nuisances injunctive relief and revocation of licenses or permits additions or amendments to the passed in the form as to indicate the intention of the city council to make the same a part of the be deemed to be incorporated in the so that reference to the the additions and amendments ordinances adopted after  that amend or refer to ordinances that have been codified in the shall be construed as if they amend or refer to like provisions of the  effective date this ordinances shall take effect immediately upon adoption passed and adopted this 15th day of december 1992 s thomas r mariani thomas r mariani mayor attest s janet r camacho janet r camacho clerk part i  charter footnotes  1  editors note the city of titusville was originally incorporated on  miscellaneous record brevard county book a pp 229318 this incorporation was validated by ch 378 act 1887 laws of fla ch 632001 is the present charter of the city which became effective  this charter is printed herein as subpart a of this as adopted except the divisions of the several sections have been renumbered and relettered for the utility of the user and for purposes of simplifying the indexing thereof so that the first divisions or subsections bear numbers and the next divisions paragraphs bear letters obviously misspelled words have been corrected without notation words added for clarification have been added in brackets amendments have been included and are indicated by a history note immediately following the amended section article i  general provisions abolish existing municipalities that the existing municipal government of the town of whispering hills golf estates in the county of brevard and state of florida and the existing municipal government of the city of titusville in the county of brevard and state of florida be and the same are hereby abolished all books and records of the municipality of the town of whispering hills golf estates hereby abolished shall be immediately delivered by the municipal officials to the clerk of the city of titusville to be by him filed and preserved title to property reserved that the title rights and ownership of all property both real and personal uncollected taxes dues claims judgments decrees choses in action and all property and property rights held or owned by the municipality named city of titusville abolished by this act shall pass to and be vested in the municipal corporation organized under this charter to succeed the municipality abolished that the title rights and ownership of all property both real and personal uncollected taxes dues claims judgments decrees choses in action and all property and property rights held or owned by the municipality named town of whispering hills golf estates abolished by this act shall pass to and be vested in the municipal corporation organized under this charter to succeed the municipality abolished obligations unimpaired that no obligations or contracts of the said municipalities hereby abolished including bonds and revenue certificates heretofore issued or any proceeding heretofore begun for any improvement or for the borrowing of money or issuing of bonds or revenue certificates shall be impaired or avoided by this charter but such debts obligations contracts bonds and revenue certificates shall pass to and be binding upon the municipality hereby created and organized and all such proceedings heretofore begun for the construction of any improvements or for the borrowing of money or issuing of bonds or revenue certificates may be continued and completed and binding upon the said new municipality and shall be valid against the new municipality created provided however that only that property which was subject to the ad valorem bonded indebtedness of the city of titusville abolished shall be subject to the ad valorem bonded indebtedness in the city of titusville established mayor and city council the mayor and city councilmen of the said municipality hereby created with the expiration dates of their terms are as follows 1 edwin h willis councilman  2 william h laing mayor  3 ed kittles councilman  4 millard finch councilman  5 james pritchard councilman  the said mayor and councilmen shall serve until their successors are elected and qualified under the provisions of this charter all officers and employees heretofore elected or appointed and holding office under the said municipality of the city of titusville hereby abolished other than the mayor and city councilmen of same shall continue to hold their respective offices and discharge the respective duties thereof under the new municipality hereby created until their successors are appointed or elected and qualified under the provisions of this charter cross reference creation composition term election of city council  11 ordinances not impaired all existing ordinances and resolutions of the said abolished municipality of the city of titusville florida including the revised ordinances of the city of titusville florida of 195 as since amended not in conflict with the provisions of this charter shall continue in effect as the ordinances of the new municipality hereby created establishment of new municipality the inhabitants of the city of titusville as its boundaries are hereinafter established and designated or as may hereafter be established and designated shall continue to be a body politic and corporate to be known and designated as city of titusville and as such shall have perpetual succession may use a common seal may contract and be contracted with and may sue and be sued in all courts of this state and in all matters whatsoever boundaries  corporate limits editors special acts of 1961  all pertaining to the existing municipal governments of the city of titusville and whispering hills golf estates be and the same are hereby repealed change of name editorially deleted editors note this section has been editorially deleted as superseded by the procedure for amending charters in fs   form of government the council government provided by this charter shall be known as the councilmanager government pursuant to its provisions and subject only to the limitations imposed by the state constitution and by this charter all powers of the city shall be vested in an elective council hereinafter referred to as the council which shall enact local legislation adopt budgets determine policies and appoint the city manager who shall execute the laws and administer the government of the city all powers of the city shall be exercised in the manner prescribed by this charter or if the manner be not prescribed then in such manner as may be prescribed by ordinances general powers of the city the city of titusville hereby created established and organized shall have full power and authority 1 taxes and assessments editorially deleted 2 utility taxes editorially deleted 3 occupational licenses editorially deleted 4 liquor license editorially deleted 5 personal property taxes against private individuals upon public lands editorially deleted 6 acquisition of property to acquire by purchase gift exchange leasepurchase devise condemnation lease or otherwise real or personal property or any estate therein or riparian rights or easements therein within or without the city to be used for any municipal purpose including all municipal or public buildings streets and highways  bridge and tunnel sites  plants works and wells and other equipment necessary for supplying said city with water gas for illuminating and heating purposes and electric power for illuminating heating or power purposes  the location of waterworks and sites for public utility works  the establishment of poor houses houses of detention and correction  hospitals for the cure or detention of the sick  jails  market houses public parks playgrounds airports docks sea walls yacht harbors wharves warehouses promenades  plants for cremating neutralizing or otherwise destroying sewerage garbage and refuse  for extension of sewer and drainage pipes and water mains  and to improve sell lease pledge or otherwise dispose of same or any part thereof for the benefit of the city to the same extent that natural persons might do in the proper manner at any regular or special meeting of the council 7 recreational facilities a operate and maintain editorially deleted b acquire recreational facilities to acquire by purchase gift devise condemnation exchange lease or otherwise real or personal property or any estate or interest therein located within or without the corporate limits and on same build repair improve construct own operate and maintain any and all manner of recreational facilities and any and all necessary or convenient appurtenances or aids in connection therewith c regulate uses editorially deleted d leases and concessions editorially deleted e pledge revenues editorially deleted f sale of recreational facilities editorially deleted g legislative findings editorially deleted 8 airports to purchase acquire lease take hold establish construct equip maintain and operate municipal airports landing fields hangars aviation terminals and administration buildings runways depots warehouses garages repair shops oil and fuel tank or stations or other necessary appurtenances for the use of airplane and other aircraft and to acquire or lease any and all real property within or without the corporate limits for such purposes  to set apart and use for such purpose any real property owned or leased by the city whether or not originally acquired by condemnation purchase or lease for another purpose  to adopt and enforce reasonable rules and regulations governing the use of such municipal airports  to employ airport directors airport managers employees or agents in connection with such operation  to impose fees or charges in connection with the use of such airport or airport facilities  to sell gasoline or other supplies necessary in connection with the operation of such airports  to provide lounges eating places refreshment parlors and other facilities in connection with such municipal airports  to let or lease to private persons or corporations portions of the said airports for building sites hangar space nonpublic uses industrial development concessions or other uses  to prescribe and promulgate reasonable rules and regulations for the operation of such airports and to exercise supervision and control of such operation  to accept and receive grants from the state and federal governments and any body politic for the construction maintenance operation and management of such airport facilities 9 hospitals editorially deleted 10 public libraries editorially deleted 11 golf courses to acquire construct own and operate a golf course or golf courses and all such buildings and improvements as said city may deem necessary or desirable for use in connection therewith within or outside the limits of said city and to sell same when deemed unprofitable to operate or expedient to do so  to use any lands now owned by said city for the purpose of golf course or golf courses and to acquire by purchase lease condemnation or otherwise for such purposes and lands within or outside the limits of said city as it may deem necessary or desirable  to charge reasonable admissions rentals or fees for the use of and enjoyment of such golf course or golf courses by the users thereof  to prescribe reasonable rules and regulations for the use and operation thereof  to lease any portion or all of any municipal golf course upon terms deemed beneficial to the city 12 cemeteries the city of titusville is hereby authorized and empowered to acquire own maintain and operate a cemetery or cemeteries within or without the corporate limits of the city for the burial and memorialization of the dead and activities incidental and convenient thereto  to issue bonds or revenue certificates for the purposes of obtaining money to establish or improve said facilities in the same manner as other bonds or revenue certificates are provided for in the charter of the city of titusville  to establish and administer an endowment or perpetual care fund for the maintenance of said cemetery or cemeteries to be made up by depositing a portion of the moneys received from the sale of lots or plots and accept gifts to be deposited in said fund  to regulate the uniformity class and kind of all markers and memorials within the cemetery or cemeteries  to erect maintain and operate chapels buildings workshops green houses nurseries and other incidental buildings and equipment  to sell burial lots and burial rights and all things incidental thereto  and to do any and all things necessary or incidental to the accomplishment of any of such purposes 13 municipal parking facilities editorially deleted 14 public improvements editorially deleted 15 docks wharves etc to construct build improve acquire maintain or discontinue sea walls docks wharves yacht basins bridges viaducts subways and necessary for such purposes  to lay and collect reasonable duties charges or fees on vessels or watercraft coming into or using such landings wharves and docks  to regulate the manner of using any and all wharves and docks within the city and the rates of wharfage or charges to be paid by vessels or other watercraft using the same  to dredge or deepen the harbors rivers canals waterways or any occupant of the ground or premises whereon the same may be  to require all lands lots or other premises within the city to be kept clean sanitary and free from weeds wild growth dilapidated buildings and rubbish  to regulate or prevent slaughterhouses and noisome or offensive business within the city  to prevent the carrying on of any dangerous or unwholesome business trade or employment within tax liens editorially deleted 42 codify ordinances to codify its ordinances into a ordinances of the city of titusville and by a single ordinance to adopt such ordinances of the city of titusville as a complete revision of all existing and applicable ordinances on the date of such adoption  and to amend such once adopted by reference to any section or sections the revised ordinances of the city of titusville florida of 195 as amended from time to time except as modified by this charter are declared to be the existing codified ordinances of the city of titusville  and such ordinances may be amended from time to time by reference to any section or sections and as many sections as desired may be amended by one ordinance such revised ordinances of the city of titusville florida of 195 as amended from time to time may be revised and codified or recodified and such revised be adopted by a single ordinance and upon such revision shall be in full force and effect the city attorney of the city of titusville shall have power and authority to codify any duly adopted ordinance of the city of titusville and assign proper section numbers and headings to various parts of such ordinances and thereafter such sections shall be cited in referring to such ordinances the city may arrange with any corporation or agency for keeping said ordinances up to date 43 enforcing ordinances editorially deleted 44 powers of local selfgovernment to exercise all of the powers of local selfgovernment and to do whatever may be deemed necessary or proper for the safety health convenience or general welfare of the inhabitants of said city to exercise full police power  to expend moneys to advertise and publicize the city  to do and perform all acts and things permitted by the laws of the state of florida and comprehended as duties in the performance of any thing recognized as a municipal purpose whether now existing and recognized or hereafter recognized as a municipal purpose by statute law or court decision 45 all powers customarily exercised by municipalities the enumeration of particular powers by this charter shall not be held or deemed to be exclusive but in addition to the powers enumerated herein implied thereby or appropriate to the exercise thereof the city of titusville shall have and may exercise all other powers which under the constitution and laws of florida it would be competent for this paragraph specifically to enumerate 46 declared municipal purposes all public improvements authorized in this charter are hereby determined and declared to be public municipal functions and all of the acts authorized to be done and performed in connection therewith are hereby designated and declared to be for a public municipal purpose in connection with providing funds for the payment of any or all of the cost of construction of any project or public improvement recognized or designated as a municipal purpose the city may use appropriate or pledge any revenues of the city available for such purpose including the power rights and authority to use or pledge the proceeds of utilities service taxes franchise taxes and cigarette taxes  12379 editors note parts of this section have been editorially deleted as the home rule powers of a municipality other than extraterritorial powers which shall be by general or special law are derived from the constitution and fs ch footnotes  2  state law reference ethics fs   et seq  public records fs ch 119  public meetings fs ch 286 establishment of governing body  term of office  determining the mayors seat  and providing for effective date the governing body of the city which will exercise all the legislative and jurisdictional powers of the city shall be composed of five 5 members of the city council four 4 of whom shall be council members and one 1 shall be the mayor the mayor shall be elected by the majority of the votes cast by the qualified electors of the city at large each of the four 4 council members shall be elected by the majority of the votes cast by the qualified electors casting ballots at the election of the entire municipality the term of office of the mayor and city council members shall be for a period of four 4 years there are hereby created five 5 election seats in the city such seats being numbered one 1 to five 5 inclusive seats 1 2 3 and 5 shall be council seats seat 4 shall be the mayors seat seats 1 2 3 4 and 5 shall consist of the entire municipality beginning with the regular or general election to be held in 1992 and future elections thereafter the following shall apply for the year 199 the council member for seat 2 shall be elected and serve for a term of four 4 years the mayor elected from seat 4 shall serve for a period of four 4 years for the year 199 the council member so elected from seats 1 3 and 5 shall serve for a term of four 4 years beginning with the regular or general election in 1992 and future elections thereafter in the event more than two 2 candidates qualify for a particular council seat or mayoral seat then in that event the candidates election shall be held on the tuesday nine weeks prior to the general election or such other date as established by applicable general law of the state for primary elections if no candidate receives a majority of the votes cast a runoff election shall be held between the two 2 candidates with the highest number of votes cast to be held on the first tuesday after the first monday in november in each applicable year if a candidate receives a majority of the votes cast for council member or mayor said candidate shall be so elected if only two 2 candidates qualify for a council seat or mayoral seat then in that event the election shall be held on the first tuesday after the first monday in november of each applicable year if only one candidate qualifies for a council seat or mayoral seat said candidate shall be deemed elected newly elected council members and mayor shall take office on the fourth tuesday in the month of november following their election  9971   72572   12280   92281   91785   112691   12798 qualifications and disqualifications members of the city council shall be and shall have been residents of the city for one year and shall have the qualifications of electors in the city members of the city council shall not hold any other elective public office any member of the city council or mayor who cease to possess the qualifications of being a resident of the city or qualifications of electors shall forfeit their office automatically members of the city council may be suspended or removed as provided for by state law absence from four 4 consecutive regular andor special meetings of the city council shall operate to vacate the seat by the city council member unless excused by the city council by motion any illness of a member of the city council or their immediate family member that interferes with a council members ability to attend meetings shall count as an excused absence unless the absence continues for more than three 3 months after which time the council may grant additional excused absences sp acts ch 672138  2   92281   21098 presiding officer  mayor the mayor shall preside at all meetings of the city council shall be recognized as head of the city government for all ceremonial purposes and by the governor for purposes of military law and shall when directed to do so by the city council execute all instruments to which the city is a party unless otherwise provided by this charter or by ordinance but shall have no regular administrative duties the mayor shall have a vote as a council member on any matters coming before the council the city council shall elect a vicemayor who shall act as mayor during the absence or disability of the mayor if a vacancy occurs in the mayor or any city council seats it shall be filled by the remaining council members for the completion of the unexpired term or until the next regularly scheduled city council election provided the vacancy occurs prior to the time period for qualifying whichever is the shortest period of time the vicemayor shall be elected from among the city council at its organizational meeting each year or such other date as established by the city council and shall hold office for a term of one year or until his successor is elected and qualified  9971   3 21098   121013 a  reserved editors note of adopted sept 22 198 repealed  14a concerning recall elections the deleted section derived from  adopted sept 9 197 and  adopted  powers all powers of the city and the determination of all matters of policy shall be vested in the council the city council may by ordinance or resolution prescribe the manner in which any power of said city shall be exercised without limitation of the foregoing the council shall have the power to 1 appoint and remove the city manager  2 appoint and remove the city attorney  3 editorially deleted 4 establish other administrative departments and distribute the work of divisions within the departments  5 adopt the budget of the city 6 appoint city auditor  21098 editors note the appointment of a municipal judge has been editorially deleted as municipal courts were abolished by fla const art v  20 appointment of city manager the council shall appoint an officer of the city who shall have the title of city manager and shall have the powers and perform the duties of this charter no council member shall receive such appointment during the term for which he shall have been elected nor within one year after the expiration of his term  21098 removal of city manager the council shall appoint the city manager for an indefinite term and may remove him by a majority vote of its members if removed at any time after having served six 6 months the city manager may demand written charges and a public hearing upon the same before the council and his final removal shall not take effect until such hearing has been had but the council may suspend him from office pending such hearing council not to interfere in appointments or removals neither the council nor any of its members shall direct or request the appointment of any person to or his removal from office by the city manager or by any of his subordinates or in any manner take part in the appointment or removal of officers and employees in the administrative service of the city except for the purpose of inquiry the council and its members shall deal with the administrative service solely city manager and neither the council nor any member thereof shall give orders to any subordinates of the city manager either publicly or privately vacancies in the city council if any vacancy occurs in the city council the remaining members of the city council shall elect within 15 days by the affirmative votes of not less than three members an eligible person to fill vacancy until the next general election at which time the office shall be filled for the unexpired term annual organization meeting on the fourth tuesday of november the existing city council shall meet at the usual place for holding the meetings of the legislative body of the city for the purpose of transacting any and all necessary business before assumption of office by the newly elected council member if an election had occurred in that year at  oclock am eastern standard time the newly elected city council shall assume the duties of office if there was no election the city council shall select the vice mayor during the regular city council meeting held on the fourth tuesday in november or such other date as established by the city council  21098   121013 regular meetings the city council shall meet regularly at such times as may be specified by ordinance except that it shall meet regularly not less than once each month state law reference public meetings fs ch 286 special meetings  how called special meetings of the city council will be scheduled by motion of any council member and passed by a majority of the members present at a regular or special council meeting the mayor or city manager can schedule a special council meeting if in their judgment a meeting is necessary any council member may request the city manager to schedule a special meeting in all cases a twentyfour 24 hour public notice must be posted and notice given to all council members verbally and in writing at their home or business and if unavailable by delivery of a notice to their home all official meetings of the city council shall be public and any citizen shall have access to the minutes and records thereof during the regularly scheduled hours that city hall is opened  21098 state law reference public meetings fs ch 286 legislative procedure a quorum must exist as determined by the city attorney or in his absence the city manager to convene an official city council meeting a quorum will include at least three city council members present to convene an official city council meeting all meetings of the city council will be either regular or special meetings the affirmative vote of three 3 members shall be necessary to adopt any ordinance or resolution and the passage of all ordinances and resolutions shall be taken by yes and no and entered upon the minutes sp acts ch 63200  23   9971   21098 editors note  amended  23 to read as set out said amendment was approved at a referendum held sept 7 197 pursuant to state law reference procedure for adoption of ordinances fs   council to be judge of qualifications of its members the city council shall be the judge of the election and qualifications of its members as established by the charter and ordinance  21098 rules of procedure  journal the council shall determine its own rules and order of business it shall keep a minutes of its proceedings and the meetings shall be open to public inspection  21098 ordinances and resolutions every proposed ordinance or resolution shall be introduced in typewritten written or printed form at any regular or special meeting the enacting clause of all ordinances shall be be it enacted by the city of titusville florida a proposed ordinance may be read by title or in full on at least two separate days and shall at least ten days prior to adoption be noticed once in a newspaper of general circulation in the municipality the notice of proposed enactment shall state the date time and place of the meeting  the title or titles of proposed ordinances  and the place or places within the municipality where such proposed ordinances may be inspected by the public the notice shall also advise that interested parties may appear at the meeting and be heard with respect to the proposed ordinance all proposed ordinances shall be read by title only unless required by state statutes that the ordinance is required to be read in full an emergency ordinance may be enacted as provided for by state law sp acts ch 652328  12  sp acts ch 672138  3   12881   92386   21098 state law reference procedure for adoption of ordinances fs   independent annual audit prior to the end of each fiscal year the council shall designate qualified public accountants who as of the end of the fiscal year shall make an independent audit of accounts and other evidences of financial transactions of the city government and shall submit their report to the city council such accountants shall have no personal interest direct or indirect in the fiscal affairs of the city government or of any of its officers they shall not maintain any accounts or records of the city business but within specifications approved by the council shall postaudit the books and documents kept by the department of finance and any separate or subordinate accounts kept by any other office department or agency of the city government state law reference annual audit required fs   21833 contracts materials and supplies with city it shall be unlawful for any council member to directly or indirectly contract with any association partnership firm or corporation in which he is financially interested for the doing of any work or the furnishing of any material or equipment to or for the city of titusville florida unless after public advertisement or competitive conditions such association partnership firm or corporation shall be the lowest responsible and competent bidder  21098 state law reference restrictions on doing business with agency fs  3 12 article iii  administrationcity manager qualifications the city manager shall be chosen by the city council solely on the basis of his executive and administrative qualifications with special reference to his actual experience in or his knowledge of accepted practices in respect to the duties of his office as hereinafter set forth at the time of his appointment he need not be a resident of the city or state but during his tenure of office he shall reside within the city the salary of the city manager shall be fixed by the city council powers and duties the city manager shall be the chief executive officer and head of the administrative branch of the city government except as herein provided he shall be responsible to the city council for the proper administration of all affairs of the city and to that end subject to provisions provided for in this charter he shall have power and shall be required to 1 appoint and when necessary for the good of the city remove all officers and employees of the city except as otherwise provided by this charter and except that he may authorize the head of a department or office to appoint and remove subordinates in such department or office  2 fix the salary of officers and employees except as otherwise provided in this charter  3 endorse on all contracts bonds and other instruments in writing in which the municipality is interested his approval of the substance thereof  4 prepare the budget annually and submit it to the city council and be responsible for its administration after adoption  5 prepare and submit to the city council as of the end of the fiscal year a complete report on the finances and administrative activities of the city for the preceding year  6 keep the city council advised of the financial condition and future needs of the city and make such recommendations as may seem to him desirable  7 he shall be purchasing agent of the city by whom all purchases of supplies shall be made subject to the rules and regulations to be prescribed by the council and he shall approve all vouchers for the payment of same in the capacity of purchasing agent he shall also conduct all sales of personal property which the council may authorize to be sold as having become unnecessary or unfit for the citys use all purchases and sales shall conform to such regulations as the city council may from time to time prescribe 8 perform such other duties as may be prescribed by this charter or required of him by the city council not inconsistent therewith absence of the city manager to perform his duties during his temporary absence or disability the city manager may designate by letter filed with the city clerk a qualified administrative officer of the city in the event of the failure of the city manager to make such designation or in the event of the failure of such designation to meet the approval of the council the city council may by resolution appoint an officer of the city to perform the duties of the city manager until he shall return or his disability shall cease  21098 administrative departments there may be a police department finance department department of fire rescue and emergency services department of public works building department and such other departments as may be established upon recommendation of the city manager at the head of each department there shall be an officer of the city who shall have supervision and control of the department who shall be appointed by and shall be under supervision and control of the city manager except as herein provided two or more departments may be headed by the same individual the city manager may head one or more departments  21098 cross reference fire department  45  assessment of taxes  66 et seq active participation in political campaign editorially deleted editors note this section has been editorially deleted at the direction of the city state law reference restrictions on political activity while not working prohibited fs  104313 4 article iv  city attorney footnotes  3  editors note  adopted nov 30 197 provided that the municipal court of the city be abolished accordingly the editors have deleted any references to municipal court in article iv city attorneyappointment and qualifications the city council shall appoint a city attorney and such assistant attorneys as may be necessary who shall act as the legal advisor to and attorney and counselor for the municipality and all of its officers in matters relating to their official duties the city attorney shall be a lawyer of at least two 2 years experience and practice in the courts of the state he shall prepare all contracts bonds and other instruments in writing to which the municipality is concerned and shall endorse on each his approval of the form and correctness thereof but failure to do so shall not affect its validity when required to do so by the city council he shall prosecute and defend for and in behalf of the city all civil complaints suits and controversies in which the city is a party he shall furnish the city council the city manager the head of any department or any officer board council or agency not included in any department his opinion on any question of law relating to their respective powers and duties in addition to the duties specifically imposed under other sections of this charter the city attorney shall perform such other professional duties as may be required of him by ordinance resolution or motion of the city council or as are prescribed for city attorneys under federal and state laws which are not inconsistent with this charter and with any ordinance resolution or motion which may be passed by the city council assistant city attorneys shall work under the supervision of the city attorney and perform such duties as he shall require of them in such cases they shall have the same powers as the city attorney laws of fla ch 652328  13  laws of fla ch 691688  1   21098 secs 3539  reserved editors note  enacted nov 30 197 provided that the municipal court as created and established pursuant to laws of fla ch 63200  35 be abolished as of  am dec 1 1976 the editors have deleted  3539 and 4143 relative to the municipal court and the municipal court following  35 article v  city clerk city clerk the city manager shall appoint an officer of the city who shall have the title of city clerk he or she shall serve at the pleasure of and shall be under the direction and control of the city manager the city manager shall appoint a deputy city clerk to act for the city clerk in his or her absence he or she shall give notice of the meetings of the city council  shall keep the minutes of its proceedings  shall authenticate by his or her signature and record in full in a book kept for that purpose all ordinances and resolutions he or she shall attest to andor countersign by his or her signature all contracts bonds and other instruments as required by law  shall perform the duties of registration officer and shall perform any other duties required by this charter and as may be assigned by the city manager the city manager may also serve as city clerk in addition to his other duties laws of fla ch 672138  4   21098 article vi  department of fire rescue department of fire rescue there shall be a department of fire rescue headed by a fire chief who shall be appointed by the city manager and as many subordinate officers firefighters and employees as may be necessary to carry on the functions of the department the fire chief shall be responsible to the city manager for stationing and supervision of all firefighters within the department and have jurisdiction over all areas in the vicinity of a fire or conflagration the city manager or his designated representative may make mutualaid agreements with other fire emergency departments to supply and receive firefighting and medical assistance when circumstances require such action laws of fla ch 652328  17  laws of fla ch 672138  5   101282 article vii  department of personnel merit basis of appointment appointments and promotions in the service of the city except as otherwise provided in this charter shall be made according to merit and fitness to be ascertained so far as practicable by competitive examination article viii  public works and utilities public works the city council shall have the power within and without its corporate limits to construct condemn purchase acquire or lease any interest in any property and to maintain conduct own and operate within and without the corporate limits wharves warehouses ship canals breakwaters reservoirs sewerage systems trunk sewers intercepting sewers pumping stations wells siphons intakes pipe lines distribution systems purification works collection systems treatment and disposal works transportation systems cemeteries gas plants and distribution systems or other public utility airports and necessary hangars and appurtenances or facility deemed necessary for the public good and any buildings or facilities as may be required in connection therewith and to make a contract of whatever nature in connection therewith  and shall have the right and power to issue bonds or revenue certificates in the manner provided in this charter in an amount necessary to carry out any of said powers or purposes all of the above works are considered as utilities within the meaning of all constitutional or statutory provision and any existing utility may be combined with another existing utility and revenue bonds or certificates issued as otherwise provided by this charter lights heat and power the city council shall have power to purchase or otherwise acquire establish maintain and provide facilities for lighting the streets parks public buildings and public places of the city  and to operate plants either within or without the corporate limits of the city for sources of power lighting heating by electricity gas atomic power or other unknown sources of energy or any other method  and to supply the inhabitants of said city with artificial light heat and power for domestic business and other purposes and to charge and collect reasonable rates prices and compensation for furnishing and supplying the same waterworks plants the city council shall have the power to construct establish maintain and operate waterworks and to bore and dig wells construct reservoirs lay pipes and do such other things as may be necessary essential or convenient for procuring and distributing an abundant supply of good and wholesome water to the inhabitants of said city for domestic and other purposes and to protect the property of said city and its inhabitants against fire  and also the power to lay water mains and water distribution systems beyond the city limits for the purpose of supplying water to persons residing outside the city limits and to collect reasonable rates prices and compensations for furnishing and supplying same except for fire protection which may be provided for in the tax levy state law reference municipal public works fs ch 180 service of utilities to consumers outside of city the city shall have power to supply water electricity and other sources of power sewerage sewage disposal and gas for domestic and other purposes to individuals firms corporations and other municipalities outside of said city and to charge and collect reasonable rates prices and compensations therefor but the city may charge rates to be fixed by ordinance higher to such consumers than is charged for a like class of service to a like class of consumers within the city limits sanitary sewerage districts editorially deleted editors note this section has been editorially deleted as the home rule powers of a municipality other than extraterritorial powers which shall be by general or special law are derived from the constitution and fs ch 166 state law reference municipal home rule powers fs ch 166  municipal public works fs ch 180  creation of special districts fs ch 189 compulsory connection to sanitary sewers editorially deleted editors note this section has been editorially deleted as the home rule powers of a municipality other than article ix  elections footnotes  4  state law reference florida election code fs chs 97106 elections the city council shall by ordinance make all regulations which it considers needful or desirable not inconsistent with this charter for the conduct of municipal elections and for the prevention of fraud therein inspectors and clerks of elections shall be appointed by the brevard county supervisor of elections  21098 electors editorially deleted editors note this section has been editorially deleted as superseded by fs   registration of voters editorially deleted laws of fla ch 652328  18  laws of fla ch 672138  6 editors note this section has been editorially deleted as superseded by fs   3c  elections  general  runoff a regular or general election of candidates or nominees to the city council of the city of titusville shall be held on the dates set forth in section 12 of article 2 of this charter each candidate for council member shall qualify as a candidate from an election seat and no candidate may qualify from more than one election seat in a single election a candidate to be elected as council member on the first ballot or elected as mayor on the first ballot must receive the majority of the votes cast in his election in the event a candidate for council member or mayor does not receive a majority of the votes cast in his election there shall be a run off election between the two candidates with the highest number of votes cast the run off election shall be held on the dates specified in section 12 of article 2 of this charter in the event that there is a tie in the first election among the candidates receiving the most votes these candidates shall be in the run off election in the event there is a tie in the run off election subsequent elections shall be held in the same manner as the original run off election the candidates shall be elected in the run off election by receiving a plurality of the votes cast in the run off election the exercise by the city council of the city of titusville of its option to adopt the permanent single voter registration system is hereby ratified confirmed and approved and all elections of the city of titusville shall be conducted by the supervisor of elections of brevard county in accordance with general state laws governing elections and registration of electors and by such ordinances as the city council of titusville may from time to time adopt notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in other sections of this charter which inconsistent provisions are hereby repealed laws of fla ch 63200  56  laws of fla ch 652328  19   91070   9971   21098   121013 elections  canvass of returns the polls shall open at seven oclock am and shall close at seven oclock pm or such other time as established by applicable general law of the state the result of the voting when ascertained shall be certified by the supervisor of elections and the county canvassing board to the city clerk who shall transmit such returns to the city council at the first regular city council meeting following the receipt of the official results for the primary election and at the organizational meeting held on the fourth tuesday of november for the general election or such other date as established by the city council at such meeting the city council shall canvass the returns and the results as shown by such returns shall be declared as the results of the election  92788   21098   121013 state law reference hours of opening and closing of polls superseded by state law fs   a  straw ballots the city council of the city of titusville florida may by ordinance passed by a threefifths  35  vote submit to the electors of the city on straw ballot or opinion poll any question of public interest at any regular or general election of candidates or nominees to the city council the results of the straw ballot or opinion poll shall not be binding upon the city council but shall serve as information to the council on matters of public interest the straw ballot or opinion poll at the general or regular election of candidates or nominees to the city council shall conform to the following requirements straw ballot mark a cross mark x in the square at the right for or against the proposal proposal to be placed upon the ballot for the proposal  against the proposal   72572 fiscal year the fiscal year of the city government shall begin on the first day of october and shall end on the last day of september in each calendar year such fiscal year shall also constitute the budget and accounting year and as used in the charter the term budget year shall mean the fiscal year for which any particular budget is adopted and in which it is administered state law reference fiscal year mandated by state law fs   21833 city managers budget message and recommendations the city manager shall submit to the city council his budget message estimates and recommendations together with a proposed budget for the fiscal year beginning october 1st thereafter the budget message shall contain an outline of the proposed financial policies of the city for the budget year and shall describe in connection therewith the important features of the proposed budget he shall estimate receipts and disbursements for the remainder of the current fiscal year based on information obtained from the various departments he shall also make an estimate of the expenditures and revenues of the city for the ensuing year  such estimate to be compiled from detailed information and its arrangement and classification of expenditures shall be as nearly uniform as possible for the main functional divisions and departments of the city schedules attached to such budget message shall show the following information 1 the current budgeted amount for each fund function department division and for each utility or facility operated by the city and the estimated surplus or deficit of each with recommendations for transfers 2 the amount of monies which he estimates will be on hand on october 1st specifying the fund or appropriation to which such monies have been appropriated after interfund transfers 3 detailed estimates of anticipated revenues to be derived from all sources other than ad valorem taxes for each fund or appropriation 4 estimated amount necessary to be raised by ad valorem taxation 5 the actual expenditure of funds for the preceding year for each fund appropriation and utility and in parallel columns the estimated expenditure of funds for the current fiscal year and the fiscal year beginning october 1st to be shown by fund or appropriation with each fund subdivided into its current classification of functions departments and divisions 6 supporting schedules showing special pledges or dedications of revenues to special funds or appropriations laws of fla ch 672138  7 annual budget recommended by city manager the city manager shall include in his budget message a recommended annual budget prepared in proper form for the next ensuing fiscal year beginning october 1st and ending september 30 following which proposed budget shall provide a clear financial plan for the ensuing fiscal year publication of notice of public hearing editorially deleted  12875 editors note this section has been editorially deleted as superseded by fs   budget  levy of taxes  certifying tax levy editorially deleted  12875 editors note this section has been editorially deleted as superseded by fs   effective date execution and amendment of budget a editorially deleted b from the effective date of the budget the several amounts stated therein as proposed expenditures shall be and become appropriated to the several objects and purposes therein named it shall be unlawful for any officer to draw money from the treasury except pursuant to an appropriation c the city manager may at any time and without formal action by the city council transfer any unencumbered appropriation balance or portion thereof between general classifications and expenditures within a department or division and shall report said transfer at the next regular meeting failure to report said transfer shall not invalidate said expenditure made in reliance on said transfer at the request of the city manager by motion recorded in the minutes of the meeting the city council may authorize at any time the transfer of any unencumbered appropriation balance or portion thereof from one department or division to another d the city council by motion recorded in the minutes of the meeting at any time within a fiscal year may amend a budget for that year as follows 1 appropriations for expenditures in any fund may be decreased and other appropriations in the same fund correspondingly increased provided that the total of the appropriations of the fund be not changed 2 appropriations from any reserve or reserve for contingencies may be made to increase the appropriation for any particular expense in the same fund or to create an appropriation in the fund for any lawful purpose 3 a receipt of a nature from a source not anticipated in the budget or received for a particular purpose including grants donations gifts or other revenues may be appropriated and expended in addition to the appropriations and expenditures provided for in the budget 4 transfers may be made between funds only for the following purposes a to correct errors in handling receipts and disbursements b budgeted transfers 5 to meet a public emergency affecting life health property or the public peace the council may make emergency appropriations to the extent that there are no available unappropriated revenues to meet such appropriation the council may authorize an emergency note which may be renewed from time to time until funds are available laws of fla ch 672138  8   12875 editors note a of this section has been editorially deleted as superseded by fs   property taxable editorially deleted editors note this section
