vol ii state law reference authority to adopt fs  56245  restrictions for offpremises sale of malt beverages fs  563021a hours of sale for the consumption and service of alcohol a any commercial establishment which serves dispenses stores or sells liquor or permits liquor to be consumed on or off its premises or any person holding a license from the division of beverage state department of business regulation or any commercial establishment bottle club or membership association in which a fee cover charge or admission fee is collected shall have hours of operation for the purposes of dispensing selling consuming or serving alcoholic beverages as follows 1 monday beginning at  am and ending at  pm 2 sunday beginning at  pm and ending at  pm b permits required for premises to remain open past  pm  suspension of permits 1 permits required all vendors licensed under the state beverage laws desiring to remain open for business for the purposes of selling offering for sale delivering serving or permitting consumption of alcoholic beverages between the hours of  pm and  am on any weekday or saturday and between  pm and midnight on sunday shall make application with the business tax department for an extended hours of operation permit an extended hours of operation permit is also available for alcohol sales between the hours of  am and  pm on sunday for commercial establishments that are also licensed to prepare and serve food when december 31 falls on a saturday sunday or other weekday the hours shall be extended until  am for the remainder of the citys fiscal year 2008200 vendors shall not be required to obtain an extended hours of operation permit commencing with  and following fiscal years vendors shall be required to obtain and possess an extended hours of operation permit 2 the application form shall be provided by the city the vendor shall complete the application by providing the information requested about the vendor including but not limited to the name and address where notices related to this section are to be mailed 3 review of application the city manager or designee shall review the application and if the application is complete and the vendor is in compliance with the code a permit shall be issued to the vendor to remain open between the hours of  pm and  am on weekdays and saturday or between  am and  pm and  pm and midnight on sunday 4 annual renewal of permit such permit must be renewed annually on or before the thirtieth day of september of each year unless the permit has been suspended by the city of titusville or the vendors state beverage license has been revoked or suspended in the event that there has been a change in ownership or a change in location of the establishment the city must be notified immediately and a new application must be processed failure to renew the extended hours of operation permit shall be cause for the immediate suspension of extended hours privileges pursuant to subsection 7 below 5 afterhours sales prohibited no vendor may sell alcoholic beverages after  pm or before  pm on sunday unless it has received an extended hours of operation permit from the city 6 open hours not impaired the provisions of this section shall not impair or impact an establishments right to remain open prior to  pm 7 permit suspension the ability to sell offer for sale deliver or permit to be consumed upon the premises any alcoholic beverage beyond the hour of  pm on any day of the week or before  pm on sunday is hereby declared to be and is a privilege subject to suspension by the city council and no person may reasonably rely on a continuation of that privilege as a condition of the continuation of the privilege vendors are required to take all necessary steps to minimize the negative impacts that their establishment may cause in nearby residential or commercial neighborhoods the city council shall consider the following in deciding whether to suspend revoke or condition the privilege a whether there is adequate offstreet parking in relation to the demands created during the extra hours of operation with special regard to any adverse impact on adjacent residential areas of any illegal or hazardous parking that can be traced directly to a particular vendor for the purposes of this section sufficient evidence of an adverse impact on adjacent residential areas will exist upon verification by police or code enforcement officials that more than ten 10 patrons of the vendor have parked illegally on public rightsofway or property or on private property upon receipt of a complaint by the property owner which has been communicated to the vendor this provision will only apply if the parking provided by the vendor is at maximum capacity at the time the illegal parking takes place or is otherwise determined to be inadequate given the size of the crowds that the vendor draws  illegal parking by an individual patron shall not constitute a violation of this subsection  b law enforcement activities on the vendors property during the extra hours of operation both outside and inside the permitted location with particular emphasis on illegal activity of the owner employees or others associated with the establishment including use sale or delivery of controlled substances allowing underage drinking violation of open container laws and loitering by intoxicated individuals the city council shall also consider whether the need for law enforcement involvement was the result of the establishments failure or inability to maintain proper order and control during the extended business hours  c complaints verified by the police arising from adverse effects extra hours of operation have upon neighboring properties including the effects of noise parking vandalism generation of trash or garbage loitering by intoxicated persons or exterior lighting on neighboring residential properties it shall be a defense to the applicability of this section that the vendor has adequate security personnel and has implemented a policy requiring that security personnel patrol the premises as well as all known parking lots that patrons use to assure the orderly conduct of patrons as they arrive at the establishment or as they depart complaints involving neighboring properties must be traceable to the actions of the owner andor his employees noise complaints shall be traceable to the actions of the vendor or his employees by entertainment provided by the vendor or noise generated from the seating areas or entertainment areas of the vendor and not individual discussions conversations by patrons within parking areas upon a showing of such security precautions the vendor shall only be held accountable if the conduct complained of constitutes a violation by the vendor of any provision of the city of titusville ordinances  d violations of any provisions of the city of titusville ordinances  specially including but not limited to sections 13101 relating to noise and sound limitations  e failure to obtain an extended hours of operation permit or failure to renew the permit as required by subsections 4 and 5 above  f violations of laws relating to the maximum permissible occupancy of vendor  g violation of any provisions of the city of titusville ordinances state or federal law in order to invoke the enforcement provisions of this section the activities described hereinabove must be traceable to the particular vendor against whom action is being taken and also must be verified by a police report police officers or code enforcement officers on the scene although not required police officers and code enforcement officers may at their discretion issue warnings that shall not be considered a notice of violation to put the vendor on notice that a particular problem or problems must be addressed and could result in a notice of violation if not corrected in addition the first violation by a vendor of a city code violation not state law violation shall be a written warning and not a notice of violation as provided for in subsection 8 any subsequent violation of any section of the city code may result in a notice of violation a vendor is encouraged to initiate calls for service to the police department if law violations are occurring on vendors property a notice of violation shall not be initiated for vendor initiated calls it is recognized that an incident that may occur during an extended hour period ie between  pm and  am could involve more than one 1 section of the code or violation of law any notice of violation that is issued that may involve multiple code or law violations on one 1 incident shall constitute one 1 notice of violation 8 notice of violation notice of violation may be issued by a police officer or code enforcement officer of a violation of this section and shall be issued to any vendor that meets or where applicable fails to meet the criteria established in subsection 7a b c d e f and g above the notice of violation shall be left with the owner proprietor or highest ranking employee then on the premises an additional copy of the notice will also be mailed via us mail certified return receipt requested to the vendor at the street address provided in the application proof of delivery by either of these two 2 methods hand delivery or mail shall be sufficient to establish receipt by the permit holder notices sent by mail that are returned or not accepted for any reason shall be deemed proper notice of the violation provided that the notice is sent to the person and address named on the application 9 consideration by city council should three 3 notices of violation be issued to any vendor within any three 3 consecutive month period the matter shall be placed on the city council agenda to consider the suspension of the vendors extended hours permit a such agenda item shall be publicly advertised in a newspaper of general circulation at least fourteen 14 days prior to any hearing of the agenda item and written notice of the charges against the vendor shall be provided at least fourteen 14 days in advance of the hearing the notice shall also contain the date time and place of the hearing such notice shall also advise the vendor of the right to be heard of the right to be represented by counsel of the right to present sworn testimony on the vendors behalf and the right to appeal to circuit court b after consideration of the matter and allowing the vendor to be heard the city council may take no action suspend or condition the extended hours privilege as they deem appropriate suspensions shall range from one 1 day in length to a maximum of ninety 90 days the maximum penalty for a first appearance by a vendor before the city council shall be thirty 30 days sixty 60 days for a second appearance and ninety 90 days for all appearances thereafter the city council shall base its decision on whether there is substantial competent evidence presented that supports a finding of noncompliance with the criteria in subsection 7a b c d e f or g as stated herein above c the city council may require as a condition of the continuation of the privilege of extra hours of operation compliance with any reasonable conditions d the city council may delegate the responsibility for conducting hearings pursuant to this section to a special magistrate any such delegation shall be by resolution 10 vendor name change any vendor that has had an extended hours of operation permit suspended or otherwise conditioned cannot avoid the consequences of the city councils action by changing its name or corporate status upon a showing to the city council that there has been a legitimate change in ownership at the location affected by the city councils actions the city council may consider allowing an extended hours of operation permit to issue at the site subject to applicable conditions if any to prevent a recurrence of the harms that caused the earlier action 11 vendors who were allowed to serve alcohol under previous ordinance those vendors in the city who are as of the effective date of this section allowed to serve alcoholic beverages for onpremises consumption later than that provided in this section preexisting late night vendors shall be treated as having an extended hours of operation permit including  subject to the same conditions and possibility of suspension as set forth above as of  such preexisting late night vendors shall be required to apply for an extended hours of operation permit in order to continue to serve alcoholic beverages at hours later than those provided in subsection a above and otherwise are subject to the terms of this section c liquors beers and wines hours of sale no vendors licensed under the state beverage law to sell liquor beer or wine by the package bottle or original container for consumption off premises shall sell or offer for sale or deliver any liquor beer or wine in the original package bottle or container for consumption off the premises during any hour prohibited by subsection a above businesses covered by this section are also required to obtain an extended hours of operation permit and are subject to all of the requirements of subsection b d taking container off premises after hours it is the intention of this section to prohibit such vendors from permitting anyone purchasing packing goods in the original container to leave the vendors premises during the prohibited hours taking with him in any container any beers wines liquors or alcoholic beverages originally purchased by package bottle or container so that the same may be consumed off the premises e sales by employees during prohibited hours any employee of a vendor licensed under the state beverage law shall not sell or offer for sale any beers wines liquors or alcoholic beverages of any kind during the prohibited hours f gifts it shall be deemed a violation of this section for any person or any agent servant or employee of any person licensed under the state beverage law during the hours prohibited under subsection c above to gratuitously give any kind of alcoholic beverage whether conditioned upon the purchase of any kind of alcoholic beverage or product of any nature at any inflated price or otherwise or in the form of a socalled bonus predicated upon another purchase or as a gift g enforcement procedures the enforcement procedures contained herein are alternative procedures and the city reserves the right to arrest prosecute take action code enforcement board or such alternative procedures as the law may authorize    81109   72611 state law reference municipality to prescribe hours of sale within corporate limits fs   562143 certain states of undress prohibited on premises under this chapter a for the purposes of this section the following definitions shall apply 1 areola shall mean the circular colored area which surrounds the nipple of a female breast 2 establishment dealing in alcoholic beverages shall mean any business or commercial establishment whether open to the public at large or where entrance is limited by cover charge or membership requirement including those licensed by the state for sale or service of alcoholic beverages and any bottle club  hotel  motel  restaurant  nightclub  country club  cabaret  meeting facility utilized by any religious social fraternal or similar organization  business or commercial establishment where a product or article is sold dispensed served or provided with the knowledge actual or implied that the product or article will be or is intended to be mixed combined with or drunk in connection or combination with an alcoholic beverage on the premises of the business or commercial establishment  or business or commercial establishment where the consumption of alcoholic beverages is permitted a private residence whether permanent or temporary in nature is not an establishment dealing in alcoholic beverages 3 premises shall mean a building that is under one roof or has common entrances and the area immediately surrounding the building b it shall be unlawful for any person maintaining owning operating or managing an establishment dealing in alcoholic beverages to 1 suffer or permit any female person to expose to the public view that area of the human breast below the top of the areola  2 suffer or permit any female person to employ any device or covering which is intended to give the appearance of or to simulate that area of a human female breast below the top of the areola  3 suffer or permit any person to expose to the public view his or her genitals pubic hair pubic area vulva buttocks or anus  or 4 suffer or permit any person to employ any device or covering which is intended to give the appearance of or to simulate human genitals pubic hair pubic area vulva buttocks or anus c it shall be unlawful for any person while on the premises of an establishment dealing in alcoholic beverages to 1 expose to public view his or her genitals pubic hair pubic area vulva buttocks or anus  or 2 employ any device or covering which is intended to give the appearance of or simulate human genitals pubic hair pubic area vulva buttocks or anus d it shall be unlawful for any female while on the premises of an establishment dealing in alcoholic beverages to 1 expose to public view that area of her breast below the top of the areola  or 2 expose any device or covering which is intended to give the appearance of or simulate that area of a human female breast below the top of the areola e it shall be unlawful for any person maintaining owning or operating an establishment dealing in alcoholic beverages to suffer or permit the exposition of any graphic representation including pictures or the projection of film which depicts human genitals pubic area vulva anus anal cleft or cleavage buttocks female breasts below the top of the areola sexual intercourse masturbation sodomy bestiality oral copulation flagellation any sexual act prohibited by law touching caressing or fondling of the breasts buttocks anus or genitals or any simulation thereof within any establishment dealing in alcoholic beverages f any person violating any of the provisions of this section shall upon conviction be punished as provided in section 115 of this    111390   81391 state law reference authority to regulate conduct fs  3 certain types of conduct prohibited on premises a for the purposes of this section the following definitions shall apply commercial establishment shall mean any establishment which operates for pecuniary gain lap shall mean the area between a persons knee and waist patron shall mean any person who is physically present on the premises of a commercial establishment and who is not an owner employee agent or subcontractor of such establishment or an entertainer or performer at the establishment premises shall mean a building that is under one 1 roof or has common entrances and the area immediately surrounding the building touching shall include any form of intentional interpersonal physical bodily contact whether or not exposed or unclothed parts of the body are involved b it shall be unlawful while on the premises of a commercial establishment at which alcoholic beverages are possessed consumed purchased sold dispensed or given away on the premises for any owner employee agent or subcontractor of such establishment or for any entertainer or performer at such establishment 1 to touch the clothed or unclothed breast of any female patron 2 to touch the clothed or unclothed body of any patron in the region of his or her genitals pubic hair pubic area vulva buttocks or anus 3 to suffer or permit herself to be touched on the breast by any patron if the owner employee agent subcontractor entertainer or performer so touched is a female 4 to sit on or in otherwise occupy the lap of any patron of such establishment c it shall be unlawful while on the premises of a commercial establishment at which alcoholic beverages are possessed consumed purchased sold dispensed or given away on the premises for any patron of said establishment 1 to touch the clothed or unclothed breast of any female owner employee agent or subcontractor of such establishment or of any female entertainer or performer at such establishment 2 to touch the clothed or unclothed body of any owner employee agent subcontractor entertainer or performer in the region of his or her genitals pubic hair pubic area vulva buttocks or anus 3 to suffer or permit herself to be touched on the breast by any owner employee agent or subcontractor of such establishment or by any entertainer or performer at such establishment if the patron is a female 4 to sit on or in or otherwise occupy the lap of any owner employee agent of or subcontractor of such establishment or of any entertainer or performer at such establishment d for the purposes of this section a commercial establishment licensed by the state to dispense alcoholic beverages on the premises shall be rebuttably presumed to be a commercial establishment at which alcoholic beverages are possessed consumed purchased sold dispensed or given away on the premises any establishment which has received an occupational license to operate commercially is presumed to be a commercial establishment e any person violating any of the provisions of this section shall upon conviction be punished as provided in section 115 of this f it shall be unlawful for any person maintaining owning operating or managing a commercial establishment at which alcoholic beverages are possessed consumed purchased sold dispensed or given away on the premises of that establishment to 1 suffer or permit any employee of or entertainer at such establishment to sit on or in or otherwise occupy the lap of any patron of such establishment 2 suffer or permit any employee of or entertainer at such establishment to touch the clothed or unclothed breast of any female patron 3 suffer or permit any employee of or entertainer at such establishment to touch the clothed or unclothed body of any patron at the point below the waist and above the knee of such patron 4 suffer or permit any employee of or entertainer at such establishment to suffer or permit himself or herself to be touched by any patron in either of the following clothed or unclothed areas of the body a at any point below the waist and above the knee b on the breast if the employee entertainer or performer so touched is a female g it shall be unlawful for any person maintaining owning operating or managing a commercial establishment at which alcoholic beverages are possessed consumed purchased sold dispensed or given away on the premises of that establishment to 1 suffer or permit any patron of or entertainer at such establishment to sit on or in or otherwise occupy the lap of any employee of or entertainer or performer at such establishment 2 suffer or permit any patron of such establishment to touch the clothed or unclothed breast of any female employee of or entertainer or performer at such establishment 3 suffer or permit any patron of such establishment to permit himself or herself to be touched by any employee of or entertainer or performer at such establishment in either of the following clothed or unclothed areas of the body a at any point below the waist and above the knee b on the breast if the patron is a female    111390 state law 7 111390 cross reference adult entertainment regulations  1181 et seq possession of open containers a for purposes of this section alcoholic beverage is defined as set forth in section 41 of the b for purposes of this section open container means any container which is immediately capable of being consumed from or the seal of which has been broken c it shall be unlawful for anyone to consume or possess open containers of beer wine alcoholic beverages or intoxicating liquors off the premises of an establishment dealing in or licensed to sell alcoholic beverages or bottle clubs and within three hundred 300 feet of the premises except within enclosed buildings or on premises occupied solely by residential structures or by an owner or tenant of a premises which is within three hundred 300 feet the distance set forth herein shall be measured from the shortest route of ordinary pedestrian travel along public thoroughfares from the principal entrance of the establishment dealing in alcoholic beverages or bottle club to the location of the violation of this section d each establishment dealing in alcoholic beverages and each bottle club shall at all times when such establishment is open to the public or is dispensing or selling alcoholic beverages have located in the interior as well as the exterior portions of the building licensed for sale of such beverages at a location which can be readily seen and read by customers of the establishment a sign prominently displayed of a size at least one 1 foot by two 2 feet containing the following information it is unlawful to consume or possess an open container of alcoholic beverages within 300 feet of this establishment and off of these licensed premises city code of ordinances 48 e the city manager or his designee shall prescribe by rule the location of the signs and the size of the lettering following as his guidelines the criteria set forth above it shall be unlawful for the owner of any establishment dealing in alcoholic beverages or any bottle club to fail to comply with this section or for any person to sell dispense or serve alcoholic beverages in any establishment which is not in compliance with this section the requirements of this section shall then apply to all establishments dealing in alcoholic beverages or bottle clubs whether or not then licensed or licensed in the future f violation of this section shall be punishable as provided in section 115 of this  3993 purchase sale possession etc in parks playgrounds recreational areas or public parking lots exceptions it shall be unlawful for any person to purchase sell or offer for sale have in his possession or consume any alcoholic beverage in or on any playground or recreational area or public park or public parking lot within the corporate limits of the city except as follows 1 the purchase sale possession and consumption of beer and wine shall be permitted at titusville memorial pier and the titusville municipal marina 2 the sale of alcoholic beverages at golf courses located within the city by a licensed vendor the purchase possession andor consumption of alcoholic beverages by patrons of such golf courses shall be permitted during the hours of operation of such golf courses andor clubhouse located at such golf courses and club pools only if such alcoholic beverages being purchased possessed andor consumed have been purchased as such course from a licensed vendor 3 the sale possession and consumption of alcoholic beverages may be permitted at other locations when specifically authorized by the city council or authorized by a representative of the county pursuant to an agreement between the city and county in the administration of city parks 4 prohibition against the sale possession and consumption of alcoholic beverages at other locations in the city may be temporarily permitted by the city council upon a finding that such permit would be in the best interests of the citizens of the city and upon a consideration by the city council of such factors as the time date location and length of the permit requested the number and average age of the persons expected at the event for which the permit is requested and such other factors as the city council may deem relevant  3993   32619 possession or consumption on streets sidewalks alleys or other city property prohibited  exceptions a it is unlawful for any person to consume or possess an open container of any alcoholic beverage or any mixture containing an alcoholic beverage on the streets sidewalks or alleys within the city b it is unlawful for any person to consume or possess an open container of any alcoholic beverage or any mixture containing an alcoholic beverage on the streets sidewalks or alleys within the city while such person as operator or passenger is inon any vehicle whether moving or stopped and such consumption is open to public view this section shall not apply to 1 a passenger of a vehicle in which the driver is operating the vehicle pursuant to a contract to provide transportation for passengers and such driver holds a valid commercial drivers license with a passenger endorsement or a class d drivers license issued in accordance with the requirements of fs ch 322  2 a passenger of a bus in which the driver holds a valid commercial drivers license with a passenger endorsement or a class d drivers license issued in accordance with the requirements of fs ch 322  or 3 a passenger of a selfcontained motor home which is in excess of twentyone 21 feet in length  3993 sale and consumption restricted to licensed building  exceptions a it shall be unlawful for any licensed vendor or for any agent servant or employee of any such vendor to permit the consumption of any alcoholic beverages in or upon any parking or other areas outside of the building or room mentioned in his license certificate as the address thereof the foregoing prohibition shall not include areas around swimming pools of hotels or motels when any part of such parking or other area is adjacent to the building or premises in which the business licensed under such section is operated and such parking or other area is owned rented leased regulated controlled or provided directly or indirectly by such licensed vendor or by any agent servant or employee of such licensed vendor and if such licensed vendor has posted and maintained a legible painted or printed sign in at least two 2 prominent places on such parking or other area with sufficient light directed thereon to be visible during the hours of darkness while such place of business is open in letters of not less than three inches in height stating warning drinking alcoholic beverages on this lot prohibitedup to $50000 fine or 60 days in jail city ordinance then in that event said posting shall constitute prima facie evidence that such vendor is not operating in violation of this subsection b it shall be unlawful for any person to consume any alcoholic beverage in or upon any parking or other area outside of and adjacent to a vendors licensed premises when such parking or other area is owned rented leased regulated controlled or provided either directly or indirectly by such vendor the foregoing prohibition shall not apply to areas around swimming pools of hotels or motels c if any licensed vendor mentioned herein be a corporate then the officers of the corporation shall be regarded as the owners thereof for the purpose of enforcement of this section d any person violating any of the provisions of this section shall upon conviction be punished as provided in section 115 of this  3993 removal of alcoholic beverages in open or unsealed container from licensed premises it is unlawful for any vendor or his agents or employees licensed to sell beer wine liquor or other alcoholic beverages within the city to knowingly allow any person to take from the licensed premises any opened beer wine liquor or other alcoholic beverage container or to knowingly allow any person to take from the premises any glass or other open or unsealed container of an alcoholic beverage or any mixture containing an alcoholic beverage  3993 animals footnotes  1  cross reference zoning regulations  6000 et seq land development regulations vol ii state law reference damage by dogs fs ch 767  animal cruelty and control of animals fs ch 828 article i  in general definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning animal shall mean any dumb living creature animal control officer shall mean any person employed or appointed by the county who is authorized to investigate on public or private property violations relating to animal control or cruelty to animals and to issue citations as provided in this chapter and in accordance with fs  82827 animal control supervisor shall mean the supervisor of the county animal control at large shall mean off the premises of the owner and not under the physical control of the owner or keeper by means of a leash cord or chain a police dog or police horse as defined in fs  84319 while in use by a law enforcement agency shall not be deemed at large board shall mean the board of county commissioners of the county citation shall mean a written notice issued to a person by an officer who has probable cause to believe that the person to whom the citation has been issued has committed a violation of a duly enacted ordinance or code and that the county court shall hear the charge the citation shall contain the following 1 the date and time of issuance 2 the name and address of the person to whom the citation has been issued 3 the date and time the violation was committed 4 the facts constituting probable cause 5 the number of the ordinance or code section violated 6 the name and authority of the police officer issuing the citation 7 the procedure for the person to follow in order to pay the civil penalty or to contest the citation 8 the applicable civil penalty if the person elects to contest the citation 9 the applicable penalty if the person elects not to contest the citation 10 a conspicuous statement that substantially states that if the person fails to pay the civil penalty within the time allowed or fails to appear in court to contest the citation or fails to provide reasonable cause for nonappearance the person shall be deemed to have waived his right to contest the citation and in such case judgment may be entered by the court against the person for an amount up to the maximum civil penalty control shall mean the regulation of the possession ownership keeping care or custody of animals cruelty shall mean any act of neglect torture or torment that causes unjustifiable pain or suffering to an animal dangerous animal shall mean any animal that according to the records of the county animal control 1 has aggressively bitten attacked or endangered a human being or has inflicted severe injury on a human being on public or private property  2 has more than once severely injured or killed a domestic animal while off the owners property  or 3 has been used primarily or in part for the purpose of fighting or is a dog trained for dog fighting  or 4 has without provocation chased or approached a person upon the streets sidewalks or any public grounds in a menacing fashion or apparent attitude of attack provided that such actions are attested to in a sworn statement by one 1 or more persons and dutifully investigated by the appropriate authority domestic animal shall mean any equine bovine goat sheep swine dog cat poultry or other domesticated beast or bird hazardous animal shall mean any animal which without provocation has inflicted any minor injury to a human being or domestic animal insecurely fenced property shall mean real property that an animal can readily enter upon or leave by going over under or existing fence keeper shall mean any person firm corporation partnership association trust estate or legal or business entity having possession custody or control of an animal kennel shall mean any enclosure in which an animal is confined and secured license certificate shall mean a county animal license certificate issued pursuant to this chapter license tag shall mean a county animal license tag issued pursuant to this chapter licensed veterinarian shall mean any person who is licensed to engage in the practice of veterinary medicine in the state under the authority of fs ch 474 nuisance shall mean disturbing the peace and quiet of any person by habitually or continuously barking howling crying screaming or making other bothersome noises officer shall mean any law enforcement officer as defined in fs  94310  any veterinarian as defined in fs  47402  and any animal control officer as defined in this section owner shall mean any person firm corporation partnership association trust estate or any other legal entity business unit or organization possessing harboring keeping or having control or custody of an animal or if the animal is owned by a person under the age of eighteen 18 years that persons parent or legal guardian secure enclosure shall mean 1 a building in which an animal is confined such as the owners dwelling  or 2 a kennel with secure top and secure sides consisting of at least 11gauge chainlink wire which does not share fencing with the perimeter of the premises and which is secured so as to prevent the animal from escaping and which provides protection from the elements severe injury shall mean any physical injury that results in a broken bone or multiple punctures or disfiguring lacerations requiring sutures or cosmetic surgery unprovoked shall mean that the victim has been conducting himself peacefully and lawfully and has been bitten or chased in a menacing fashion or attacked by an animal 43 4991 cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 authority and purpose this chapter is hereby enacted pursuant to the provisions of fs  12501 and 82827 and laws of fla ch 90180 with the purpose of regulating the possession ownership keeping care and custody of animals in the interest of the health safety and welfare of the people of the city 41 4991 wildlife sanctuary all property within the limits of the city is hereby declared to be a bird and wildlife sanctuary the indian river audubon society an organization organized and promoted by the citizens is hereby given permission to erect appropriate signs approved by the city manager on public property designated by the city stating that the city has been declared to be a bird and wildlife sanctuary and that hunting is prohibited within the corporate limits of the city it shall be unlawful for any person to hunt shoot or kill birds or wildlife within the city unless written permission is expressly granted to an individual or group by the city manager  animals creating nuisance prohibited any person that owns keeps or harbors any animal which is found to have done any of the following acts shall be deemed in violation of this section and shall be punished as provided in section 57 et seq the following are the offenses that are deemed to create a nuisance 1 any animal or bird which a frequently and for continued duration howls barks meows squawks or makes other sounds  b endangers or injures the safety or health of humans  c annoys or disturbs a reasonable person of normal sensitivities across residential real property boundaries  d by its own condition or the condition of its confinement creates obnoxious odors 2 any animal that chases or runs after persons or vehicles  disposal of domestic dead animals a by resolution the board of county commissioners shall establish fees to be charged for disposal by the county of domestic dead animals from private property b the owner of any real property may bury or dispose of any dead animal on such property after notice to the animal control supervisor unless otherwise prohibited by law 47 4991 quarantine of animals a the provisions of sections 10d florida administrative sections 10d florida administrative are hereby adopted by reference in this chapter a copy of chapter 103 florida administrative has been attached to the ordinance enacting this chapter and is available for inspection in the office of the clerk to the board of county commissioners b it is a violation of this chapter for any person to commit an act or cause an act to be committed which is in violation of any provision of sections 10d florida administrative c if quarantine of a dog or cat cannot be maintained at the owners home or at another location permitted under section 10d2 florida administrative the dog or cat shall be quarantined at a county shelter or other shelter facility or veterinary clinic it is a violation of this chapter for the owner of a dog or cat to refuse or fail to maintain the dog or cat under rabies quarantine as required by section 10d2 florida administrative d by resolution the board shall establish fees to be charged for the quarantine of animals pursuant to this chapter e a police dog as defined in fs  84319 with a current rabies vaccination who bites in the line of duty shall be exempt from confinement under this section and allowed to continue in a working capacity 48 4991 proceedings for violations a an officer who has probable cause to believe that a person has committed an act in violation of this chapter may issue a citation to such person b any citation issued pursuant to this chapter may be contested in the county court c if the person issued a citation elects not to contest the citation that person shall pay the applicable civil penalty to the clerk of the county court within ten 10 days after issuance of the citation d if a person issued a citation elects to contest the citation that person shall request a hearing before the county court within ten 10 days after issuance of the citation the clerk shall schedule a hearing in the county court and shall provide written notice of the date time and location of the hearing to the person issued the citation and the applicable officer e if the person issued a citation fails to pay the applicable civil penalty within the time period allowed or fails to appear in court to contest the citation that person shall be deemed to have waived his right to contest the citation and in such case judgment may be entered against the person for an amount up to the maximum civil penalty provided for such a violation of this chapter 416 4991 penalties a a violation of this chapter shall constitute a civil infraction b the maximum civil penalty for a violation of this chapter shall not exceed five hundred dollars $50000 per violation c if a person who has committed a violation does not contest the citation the civil penalty shall be less than the maximum civil penalty d by resolution the board of county commissioners shall establish the amount of any civil penalty for a violation e any person who willfully refuses to sign and accept a citation issued by an officer pursuant to this chapter shall be guilty of a violation punishable as provided by fs    or  417 4991 alternative remedies in addition to the penalties otherwise provided in this chapter the city or board of county commissioners shall have the right to enforce by injunction or any other appropriate legal means compliance with the regulations and requirements of this chapter 418 4991 secs 510526  reserved article ii  enforcement footnotes  2  state law reference penalties and enforcement of provisions regarding care and control of animals fs  82827 contract with county a the city is empowered and authorized to contract with the board of county commissioners for the enforcement of this chapter any reference to the county animal control officer shall be deemed to be an animal control officer who is acting pursuant to an agreement between the city and county and such county animal control officer shall have authority to enforce the provisions of this chapter b the city has entered into an agreement with the county and the provisions of this chapter shall be enforced by the county animal control officer c any police officer of the city may arrest without warrant any person found violating any of the provisions of this chapter  483 484 jurisdiction the county is empowered and authorized to enforce this chapter any reference to an animal control officer shall be deemed to be an animal control officer who is acting on behalf of the county 42 4991 animal control officers a the county animal control director is authorized to administer and enforce the provisions of this chapter b the board of county commissioners may employ animal control officers to assist in the administration and enforcement of this chapter such animal control officers shall successfully complete a training program as provided by county policies and in accordance with fs  82827 c animal control officers are not authorized to bear arms or make arrests d it is a violation of this chapter for any person to resist obstruct hinder or interfere with the animal control supervisor or an animal control officer in the administration or enforcement of this chapter e the animal control supervisor and animal control officers may enter upon public property and unfenced or insecurely fenced private property except residential dwellings to administer and enforce the provisions of this chapter the animal control supervisor and animal control officers shall be immune from prosecution for reasonable good faith trespass upon such private property as provided in fs  81012 f the animal control supervisor and animal control officers shall investigate complaints of alleged violations of this chapter g the animal control supervisor and animal control officers are hereby authorized to catch seize or pick up 1 any sick or injured animal including any animal subjected to cruelty or in need of immediate medical attention  2 any animal infected with or suspected of carrying rabies or any other infectious disease  3 any dangerous animal not properly confined or restrained  4 any hazardous animal not properly confined or restrained  5 any animal not properly quarantined  6 any animal at large  7 any animal causing injury or threat of injury to any person by being at large or chasing persons or by causing property damage to a person other than the owner of the animal  8 any female dog or cat in heat not properly confined  9 any dog or cat not vaccinated against rabies  and 10 any animal deemed in violation of this chapter h the animal control supervisor and animal control officers shall impound any animal caught seized or picked up pursuant to this chapter i it is a violation of this chapter for any person to remove or attempt to remove an animal from the custody of the animal control supervisor or an animal control officer j it is a violation of this chapter for any person to fail to surrender an animal or the carcass of a dead animal upon lawful demand by the animal control supervisor or any animal control officer k the animal control supervisor may declare an animal to be a hazardous animal or dangerous animal pursuant to the provisions of this chapter and shall order the owner or keeper of such animal to confine or restrain such animal as required by this chapter animal control officers may inspect the premises of the owner or keeper of such animal to determine compliance with any order of the animal control supervisor under this section and all other provisions of this chapter 44 4991 impoundment of animals a the board of county commissioners may purchase construct lease operate and maintain county shelters or contract for other shelter facilities to maintain any animal authorized to be caught seized or picked up by the animal control supervisor or animal control officer b it is a violation of this chapter for any person to remove or attempt to remove any animal from a county shelter or other shelter facility c the animal control supervisor may engage the services of a licensed veterinarian to treat any sick or injured animal including any animal subjected to cruelty or any animal infected with or suspected of carrying rabies which animal has been impounded pursuant to this chapter the owner or keeper of such animal shall be liable for payment of all veterinary and shelter expenses and reimbursement of the countys expenses for treating such animal d by resolution the board shall establish fees to be charged for impounding boarding and feeding animals pursuant to this chapter e no animal impounded pursuant to this chapter shall be released until 1 the owner or keeper of an impounded dog or cat which is not vaccinated against rabies or which does not have a valid license certificate or license tag arranges for rabies vaccination and obtains a license certificate and license tag for the dog or cat  2 the owner or keeper of an impounded animal pays the fees for impoundment board and feed and any additional fees for rabies vaccination veterinary expenses and license certificate and license tag  3 the owner or keeper of an impounded animal provides proof of ownership or custody such as a license certificate sales receipt affidavits of neighbors photographs or other documentary evidence  4 if a hazardous or dangerous animal is impounded the owner or keeper of such animal must comply with all provisions of this chapter applicable to such hazardous or dangerous animal  5 if an animal which has been subjected to cruelty is impounded the county court issues a release order as provided by fs   45 4991 disposition of impounded animals a an animal control officer shall attempt to identify and locate the owner or keeper of an animal impounded pursuant to this chapter if the owner or keeper is identified and located the animal control officer shall provide notice to the owner or keeper that the animal has been impounded and may be redeemed within five 5 days of such notice the fiveday period for redemption shall not include the day of impoundment the last day of such fiveday period shall only occur on a day that the county shelter or other shelter facility at which the subject animal has been impounded is open for business b an animal impounded pursuant to this chapter shall become the property of the county when 1 the owner or keeper of such animal is not identified or located within five 5 days after impoundment  2 the owner or keeper of such animal is notified but does not redeem the animal within five 5 days after notice  3 confinement of a wild or feral animal creates unusual risks to such animal or an animal control officer  or 4 any animal is examined by a licensed veterinarian who determines that the medical condition of the animal warrants humane destruction c when an animal becomes the property of the county the animal control supervisor may without further notice to the former owner or keeper 1 transfer ownership of such animal to a humane society humane agency law enforcement agency zoo or other person institution or agency provided that such person institution or agency agrees to record the name and address of the new owner upon subsequent transfer of ownership of the animal  or 2 destroy such animal in a humane manner d any animal subjected to cruelty impounded under this chapter shall be disposed of as provided by fs ch 828 e any livestock as defined in fs  58813 impounded pursuant to this chapter shall be disposed of as provided by fs ch 588 46 4991 secs 532545  reserved vaccination of dogs and cats a the owner or keeper of a dog or cat in the city shall cause such dog or cat to be vaccinated against rabies each year by a licensed veterinarian b it is a violation of this chapter for the owner or keeper of a dog or cat to refuse or fail to have the dog or cat vaccinated against rabies as required by this section  provided however that rabies vaccination is not required if 1 a dog or cat is less than four 4 months of age  2 a dog or cat has been vaccinated against rabies in another state during a period not to exceed one 1 year from the date of the rabies vaccination provided that the owner of such dog or cat presents a certificate of rabies vaccination to the animal control supervisor  or 3 a licensed veterinarian examines the dog or cat and certifies in writing that rabies vaccination would endanger the health of such dog or cat due to age infirmity disability illness or other medical condition  provided however the licensed veterinarian presents such certificate to the animal control supervisor within five 5 days after the examination and that dog or cat is confined in a secure enclosure until a licensed veterinarian properly vaccinates the dog or cat 414 4991 license certificates and license tags a the owner or keeper of a dog or cat in the city which is vaccinated against rabies shall obtain a license certificate and license tag for such dog or cat each year b it is a violation of this chapter for the owner or keeper of a dog or cat to refuse or fail to obtain a license tag for the dog or cat as provided by this section c a license certificate and license tag are not required if the owner or keeper of the dog or cat has not resided in the city for more than the previous twentyeight 28 days d the animal control supervisor shall approve the form content and design of the license certificate and license tag no other license certificate or license tag shall be valid in the city e by resolution the board of county commissioners shall establish fees to be charged for the issuance of license certificates and license tags f any resident of the city who owns or keeps a dog guide especially trained for such purpose and is being used to assist a deaf person or totally or partially blind person or physically disabled person as defined in fs  41308 may obtain a license certificate and license tag for such dog guide at no charge g a license certificate and license tag shall be issued by 1 the animal control supervisor or designee  or 2 any licensed veterinarian who administers the rabies vaccination and has been authorized by the county to collect the fee for such license certificate and license tag h the license certificate shall be signed by the licensed veterinarian administering the rabies vaccination and shall list the date of rabies vaccination the type of vaccine information identifying the owner or keeper and describing the dog or cat an identification number shall be printed on the license certificate and shall correspond to the same number on the license tag i if a license tag is lost or destroyed the owner or keeper of the dog or cat shall obtain a replacement license tag a replacement license tag may be issued to the owner or keeper of a dog or cat upon presentation of a corresponding license certificate and payment of the applicable fee j the license tag shall be attached to the collar or harness of the dog or cat and shall be worn at all times except when such dog or cat is confined for treatment in a veterinary hospital or clinic operated by a licensed veterinarian or while competing in an organized animal show trial or doing training therefor k it is a violation of this chapter for the owner or keeper of a dog or cat to permit or allow the dog or cat to be without a physically attached license tag as required by this section l each license certificate and license tag shall be valid for a period of one 1 year from the date of the rabies vaccination m it is a violation of this chapter for the owner or keeper of a dog or cat to permit or allow the dog or cat to wear a license tag which has expired n a license certificate or license tag issued for one 1 dog or cat is not valid for any other dog or cat and it is a violation of this chapter for the owner or keeper of a dog or cat to allow the dog or cat to wear a license tag which has not been issued for such dog or cat o a police dog as defined in fs  84319 shall be exempt from wearing a license tag while being used by a law enforcement agency 415 4991 secs 549565  reserved article iv  care and control of animals hazardous animals when the animal control supervisor declares that an animal is a hazardous animal the animal control supervisor shall provide written notice to the owner or keeper of such animal the written notice shall include the basis for declaring the animal hazardous a description of the animal and describe the responsibility of the owner or keeper for maintenance of the animal 49 4991 dangerous animals a when the animal control supervisor declares that an animal is a dangerous animal the animal control supervisor shall provide written notice to the owner or keeper of such animal by registered mail or certified mail or hand delivery the written notice shall include the basis for declaring the animal dangerous a description of the animal and describe the responsibility of the owner or keeper for maintenance of the animal b within thirty 30 days after the animal has been declared dangerous the owner of the dangerous animal must obtain a certificate of registration for the dangerous animal from the county animal control and a certificate shall be renewed annually the county is authorized to issue such certificates of registration and the renewals thereof only to persons who are at least eighteen 18 years of age and who present to the county animal control evidence of 1 a current certificate of rabies vaccination for the animal  2 a secure enclosure to confine a dangerous animal and the posting of the premises with a clearly visible warning sign at all entry points that informs both children and adults of the presence of a dangerous animal on the property  3 permanent identification of the dangerous animal such as a tattoo on the inside thigh or an electronic implantation as specified by the animal control supervisor  and 4 payment of the applicable annual fee for the issuance of the certificate of registration required by this section the annual fee shall be established by the board of county commissioners by resolution c the owner shall immediately notify the appropriate animal control authority when an animal that has been classified as dangerous 1 is loose at large or unconfined  2 is sold given away or dies  or 3 is moved to an address other than that stated in the certificate of registration d any animal declared to be dangerous shall be confined in a secure enclosure on the premises of the owner or keeper of such animal no dangerous animal shall be permitted or allowed off the premises of the owner or keeper unless such animal receives approval by the animal control supervisor or requires veterinary treatment and remains 1 inside a locked animal carrier  or 2 under the physical control of the owner or keeper and is securely muzzled and restrained by a chain or lead with a minimal tensile strength of three hundred 300 pounds and which does not exceed three 3 feet in length  and 3 subject to such further conditions as established by the animal control supervisor e it is a violation of this chapter for the owner or keeper of a dangerous animal to refuse or fail to confine or restrain such dangerous animal as required by this section f it is a violation of this chapter for any person to release or remove a dangerous animal from a secure enclosure contrary to the provisions of this section g no dangerous animal impounded pursuant to this chapter shall be released until 1 the owner or keeper of such dangerous animal presents proof to the animal control supervisor that the animal will be confined as required by this section  and 2 the owner or keeper of such dangerous animal executes a sworn affidavit acknowledging that the animal has been declared dangerous and agreeing to confine and restrain the animal and recognizing the countys right to ownership and custody of the animal if the animal bites or injures a human being or another animal after being declared dangerous h the owner or keeper of a dangerous animal shall report in writing the name and address of any new owner or keeper of the dangerous animal to the animal control supervisor prior to transfer of ownership or custody of such dangerous animal i the owner or keeper of a dangerous animal shall report in writing or by telephone the death of such animal to the animal control supervisor immediately the death of such animal shall be verified by a licensed veterinarian or an animal control officer j this section does not apply to police dogs as defined in fs  84319 k any violation of any provision of this section shall constitute a civil infraction punishable by a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 per violation l if an animal that previously has been declared dangerous under this chapter attacks or bites a person or domestic animal without provocation the owner of the animal upon conviction shall be punished as provided under fs   or fs   in addition the animal shall be immediately confiscated by the county animal control placed in quarantine if necessary for the proper length of time or impounded and held ten 10 business days and thereafter destroyed in an expeditious and humane manner this tenday time period shall allow the owner or keeper to apply to a court of competent jurisdiction for any remedies that may be available the owner or keeper shall be responsible for payment of all boarding costs and other fees as may be required to humanely and safely keep the animal during any appeal procedure m if an animal that has not been previously declared dangerous under this chapter aggressively attacks and causes severe injury to or death of any human the owner of the dangerous animal upon conviction shall be punished as provided in fs   or fs   in addition the animal shall be immediately confiscated by the county animal control placed in quarantine if necessary for the proper length of time or impounded and held ten 10 business days and thereafter destroyed in an expeditious and humane manner this tenday time period shall allow the owner or keeper to apply to a court of competent jurisdiction for any remedies that may be available the owner or keeper shall be responsible for payment of all boarding costs and other fees as may be required to humanely and safely keep the animal during any appeal procedure n if an animal that previously has been declared dangerous under this chapter attacks or bites a person or domestic animal without provocation the owner of the animal upon conviction shall be punished as provided under fs    or  in addition the animal shall be immediately confiscated by the county animal control placed in quarantine if necessary for the proper length of time or impounded and held ten 10 business days and thereafter destroyed in an expeditious and humane manner this tenday time period shall allow the owner or keeper to apply to a court of competent jurisdiction for any remedies that may be available the owner or keeper shall be responsible for payment of all boarding costs and other fees as may be required to humanely and safely keep the animal during any appeal procedure 410 4991 responsibility for animals a the owner or keeper of any animal shall exercise reasonable care to protect humans other animals or property from injury or damage caused by the behavior of such animal b the owner or keeper of any animal shall exercise reasonable care to prevent such animal while unattended from leaving the premises of such owner or keeper by 1 confinement in a secure enclosure fence or pen from which the animal cannot dig climb jump or escape and which is locked when the animal remains unattended  2 restraint by chain cable and trolley or other tether of sufficient strength to prevent escape  or 3 leash and physical control of a person capable of preventing such animal from escaping c the owner or keeper of an animal shall exercise reasonable care to maintain such animal while off the premises of such owner or keeper by 1 confinement in a secure enclosure fence or pen from which the animal cannot dig climb jump or escape  2 confinement in a vehicle from which the animal cannot climb jump or escape  or 3 leash and physical control of a person capable of preventing such animal from escaping 411 4991 animals at large  confinement of animals a no animal shall be permitted or allowed to be at large b it is a violation of this chapter for the owner or keeper of an animal to permit or allow the animal to be at large c no animal shall be permitted or allowed to cause injury or threat of injury to any person or cause any property damage to a person other than the owner as a result of the animal being at large it is a violation of this chapter for the owner or keeper of an animal to permit or allow the animal to violate this subsection d no animal shall be permitted or allowed to defecate or urinate upon any public property or any private property without permission of the property owner it is a violation of this chapter for the owner or keeper of an animal to permit or allow the animal to defecate or urinate upon any public property or any private property without permission of the property owner e no animal shall be permitted or allowed into or on any public park or beach  provided however that an area in public parks may be designated for animals by resolution of the board of county commissioners or by the city in that event the area provided for animals must be properly identified and posted by the county or the city f it is a violation of this chapter for the owner or keeper of an animal to permit or allow the animal into or on any public beach or any public park not designated for animals and not properly identified and posted however a deaf person or totally or partially blind person or physically disabled person as defined in fs  41308 shall have the right to be accompanied into or on any public park or beach by a guide dog which is especially trained for such purpose and while being used to assist such person without violating this section g any animal being transported in the open bed of a pickup truck or other similar vehicle from which the animal can easily escape shall be confined inside a locked animal carrier or restrained by a minimum of two 2 tethers with one 1 tether being affixed to the opposite side of the truck or other similar vehicle and both tethers being attached to the collar or harness of such animal it is a violation of this chapter for the owner or keeper of an animal as well as the driver of the pickup truck or other similar vehicle being used to transport an animal to refuse or fail to confine or restrain the animal being transported as required by this section h any female dog or cat in heat shall be confined in a secure enclosure veterinary hospital or boarding facility so as to prevent such dog or cat from coming into contact with another dog or cat except for intentional breeding purposes it is a violation of this chapter for the owner or keeper of a female dog or cat in heat to refuse or fail to confine the dog or cat as required by this section 412 4991 cruelty to animals a the provisions of fs  82812 and 82813 are hereby adopted by reference in this chapter and shall be enforced as if fully set forth in this chapter a copy of fs ch 828 is attached to the ordinance enacting this chapter and is available for inspection in the office of the clerk to the board of county commissioners b it is a violation of this chapter for any person to commit an act or omission or cause an act to be committed in violation of fs  82812 or 82813 413 4991 secs 571585  reserved article v  livestock and fowl division 1  generally certain animals restricted  permits for certain animals required a it shall be unlawful for any person to keep or permit to be kept within the city any horses hogs sheep goats cattle chickens or other farm animals and any domestic animal from the wild except 1 the aforementioned animals shall be allowed in any guzoned district provided the regulations as provided in section 6511 et seq land development regulations volume ii are complied with 2 animals as aforedescribed shall be permitted in other districts provided they are an incidental or necessary part of a licensed business ie veterinarian pet shop etc 3 horses or ponies may be allowed in any district in the city provided a permit as provided for in section 5101 has been secured 4 seamless banded homing pigeons for sporting andor exhibition purposes shall be permitted as accessory uses in any residential use district 5 backyard chickens shall be permitted on a singlefamily properties subject to all regulations described below a for the purposes of this section the terms backyard chicken or chicken refers to hens or female chickens only it shall be unlawful to keep ducks geese turkeys peafowl roosters or male chickens or any other fowl b no more than four 4 chickens shall be permitted on any lot or parcel c chickens may only be kept for personal use selling chickens eggs feathers or chicken manure or the breeding of chickens for commercial purposes shall be prohibited d chickens shall not be slaughtered on site e all stored feed must be kept in a pestproof container or be kept inside a secured structure f chicken coops and enclosures must be maintained in a clean and sanitary condition at all times including dry bedding material activities permitted by this section must be conducted in a manner that does not create a public nuisance such as odor noise or the attraction of pests g chickens must be kept within a coop or enclosure and may not be released or set free to roam unless such roaming is confined to the fenced rear yard of the subject property h chicken coops and enclosures must be screened from neighboring properties with either an opaque fence andor landscaping i chicken coops and enclosures shall be located in the rear yard only no chicken coop or enclosure shall be closer than ten 10 feet from any rear or side property line side corner setbacks shall meet the principal structure setbacks j a permit is required applications shall be filed with the city clerks office together with a filing fee to be set by resolution of council the applications must include a site sketch that demonstrates compliance with the regulations in the subsections above the applicant must also provide proof of successful completion of a university of floridaifas backyard chicken training class or an equivalent class approved by the city manager or designee the city manager or designee is authorized to revoke an issued permit if the property is no longer in compliance or is creating a public nuisance  8817 cross reference general use gu district  6511 et seq land development regulations vol ii nuisances any horse hog sheep goat cow chicken or other farm animal which causes frequent or longcontinued noise that can be heard at a distance of five hundred 500 feet from the fence enclosing the animal or which causes serious annoyance to neighboring residents or shall interfere with the reasonable use and enjoyment of the property of a reasonable man is hereby declared a nuisance and considered in violation of this chapter and upon conviction is punishable as provided for in section 115 and section 57 et seq 3 secs 5885100  reserved division 2  horses permit required any person may apply for a permit for the keeping of horses or ponies in accordance with this section 2a   102803 application an application for a permit shall be filed with the city clerk together with a filing fee of twentyfive dollars $2500 which fee shall accompany the application the application form must be fully completed and the applicant shall include as a part of his application a map or sketch showing the location size and dimensions of the parcel the relationship of the site to surrounding property and buildings and the location of fences as required in this article within ten 10 working days of receipt of the application by the clerk the city manager or his designee shall approve approve subject to conditions or deny the request 2a   102803 considerations in issuance of permit the factors considered in determining whether a permit shall be issued are as follows 1 will public safety and health and welfare be assured 2 will there be any detrimental effect to surrounding property owners 3 will all design requirements be met 4 will any nuisances be created 2b   102803 design requirements for permit prior to the issuance of the permit for horses or ponies the city manager or his designee shall inspect the property to determine whether or not the applicant complies with the following design requirements 1 size of parcel the minimum size of the parcel and number of horses or ponies permitted shall comply with the following schedule a one 1 acre one 1 horse or pony b two 2 acres two 2 horses or ponies c three 3 acres three 3 horses or ponies d not more than three 3 horses or ponies shall be permitted on any parcel other than a gu district e the average depth to average width shall not be in excess of  2 fencing the parcel on which the horses or ponies are to be kept shall be enclosed by a fence at least four 4 feet in height capable of securing the animal 3 relationship to surrounding property no horse or pony shall be permitted within fifty 50 feet of any residence except the residence of the applicant 2c   102803 revocation of permit a if a permit for horses and ponies has been issued and it is found that the applicant has violated any of the aforementioned design requirements or a condition imposed by the permit the city manager shall be authorized to revoke the permit b the applicant shall have the right to appeal the revocation of the permit to the board of adjustments and appeal as provided for in division 2 of the land development regulations 2d   102803 article vi  animal displays or exhibits purpose and intent the purpose and intent of this article is to protect the health safety and welfare of the public and animals by establishing a process and regulations pertaining to the display and exhibition of animals exposed to the public for entertainment or amusement on property within the city of titusville  61014 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning display or exhibit shall mean any exhibition act show photographic opportunity ride performance or similar undertaking whether or not a fee is charged display or exhibit shall not include the use or exhibition of animals solely for animalrelated educational purposes by groups institutions or individuals educational purposes means teaching and instructing with the intent and effect of imparting knowledge to others  61014 animal displays or exhibits a no person or entity shall exhibit or display to the public for entertainment amusement or promotion any live animal on property within the city unless they have first secured all federal and state licenses and permits authorizing such exhibit or display and shall obtain all applicable city permits and business tax receipts b in addition to complying with all federal and state regulations regarding the proper treatment of animals on exhibit or display any person or entity that exhibits or displays to the public for entertainment amusement or promotion any live animal on property within the city must comply with the following 1 there shall be no exhibition or display of any sick injured or crippled animal 2 the use of techniques and devices that cause physical injury torment or pain and suffering to animals are prohibited 3 the animals shall not be kept on hard surfaces such as concrete asphalt or gravel animals shall only be permitted on unimproved natural surfaces and shall not be kept or displayed in an environment that endangers the health or safety of the animal 4 the animals must be kept in appropriate housing and husbandry conditions including regular access to food water shade from direct sunlight shelter from inclement weather nest boxes or dens relief from human interaction and veterinary care 5 the keeping or harboring of any animal or fowl whereby frequent or habitual howling yelping barking crowing or making of other noises shall annoy or disturb a reasonable person of normal sensitivities across real property boundaries is prohibited 6 solid fecal matter of any such animal deposited on any street alley or other public or private property is prohibited and such must be immediately removed by the owner or person in charge c the city of its code enforcement department police department or the brevard county animal control officers officer may terminate any exhibition or display of live animals if in their discretion said display or exhibition poses a danger to an animals or to humans or is cruel and inhumane d prior to termination of the exhibition or display the animal exhibitor or his representative or employee if available at the site of display shall be informed of the danger posed by or objection to said exhibition or display and shall permit a period of time to correct or remedy same failure to take immediate action by the exhibitor to correct the condition or danger as required shall result in the termination of the exhibition or display by the officer e any party aggrieved by termination of an exhibition and display under this subdivision may request an appeal in writing to the city manager within three 3 calendar days of said decision the city manager or his designee shall schedule a meeting within two 2 business days of receipt of the written request and may overrule affirm or modify the decision of the officer  61014 penalties in addition to the penalties set forth in this chapter offenses under this article shall be punishable as provided in section 115 of this
