applicable median income adjusted for family size for purposes of meeting the requirements of 679 welfare transition program means a program pursuant to the provisions of fs    51308 creation of the local housing assistance trust fund 1 the local housing assistance trust fund is hereby created and established 2 all monies received from the state pursuant to the state housing initiative partnership act and any other funds received or budgeted to provide funding for the city of titusville housing assistance program shall be deposited into the local housing assistance trust fund administration of the local housing assistance trust fund shall comply with rule 67 florida administrative 3 expenditures other than for the implementation and administration of the local housing assistance program shall not be made from the local housing assistance trust fund 4 amounts on deposit in the local housing assistance trust fund shall be invested as provided by law all investment earnings shall be retained in the local housing assistance trust fund and used for the purposes thereof 5 until utilized for the purposes thereof monies in the local housing assistance trust fund shall be held in trust by the city solely for use pursuant to the local housing assistance program all local housing assistance program income including investment earnings shall be retained in the local housing assistance trust fund and used for purposes thereof 6 the city agrees that the local housing assistance trust fund shall be separately stated as a special revenue fund in the citys audited financial statements copies of such audited financial statements shall be forwarded annually to the florida housing finance corporation no later than june 30 of the following fiscal year 7 local governments which have an audit review or investigation involving ship funds will send the corporation a copy of any related report within ten 10 days of the issuance of such report  51308 intent and purpose of the local housing assistance program 1 the intent of the local housing assistance program is a increase the availability of affordable housing units by combining local resources and costsaving measures into a local housing partnership and using private and public funds to reduce the cost of housing  b promote innovative design of eligible housing that provides cost savings flexible design options for housing and development such as the combination of architectural styles building forms and development requirements  and positive design features such as orientation towards the street and pedestrian access without compromising the quality of the eligible housing  c promote mixedincome housing in urban suburban and rural areas so as to provide increased housing and economic opportunities for persons who have special housing need very lowincome lowincome or moderateincome  and d build the organizational and technical capacity of communitybased organizations so as to optimize the role of communitybased organization in the production of affordable housing 2 the purpose of this article is to aid in achieving the intent of the local housing assistance program while providing for a protection of natural resources  b enhancement of viability of public transit pedestrian circulation and nonmotorized modes of transportation  c community development and economics growth  and d strong sense of community social and economic integration  51308 establishment of the local housing assistance program 1 the local housing assistance program is hereby created and established this program shall apply to the incorporated area of the city of titusville 2 pursuant to resolution 14200 the city hereby specifically finds the cost of administering the local housing assistance program shall exceed five 5 percent of the funding received from the state pursuant to the state housing initiative partnership act and authorizes the use of up to ten 10 percent of the ship funds and five 5 percent of any program income received from investment of the housing distribution received by the city in a fiscal year for administration of the housing assistance program 3 the city shall use the funds received from the state pursuant to the state housing initiative partnership act to implement the local housing assistance program the detailed design specifications for the use of the trust fund monies will be adopted in the city of titusville local housing assistance plan after review of the statutory requirements and the local needs the city council will after giving due consideration to the recommendations of the affordable housing advisory committee and considering the advice of the department and the comments from the public adopt the local housing assistance plan a a percentage of the funds may be used by the city to implement the following locally designed strategies 1 implementation of the local housing assistance plan and incentive strategies that create or preserve affordable housing  2 supplement corporation programs for example the state apartment incentive loan sail program established under fs   the community workforce housing innovation pilot cwhip program and home ownership assistance program hap established under fs   with the ship local housing distribution directed to uses within the local government jurisdiction  3 provide local match to obtain federal housing grants or programs such as home established by 24 cfr   4 fund emergency repairs by existing service providers under weatherization programs pursuant to fs   5 to further the housing element of the local government comprehensive plan adopted pursuant to fs   specific to affordable housing  and 6 home ownership and rental housing activities  however at least sixtyfive 65 percent of each local governments local housing distributions must be used for home ownership activities 4 the local housing assistance program shall include all other lawful objectives not previously listed if said objectives have been adopted into the local housing assistance plan in the manner provided for by fs   and rule 6737 florida administrative  51308 creation of the local housing partnership 1 the local housing assistance program shall combine city of titusville resources and cost saving measures into a titusville housing partnership by using private and public funds in order to reduce the cost of housing 2 the local housing partnership includes but is not limited to the city communitybased organizations forprofit housing developers lending institutions providers of professional services relating to affordable housing and service organizations working on behalf of person with special housing needs the partnership shall be represented by members of the affordable housing advisory committee created in of this article in the implementation of the local housing assistance program 3 the local housing partnership shall implement the local housing assistance program in a manner that provides support services for housing program beneficiaries such as training to prepare persons for the responsibility of homeownership and counseling of tenants and the establishment of support services such as day care health care and transportation such implementation shall be consistent with this article fs  420970 and rule 6737 florida administrative  51308 designation of responsibility for administration and implementation of the local housing assistance program 1 the neighborhood services department shall be responsible for implementation and administration of the local housing assistance program 2 the neighborhood services department responsibilities shall be a to work with the committee to implement the incentive strategies in the local housing assistance plan lhap that create or preserve affordable housing  monitor the success of the local housing assistance program  provide advice and suggestions as to whether and in what ways the local housing assistance program might be improved from year to year  and to develop proposals to initiate and modify when necessary the local housing assistance plan b to supplement florida housing finance corporation programs with the ship local housing distribution funds directed to uses within the local government jurisdictions  c to provide local match to obtain federal housing grants or programs such as home established by 24 cfr   d to fund emergency repairs by existing service providers under weatherization programs pursuant to fs    e to further the housing element of the local government comprehensive plan adopted pursuant to fs   specific to affordable housing  and f to coordinate with city of titusville programs such as community loan funds inclusionary housing programs linkage programs and with federal programs such as the community development block grant cdbg program home investment partnership program home low income rental housing tax credit lihtc program and section 8 rental assistance so as to maximize the production of eligible housing local housing assistance program 3 the total amount paid for any administrative expenses in connection with the local housing assistance program will not exceed ten 10 percent of the proceeds of the city of titusville housing distribution and five 5 percent of any program income received from investment of the housing distribution 4 the city shall not treat as administrative expenses any costs previously borne by another funding source which could continue to be available at the time the local housing assistance plan is submitted 5 in implementing the local housing assistance program the department shall a advertise the availability of a housing assistance program in a newspaper of general circulation in the city and periodicals serving ethnic and diverse neighborhoods at least thirty 30 days before the beginning of any application period b adopt a maximum award schedule or system of awards to comply with the following criteria 1 at least sixtyfive 65 percent of the funds shall be reserved for homeownership for eligible persons  2 at least seventyfive 75 percent of the funds shall be reserved for construction rehabilitation or emergency repair of affordable eligible housing  3 the sales price or value of new or existing eligible housing shall not exceed ninety 90 percent of the median area purchase price in the area where the eligible housing is located as established by the united states department of treasury in accordance with subsection 3b2 of the united states housing act of 1937  4 all units constructed rehabilitated or otherwise assisted with program funds shall be occupied by extremely low very low low or moderateincome persons at least thirty 30 percent of funds must be expended for the benefit of very lowincome persons and at least another thirty 30 percent by lowincome persons 5 the amount of monthly mortgage payments or the amount of monthly rents charged by the eligible sponsor or its designee must be affordable to eligible persons  6 loans shall be provided for periods not exceeding thirty 30 years except for deferred payment loans dpl or loans that extend beyond thirty 30 years which continue to provide eligible housing for eligible persons  7 eligible owneroccupied housing constructed rehabilitated or otherwise assisted from proceeds provided from the local housing assistance program shall be subject to subsidy recapture provisions which are provided for in the plan  8 eligible rental housing constructed rehabilitated or otherwise assisted from proceeds provided from the local housing assistance program shall be reserved for eligible persons for the greater of fifteen 15 years or the term of the assistance eligible sponsors who offer eligible rental housing for sale before fifteen 15 years or that have remaining mortgages funded under the local housing assistance program must give a first right of refusal to eligible nonprofit organizations for purchase for continued occupancy by eligible persons  9 the maximum sales price or value per unit and the maximum award per unit for eligible housing benefiting from awards made pursuant to the local housing assistance program shall be established in the approved local housing assistance plan  10 a qualification system for applicants for awards consistent with the intent of the local housing assistance program and fs   shall be established by the local housing partnership  11 the department shall annually monitor the local housing assistance plan to determine compliance with the eligibility and affordability provisions including the amount of subsidy of this article and state and federal laws  12 the department shall monitor and determine tenant eligibility and the amount of subsidy pursuant to the provisions of this article fs   and rule 6737 florida administrative 6 the city the council the department the partnership and all eligible sponsors shall not discriminate in the provisions of affordable housing and loan application process of eligible persons on the basis of race creed religion color age sex marital status family status national origin or handicap 7 the city shall comply with all rules and regulations of the florida housing finance corporation in connection with required reporting by the city of compliance with its local housing assistance program 8 prior to receiving an award all eligible persons or eligible sponsors shall enter into an agreement to comply with the affordable housing criteria provided under fs   and this article all eligible persons or eligible sponsors shall include in the deed transferring ownership of the property to the eligible person or eligible sponsor a covenant agreeing to comply with terms of the abovedescribed laws which covenant will run with the land or in the alternative the agreement shall be made a part of the mortgage agreement failure to comply with the covenant in the mortgage shall result in the default of the mortgage with all remedies and rights for enforcement ensuring to the benefit of the city  51308 creation of the affordable housing advisory committee 1 the affordable housing advisory committee ahac is hereby created and established the members of the committee shall be appointed by resolution of the city council 2 the ahac shall consist of eleven 11 voting members a simple majority of the appointed voting members shall constitute a quorum the committee may not take formal actions unless a quorum is present but may meet to hear presentations if duly noticed the ahac shall include the following a one 1 citizen who is actively engaged in the residential home building industry in connection with affordable housing  b one 1 citizen who is actively engaged in the banking or mortgage banking industry in connection with affordable housing  c one 1 citizen who is a representative of those areas of labor actively engaged in home building in connection with affordable housing  d one 1 citizen who is actively engaged as an advocate for lowincome persons in connection with affordable housing  e one 1 citizen who is actively engaged as a forprofit provider of affordable housing  f one 1 citizen who is actively engaged as a nonprofit provider of affordable housing  g one 1 citizen who is actively engaged as a real estate professional in connection with affordable housing  h one 1 citizen who actively serves on the local planning agency pursuant to fs    i one 1 citizen who resides within the jurisdiction of the local governing body making the appointments  j one 1 citizen who represents employers within the jurisdiction  k one 1 citizen who represents essential services personnel as defined in the local housing assistance plan 3 members shall serve for a twoyear term and may be reappointed for subsequent terms vacancies shall be filled within sixty 60 days of the meeting at which the resignation vacancy is accepted appointments shall be made whenever the terms of appointees expire and in accord with the regulations set forth herein all members shall serve until their respective successors have been appointed and qualified each appointment to fill a vacancy shall be for the unexpired term and shall be made by the mayor with approval of the majority of the city council 4 the ahac shall comply with the government in the sunshine law the public records law and the special provisions regarding notice of affordable housing incentive plan considerations found in fs   minutes of the meeting shall be kept by the department 5 an organizational meeting of the committee shall be held as soon as practical after the creation by the city council the ahac shall annually elect a chairperson vicechairperson secretary and such other offices as it deems necessary the chairperson is charged with the duty of conducting meetings in a manner consistent with law the committee shall adopt reasonable rules of procedures to govern the conduct of its business and the holding of hearings meetings of the committee shall be held as needed and may be called by the chairperson upon due notice all meetings shall be open to the public announced in advance and shall provide for public inspection of prepared agendas in advance of all meetings 6 it is intended that members of the ahac will be persons of knowledge experience judgment and background and have personal or professional interest or experience in affordable housing they will have the ability and desire to act in the public interest and represent insofar as possible the various special personal and professional interests required to make informed and equitable decisions concerning the provisions of housing which is affordable for all economic segments of the community 7 staff administrative and facility support for the ahac shall be provided by the department 8 triennially the ahac shall review the established policies and procedures ordinances land development regulations and adopted comprehensive plan of the city of titusville and shall recommend specific actions or initiatives to encourage or facilitate affordable housing while protecting the ability of the property to appreciate in value the recommendations may include the modification or repeal of existing policies procedures ordinances regulations  the creation of exceptions applicable to affordable housing or adoption of new policies procedures regulations ordinances or plan provisions including recommendations to amend the titusville comprehensive plan and corresponding regulations ordinances and other policies at a minimum the ahac shall submit a written report to the city council that includes recommendations on and triennially thereafter evaluate the implementation of affordable housing incentives in the following areas a the processing of approvals of development orders or permits as defined in fs  7 and 8 for affordable housing projects is expedited to a greater degree than other projects  b the modification of impactfee requirements including reduction or waiver of fees and alternative methods of fee payment for affordable housing  c the allowance of flexibility in densities for affordable housing  d the reservation of infrastructure capacity for housing for very lowincome lowincome and moderateincome persons  e the allowance of affordable accessory residential units in residential zoning districts  f the reduction of parking and setback requirements for affordable housing  g the allowance of flexible lot configurations including zerolotline configurations for affordable housing  h the modification of street requirements for affordable housing  i the establishment of a process by which the city of titusville considers before adoption policies procedures ordinances regulations or plan provisions that increase the cost of housing  j the preparation of a printed inventory of cityowned public lands suitable for affordable housing  k the support of development near transportation hubs and major employment centers and mixed use developments the ahac recommendations may also include other affordable housing incentives identified by the committee local governments that receive the minimum allocation under the ship program shall perform the initial review but may elect to not perform the triennial review 9 the ahac shall be cooperatively staffed by the local government department or division having authority to administer local planning or housing programs to ensure an integrated approach to the work of the committee 10 the approval by the ahac of its local housing incentive strategies recommendations and its review of the implementation of local governments previously recommended strategies must be made by affirmative vote of a majority of the members of the ahac taken at a public hearing notice of the time date and place of the public hearing of the ahac to adopt final local housing incentive strategies recommendations must be published in a newspaper of general circulation in the city the notice must contain a short and concise summary of the local housing incentives strategies recommendations to be considered by the ahac the notice must state the public place where a copy of the tentative ahac recommendations can be obtained by interested persons  51308 adoption of the affordable housing incentive plan 1 within ninety 90 days after the date of receipt of the local housing incentive strategies recommendations from the ahac the city council shall adopt an amendment to its local housing assistance plan to incorporate the local housing incentive strategies it will implement within its jurisdiction the amendment must include at a minimum the local housing incentive strategies required under fs  16  expedited permit process and ongoing review process the city council must consider the strategies specified in paragraph h111 as recommended by the committee 2 upon adoption of the affordable housing incentive plan the department shall so notify the corporation by certified mail of its adoption of an amendment of its local housing assistance plan to incorporate local housing incentives strategies the notice shall include a copy of the approved amended plan 3 the ahac may perform other duties at the request of the city including a the provision of mentoring services to affordable housing partners including developers banking institutions employers and others to identify available incentives assist with applications for funding requests and develop partnerships between various parties b the creation of best practices for the development of affordable housing in the community 4 committee members shall receive no compensation for their services 5 committee members shall abide by and be subject to the provisions of fs chapter 112 part iii pertaining to the ethics for public officers and employees  51308 purchases of precious metals a every person dealing in precious metals such as gold silver and platinum shall keep a record in accordance with fs  53803 et seq of all purchases from private individuals at the time of each purchase which individuals are not themselves licensed dealers regularly engaged in the buying and selling of precious metals the following information shall be obtained the date of the transaction  the number which appears on the sellers drivers license or comparable identification used  the type of identification used  the name and address of the seller as it appears on the item of identification  a complete and accurate description of such property  and the signature of the seller in the event coins are purchased in such large numbers that it is impractical to describe each coin separately the description may consist of a general description of the various denominations of coins included together with the total weight or face value thereof b privilege of engaging in or managing any business profession or occupation within the city is hereby required to have a current local business tax receipt and pay the required fee prior to engaging in or managing such business profession or occupation the local business tax receipt is required of 1 any person who maintains a permanent business location or branch office within the city for the privilege of engaging in or managing any business within its jurisdiction 2 any person who maintains a permanent business location or branch office within the city for the privilege of engaging in or managing any profession or occupation within its jurisdiction 3 any person who does not qualify under the provisions of subsection 1 or 2 above and who transacts any business or engages in any occupation or profession in interstate commerce where such local business tax receipt is not prohibited by section 8 article 1 of the united states constitution b person as referred to above means any person holding himself out to the public by sign printed matter or otherwise as being engaged in business or as offering services or property to the public for a consideration shall be considered as engaging in a business occupation or profession and shall be liable for the local business tax receipt therefore according to the classification of the business advertised as set forth in section 1158  112806   6909 when due a every person engaged in or managing any business occupation or profession referred to in this article is required to procure a city local business tax receipt by purchasing same beginning july 1 of each year and shall be due and payable on september 30 of each year and shall expire on september 30 of the succeeding year if september 30 falls on a weekend or holiday the tax shall be due and payable on or before the first working day following september 30 b partial year business tax receipts any business profession or occupation required to obtain a local business tax receipt under the provisions of this chapter or general law that begins business during the first half of the receipt year october 1  shall be required to pay the full local business tax for the applicable classification under the provisions of this chapter any such business profession or occupation that begins business on or after april 1 of the current receipt year shall be required to pay onehalf  of the amount of local business tax for the applicable classification under the provisions of this chapter and shall expire on september 30 of the current year  112806   6909   121118 application contents every person before engaging in a new business occupation or profession shall make application for and obtain a local business tax receipt before engaging in such business occupation or profession and shall file an application on the form prescribed by the administrator the application for a local business tax receipt for a business shall be signed by an officer partner agent or the owner of the business all local business tax receipts shall be applied for and issued in the real name of the applicant unless the applicant has qualified under the laws of the state for the use of a fictitious name such local business tax receipt if issued shall show the real name as well as the fictitious name of the applicant such application shall contain the following information 1 the name of the owner and if a firm the names of all members of the firm and if a corporation provide the administrator with a copy of the corporate papers with the names of all officers of the corporation 2 the location of the business 3 the full nature of the business 4 where the local business tax receipt is based thereon 5 the value of stock carried or the number of seats machines employees gasoline pumps rooms or vehicles etc used as the case may be 6 such other pertinent information as may be prescribed by the city 7 at the time of filing the business tax receipt application the applicant shall pay a nonrefundable administrative fee of fifteen dollars $1500 for each application filed  112806   6909 false statements in application any local business tax receipt obtained under the provisions of this article upon a misrepresentation of a material fact shall be deemed null and void and the local business tax receipt holder who has engaged in any business under such business tax receipt shall be subject to the enforcement provision contained in section 1158  112806   6909 determination of classification in the event of a disagreement between applicant and the city on the question of proper classification of any business occupation or profession for local business tax receipt purposes the administrator shall decide the proper classification with the right disabled persons widowswidowers a all confirmed disabled persons physically incapable of manual labor widowswidowers with minor dependents and persons sixtyfive 65 years of age or older with not more than one 1 employee or helper and who use their own capital only not in excess of one thousand dollars $100000 shall be allowed to engage in any business or occupation without being required to pay for a local business tax receipt the exemption provided by this section shall be allowed upon the certificate of the county physician or other reputable physician that the applicant claiming the exemption is disabled the nature and extent of the disability being specified therein and in case the exemption is claimed by a widowwidower with minor dependents or a person over sixtyfive 65 years of age proof of the right to the exemption shall be made any person entitled to the exemption provided by this section shall upon application and furnishing of the necessary proof be issued a local business tax receipt which shall have plainly stamped or written across the face of the business tax receipt the fact that it is issued under this section and the reason for the exemption shall be written on the local business tax receipt b in no event under this or any other law shall any person veteran or otherwise be allowed any exemption whatsoever from the payment of any amount required by law for the issuance of a local business tax receipt to sell intoxicating liquors malt or vinous beverage  112806   6909 exemption for disabled veterans of any war or their unremarried widowswidowers a any bona fide permanent resident elector of the state who served as an officer or enlisted person during any of the periods specified in fs  101 14 in the armed forces of the united states national guard united states coast guard or coast guard reserve or any temporary members thereof who have actually been or may hereafter be reassigned by the air force army navy coast guard or marines to active duty during any war declared or undeclared armed conflicts crises etc who was honorably discharged from the service of the united states and who at the time of histheir application for local business tax receipt shall be disabled from performing manual labor shall upon sufficient identification proof of being a permanent resident elector in the state and production of an honorable discharge from the service of the united states during the aforesaid period of time respectively be granted a local business tax receipt to engage in any business or occupation in the state which may be carried on mainly personal efforts of the business tax receipt holder as a means of livelihood and for which the local business tax receipt does not exceed the sum of fifty dollars $5000 for each without payment of any local business tax receipt otherwise provided for by law  or shall be entitled to an exemption to the extent of fifty dollars $5000 on any local business tax receipt to engage in any business or occupation in the city which may be carried on mainly personal efforts of the business tax receipt holder as a means of livelihood where local business tax receipt for such business or occupation shall be more than fifty dollars $5000 b this exemption shall extend to and include the right of the business tax receipt holder to operate an automobile for hire of not exceeding fivepassenger capacity including the driver when it shall be made to appear that such automobile is bona fide owned or contracted to be purchased by the local business tax receipt holder and is being operated by the applicant as a means of livelihood and that the proper local business tax receipt for the operation of such motor vehicle for private use has been applied for and attached to such motor vehicle and the proper fees therefore paid by the business tax receipt holder c when any such person shall apply for a local business tax receipt to conduct any business or occupation for which the fee as fixed by law shall exceed the sum of fifty dollars $5000 the remainder of such local business tax in excess of fifty dollars $5000 shall be paid by the applicant d the administrator shall issue to such persons as may be entitled hereunder a local business tax receipt pursuant to the foregoing provisions and subject to the conditions thereof such local business tax receipt when issued shall be marked across the face thereof veterans exempt local business tax receipt  not transferable before issuing the same proof shall be duly made in each case that the applicant is entitled under the conditions of this law to receive the exemption provided for in this section the proof may be made by establishing to the satisfaction of the administrator by means of a certificate of honorable discharge or a certified copy thereof that heshe is a veteran within the purview of this section and by exhibiting 1 a certificate of governmentrated disability to an extent of ten 10 percent or more 2 the affidavit or testimony of a reputable physician who personally knows the applicant and who makes oath that the applicant is disabled from performing manual labor as a means of livelihood 3 the certificate of the veterans service officer of the county in which applicant lives duly executed under the hand and seal of the chief officer and secretary thereof attesting the fact that the applicant is disabled and entitled to receive a local business tax receipt within the meaning and intent of this section 4 a pension certificate issued to the applicant by the united states by reason of such disability 5 such other reasonable proof as may be required by the administrator to establish the fact that such applicant is disabled e all local business tax receipts issued under this section shall be in the same general form and shall expire at the same time as other local business tax receipts are fixed by law to expire f all local business tax receipts obtained under the provisions of this section by the commission of fraud upon any issuing authority shall be deemed null and void any person who has fraudulently obtained any local business tax receipt or who has fraudulently received any transfer of a local business tax receipt issued to another and has thereafter engaged in any business or occupation requiring a local business tax receipt under color thereof shall be subject to prosecution as for engaging in a business or occupation without having the required local business tax receipt such local business tax receipt shall not be issued in any county other than the county wherein the veteran is a bona fide resident citizen elector unless such veteran applying therefore shall produce to the administrator a certificate of the tax collector of the veterans home county to the effect that no exemption from local business tax receipt has been granted to such veteran in his home county under the authority of this section g in no event under this or any other law shall any person veteran or otherwise be allowed an exemption whatsoever from the payment of any amount required by law for the issuance of a local business tax receipt to sell intoxicating liquors malt and vinous beverages h the unremarried widowwidower of the deceased disabled veteran of any war in which the united states armed forces participated will be entitled to the same exemptions as the disabled veteran  112806   6909 reserved editors note  adopted  reserved  1140 formerly such section pertained to charitable religious educational organizations exemption and 112806   6909 state law reference similar provisions fs   charitable religious educational organizations exemption a definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this section shall have the meanings ascribed to them herein except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning charitable institutions shall mean only nonprofit corporations operating physical facilities in this state at which are provided charitable services a reasonable percentage of which shall be without cost to those unable to pay educational institutions shall mean state taxsupported or parochial church and nonprofit private schools colleges or universities conducting regular classes and courses of study required for accreditation by or membership in the southern association of colleges and secondary schools department of education or the florida council of independent schools nonprofit libraries art galleries and museums open to the public are defined as educational institutions and eligible for exemption religious institutions shall mean churches and ecclesiastical or denominational organizations or established physical places of worship in this state at which nonprofit religious services and activities are regularly conducted and carried on and shall also mean church cemeteries b exemption a nofee local business tax receipt shall be required of any charitable religious fraternal youth civic service or other such organization when the organization makes occasional sales or engages in fundraising projects when the projects are performed exclusively by the members thereof and when the proceeds derived from the activities are used exclusively in the charitable religious fraternal youth civic and service activities of the organization any organization that would otherwise meet the criteria stated above with the exception that the fundraising projects are performed by persons other than members of said organization may request an exemption of the local business tax receipt requirement from the city council c sponsoring organization the sponsoring organization can secure one 1 local business tax receipt which will cover all activities for that event except that if a carnival or circus is a part of the event that activity will require a separate local business tax receipt per section 1158 d site plan submission required a site plan must be submitted to the administrator at least five 5 working days prior to the event and must contain the following 1 location of all activity areas 2 location of all temporary or permanent structure ie tents bleachers stage 3 ingress egress internal circulation and parking 4 one 1 sign per street frontagethirtytwo 32 square feet maximum area of sign face sign can be doublesided 5 all signs displays and associated uses must be removed daily 6 location of restroom facilities onsite portalets are permitted 7 any lighting andor electrical installation shall be installed in compliance with the provisions of electric code adopted in section 6221 8 cleanup of the property upon expiration of the local business tax receipt shall be the responsibility of the local business tax receipt holder and property owner equally e approval required if the event is located on public property appropriate approvals will be required f liability insurance required proof of liability insurance in the amount of five hundred thousand dollars $50000000 must be provided for any event held on any public property g medical and security medical and security provisions are the responsibility of the sponsoring organization and property owner h amount the local business tax receipt for the sponsoring organization is one hundred and five dollars $10500 per event  112806   6909 state law reference similar to the city inspectors or any police officer upon request b where any coinoperated machine is subject to local business licensing as provided herein the local business tax receipt shall be displayed in a conspicuous place upon the machine  112806   6909 transfer of local business tax receiptlocation a local business tax receipt may be transferred from one 1 location to another provided that the original local business tax receipt is presented to the administrator for the approval of such transfer the local business tax receipt holder shall pay a fee of ten 10 percent of the appropriate annual local business tax receipt fee not to exceed twentyfive $2500 but not less than three dollars $300  112806   6909 transfer of ownershipchange of name a a local business tax receipt issued by the city may be transferred with the approval of the administrator subject to the following conditions 1 the seller of the business shall present the local business tax receipt to the administrator with an endorsement on the reverse side thereof assigning all right title and interest to the purchaser 2 the purchaser shall file an application for local business tax receipt and shall qualify in all respects as provided by law and by the ordinances of the city as an applicant for a local business tax receipt as if he had applied for the local business tax receipt in the first instance 3 where the local business tax receipt holder has been exempted from payment of all or any part of the local business tax receipt thereof any such local business tax receipt shall not be transferable under this section 4 the purchaser shall show evidence of bona fide sale of the business and pay a transfer fee of ten 10 percent of the appropriate annual local business tax receipt fee not to exceed twentyfive dollars $2500 but not less than three dollars $300 b the name of a local business tax receipt issued by the city may be changed with the approval of the administrator subject to the following conditions 1 file a complete application provided by the administrator 2 provide evidence of the newly registered name or corporation 3 the applicant pays a change of name fee of ten dollars $1000  112806   6909 replacing lost or destroyed local business tax receipts for the purpose of replacing any mutilated destroyed or lost local business tax receipt relating to any local business tax receipt granted the administrator is hereby authorized and empowered to cause to be executed and delivered an appropriate duplicate local business tax receipt upon the submission of evidence satisfactory to the development supervisor or hisher designee that the original business tax receipt was mutilated destroyed or lost and the payment of a fee of five dollars and fifty cents $550 for local business tax receipt or the transfer of a local business tax receipt the city shall inspect the premises for compliance with all applicable zoning building fire etc codes and ordinances b the local business tax receipt of any person for the operation of any business may be revoked by the city council upon notice and hearing for violation of any ordinance of the city or law of the state  112806   6909 regulatory ordinances remain in effect unless otherwise herein specifically accepted changed or differentiated all qualifying or regulatory ordinances of the city applicable to or affecting any of the businesses operations professions occupations or classifications covered by this chapter shall be and remain in full force and effect  112806   6909 zoning regulations a no local business tax receipt shall be issued under this article for any new business occupation or profession until the location shall have first been found consistent with any of the citys zoning regulations b no commercial outdoor sales or outside display of goods or products will be permitted with the following exceptions 1 storage and sale of vehicles 2 motor fuel sales 3 retail display of garden supplies and products lawn care equipment lawn ornaments swimming pools or such items as are not customarily sold in an enclosed building such display shall not be located within any required setback or displace required parking 4 outdoor sale displays which are mobile in nature and are stored inside the store during nonbusiness hours location of outdoor display shall not interfere with normal pedestrian or vehicular traffic 5 any previously local business holding a business tax receipt with an outdoor display local business tax receipt that does not meet the exceptions previously outlined shall be given one 1 year from the time of renewal of the current local business tax receipt to eliminate said display after  no outdoor display will be permitted except as noted above  112806   6909 cross reference zoning regulations  6000 et seq land development regulations vol ii interpretation of regulations the city manager may make such rules and regulations not inconsistent with this article as may be necessary or proper for the enforcement of the provisions hereof  112806   6909 local business tax receipt year the local business tax receipt year shall begin on the first day of october and end on the thirtieth day of september of each year on which date all local business tax receipts heretofore issued shall expire if september thirtieth falls on a weekend or holiday the local business tax receipt shall be due on the next working day no local business tax receipt shall be issued for more than one 1 year after april first a local business tax receipt for six 6 months may be issued for half of the amount of the annual local business tax receipt except business tax receipts specifically provided as per day or per week every person applying for a new local business tax receipt after july first will be issued a local business tax receipt which will not expire until september thirtieth of the next local business tax receipt year this local business tax receipt will be issued at the regular annual charge for said local business tax receipt  112806   6909 state law reference similar provisions fs  1 local business tax receipt a debt the amount of any local business receipt tax and penalty imposed by the provisions of this article is hereby declared to be a debt due to the city and any person carrying on business without first having procured a local business tax receipt from the city shall be liable to the city for the amount of such local business tax receipt recoverable in any court of competent jurisdiction  112806   6909 cross reference enforcement by code enforcement board  1410 et seq land development regulations vol ii penalty for delinquencies whenever any local business tax receipt provided by this article or any other ordinance of the city to be paid to the city shall remain unpaid after september thirtieth such local business tax receipt shall be considered delinquent and subject to a delinquency penalty of ten 10 percent for the month of october plus an additional fivepercent penalty for each month of delinquency thereafter until paid  provided that the total delinquency penalty shall not exceed twentyfive 25 percent of the local business tax receipt fee for the delinquent establishment if a new business commences operation prior to obtaining a local business tax receipt and paying the required fees a surcharge of twentyfive 25 percent will be added to all applicable fees the penalty provided for in section 1157 shall be cumulative and in addition to any and all other penalties prescribed in this article and shall be enforced and collected in the same manner and as a part of the local business tax receipt affected  112806   6909 violations  penalties any person convicted of doing business without a local business tax receipt fraudulently obtaining a local business tax receipt or violating any of the terms of this article shall upon conviction be punished as provided by section 115  112806   6909 cross
