for gas installations  6175c  classification of electrical workers  6203  swimming pool contractors qualifications  183 state law reference contractors and contracting fs ch 489 division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning board shall mean the city of titusville board certificate of competency shall mean that instrument which is issued to an individual upon passage of a standard examination required by this article or required by the building official verifying the passage of the standard examination certificate of compliance shall mean that instrument which authorizes an individual firm or corporation to engage in subcontracting in a category as specified in section 11126 specialized contractor classifications entities which hold a certificate of compliance may subcontract work covered by the certificate of compliance from residential building general or owner contractors but may not themselves subcontract any work to any other person except work covered by the certificate of compliance and then only to a person who also possesses a current certificate of compliance issued by the city for all work being subcontracted a certificate of compliance does not qualify the holder to obtain permits for construction certificate of proficiency shall mean that instrument which is issued to an individual upon passage of a standard examination required by this article or required by the building official verifying the passage of the standard examination contracting shall mean engaging in business as a contractor contractor shall mean a person who in any capacity undertakes or offers to undertake or purports to have the capacity to undertake or accepts an order or contract either on a fixed sum cost plus a percentage or a fixed fee or any combination thereof or for any other type of compensation or submits a bid or does himself or by others to construct alter repair add to subtract from improve move wreck or demolish any building or other structure to excavate or commence any project development or improvement or do any other part thereof including the erection of scaffolding or other structures or works in connection therewith or the incorporation of labor or materials therein contractors include specialty contractors and contractors in the following categories 1 general contractors class i are those whose services are unlimited 2 building contractors class ii are those whose services are limited to construction of commercial buildings and single or multipledwelling residential buildings neither to exceed three 3 stories in height and accessory remodeling repair or improvement of any size building if the services do not affect the structural members of the building 3 residential building contractors class iii are those whose services are limited to construction remodeling repair or improvement of one two or threefamily unit residences not exceeding two 2 stories in height and accessory use structures in connection therewith 4 class a air conditioning contractor harv unlimited means any person whose services are unlimited in the execution of contracts requiring the experience knowledge and skill to perform the following install maintain repair fabricate alter extend or design when not prohibited by law central air conditioning refrigeration heating and ventilating including duct work in connection with a complete system only to the extent such duct work is performed by the contractor necessary to make complete an air distribution system boiler and unfired pressure vessel systems and all appurtenances apparatus or equipment systems and all appurtenances apparatus or equipment used in connection therewith  also piping insulation of pipes vessels and ducts pressure and process piping pneumatic control piping and installation of a condensate drain from an air conditioning unit to an existing safe waste or other approved disposal other than a direct connection to a sanitary system all in such a manner as to comply with all plans specifications codes laws and regulations applicable thereto the scope of work for such contractor shall also include any excavation work incidental thereto but shall not include any work such as liquefied petroleum or natural gas fuel lines within buildings potable waterlines or connections thereto sanitary sewer lines swimming pool piping and filters and electrical power wiring 5 class b air conditioning contractor harv unlimited means any person whose services are limited to twentyfive 25 tons cooling and five hundred thousand 500000 btu heating in any one 1 system in the execution of contracts requiring the experience knowledge and skill to perform the following install maintain and repair fabricate alter extend or design when not prohibited by law central air conditioning refrigeration heating and ventilation including duct work in connection with a complete system only to the extent such duct work is performed by the contractor necessary to make complete an air distribution system being installed under this classification  also piping insulation of pipes vessels and ducts and installation of a condensate drain from any air conditioning unit to an existing safe waste or other approved manner as to comply with all plans specifications codes laws and regulations applicable thereto 6 class c air conditioning contractor harv refrigeration means any person whose business is limited to the servicing of air conditioning heating or refrigeration systems including duct alterations in connection with those systems they are servicing service is herein defined as maintenance service and replacement of certain minor components of an air conditioningrefrigeration system of up to twentyfive 25 tons and a heating system not to exceed two hundred thousand 200000 btu straight heating minor components shall include sections of refrigeration tubing and recharging solenoid and relays thermostats belts blower motors and minor alterations of duct systems not to exceed ten 10 percent of the total duct system service work shall not include repairs repairs are herein defined as the replacement of major component items such as blower assemblies condensation units compressors compressor motors and major alterations to duct systems exception no examination registration or certification is required under this part for the sales service or installation of package heating or air conditioning units windowtype units with no ducts or remote controls maximum of three 3 tons thirtysix thousand 36000 btu in capacity 7 mechanical contractor harv mechanical means any person whose services are unlimited in the execution of contracts requiring the knowledge experience and skill to perform the following install maintain repair fabricate alter extend or design when not prohibited by law central air conditioning refrigeration heating and ventilating including duct work in connection with a complete system only to the extent such duct work is performed by the contractor necessary to make complete an air distribution system boiler and unfired pressure vessel systems lift station equipment and piping and all appurtenances apparatus or equipment used in connection therewith  also piping gasoline tanks and pump installations and piping for same air piping vacuum line piping oxygen lines nitrous oxide piping ink and chemical lines fuel transmission lines and installation of existing safe waste or other approved disposal other than a direct connection to a sanitary system all in such a manner as to comply with all plans specifications codes laws and regulations applicable thereto the scope of work for such contractor shall also include any excavation work incidental thereto but shall not include any work such as liquefied petroleum or natural gas fuel lines within buildings potable waterlines or connections thereto sanitary sewer lines swimming pool piping and filters and electrical power wiring 8 master electrician shall mean a person who possesses the necessary qualifications training and technical knowledge to plan layout and supervise the installation of electrical wiring apparatus or equipment for light heat or power and who is qualified under the provisions of this article 9 journeyman electrician shall mean a person who possesses the necessary qualifications training and technical knowledge to install electrical wiring apparatus or equipment for light heat or power and who is qualified under the terms and provisions of this article he shall be capable of doing electrical work according to the plans and specifications furnished to him and in accordance with the rules and regulations governing wiring installations within the citys jurisdiction 10 master plumber shall mean a person who possesses the necessary qualifications training and technical knowledge to plan layout and supervise the installation of plumbing equipment apparatus or equipment or other related work according to the standards of the standard plumbing 11 journeyman plumber shall mean a person who possesses the necessary qualifications training and technical knowledge to install plumbing fixtures and apparatus or equipment who is qualified under the terms and provisions of this article he shall be capable of doing plumbing work according to the plans and specifications furnished to him and in accordance with the rules and regulations governing plumbing installations within the city 12 commercial pool contractor or class a pool contractor means any person whose scope of work involves but is not limited to the construction repair water treatment and servicing of all swimming pools both public or private or otherwise and used for therapy swimming or other use this work shall include but not be limited to layout excavation operation of construction pumps for dewatering purposes steelwork installation of light niches pouring of floors guniting fiberglassing installation of tile and coping installation of all perimeter and filter piping installation of all filter equipment and chemical feeders of any type plastering of the interior pouring of decks construction of equipment rooms or housing for pool equipment and the installation of package pool heaters however the scope of work of such contractor shall not include direct connections to a sanitary sewer system or to potable water lines 13 sheet metal contractor means one whose services are unlimited in the sheet metal trade and who has the experience knowledge and skill necessary for the manufacture fabrication assembling handling erection installation dismantling conditioning adjustment alteration repair servicing and design when not prohibited by law or ferrous or nonferrous metal work of us no 10 gauge or its equivalent or lighter gauge and other materials used in lieu thereof  and air handling systems including the setting of air handling equipment and reinforcement of the same and including the balancing of air handling systems 14 roofing contractor means one whose services are unlimited in the roofing trade and who has the experience knowledge and skill to install maintain repair alter extend or design when not prohibited by law and use materials and items used in the installation maintenance extension and alteration of all kinds of roofing and waterproofing all in such manner as to comply with all plans specifications codes laws and regulations applicable thereto 15 residential pool contractor or class b pool contractor means any person whose scope of work involves but is not limited to the construction repair water treatment and servicing of all residential swimming pools used for therapy swimming or other use this work shall include but not be limited to layout excavation operation of construction pumps for dewatering purposes steelwork installation of light niches pouring of floors guniting fiberglassing installation of tile and coping installation of all perimeter and filter piping installation of all filter equipment and chemical feeders of any type plastering of the interior pouring of decks installation of housing for pool equipment and the installation of package pool heaters however the scope of work of such contractor shall not include direct connections to a sanitary sewer system or to potable water lines 16 swimming pool servicing contractor or class c pool contractors are those contractors whose scope of work involves the servicing repair water treatment and maintenance of all swimming pools both public and private they shall be permitted to make any necessary piping and repairs to replace and repair all existing equipment or to install new additional equipment as necessary their scope of work shall include the reinstallation of tile and coping  repair and replacing of all piping filter equipment and chemical feeders of any type  replastering  repouring of decks  and the reinstalling or addition of pool heaters engage in business shall mean doing a trade of any owner or any tenant of land water or of a building or any part thereof or for any person in possession of or in charge of the same or any part thereof or entering into a contract with such owner tenant or person for the doing of a trade firm shall include a sole proprietorship partnership association corporation agency or any other type of business organization owner shall mean any person who owns property either individually jointly or by an estate by the entirety with another person when the provisions of this article provide for the issuance of a building permit to an owner and the title to the property upon which the building permit is issued shall be held other than individually but within the limitations of this definition such other person holding title together with the applicant shall join in the application for such permit ownership in this definition shall be fee simple ownership and nothing herein contained shall require a mortgagee or other lien holder to join in such application specialty contractor shall mean a contractor whose operations consist of the performances of construction work requiring special skills and whose principal contracting business involves the use of specialized building trades and crafts the following classifications shall show proof of at least one 1 years experience except as otherwise stated herein in their selected field of construction and meet the requirements as hereinafter provided specialty contractors shall be classified as but not limited to one 1 of the following crafts 1 aluminum qualified to fabricate erect and install screen enclosures with metalsupporting members in whole or part selfsupporting and shall include any work dealing with the use of aluminum piece work or any work related thereto the scope of the work shall include footings and slabs on grade only in connection with the overall project 2 carpentry qualified to build install or repair nonstructural wooden items such as cabinets trim doors windows window and door frames molding or any other wooden item or member which is not a structural part of the building or structure structural work may be performed if first an outstanding permit for such work is obtained by contractor holding proper certificate of competency nonstructural part of the building or structure may include formwork for concrete placement 3 communications towers qualified to fabricate and erect communications towers in accordance with approved engineering drawings in such a manner as to comply with all applicable codes laws and industry standards permits will be required in all cases for towers in excess of thirtyfive 35 feet height to be measured from grade as defined in chapter ii of the standard building 4 concrete and masonry qualified to construct forms and framework for the casting and shaping of concrete including but not limited to columns beams decks and window frames to place and erect reinforcing steel and miscellaneous embedded steel and to pour place and finish concrete including terrazzo this category shall include the cutting and laying of all masonry items including but not limited to brick block clay products rough and cut stone structural glass decorative block and veneer block all installed in accordance with applicable codes and industry recommendations and standards 5 elevators see fs ch 399 as defined therein 6 fencing qualified to fabricate assemble erect and install fences of masonry chain link concrete wood and other fence materials in such manner that an acceptable fence can be erected complying with applicable regulations including zoning regulations 7 fire sprinkler systems applicant must show proof of certification by state fire marshals office as a prerequisite to application submittal qualified to install maintain repair alter or extend all piping for fire sprinkler systems including the connection to the water service outlet provided solely for fire sprinkler systems installation of a fire sprinkler in laundry and waste chutes or garbage rooms shall not constitute a system which would permit the installation of standpipes in conjunction therewith the system must be approved and accepted by the building department and the fire department 8 gas fitter bottled or liquefied petroleum gas such competency shall have as a prerequisite that the individual hold a certificate from the state fire marshals office prior to submittal of application applicant shall be qualified to install maintain repair alter or extend fuel gas piping or appliances involving bottled or liquefied petroleum gas 9 gas fitter natural gas qualified to install maintain repair alter or extend fuel gas piping or appliances involving natural gas 10 house moving and demolition limited to the loading moving and unloading of structures and qualified to demolish frame or block structures not exceeding two 2 stories in height anything to be demolished over two 2 stories must show proof of hh block examination passage 11 marine construction qualified as a class i or ii building contractor as defined by state and local regulations 12 mobile homes qualified to install mobile homes to meet the state standards or any other applicable federal laws this classification shall include no work for which state registration or for which an examination is required as stated in previous sections of this article but shall include the installation of slab tiedowns etc permits may be obtained for installation by owners or agents of the mobile home site 13 painting and waterproofing qualified to clean caulk and size surfaces in preparation for and to apply paint and related liquid or viscous products thereon by brush roller or spray methods in such a manner that under an agreed specification satisfactory painting and waterproofing can be accomplished 14 paving qualified to construct roads airport runways and aprons parking lots sidewalks curbs and gutters property line walls storm drainage facilities and to perform the excavating clearing and grading incidental thereto 15 sign erection qualified to paint or otherwise apply or erect outside displays of character letters illustrations or ornamentations the work of sign contractor shall include the installation of panels facing frame structure movable or fixed freestanding or attached to a building or other structure which is to be used for sign purposes or erection any electrical work involved must be accomplished by a licensed electrician 16 solar contractor a person who possesses the requisite qualifications training and technical knowledge and who is qualified in accordance with this article a class a qualified to fabricate extend alter and install any and all solar components and appurtenances thereto this would include water other known volatile liquids and gases being utilized as the vehicle for thermal transfer and would not be limited to a heating classification having a minimum of two 2 years experience in plumbing or mechanical with an additional one 1 years experience in supervisory capacity  however applicant may substitute a maximum of onethird required time in a related electric or structural field b class b qualified to utilize only water as a thermal transfer medium limited to the thermal transfer components and storage tank installation having a minimum of two 2 years experience in plumbing or mechanical with a portion of these two 2 years not to exceed fifty 50 percent in an electrical or structural field a minimum of one 1 years experience in supervisory capacity in mechanical or plumbing is required c class c qualified to install solar components and storage tanks which use nonpotable supplies limited to the installation of solar components on or at grade level and minor repairs and system alterations without increased structural and system alterations without increased structural loading on other existing systems having a minimum of two 2 years experience in plumbing or mechanical fields no supervisory experience is required 17 tile terrazzo and marble qualified to mix place screed grind polish and finish terrazzo applied to surfaces erected and provided by others also qualified to erect attach apply and embed tile or concrete clay or any other materials none of which exceeds threefourths inch in thickness to floors or walls and shall include tile veneer not exceeding threefourths inch thickness to the exterior of buildings 18 underground fuel tank qualified to install underground storage tanks concrete or other surfaces and piping as required to facilitate tanks use wherein it is not governed or limited by other ordinances or state laws shall also include the placement of equipment ballasting tiedowns earth backfill electrical work shall be a part of the project contract and such work shall be performed by a properly licensed electrical contractor 19 underground utilities qualified to excavate construct install repair or alter pipelines such as water and gas transmission and distribution lines storm and sanitary sewerage lines force main outfalls and pumping facilities incidental to the collection or installation of pipeline products including the equipment and piping installation and placing within a structure which is constructed for the purpose of pumping or processing such pipeline products an underground utilities contractor may construct or install junction boxes manholes inlets valves and similar components in such a manner as to comply with all plans specifications codes laws and regulations applicable the work of the underground utilities contractor shall be considered to stop at a point not more than five 5 feet from the intersection of rightofway and private property the scope of work of such a contractor does not include the installation of chilled water lines or related work incidental thereto passage of an h h block examination in this category is a prerequisite to issuance of the competency card specialized contractor shall mean a contractor whose operations consist of the performance of a trade which requires technical knowledge and skills gained specialized contractors are issued a certificate of compliance in accordance with these definitions and section 11195 specialized contractor classifications include but are not limited to the following defined categories 1 alarm installers qualified to install low voltage wiring systems for fire or security alarm systems system voltage is limited to fifty 50 volts acdc no direct wiring into existing load centers or junction boxes is authorized 2 carpeting and vinyl installation qualified to install semipermanent floor coverings of fabric vinyl linoleum or wood not including ceramic tile or stone work 3 drywall qualified to install gypsum drywall products to studs joists and suspended ceiling channels and to fabricate and install metal accessories and all necessary trim in connection therewith including metal studs runners hangers channels drywall metal suspensions accessories and prefabricated ceiling materials provided that any plaster work or troweled material application of block or wood partitions shall not be a part of metal stud framing 4 excavating and grading qualified to make excavations to obtain or remove materials such as rock gravel or sand to construct or excavate canals lakes levees roadways including land cleaning filling and grading an excavating and grading specialized contractor may do the work of a land clearing and grubbing contractor including landscaping 5 glass and glazing qualified to install and attach windows of any type fixed or movable and swinging or building walls or columns holding or supporting mullions or horizontal bars which in turn are attached to building walls or columns erected by others including the cutting and installation of glass and shall also include metal accessories and prefabricated glass metal or plastic curtain walls or panels and tinting the scope of work shall include the fabrication and installation of garage and industrial doors and shower and tub enclosure doors and metal facias storefront awnings or canopies 6 insulation and acoustic tile qualified to fabricate install and apply thermal acoustic or fireretardant acoustic material to walls floors ceilings or within such walls floors or ceiling by mechanical or adhesive method in such a manner to comply with applicable codes and industry recommendations and standards 7 landscaping qualified to perform the placement of sod shrubbery bushes trees and ornamental plantings and independent ornamental structures eg fountains birdbaths decorative statuary any plumbing connections shall be made by a licensed master plumber placement of recirculating andor single direction fountains shall fall under the scope of work of a lawn sprinkling specialized contractor or master plumber contractor if potable water is utilized 8 lathing and plastering qualified to apply and affix wood gypsum or metal lath or any other product prepared or manufactured including the placing of metal studs and runners to which lath is to be applied to provide hangers channels and other mechanical suspension work for the support of lath or acoustical tile or other prefabricated ceiling materials including the channel iron work for the support of metal or other fireresistive lath on wall ceilings or soffits or for solid plaster partitions and to coat surfaces with a mixture of sand or other aggregate gypsum plastering portland cement or quicklime and water or any combination of such materials as to create a permanent surface coating and which coatings are usually applied with a plasterers trowel or by pneumatic pressure on any surface which offers a mechanical key for the support of such coating or to which the coating will adhere by suction the scope of work shall not include the erection of wood stud or masonry walls such contractor may perform the work of a drywall contractor 9 lawnsprinkler qualified to install irrigation systems for residential commercial and agricultural lawns and gardens classification does not include connections to potable water which must be accomplished by a master plumber nor well drilling which is a separate category 10 paintingwaterproofingsandblasting qualified to clean sandblast pressure clean caulk and size surfaces in preparation for and to apply paint and related liquid or viscous products thereon by brush roller or spray methods in such a manner that under an agreed specification satisfactory painting and waterproofing can be accomplished 11 property management and maintenance qualified to make minor nonstructural repairs such as to repair nonbearing frames repair floors doors and locks caulk and make necessary painting repairs patch and stucco repairs provided however that the scope of the work shall not include plumbing electrical mechanical roofing or structural work of any kind 12 sewer cleaner to remove the cleanout plug for the purpose of cleaning andor removal of blockage causing stoppage in building drains and sewers not included within the definition of sewer cleaning is work included with the definition of plumbing as defined in section 6141 13 tile terrazzo and marble qualified to mix place screed grind polish and finish terrazzo tile or marble applied to surfaces erected and provided by others also qualified to erect attach apply and embed tile or concrete clay or any other materials to floors or walls and shall include tile veneer not exceeding threefourthsinch thickness to the exterior of buildings 14 tree removaltree surgeon qualified to prune trim cut down and transplant trees remove tree root systems and stumps cable fill cavities brace and support damaged trees and treat trees for various bacteriological or fungal diseases as long as such treatment does not require the use of controlled toxic substances permits for tree removal may be issued to persons in this category 15 well drilling qualified to drill water supply or drainage wells install and maintain and repair pumps incidental to a private swimming pool not to include pumps filters and chlorinators incidental to such pools a welldrilling specialized contractor may install lawn sprinkler systems and make connection of such lawn sprinkler piping but he shall not make a connection to sanitary or storm sewers a welldrilling contractor shall when engaged in the welldrilling business provide and maintain the necessary equipment in proper and sanitary condition a prerequisite to the issuance of this certificate shall be the submittal of a current state well drillers license subcontractor shall mean one who contracts with a contractor to perform a portion of the contractors work trade shall include but shall not be limited to construction repair removal of buildings plumbing work electrical work mechanical work engineering construction work and any similar occupation connected with the construction industry qualifying agent shall mean any person who has made application  been examined where required and approved to qualify as a contractor he may qualify as a contractor himself another individual a firm or a corporation and in addition to other responsibilities shall perform all necessary supervision for the contractor    62795 cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 proof of examination passage for the purposes of this article all of the contractor classifications as defined in section 11126 shall show proof of passage of h h block examination for their particular classification when applying for a competency card and shall adhere to fs ch 489 if applicable pertaining to state registration in addition they must show proof of two 2 years experience in their classification prior to issuance of a certificate of competency  previously licensed contractors a any person holding a current certificate of competency or certificate of proficiency issued by the board of contractor examiners or the board of electrical examiners or the board of plumbing examiners or the building trades board shall not be required to obtain a new certificate of proficiency or competency as a result of the repeal of the building trades board b nothing contained in this section shall affect those contractors who currently hold a certificate of competency in a particular classification as previously defined in this chapter of the ordinances and such persons shall be authorized to continue to act as contractors within the scope and limitations as previously defined provided however that the certificate of competency is not revoked or suspended in accordance with this division c nothing contained in this division shall be construed to exempt a person currently licensed from the requirement of obtaining a certificate of proficiency or competency if such current license is abandoned or a new type of license is sought d the building official shall review the existing licensed contractors as to classification and shall recommend reclassification of contractors in accordance with provisions of this division    62795 prosecution  penalties a unless otherwise specifically provided herein all violations of this article shall be prosecuted municipal code enforcement board of the city or a court of competent jurisdiction b any person who may himself or by his agent or any holder of a certificate of competency or certificate of compliance or certificate of proficiency who fails to comply with the provisions of this article shall be guilty of a violation of this division and upon conviction thereof shall be punished as provided in section 115  prohibited acts and omissions it shall be unlawful for any contractor or any partner officer director or qualifying agent of such a contractor to commit any one 1 or more of the following acts or omissions 1 to do work outside of the scope of work for which the contractor is authorized to perform 2 abandon without legal excuse a construction project or operation in which the contractor is engaged or under contract as a contractor 3 divert funds or property received for the execution or completion of a specific construction project or operation or for a specific purpose to any other use whatsoever 4 to depart from or disregard in any material respect the plans or specifications of a construction job without the consent of the owner or his duly authorized representative and the building official as defined by the standard building in section 6101 5 disregard or violate any county or municipal ordinance or state law pertaining to the contractors business or employee or regulating his work or providing safety and health regulations in the construction trades or for construction work 6 misrepresent any material fact in an application or supporting papers to obtain a certificate required by this article 7 failing to fulfill his contractual obligations including but not limited to the payment of all creditors for materials furnished or work or services performed 8 intentionally evading or violating any of the provisions of this article which may be evidenced by but not limited to one 1 or more of the following acts a aiding or abetting any person not holding a certificate of competency to evade or violate any of the provisions of this chapter b allowing a certificate to be used by an unauthorized person c obtaining a permit for any work in which the certificate holder does not actually supervise direct and control the construction or installation covered by such permit d subcontracting any work to any person not holding a certificate of competency or certificate of compliance for work involved in the subcontract 9 do any fraudulent act as a certificate holder by which another is substantially injured  secs 1113111140  reserved division 2  building official footnotes  5  editors note  adopted  changed the name of this division from building trades board to building official cross reference provisions regarding the appointment removal and resignation requirements  251 et seq  travel expenses  2131 et seq examination of contractors  delegation of authority a there is hereby delegated to the city building official the duty of examining and periodically reviewing contractors as to their qualifications including proof of financial responsibility to engage in the business of contracting in the incorporated areas of the city b hearings before the building official pursuant to this part shall be held monthly at such time and place as the building official may designate the building official shall prescribe such rules of procedure and as shall be necessary to carry into execution and operation the powers and duties delegated hereunder    31495   62795 powers and duties of building official a the building official shall have jurisdiction over all matters pertaining to the examination and issuance of certificates of proficiency and of certificates of competency and certificates of compliance and financial responsibility of all contractors who engage in the business of contracting and specialty contracting within the city b the building official shall have the power to determine the qualifications of applicants for the various classes of certificates of competency and certificates of compliance  to hold hearings to determine if a certificate of competency or certificate of compliance or of any contractor subcontractor or specialty contractor or specialized contractor should be suspended for violation of a city ordinance and to fix the length of the time for such suspension or to revoke the certificate of competency or certificate of compliance under the provisions of this article or to request an investigation of any complaints made against the licensed contractor and determine whether administrative action shall be taken against the contractor or specialty contractor or direct the investigator to file a complaint for prosecution for the violation against the contractor or specialty contractor  and to call upon members of the industry for advice and assistance it shall be the duty of the building official to annually review all related building codes and to make recommendations for any lawful amendments or changes thereto c testing requirements and experience requirements for all classifications of contractors will be reviewed annually by the building official for recommendations and suggested changes to council d definitions of contractor specialty contractor and specialized contractor categories may only be changed by council action e the building official shall have the authority to review applications for certificates of compliance categories applicants denied a certificate of compliance by the building official may appeal within thirty 30 days of the denial by notarized letter to the city council f the building official shall keep a permanent record of those persons applying for certificates of compliance as long as such certificates are renewed biannually in accordance with section 11178 g the building official may upon his own motion or upon a sworn complaint in writing of any person investigate the charges against any contractor holding a certificate of competency or certificate of compliance under the provisions of this article or any person who purports to be a contractor    62795 reserved editors note  adopted  repealed former  11143 which pertained to the executive secretary secs 1114411155  reserved division 3  examination footnotes  6  editors note  adopted  repealed former div 3  1115611165 which pertained to enforcement of said ordinance renumbered former div 4  1117611182 as div 3 1115611161 scope  standard a the building official shall prescribe the type of examination or degree of experience the knowledge of building safety health and lien laws of the city county state and federal governments as may be applicable and the knowledge of rudimentary administrative principles of the contracting business for the attainment of a certificate of competency in the classification of contractor desired until changed by the city council the hh block proctored examination will be the standard as criteria for the issuance of certificates of competency for all contractors except specialty contractors and specialized contractors b in the event an examination is not available hh block proctored examination the building official shall have the authority to prescribe any standard examination which meets equivalent criteria as required in city ordinances and state law for the category indicated proof of passage of a proctored examination shall be prerequisite to the issuance of a certificate of proficiency for the tested categories specified in this ordinances a   62795 conduct generally reciprocity examinations shall be held at a place date and hour to be set by the building official the examination fees shall be sufficient to cover the costs involved by the building official to administer such examination as long as the h h block proctored examination is used by the building official as the standard examination the building official will recognize the passage by any contractor of such examination for the purposes of this article if such examination is given under the administration of a municipality or county using the h h block examination as the standard criteria b   62795 recognition of licenses issued under statute if the applicant is a holder of a current valid certificate of certification from the florida construction industry licensing board as authorized by fs ch 489 the board shall recognize such certificate as meeting the certificate of proficiency and certificate of competency requirements of this ordinances and no additional examination or requirements shall be imposed  however the building official may impose the posting of a bond as a condition of issuance of a permit as set forth in section 1062 of the standard building b   62795 notices a notice of the next regular examination shall be given by the executive secretary of the building official to all who make application to take such examination b the executive secretary shall notify each applicant in writing whether he has passed the examination and shall automatically issue a certificate of proficiency upon successful passage of such examination c d   62795 qualification to apply any individual may apply for a certificate of competency whether he holds a certificate of proficiency or not but the attainment of a certificate of proficiency is a condition precedent to the issuance of a certificate of competency as provided in section 11178 e   62795 filing by licensee or holder of certificate of proficiency each licensee shall keep on file with the city at all times the names and addresses of the persons in the employment of the licensee who hold certificates of proficiency and all projects upon which the licensee is issued a building permit shall be placed under the supervision and control of such a person the licensee shall notify the city within five 5 days of the termination of the employment of such person by the licensee    62795 secs 1116211175  reserved division 4  certificate of competency and certificate of compliance footnotes  7  editors note  adopted  renumbered former div 5 as div 4 see the table certificate of competencyrequired a it shall be unlawful for any person to engage in business or to act in the capacity of a contractor or subcontractor under this article within the city without having made application for and been issued a current certificate of competency as required by this article proof of issuance of a certificate of competency shall be required prior to issuance of an occupational license when required by section 1158 b all contractors requiring state registration shall possess as a prerequisite to obtaining a certificate of competency a minimum of two 2 years experience within the classification for which application is made contractors in the heading of specialty or specialized contractors shall require one 1 years experience c the building official may authorize the executive secretary to enter into reciprocal agreements to and issue certificates of competency the executive secretary shall grant certificates of competency by reciprocity only from those counties and municipalities where the applicant has successfully passed with a grade of seventyfive 75 percent or more a written examination prepared graded and proctored by h h block and associates such application shall be accompanied by a financial statement written affidavit that the applicant will not engage in any work which is not within the scope of the certificate of competency for which the application is made and will comply with all regulations applicable to the certificate of competency from which application is made d holders of current certificates of competency may sign building permits to construct work contracted for by a partnership corporation business trust or other legally organized association only if the certificate holder is a partner officer or agent with fulltime employment in the partnership corporation business trust or other legally organized association e any person holding a city competency card or compliance certificate or certification at state level may designate one agent to obtain permits for work under the supervision of the qualifier the agent must be a member or employee of the firm partnership or corporation which the card or certificate holder is qualifying and the form of designation must be a notarized letter the letter may designate an agent for a specified job location and separate authorization letters would be required for any additional permits not in connection with the listed job the letter may designate an agent for an extended time not exceeding the biennial competency card or certificate of compliance renewal date of september thirtieth of each oddnumbered year letters of authorization of this type will allow the named individual authority to act in the contractors name for all permits during the time frame specified only one 1 person shall be listed on this type of authorization    62795 sameapplication a any person required or desiring to be qualified as a contractor shall make application on a form prescribed by the building official the application shall be retained by the building official together with all supporting papers the building official shall obtain a written credit report in regard to the application and shall make such additional investigation as may be directed by the building official should the applicant be a firm or corporation the application shall be executed by the president or one legally qualified to act for the firm or corporation and shall show his authority to so act on the application b the application for a certificate of competency shall contain 1 name residence address and phone number and business address and phone number of applicant 2 determination of whether individual partnership or corporation if partnership or corporation names of partners and corporate officers if the applicant is a corporation there must be furnished a certified copy of the incorporation and a letter from the secretary of the state that such corporation is in a current status with the secretary of state including the appointment of a resident agent to receive service of process 3 a sworn financial statement of the applicant and an agreement authorizing the building official to obtain from any source dealing with the applicant even though confidential such additional information concerning the applicants financial condition as the building official deems necessary a sworn financial statement will not be required of an applicant who has a current certificate of competency with the city for at least three 3 years from the date of the application an applicant shall be required to disclose any substantial change in his financial statement if a substantial change has occurred this provision for waiving the financial statement shall control over any section in this chapter to the contrary 4 a list of all businesses owned operated or managed by applicant or in which the applicant has had an interest of any kind during the past five 5 years and the addresses of these businesses 5 a statement that the applicant has not been convicted of a misdemeanor involving dishonesty fraud or moral turpitude or felony during the past five 5 years and that he is not presently charged with committing a felony or misdemeanor involving dishonesty fraud or moral turpitude if this is not the case applicant shall attach a sheet to the application specifying the details of the conviction or charges 6 shall list on the application any schooling or work experience the applicant has had along with dates of such schooling or work experience 7 shall state on the application whether or not the applicant has ever declared bankruptcy or had bankruptcy declared against him and the outcome if any 8 attached to the application shall be the following documents in addition to those required under the previous sections of this article a letter from a licensed insurance agent or agency showing the applicants insurability for the following policies of insurance 1 workers compensation insurance as required by law 2 public liability insurance in at least the policy limits commonly known as one hundred thousand dollarsthree hundred thousand dollars $10000000$30000000 and property damage coverage with limits and liability of fifty thousand dollars $5000000 for all categories requiring an examination all other categories will require fifty thousand dollarsone hundred thousand dollars $5000000$10000000 liability and twenty thousand dollars $2000000 property damage b certificate of passage of hh block proctored examination for the following classifications general contractor residential contractor building contractor class a b charv contractors roofing contractor sheet metal contractor commercial swimming pool contractor residential swimming pool contractor swimming pool servicing contractor mechanical contractor master electrician master plumber underground utilities contractor journeyman electrician journeyman plumber a   62795 sameissuance expiration renewal a the building official shall issue a certificate of competency when it is determined that the applicant is qualified under this division and has met the following requirements 1 that the financial statement of the applicant and the citys investigation of such financial statement and applicants credit record show that the applicant is financially able to engage in the contracting business for which the license is requested 2 that the applicant and each member of the firm and each holder of a certificate of proficiency possesses a reputation for honesty integrity and has a good character the lack of honesty integrity or good character may be established by competent evidence that a applicant or others aforementioned have committed an act within the past five 5 years involving dishonesty fraud deceit and lack of integrity whereby the contractor has been benefited or whereby some injury has been sustained by another b applicant or others aforementioned or another firm in which the applicant or others aforementioned were interested has in the past five 5 years refused to pay valid bills of at least three 3 different persons or firms or has been adjudged a bankrupt c applicant or others aforementioned have been convicted of a misdemeanor involving dishonesty fraud or moral turpitude or felony during the past five 5 years 3 that the applicant is insured by a responsible insurance company for the previously stated policy limits in section 11192b8a 4 that the applicant or one 1 of its officers or employees is a holder of a valid certificate of proficiency for the class of license desired a a certificate of competency shall expire biennially on september thirtieth failure to renew the certificate during september of the renewal year shall cause the certificate to become inoperative and it is unlawful thereafter for any person to engage to offer to engage or hold himself out as engaging in contracting under the certificate unless the certificate is restored or reissued b a certificate of competency which is inoperative because of failure to renew shall be restored on payment of the proper renewal fee if the application for restoration is made within ninety 90 days after september thirtieth of the renewal year if the application for restoration is not made within the ninetyday period the fee for restoration will be a fiftydollar penalty in addition to the proper renewal fee  except for journeymen the fee will be a tendollar penalty in addition to the proper renewal fee the building official shall require reexamination of the applicant if the certificate has lapsed for more than two 2 years c a person who holds a valid certificate of competency from the building official may go on an inactive status during which time he shall not engage in contracting but maintain his certificate on an inactive basis upon payment of the required fee during the inactive period an inactive certificate of competency which is invalid because of failure to renew shall be restored on payment of the proper renewal fee if the application for restoration is made within ninety 90 days after september thirtieth of the renewal year if the application for restoration is not made within the ninetyday period the fee for restoration will be a fiftydollar penalty in addition to the proper renewal fee  except for journeymen the fee will be a tendollar penalty in addition to the proper renewal fee in addition the building official shall require reexamination of the applicant if the certificate has lapsed more than two 2 years    62795 certificate of compliancerequired a it shall be unlawful for any person or firm to act in the capacity of a specialized contractor as defined in section 11126 within the city without having made application for been issued and possessing a current certificate of compliance as required by this article b an employee of a person who holds a current certificate of compliance is not required to possess a certificate of compliance to perform specialized contractor work only if the work is performed under the employers supervision and if the specific type of work being performed is the type of work for which the employers certificate of compliance was issued 1   62795 sameapplication any person required or desiring to receive service of process 3 a list of all businesses owned operated or managed by applicant or in which the applicant has had any interest of any kind during the past five 5 years and the addresses of these businesses 4 a statement stating that the applicant has not been convicted of a misdemeanor involving dishonesty fraud or moral turpitude or felony during the past five 5 years and expiration renewal a the building official shall authorize the executive secretary to issue a certificate of compliance when it is determined that the applicant is qualified under this article and has met the following requirements 1 that the applicant and each member of the firm and each holder of a certificate of proficiency possesses a reputation for honesty integrity and has a good character the lack of honesty integrity or good character are as previously noted under section 11178a2 2 that the applicant is insured by a responsible insurance company for the previously stated policy limits in section 111807 3 that the applicant holds the required previous experience for the classification being applied for b the renewal of the certificate of compliance and failure to renew fees renewal date inactive status etc shall be as referenced in sections 11177 and 11178 1   62795 business organizations a when an individual proposes to do business in his own name a certificate of competency or certificate of compliance when granted shall be issued only to that individual b if the applicant proposing to engage in contracting is a partnership corporation business trust or other legal entity the application shall state the name of the partnership and of its partners or the name of the corporation and of its officers and directors or the name of the business trust and its trustees or the name of such other legal entity and its members and furnish evidence of statutory compliance if a fictitious name is used such application shall also show that the person applying for the examination is legally qualified to act for the business organization in all matters connected with its contracting business  and that he has authority to supervise construction undertaken by such business organization the certificate of competency or certificate of compliance when issued upon application of a business organization shall be in the name of such business organization and the name of the qualifying individual shall be noted thereon c at least one 1 officer or supervising employee of the business organization shall be qualified under this article in order for the business organization to hold a current certificate of competency or certificate of compliance in the category of business conducted for which the officer or supervising officer or supervising employee is qualified if any individual so qualified on behalf of such business organization ceases to be affiliated with such business organization he and the organization shall inform the building official within thirty 30 days from whence the change occurs in addition if such individual is the only qualified individual affiliated with the business organization the business organization shall have a period of sixty 60 days from the termination of the individuals affiliation with the business organization to qualify another person under the provisions of this article failing which the certificate of the business organization shall be subject to revocation by the building official during the abovementioned sixtyday period no permits shall be issued to such business organization until a qualified individual is approved by the building official for such company d any contractor issued a certificate of competency or certificate of compliance as herein provided shall place on any and all vehicles utilized by such contractor in his business in the city his competency card number or his licensed business name and telephone number stenciled in oneinch letters in a contrasting color on each side of the vehicle from the back of the drivers side forward state registered or state certified contractors must display their registration numbers on any and all advertisementssigns per state law    92893   62795 suspension and revocation of certificate the building official may suspend or revoke or refuse to renew a contractors certificate of competency or certificate of compliance if it is found that the contractor 1 fails to maintain at all times with the insurance company authorized to do business in the state the limits of insurance required by this division 2 contractor andor licensee or the holder of the certificate of proficiency has committed an act since the issuance of the original certificate of competency or compliance involving dishonesty fraud deceit or lack of integrity whereby the contractor or the holder of the certificate of proficiency has been benefited or whereby some injury has been sustained by another 3 contractor andor licensee or the holder of the certificate of proficiency has since the issuance of the original certificate of competency or compliance refused to pay valid bills of at least three 3 different persons or firms 4 contractor andor licensee or the holder of the certificate of proficiency has since the issuance of the original certificate of competency or compliance been convicted of the commission of a misdemeanor involving dishonesty fraud or moral turpitude or a felony 5 that the original license was obtained misstatement or misrepresentation of a material fact 6 that the licensee no longer has an employee or partner in the licensees business who holds a certificate of proficiency required for the class and type of license held by the licensee 7 that the licensee has allowed another person to use his license as prohibited by section 11186 8 that the licensee has violated any provisions of this chapter or any other ordinance building code or regulation 9 contractor andor licensee or the holder of the certificate of proficiency has since the issuance of the original certificate of competency or compliance within any twelvemonth period refused to correct or satisfy three 3 or more valid complaints from customers relating to the performance of work by the contractor alternatively contractor andor licensee has failed to remedy or satisfy five 5 or more valid complaints from customers during any threeyear period the customers complaints must be filed with the city to constitute a complaint within the terms of this section in order to constitute a valid complaint information or evidence must be produced which would show that the contractor andor licensee or holder of the certificate of proficiency has failed and refused to honor a contractual provision or failed or refused to honor any warranty or representation relating to work to be performed by a contractor    62795 procedure for revocation or suspension of certificate of competency and certificate of compliance a the building official for good cause may upon his own motion or shall upon a sworn complaint in writing of any person investigate or cause to be investigated the charges against any person or any holder of a certificate of competency or compliance upon the failure of such contractor to keep in force the insurance policy required in this article the building official take appropriate action as provided herein b the building official upon completion of such investigation shall decide if a prima facie showing of a violation of this article exists and if so shall take one 1 or both of the following actions 1 send by certified mail a letter to the certificate of competency or certificate of compliance holder or holders at their last known address as shown by the building officials records setting out the name of the complainant the alleged offense and the approximate time of the commission and the section of this article alleged to be violated and notifying them to appear before the building official at a time and place fixed not sooner than twenty 20 days from the mailing of the certified letter advising that they may be represented by an attorney and that they should bring with them all original documents and other data that may be pertinent to the case and that they will be given the opportunity to present such witnesses and evidence as they deem appropriate 2 refer the matter to the state attorneys office for appropriate action c the administrative hearing provided for above shall be open to the public d the proceedings at the hearing shall be recorded and may be transcribed at the expense of the party requesting the transcript e the hearing need not be conducted according to technical rules relating to evidence and witnesses any relevant evidence shall be admitted if the building official finds it competent and reliable regardless of the existence of any common law or statutory rule which might make improper the admission of such evidence hearsay evidence may be used for the purpose of supplementing or explaining any direct evidence but shall not be sufficient in itself to support a finding unless it would be admissible in civil actions the rules of privilege shall be effective to the same extent that they are now or hereafter may be recognized in civil actions irrelevant and unduly repetitious evidence shall be excluded f each party shall have the following rights to call and examine witnesses  to introduce exhibits  to crossexamine opposing witnesses on any matter relevant to the issues even though that matter was not covered in the direct examination  to impeach any witnesses regardless of which party first called him to testify  and to rebut the evidence against him the procedure to be utilized shall be substantially in accordance with fs ch 120 g a decision shall be made within five 5 days after the close of the hearing the decision shall be one 1 of the following 1 not guilty 2 suspension of the certificate of competency stating time 3 revocation of the certificate naming the effective date 4 official letter of reprimand to become a part of the certificate holders permanent record h the building official may at its discretion assess all or any part of the direct costs of the administrative hearing upon any contractor found guilty of a violation of this chapter the assessment if any will be required to be paid prior to any reinstatement of the certificate of competency or certificate of compliance costs of the hearing shall be as determined by the city finance department from direct billing and manhours expended    62795 appeals any applicant for a certificate of competency or certificate of compliance that is denied a certificate by the building official may appeal to the city council and any contractor that has had his certificate of competency or certificate of compliance suspended revoked or reprimanded by the building official may appeal to the city council any such appeal must be taken within twenty 20 days of denial suspension revocation or reprimand or otherwise shall be barred    62795 use of contractors name by another no contractor shall allow his name to be used by any person directly or indirectly for the purpose of obtaining a permit or for the purpose of doing any work under his occupational license or certificate of competency or certificate of compliance violation of this section shall be grounds for the suspension or revocation of a certificate of competency certificate of compliance and an occupational license    62795 credit report fees in addition to the occupational license fee required in section 1158 and the examination fee the building official may establish a fee schedule to cover the cost of obtaining the credit reports outlined in this article    62795 secs 1118811200  reserved division 5  enforcement of unlicensed contractor activities definitions a advertise shall mean to tell about communicate inform advise in or public or private manner or form including but not limited to s handbills or flyers business cards magazines telephone directoryies radio television telephone solicitation andor conversation b board shall mean the city of titusville municipal board as established by the city of titusville ordinances c certificate means a certificate of competency issued by the state department of processional regulation or the building official of the city d certification means the act of obtaining or holding a certificate of competency from the state department of profession regulation or the building official of the city e certified contractor means any contractor who possesses a certificate of competency issued by the board or the state department of professional regulation or the building official of the city f officer shall mean a person as defined in fs ch 162 and authorized by the city to enforce this division g contractor shall mean and refer to any person who undertakes to or submits a bid to or does himself or herself or by others construct repair alter remodel add to subtract from demolish move or improve any building or structure including related improvements to real estate for others or for resale to others or who undertakes or offers to undertake or purports to have the capacity to undertake or submits a bid to or does himself or herself or by or engages in a trade or occupation regulated by this division ordinances section 11126 et seq or fs ch 489 h licensed means possessing the certificates required pursuant to fs ch 489 parts i and ii andor city ordinances and the
