administrator shall keep a record of all such business tax receipts and of such complaints and violations m12   111296   6909 revocation of business tax receipt a the business tax receipt issued pursuant to this article may be revoked by the administrator after notice and hearing for any of the following causes 1 any fraud misrepresentation or false statement contained in the application for business tax receipt 2 any fraud misrepresentation or false statement made in connection with the selling of goods wares or merchandise 3 any violation of this article 4 any plea of no contest or conviction for theft consumer fraud deceptive trade practices or sexual battery 5 conducting the business that holds a business tax receipt under this article in an unlawful manner or in such a manner as to constitute a breach of the peace or to constitute a menace to the health safety or general welfare of the public b notice of hearing for revocation of a business tax receipt shall be given and shall comply with current code enforcement regulations specifically the grounds of the complaint and the time and place of the hearing such notice shall be mailed postage prepaid to the business tax receipt holder at his last known address at least ten 10 days prior to the date set for the hearing m13   111296   6909 appeal said aggrieved person shall have fourteen 14 calendar days to file with the city clerks office to be heard by the city council at the next available council meeting the council shall set the time and place for a hearing on such appeal and notice of such hearing shall be given to such person in the same manner as provided in section 11345 for notice of hearing on revocation the order of the city council on such appeal shall be final m14   111296 enforcement it shall be the duty of the code enforcement supervisor or hisher designee of the city to examine all places of business and persons in their respective territories subject to the provisions of this article to determine if this article has been complied with and to enforce the provisions of this article against any person found to be violating the same m11   111296 penalty any person violating any of the provisions of this article shall upon conviction thereof be punished pursuant to section 3166 m16     111296 cross reference board  14101440 land development regulations vol ii secs 1134911370  reserved article ix  peddlers solicitors and canvassers definitions for purposes of this article the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section peddler canvasser or solicitor shall mean any individual whether a resident of the city or not traveling either by foot wagon automobile motor truck or any other type of conveyance from place to place from house to house or from street to street within the corporate limits of the city or any individual whether a resident of the city or not who uses a telephone located within the city taking or attempting to take orders for sale of goods wares and merchandise personal property of any nature whatsoever for future delivery or for services to be furnished or performed in the future whether or not such individual has carries or exposes for sale a sample of the subject of such sale or whether he is collecting in advance payments on such sales or not provided that such definition shall include any person who for himself or for another person hires leases uses occupies any building structure tent railroad boxcar house trailer hotel room lodging house apartment shop or any other place within the city for the sole purpose of exhibiting samples and taking orders for future delivery other than a seasonal sales vendor or fruit vegetable seafood and nursery products vendor    111296   6909 cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 business tax receipt required it shall be unlawful for any peddler solicitor or canvasser to engage in such business within the corporate limits of the city without first obtaining a business tax receipt therefore in compliance with the provisions of this article any permanent business in the city of titusville wishing to engage in doorordoor sales shall be required to obtain a business tax receipt pursuant to this article    111296   6909 application a applicants for a business tax receipt under this article must file with the administrator a sworn application in writing on a form to be furnished by the administrator which shall give the following information 1 name and description of the applicant 2 permanent home address and full local address of applicant 3 a brief description of the nature of the business and the goods to be sold 4 a passportsized photograph 5 if employed the name and address of the employer together with the credentials establishing the exact relationship 6 the length of time for which the right to do business is desired 7 the place where the goods or property proposed to be sold or orders taken for the sale thereof is manufactured or produced where such goods or products are located at the time such application is filed and the proposed method of delivery 8 a statement as to whether or not the applicant has pled no contest or been convicted of any crime involving theft consumer fraud deceptive trade practices or sexual battery within the last five 5 years 9 the place or places other than the permanent place of business of the applicant where applicant within the six 6 months next preceding the date of such application conducted a business stating the nature thereof and giving the post office and street address of any building or office in which such business was conducted 10 at the time of filing an application for a permit the applicant shall present a valid drivers license if having one 1 issued or another valid form of identification 11 the applicant shall submit to fingerprinting at the titusville police department pay the costs thereof and verification of fingerprinting shall be provided by the applicant at the time of filing the application b at the time of filing the application a fee of twentyfive dollars $2500 shall be paid to the city to cover the cost of investigation of the facts stated therein    111296   51303   6909  a  1 82509 investigation  issuance or denial of business tax receipt  contents upon receipt of an application for a business tax receipt required by this article the administrator shall have five 5 working days to conduct an investigation police department building department and the better business council of the titusville area chamber of commerce of the applicants business and moral character to be made as they deem necessary for the protection of the public good 1 if as a result of such investigation the applicants character or business responsibility is found to be unsatisfactory the application will be disapproved and no business tax receipt will be issued 2 a business tax receipt will not be issued if it is determined that an applicant has a been convicted of or entered a plea of guilty or nolo contendere to a crime against the laws of this state or any other state the united states or violated ordinances of this city or any other city or county in this state or any other state involving moral turpitude theft consumer fraud deceptive trade practices fraudulent or dishonest dealing sexual battery the illegal sale of a controlled substance or been convicted of or entered a plea of guilty or nolo contendere to a violation of any provisions of fs   any successor thereto andor this article b attempted to obtain a business tax receipt by fraud false statement misrepresentation or failure to truthfully answer any question in the application 3 if as a result of such investigation the character and business responsibility of the applicant are found to be satisfactory the business tax receipt will be issued such business tax receipt shall show the name address and photograph of the business tax receipt holder the date of issuance and the length of time the business tax receipt shall be operative as well as the business tax receipt number and other identifying description of any vehicle used in such soliciting or canvassing the administrator shall keep a permanent record of all business tax receipts issued 4 the applicant shall pay an annual business tax receipt fee of twentytwo dollars and five cents $2205 for each solicitor any renewal of such business tax receipt may be granted provided the business tax receipt has not been revoked upon payment of the twentytwo dollars and five cents $2205 fee 5 no applicant or individual acting on behalf of a corporate applicant or an applicant organization shall receive a business tax receipt allowing solicitation for more than a total of sixty 60 days per allocation for business tax receipt if applicant desires to apply for an additional permit an applicant may do so and its duration of the new permit may not exceed sixty 60 days no applicant shall receive a permit allowing solicitation for more than one hundred twenty 120 total calendar days in any fiscal calendar year 6 no more than four 4 solicitors may solicit at any one 1 time 7 no business tax receipt shall be issued to a corporation partnership or other impersonal entity but each individual person engaging in the business of peddling canvassing or soliciting within the city shall be required to have a business tax receipt whether acting for themselves or as an agent of another 8 it shall be unlawful for any peddler canvasser or solicitor to engage in the business of peddling canvassing or soliciting within the city between the hours of  pm and  am during eastern daylight saving time nor between the hours of  pm and  am during eastern standard time 9 solicitors peddlers and canvassers are prohibited from soliciting peddling and canvassing on premises in areas where a notice stating no trespassing no solicitors no soliciting or words of a similar meaning is posted in plain view 10 it shall be unlawful for any person under the age of eighteen 18 years to engage in peddling canvassing or soliciting without direct supervision by a person at least eighteen 18 years of age direct supervision means the supervising person shall at all times have the minor in sight and shall in no event be more than one hundred 100 feet away from the minor    111296   51303   6909  a  1 82509 appeals from denial or revocation said aggrieved person shall have fourteen 14 days from the date of denial or revocation of the business tax receipt to file an appeal with the administrator to be heard by the city council at the next available council meeting the council shall set a time and place for a hearing on such appeal the notice of hearing shall contain the date time and place of the hearing such notice shall also advise the vendor of the right to be heard of the right to be represented by counsel and of the right to present sworn testimony on the vendors behalf the decision and order of the council on such appeal shall be final and conclusive    111296   51303   6909  a  1 82509 revocation licenses issued under the provisions of this article may be revoked by the license department for any of the following causes 1 fraud misrepresentation or false statement contained in the application for license 2 fraud misrepresentation or false statement made in the course of carrying on his business as solicitor or as canvasser 3 any violation of this article 4 been convicted of or entered a plea of guilty or nolo contendere to a crime against the laws of this state or any other state the united states or violated ordinances of this city or any other city or county in this state or any other state involving moral turpitude theft consumer fraud deceptive trade practices fraudulent or dishonest dealing sexual battery the illegal sale of a controlled substance or been convicted of or entered a plea of guilty or nolo contendere to a violation of any provision of fs   any successor thereto andor this article 5 conducting the business of peddling soliciting or canvassing in an unlawful manner or in such a manner as to constitute a breach of the peace or to constitute a menace to the health safety or general welfare of the public    111296   6909  a  1 82509 records the chief of police shall report to the administrator all convictions for violation of this article and the administrator shall maintain a record for each license issued and record the reports of violation therein    111296   51303   6909 exhibition of business tax receipt peddlers solicitors and canvassers are required to exhibit their business tax receipt at the request of any citizen    6909 solicitation on rightofway a definitions for the purpose of this section the following definitions shall apply unless the context clearly indicates or requires a different meaning road rightofway the land in which the state county or municipality owns the fee or has an easement devoted to or required for use as a transportation facility to include streets sidewalks alleys appurtenant drainage structures and facilities solicitation any activity taking place on a state county or municipal rightofway within the city wherein an individual or individuals are intentionally intermingling with motor vehicle traffic for the purpose of obtaining support for any event issue organization or any other purpose for which support may be solicited solicitation shall include but not be limited to seeking donations of funds from motorists seeking signatures from motorists passing out literature to motorists and any other activity wherein a pedestrian approaches a motor vehicle while the motor vehicle is being operated andor stopped on a state county or local rightofway within the city for the purpose of this section solicitation shall not be construed to mean activities whereby pedestrians stand immediately off andor immediately adjacent to public rightsofway displaying signs in support of any cause provided such activity does not require any physical contact between the pedestrian and motorists as previously described herein and provided such activity does not create a traffic hazard b prohibited activity it shall be strictly prohibited within the city to engage in any solicitation activity on a state county or municipal rightsofway within the city it is the intent of this provision to prohibit all such solicitation activity in order to protect the public health safety and welfare of the citizens of the city c penalty any person violating the provisions of this section shall be guilty of a second degree misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be punished by fine andor imprisonment as provided in florida statutes  51303 editors note  adopted nov 12 199 reserved  11379 formerly such section pertained to bond and derived from  219 of the 1963 no 192003  2 adopted  added new provisions to the  hours of solicitation no peddling canvassing or solicitation shall occur by any individual licensed under this article before  am on any day and after  pm during the months of standard time and after  pm during the months of daylight savings time unless the peddler canvasser or solicitor has the express permission of the property owner or resident prior to calling for solicitation  enforcement it shall be the duty of any code inspector or police officer of the city to require any person peddling soliciting or canvassing and who is not known by such officer to be duly authorized to produce his business tax receipt and to enforce the provisions of this article against any person found to be violating the same    6909 penalty any person violating any of the provisions of this article shall upon conviction be punished as provided by section 115  secs 1138311405  reserved article x  reserved footnotes  11  editors note  adopted  repealed  1140611413 formerly such sections pertained to solid waste collection and disposal secs 1140611413  reserved article xi  motion and still photography production permits title this article shall be known and cited as the city of titusville motion and still photography production permit   72595 purposes the purpose of this article is to establish a onestop permitting process for motion picture and still photography on public property owned or controlled by or under the jurisdiction of the city in recognition of the economic impact of the motion picture and television industry  72595 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly requires otherwise city shall refer to the city of titusville florida city equipment is any tangible property other than real property purchased by public funds and utilized in the normal course and scope of providing governmental service by the city city facility is any public street sidewalk place or building owned or controlled by or under the jurisdiction of the city to include but not be limited to city park and recreation facilities production is the commercial taking or making of a motion picture television videotape or still photographic production this term shall include and a production permit shall be required for such production on private property not at a studio involving the erection of tents or other temporary structures or involving the use of pyrotechnics explosives or other incendiary devices production permit also referred to herein as permit is the permit required by this article  72595 city manager the city manager is hereby authorized to act as the agent for the city in the receipt and processing of applications for production permits after review and approval by the applicable city department and final approval by the city manager the permit will be issued the city manager is further authorized to act as liaison with the brevard county film commissioner  72595 permit required  suspension andor revocation  violation a no person shall advertise engage in participate in andor start any motion and still photography production on or upon any city facility or utilizing city equipment unless a production permit shall first have been obtained from the city manager violation of this section shall be punishable as provided for by law b failure to comply with the terms and conditions of the production permit once issued shall be grounds for immediate suspension of the production until such time as the noncompliance is remedied the suspension shall be initially communicated orally followed by a written suspension order continued failure to comply with the terms and conditions of the production permit may result in revocation of the permit at the discretion of the city manager continuation of the production in violation of the suspension andor revocation shall be punishable as provided by law  72595 application for permit a any person seeking the issuance of a production permit shall file an application with and on forms provided by the city manager prior to commencement of production the application shall be signed by an authorized representative of the applicant b the application shall contain the following information 1 locations of the production 2 duration and type of production 3 proof of liability insurance coverage with the city named as an additional insured as commensurate with the scope of the production 4 special effects to be utilized especially incendiary or explosive devices in addition the application shall list the person in charge pyrotechnician of such special effects together with hisher qualifications and licensure by the applicable federal andor state agencies 5 proposed utilization of city equipment 6 necessity for closures of public streets and sidewalks and duration therefor 7 a written summary or explanation of the portion of the production to be shot within unincorporated areas of the city 8 number and type of vehicles andor equipment and number of personnel to be on location with the production 9 an agreement to pay for extraordinary services provided by the city 10 a hold harmlessindemnification agreement for the benefit of the city and any participating municipality 11 the applicant for a motion and still photography production permit shall at the time of making application furnish proof that the applicant carries workers compensation insurance for applicants employees as provided by the laws of the state the applicant shall file with the city manager a certificate of insurance evidencing the carrying of public liability insurance in an amount not less than one million dollars $100000000 per occurrence and three million dollars $300000000 aggregate issued by an insurance carrier authorized to transact business in the state for the benefit of the city as an additional insured as evidence of the ability to respond for damages which may result from or be attributable to the motion andor still photography production the insurance policy shall be approved by the city manager  72595 nonexemption from other city nothing herein contained shall be construed to exempt any holder of a production permit from any other required licenses permits or other required authority or from any other provision of the citys ordinances  72595 cost for extraordinary services the city shall recover its cost for extraordinary services rendered in connection with a production such costs shall include but not be limited to charges for personnel andor equipment committed in support of the production which are outside the normal scope of government services and an allocable share of the citys overhead costs will be applied to the direct charges for personnel equipment and other direct costs incurred by the city based on the information contained in the permit application an estimate of these costs shall be provided to the applicant prior to the issuance of the permit the applicant agrees to pay the city in advance for any services provided by the city the city managers office will provide coordination and advise the applicant of estimated costs  72595 secs 1142211499  reserved article xii  special events definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning amusement attraction means any building or structure around over or persons may move or walk without the aid of any moving device integral to the building or structure which building or structure provides amusement pleasure thrills or excitement the term does not include enterprises principally devoted to the exhibition of products of agriculture industry education science religion or the arts amusement device means any mechanical device or combination of devices which carries or conveys passengers on along around over or fixed or restricted course or within a defined area for the purpose of giving its passengers amusement pleasure or excitement the following are not considered amusement devices or amusement attractions traditional theaters bowling alleys skating rinks miniature golf exercise equipment batting cages and live animal rides applicant means the property owner individual or organization sponsoring the event and who must apply for the special event permit booth means a small stand for the sale of goods or containment of games and other individual entertainment activities associated with the special event classifications waivers special events shall be classified in the belowlisted categories and subject to certain terms and conditions based on the impact the event may have on titusville residents and city services class a those public or private events which by design are intended to attract patrons from both within and outside brevard county and may include 1 paid commercial advertisement  and 2 outside beeralcohol concessions or amplified entertainment these events shall include but are not limited to certain festivals concerts athletic events contests competitions and dances these events shall be limited to the downtown redevelopment area urban village and industrial zoned properties and may include the following characteristics  up to four 4 stages  one 1 observation tower  multiple sources of amplified sound  tentscanopies  serving of food  beverages and alcohol where permissible  multiple parking areas and traffic control  four 4 days of activities  hours of operation no earlier than  am and no later than  pm  amnew years eve unless otherwise stipulated by the terms of the special event permit class b those public or private events which by design are intended to attract patrons from the city of titusville area where advertisement if done is limited to the brevard county target market these events shall include but are not limited to certain cultural events arts and craft shows athletic events community celebrations dances car and boat shows as regulated by section 11516 competitions and parades class b events shall not be allowed on singlefamily residential lots these events may include the following characteristics  up to two 2 stages  amplified sound  tentscanopies  serving of food  beverages and alcohol where permissible  up to four 4 days of activities  hours of operation no earlier than  am and no later than  pm  amnew years eve unless otherwise stipulated by the terms of the special event permit class c those activities or events that involve the private use of cityowned or controlled property and are not open to the general public these events are characterized by their limited impact on traffic parking and noise in surrounding neighborhoods and do not exceed the capacity of the facility or other property proposed to be used class c events on property controlled by brevard county parks and recreation shall be exempt from the citys special event permit process such events or activities shall include but are not limited to weddings large picnics family reunions block parties and birthday parties class c events are not intended to regulate typical use of parks or public areas but only those events that require rental of pavilions park facilities road closures building or alcohol permits andor other city or county services these events may include the following characteristics  serving of food  beverages and alcohol where permissible  up to two thousand five hundred 2500 square feet of tentscanopies  one 1 source of amplified sound  up to eight 8 hours of activities  less than five hundred 500 people  hours of operation no earlier than  am and no later than  pm  amnew years eve unless otherwise stipulated by the terms of the special event permit provider means the person partnership or organization that is providing the amusement rides devices games and booths tents or entertainment to the sponsoring person partnership or organization security violations includes any activity which results in an arrest by a certified law enforcement officer resulting in the imposition by a court of law of a fine imprisonment probation andor other criminal penalty this term includes only those arrests which occurred during a permitted special event and on property where such event was held special event means a any temporary public gathering for the purpose of participating in entertainment in an open area which may consist of music parades fairs festivals carnivals circuses sports events arts and crafts or any other public entertainment event taking place in the incorporated areas of the city excluding state and federally owned property and property controlled by the county parks and recreation department unless when there is a request for city services organized sport leagues shall not be classified as a special event and are hereby exempt from said restrictions b public events held in facilities that are not within the original purpose of the facility c any event with one 1 or more of the following regardless of the anticipated number of attendees 1 amusement rides or devices subject to inspection under fs ch 616 2 any special event requiring the utilization or temporary closing of any state city or county maintained public and private roadways including but not limited to road races and block parties 3 the operation andor performance of a fireworks display 4 a temporary tent in excess of four hundred 400 square feet for use at public gatherings d special event shall not mean any activity upon or over any watercourse or body of water including but not limited to boat races unless it also includes an activity defined as a special event e no special event shall extend on any weekday or weekend after  pm sponsor means the person entity or organization responsible for the finances and administration of the special event  52212 permit required any special event held within the corporate limits of the city of titusville shall obtain a special event permit all special events shall comply with the provisions set forth in this chapter and with all terms conditions and requirements identified in an issued permit  52212 permit application a the applicant for a permit under this article shall file a completed special event application with the special events coordinator of the city as part of the application the applicant must complete and submit to the special events coordinator a preevent assessment list along with a completed site plan and tentative schedule of events with the application the preevent assessment list shall at a minimum contain the following  type of event activities  location of event  date and times of event  event applicants  contact persons telephone numbers  estimated number of spectatorsattendees each day of event  requested waiver of fees exceptions  tentative schedule of events for each day of event  detailed site plan including pedestrian traffic access  vehicular traffic control plan  life safety plan  other information deemed appropriate by the event applicants b the special events coordinator shall review the application to determine if the proposed event may be designated as a special event if so determined the special events coordinator shall contact the applicants and make arrangements for a planning meeting c planning meeting upon receipt of a completed application if so determined the special events coordinator shall prepare a planning meeting all aspects of the proposed event and its impact on the city shall be discussed to establish policy and procedural requirements necessary city services appropriate fees and correct any deficiencies from a public health and safety standpoint that may be necessary andor in the best interests of the city city staff will either approve or disapprove both class a and class b events upon approval by city staff the special events coordinator shall establish an agreement stipulating the terms and conditions of the permit and all estimated fees no planning meeting or agreement is required for class c events the special events coordinator shall coordinate class c events the special events coordinator has approval authority for class c events d no single location shall play host to more than four 4 class b special events per calendar year requests for class c events will be considered on a casebycase basis special events held on property within the downtown redevelopment area and industrial zoned properties shall be exempt from said requirement e no event will be approved that would adversely impact another event previously approved or applied for with the city f acquiring all permits is the responsibility of the applicants and they must be submitted to the citys special events coordinator no later than twentyone 21 days prior to the first day of the special event this includes but is not limited to  finalized site plan  finalized life safety plan  security schedule  letters to affected property owners  other required inspections and permits g if the special event application is denied the special events coordinator will provide the reasons for denial in writing the applicants may in writing appeal the decision to the city manager as defined within section 11505 h if an event is not approved the city shall not be responsible for any costs incurred by the event applicants i failure to comply with the terms and conditions of a special event permit may be grounds for immediate suspension of the event until such time as the noncompliance is remedied the noncompliance shall be initially communicated orally followed by a written suspension order if the noncompliance is not remedied noncompliance includes conducting unapproved activities and activities involving unsafe conditions  52212 advanced notification a whenever a class a or class b special event is planned to be held within the city on the holiday or holiday weekend of martin luther king jr day easter memorial day independence day labor day thanksgiving christmas and new years eve the applicants shall submit at least sixty 60 days but no more than three hundred sixtyfive 365 days prior to the event a special event application to the special events coordinator b whenever a class a or class b special event is planned to be held within the city that does not include a holiday weekend the applicants thereof shall at least sixty 60 days but no more than one hundred eighty 180 days prior submit a completed special events application to the special events coordinator class a and class b special event requests submitted less than sixty 60 days in advance will be subject to a late fee in the amount on file with the city no class a or class b special event requests will be accepted with less than forty 40 days notice in advance of the proposed event date c whenever a class c special event is planned to be held within the corporate limits of the city the applicants thereof shall submit at least thirty 30 days but no more than one hundred eighty 180 days prior to the event a special events application to the special events coordinator class c special events submitted less than thirty 30 days in advance will be subject to a late fee in the amount on file with the city  52212 special event permit  feeissuance a a nonrefundable check made payable to the city of titusville for a special events application fee shall be required upon application approval the applicants shall be required to pay fees for law enforcement fire ems building and public works and equipment fees and provide the security required pursuant to sections 11512 and 11513 herein all estimated fees shall be paid by at least five 5 days prior to the event failure to pay the estimated fees shall result in the permit not being issued unless approved by the city b if an entire special event is canceled all fees other than the event application fee and the fees for services rendered or contractually obligated shall be reimbursed to the applicants c the special event applicants for class a events shall be notified of event approval or disapproval andor any additional requirements or modification of requirements no less than thirty 30 days prior to the commencement of the event a nonrefundable check made payable to the city of titusville shall be required upon application approval by the city staff d the special event applicants for class b events shall be notified of event approval or disapproval andor any additional requirements or modification of requirements no less than fourteen 14 days prior to the commencement of the event a nonrefundable check made payable to the city of titusville shall be required upon application approval by the city staff e the special event applicants for class c events shall be notified of event approval or disapproval andor any additional requirements or modification of requirements no less than fourteen 14 days prior to the commencement of the event a nonrefundable check made payable to the city of titusville for a special events application fee will be required upon application approval by the special events coordinator exemptions events observed for federally recognized holidays are exempt from special event fee requirements  52212 limiting altering denying applications and appeals a the city reserves the right to limit alter or deny special events the city may deny a special event permit application if it is determined that the activity will adversely impact neighboring businesses or residents impose a safety hazard create a noise disturbance that is not appropriate for the location create the potential for damage to city or county property place the city in a position of contingent liability or overextend the citys ability to provide services the city may limit the duration of the event including the hours of the event and the number of days it can be conducted to minimize adverse impact caused by the activity that the city cannot manage b if the special event application is denied the special events coordinator will provide the reasons for denial in writing the applicants may in writing appeal the decision to the city manager within ten 10 days of application denial the requests for appeals will be considered by the city manager or hisher designee the city manager will render a final decision in writing within seven 7 working days upon receipt of the appeal  52212 fireworks display a in addition to the requirements in section 11503 the following shall be required 1 name and address of individuals performing display 2 name address and telephone number of transporting company 3 a copy of the drivers license for each individual transporting the pyrotechnics including the hazardous materials transportation sticker 4 name address and telephone number of fireworks company providing pyrotechnics 5 location of where and how pyrotechnics will be stored 6 a complete list of firing shells and their respective sizes 7 a site plan as required by the national fire protection association #112 as adopted by florida administrative including but not limited to the location of the firing range distance from any structures and electrical lines 8 copy of a plan to provide adequate onsite fire suppression b all fireworks display shows must meet the national fire protection association standards  52212 tents a it shall be unlawful for any person to erect a temporary structure for use by the general public as a tent without having made application for and receiving a permit to do so in accordance with the conditions and limitations as established by city zoning and land use laws ordinances and regulations b sales tents may be erected temporarily on commercially developed property or on a vacant commercially zoned property adjacent to commercially developed property for a period not to exceed more than six 6 weeks per year the sales tent shall not encroach into any parking driveway aisle and shall not impact more than twentyfive 25 percent of the number of existing parking spaces on a developed site when proposed to be located on vacant commercially zoned property adjacent to commercially developed property the applicant shall provide written proof that the owner of the adjacent property has consented to the use of his improved parking and access driveways to accommodate the applicants parking needs c the applicant for a special event permit under this article shall file a special event application in accordance with section 11502 and shall specify at a minimum the following 1 plot plan of proposed site indicating the existing structures all parking and driveway isles 2 flameretardant certificate for tent 3 the building official shall require a separate electrical permit in the event that a the maximum size portable generator designated for use as the primary electrical supply exceeds ten kw the generator must be equipped with groundfault protection devices only ul listed flexible cords with attachment plugs may be used hard wiring shall be completed only by a florida certified or registered electrical contractor b any alteration to the existing wiring will require a separate electrical permit  52212 alcohol and beverage sales alcohol and beverage sales conducted on the property on which the special event is being held shall be in accordance with florida state statutes and shall be considered in conformance with the city of titusville ordinances chapter 4 alcoholic beverages upon the approval of the special event the city manager may provide city approval for a permit for the drinking consumption and possession of open containers of alcoholic beverages on or upon any city street sidewalk or parking area open to the public in the ordinary course of business provided that such permit is applied for in advance process outlined in this chapter and the permit has a connection with social functions such as weddings receptions chamber of commerce functions civic leagues charitable organizations art and craft shows public sporting events and other social functions of a similar nature furthermore it is the responsibility of the alcohol licensee to ensure that no open containers of alcohol sold on the premises shall be permitted beyond the designated special event site  52212 indemnificationinsurance  liquor liability insurance a prior to the issuance of a special event permit the applicants shall execute an indemnification form which provides that the applicants agrees to hold harmless and indemnify the city its officers agents and employees against any loss damage or expense including all costs and reasonable attorneys fees suffered by the city for 1 any breach of the approved agreement reached at the planning meeting including any inaccuracy in or breach of any representation warranty or covenant made by the applicants to the city 2 any claims suits actions damages or cause of actions for any personal injury loss of life or damages to personal or real property sustained by reason of result of or by presence of the applicant on public property by applicants agents employees invitee andor any other persons b insurance coverage shall be on licensed insurance company letterhead or its legal equivalent and shall provide liability insurance protection for the city not less than one million dollars $100000000 per person for bodily injury one million dollars $100000000 per accident and one million dollars $100000000 per occurrence indemnifying the city as additional insured c if alcoholic beverages are to be dispensed served sold or distributed at an outdoor event the applicants shall in addition provide liquor liability insurance in the amount of five hundred thousand dollars $50000000 d the applicant shall pay the premiums for the insurance and provide the completed indemnification form to the city prior to issuance of the special event permit e class c special events are exempt from the insurance requirement but will be required to provide a completed indemnification form to the city f nothing in this section shall be construed to affect in any way the citys rights privileges and immunities as set forth in fs  76828  52212 performance bond  security for damage to public property security for damage to public property shall be provided by the applicants in a form suitable to the city to secure restoration of any public property damaged within one thousand five hundred 1500 feet of all property line boundaries of the special event and within twentyfour 24 hours of the conclusion of the event to warrant that the same shall be free of trash garbage litter and any other debris and that the said property shall be placed in the same conditional state existing prior to the special event the amount of the security shall be set forth per the request fee on file with the city the city inspector shall inspect the public property impacted by the special event on the days immediately prior to and following the conclusion of the event to confirm compliance the security shall also be conditioned to cover any nonpaid expenses incurred by the city for any additional services such as necessary reinspections additional personnel costs due to schedule adjustments and any other impact to existing city services not approved prior to the special event  52212 public law enforcement and private security services a unless otherwise authorized by the chief of police the titusville police department shall be the sole provider for public law enforcement services the number of public law enforcement personnel and the number of the applicants private security personnel required to service the special event shall be determined in the planning meeting with final approval by the city b the formula for determining the number of public law enforcement officers required shall be two 2 police officers for the first two thousand 2000 or less persons peak attendance per day attendance above two thousand 2000 persons shall require two 2 additional officers for each additional increment of two thousand 2000 the number of authorized private security personnel shall be determined in the planning meeting based on city requirements applicants needs traffic control parking and required protection of adjacent sites within one thousand five hundred 1500 feet of the property of which the special event is held this formula shall be considered as a guideline only additional officers may be authorized or required depending upon the character and risk factor of the proposed special event c the city in consultation with the applicants shall establish the appropriate time frames in which public law enforcement and private security is needed for each aspect of the special event the applicants will provide a tentative schedule of activities for each day of the event at the planning meeting the city shall assign a special event field operations detail to handle law enforcement services because the final activities schedule may change the citys police department supervisor in charge of the detail shall have the authority to adjust the work schedule to cover any activities that may require additional or fewer public law enforcement services fees for police services may vary due to scheduling adjustments determined and approved on site by the police supervisor and the applicants during the event any additional fees generated by scheduling adjustments shall be the responsibility of the applicants d in the event the applicants are authorized to utilize sworn law enforcement officers from an agency other than the titusville police department an agency representative must be present in the planning meeting that agency must meet the requirements for security as agreed in the meeting law enforcement officers from other agencies shall be responsible for arresting booking and transporting arrestees as the law may require in each situation e fee schedule for determining officer personnel and equipment costs to be paid by applicants of event shall be as set forth per the request fee on file with the city  52212 fire department services a unless otherwise authorized by the fire chief the titusville fire department shall be the sole provider for fire department services the number of certified fire department personnel and the level of fire protection services required to service any special event shall be determined by the city in the planning meeting with final approval by the city fire department services shall be for the purpose of fire protection standby and shall be required for each structure intended to be used for public assembly when the place of assembly reaches attendance of three hundred 300 or more occupants fire protection shall also be required during the event or certain aspects of the event in any structure in which any type of explosive open flame sparkproducing device or flammable solid liquid or gaseous material is used the fire department shall determine all that is necessary to provide adequate fire protection and safety for each event b two 2 firefighters shall be required for each tent or assembly structure as deemed necessary for occupancies exceeding three hundred 300 persons there shall be a minimum of one 1 additional firefighter posted at each approved entranceexit in any structure utilizing any type of explosive open flame sparkproducing device or flammable solid liquid or gaseous material one 1 firefighter shall be posted at each entranceexit c the city shall also establish the appropriate time frames fire personnel are needed for fire protection services for each aspect of the special event the applicants will provide a tentative schedule of activities for each day of the event at the planning meeting because the final activities schedule may change the fire supervisor in charge shall have the authority to adjust the work schedule to cover those activities that may require additional fire protection services fees may vary due to scheduling adjustments approved by the fire supervisor and the applicants on site during the event any additional fees generated by scheduling adjustments shall be the responsibility of the applicants d in the event the applicants are authorized to utilize certified firefighters from an agency other than the titusville fire department an agency representative must be present in the planning meeting and the agency must meet the requirements for fire protection as agreed in the meeting e the fee schedule for determining fire department personnel costs equipment costs and inspection fees to be paid by applicants of event shall be set forth per the request fee on file with the city  52212 emergency medical services ems  advanced life supportwater rescue a unless otherwise authorized by the fire chief the city of titusville fire department shall be the sole provider for emergency medical services the number of emergency medical services personnel and the level of emergency medical care services necessary shall be determined by the city b two 2 emergency medical technicians emtparamedics shall be required for the first two thousand five hundred 2500 or less persons attendance per day attendance above two thousand five hundred 2500 persons shall require two 2 additional emts for each additional two thousand five hundred 2500 or any part thereof for events over two thousand five hundred 2500 persons there shall also be an advanced life support capability with a minimum of two 2 certified emergency medical personnel one 1 of which shall be a certified paramedic c the city shall establish the appropriate time frames emergency medical services personnel are needed for each aspect of the special event the applicants will provide a tentative schedule of activities for each day of the event at the planning meeting because the final activities schedule may change the police or fire department supervisor shall have the authority to adjust the ems work schedule to cover those activities which may require additional emergency medical care services in agreement with the applicants d if ems services are waived by the fire chief or hisher designee fees due to a private ems contractor or the public fire department for extended services shall be the responsibility of the applicants e in the event the applicants is authorized to utilize certified emergency medical technicians for standby both private or from an agency other than the titusville fire department the applicants shall ensure that the requirements for emergency medical services are met as agreed in the planning meeting f all special events involving river and lagoon system activities that include boats personal watercraft canoes kayaks paddle boards surf and boogie boards andor swimming shall require a twoperson water rescue team with an approved rescue craft g the fee schedule for determining fire department personnel and equipment costs to be paid by the applicants of the event shall be set forth per the request fee on file with the city  52212 public health requirements the provisions of fs pt i ch 386 sanitary nuisances  florida administrative sanitary facilities special requirements places of public assembly  florida administrative temporary food service events  and fs   environmental health  and all rules of the state department of health promulgated pursuant thereto are adopted by reference the formula for determining the number of sanitary facilities required per special event shall be one 1 sanitary facility per one hundred 100 people  52212 parades and block parties a a permit for all parades shall be obtained from the special events coordinator b no vehicle shall be driven parade or other procession except with the permission of a police officer c application in addition to the requirements in section 11503 the following are required 1 a map showing the location of the event indicating the complete route of the proposed event and all auxiliary and adjacent roadways the applicant must also supply an alternate route for travel impacted by the proposed event 2 road closure permits from the state department of transportation if the parade route will utilize a state highway d when applicable the sponsor andor provider will be responsible for 1 coordinating traffic control with the county sheriffs department municipal law enforcement agency andor the state highway patrol and notifying the fire department and emergency management services of the closure and alternate routes 2 city may request written majority support from those parties owning real property within the designated event 3 notifying the general public affected by the temporary road closing at least seventytwo 72 hours in advance of the event 4 implementing and removing the approved maintenance of traffic mot plan including all signage barricades etc necessary to safely protect the traveling public within the area of the event the mot plan shall designate the beginning and end time for the plan 5 erecting signage identifying road closures and detours in advance of actual closure in conformance with the manual of uniform traffic control devices mutcd latest edition 6 collecting and disposing of all debris within the road and rightsofway upon completion of the event 7 no vehicle shall exceed fifteen 15 feet in height due to height restrictions of traffic signals 8 maximum speed of vehicles or units in event shall not exceed ten 10 miles per hour mph 9 if the block party is a noncommercial activity and is not open to the public the block party will not be required to supply the city with a certificate of insurance    52212 editors note of adopted  renumbered  2027 as  11515 temporary auto sales and shows a the temporary sales or shows not to exceed five 5 consecutive days of automobiles boats recreational vehicles and related merchandise may be permitted in any cm and rc zoning districts the applicant shall submit a site plan reflecting the intended temporary sale or show and included in said site plan shall be the particular lot together with dimensions of said site including any and all structures parking ingress and egress setbacks and other information as may be necessary to review said application the applicant shall submit information showing 1 the name or names of the person or persons having the management or supervision of the applicants business during the time that it is proposed that it will be carried on in the city  the local address or addresses of such person or persons while engaged in such business  the permanent address or addresses of such person or persons  the capacity in which such person or persons will act that is whether as proprietor agent or otherwise  the name and address of the person firm or corporation for whose account the business will be carried on if any  and if a corporation under the laws of what state the same is incorporated from the owner of the property must be shown  3 a statement detailing the nature of the proposed sales or show event including dates and hours of operation  4 a brief statement of the nature and character of the advertising done or proposed to be done in order to attract customers abovenoted information shall be submitted to the planning administrator or his designee accompanied with a fee of two hundred dollars $20000 per show or sale event a minimum of thirty 30 days prior to the proposed event an applicant who is a charitable religious educational or notforprofit organization as defined in section 1142 of the ordinances shall be exempt from paying an application fee 5 there shall be a maximum of eight 8 auto sales events per year citywide those desiring to obtain a temporary auto sales event permit may submit an application on the first business day in november for the following calendar year during the 30day sign up period local dealers shall have the right to select the first four 4 sales events thereafter any applicant may apply for a temporary auto sales event permit on a first come first serve basis 6 sales events shall be a minimum of fifteen 15 days apart and there shall be no more than one 1 sales event per calendar month b minimum development criteria to be met shall include but not be limited to the following 1 all ingressegress to said site shall be from an arterial roadway 2 all temporary structures sanitary facilities and electrical wiring to be permitted and inspected 3 if the proposed event is to have temporary trailers and said trailers are to be open for use by the general public they shall be required to be handicap accessible in addition trailers open to the general public are required to provide proper tie downs for appropriate wind load restraint and receive site inspectionsapproval from the building department this requirement shall not be required if the trailers are not open to the general public and used only by sales staff representatives to conduct the temporary sales event 4 all tents shall be required to be fire retardant and appropriate documentation noting fire retardants is required to be provided to the fire department the fire marshal will inspect tents on site for appropriate documentation and setup 5 the applicant shall be responsible for arranging all the required inspections prior to the commencing of each sales event failure to obtain the required inspection shall cause the permit to become void 6 the applicant shall possess a city mobile vendors business tax receipt and pay the fee as prescribed in section 1131 a charitable religious educational or notforprofit organization as defined in section 1142 of the ordinances shall be exempt from the business tax receipt fee 7 the applicant shall be the primary operator of a licensed and certified repair facility equipped with at least three 3 mechanical work bays the city of titusville may require proof of ownership of the repair facility or a bona fide lease of at least one 1 year 8 a bannersign a minimum of thirtytwo 32 square feet in area prominently displaying the name and address of the dealer conducting the sale shall be required to be placed on the site the bannersign shall be in compliance with the sign code land development regulations section 39171 c in determining whether or not the application shall be approved the planning administrator shall consider the following factors 1 the traffic to be generated by the intended temporary use ingress and egress to the property with particular reference to automotive and pedestrian safety and convenience traffic flow and control and access in the case of a fire or catastrophe 2 the effect of the temporary use upon surrounding properties general compatibility with adjacent properties and other properties in the district staff shall also consider nuisance factors detrimental to adjacent and nearby properties nuisance factors shall include but not necessarily be limited to noise odor smoke glare electrical interference andor mechanical vibrations 3 compliance with applicable codes safety and fire regulations 4 offstreet parking and loadingstaging are for the event with particular attention to the items in paragraph 1 above the area of the sales eventshow shall not place the existing use of the site under its minimum onsite parking requirements 5 screening and buffering of adjacent residential uses 6 temporary signs and temporary proposed exterior lighting with reference to glare traffic safety economic effect compatibility and harmony with properties in the district d the planning administrator may impose any additional condition it deems appropriate including but not limited to 1 limiting the size or location of the event on the property 2 controllinglimiting the location and number of vehicle access points for the event 3 limiting the number size and location of lighting and signs  102699   3500     52212 editors note had been saved from repeal refer to adopting secs 1151711600  reserved article xiii  rave club ordinance title this article shall be known and may be cited as the city of titusville rave club   authority this article is enacted under the homerule owner of titusville florida in the interest of the health safety and general welfare of the people of titusville  intent a it is the intent of the city to address the unique problems associated with rave clubs by implementing rave club regulations and to protect juveniles and adults from criminal activity that occurs at such rave clubs b titusville hereby asserts that the following purposes of the rave club regulations set forth herein are matters of legitimate substantial and compelling governmental interests 1 to protect juveniles and adults from illegal drug activity including use sale and drug abuse such as overdoses and to reduce if not eliminate such activity from occurring in rave clubs  2 to protect juveniles and adults from criminal activity occurring in rave clubs 3 to protect juveniles and adults from predatorytype sexual crimes and acts occurring in rave clubs  4 to reduce the amount of criminal activity occurring in rave clubs predominantly in the latenight and earlymorning hours by prohibiting rave clubs from operating during the latenight and earlymorning hours  and 5 to prevent eliminate or at least reduce the deleterious effects of noise traffic and debris on residential and commercial property near rave clubs that occurs in the latenight and earlymorning hours  findings of fact the city finds and determines as factual matters the following 1 latenight and allnight rave clubs and similar forums of assembly commonly or sometimes referred to as raves are frequently sites for the sale possession and use of illicit drugs  2 rave clubs expose juveniles and adults to illegal drug activity and such exposure to drug activity is found to result often in drug addiction drug overdoses and death of juveniles and adults  3 rave clubs are often sites for criminal activity  4 rave clubs expose drug activity to the uninitiated youth of the city and such exposure to drug activity occurring at such raves is often found to result in drug addiction overdose and death of both juveniles and adults  5 rave clubs provide an arena for predatorytype sexual crimes thus for the protection of the citys youth juveniles should not congregate in such social settings with adults  additionally regulation of rave clubs is also necessary for the protection of adult victims of such crimes  6 criminal activity occurring at rave clubs takes place predominantly in the latenight and earlymorning hours  7 the actions of rave club patrons entering and exiting rave clubs can have an adverse impact on nearby residential and commercial properties in terms of excessive noise traffic and debris and such impacts are exacerbated by the fact that rave club patrons enter and exit such rave clubs at latenight and earlymorning hours when citizens have a reasonable expectation of peace and quiet  and 8 the abovereferenced problems associated with rave clubs while not unique and specific to rave clubs tend to occur more frequently and tend to be more prevalent than in other places of assembly that are not regulated by this article  definitions for purposes of this article the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section adult rave club means any rave club whose patrons or admittees are eighteen 18 years of age or older business tax receipt holder means a person in whose name a rave club business tax receipt has been issued as well as the individual listed as the applicant on the application for a rave club business tax receipt convictions or convicted means the finding of guilt or the entry of a plea of guilt or nolo contendere for a violation of a municipal or city ordinance or state or federal law regardless of whether adjudication is withheld or the forfeiture of a bond or bail when charged with a violation of a municipal or city ordinance or state or federal law city manager means the city of titusville manager or designee juvenile rave club means any rave club whose patrons or admittees are seventeen 17 years of age or younger knowingly means with actual knowledge of a specific fact or facts or with reasonable inquiry a reasonable person should have known a specific fact or facts person means an individual partnership corporation association or other legal entity police means the city of titusville police department rave club means any place area or property which is operated either as an ongoing enterprise or undertaking or as a onetime event or a limited number of events which is open to the public and which 1 has music either live or electronically produced or transmitted  2 has space available for dancing or dancing is permitted regardless of whether such dancing takes place  3 allows free admission or admission by payment of a direct or indirect charge fee donation or other form of consideration or by the purchase possession or presentation of a ticket token or membership card  and 4 is not licensed or permitted to sell serve or dispense alcoholic beverages for onpremises consumption or permit alcoholic beverages to be consumed on premises the term rave club does not include 1 an establishment with a license reviewed and approved by the state and city of titusville to sell serve or dispense alcoholic beverages for onpremises consumption  2 an adult entertainment establishment as defined in section 1182 ordinances of the city of titusville lawfully established existing permitted and licensed during such hours of the day as such establishment is being lawfully and principally operated as an adult entertainment establishment  3 a bona fide dance studio where students are taught the art of dancing or ballet  4 a place owned leased or operated by the federal state or local government  5 a place owned leased or operated by public or private elementary school secondary school college or university  6 a place owned leased or operated by a notforprofit organization and sponsored by a bona fide law enforcement organization or federal state local government or school board  7 a place owned leased or operated by a bona fide religious organization created organized existing and recognized as such pursuant to all applicable laws including federal tax laws  or 8 a private residence or residential facility from which the general public is excluded rave club business tax receipt means a business tax receipt to operate a rave club issued pursuant to this article    6909 reserved business tax receipt required  application for business tax receipt  application fee a no person may operate a rave club without a business tax receipt b an application for a business tax receipt shall be made on a form provided by the administrator and shall have notarized signature thereon the applicant must be qualified to be issued a business tax receipt according to the provision of this article c a person who wishes to operate a rave club shall sign the application for a business tax receipt as the applicant if a person who wishes to operate a rave club is not an individual each individual who has an ownership interest in the business which will operate the rave club equal to or greater than twenty 20 percent must sign the application for a business tax receipt as an applicant each applicant must meet the requirements of section 11608 and each applicant shall be considered a business tax receipt holder if a business tax receipt is granted d each applicant shall be accompanied by a nonrefundable fee of two hundred fifty dollars $25000 such application fee shall be used to defray the costs and expenses or reviewing the rave club business tax receipt application and for each business tax receipt under the terms of this article e the applicant shall indicate whether the application is for a juvenile rave club or adult rave club    6909 requirements for issuance of business tax receipt  posting a within fortyfive 45 days after receipt of an application for a rave club business tax receipt the administrator shall either approve or deny issuance of the business tax receipt the administrator shall deny a business tax receipt when he finds one 1 or more of the following to be true 1 an applicant is under eighteen 18 years of age 2 an applicant has failed or refused to answer or has falsely answered a question on the application provided or has failed or refused to provide any information requested on the application provided 3 an applicant has been convicted of a violation of any provision of these rave club regulations within two 2 years immediately preceding the filing of the application 4 an applicant has failed to obtain a certification from the fire marshal that the rave club complies with all applicable provisions of chapter 9 fire prevention and protection ordinances city of titusville  relative to places of assembly including but not limited to maximum permitted occupancy load 5 an applicant has failed to obtain a certification from the building official that the rave club complies with all applicable provisions of chapter 6 building and building regulations ordinances city of titusville  including but not limited to those relative to places of assembly 6 an applicant has failed to obtain a certification from the zoning department that the rave club complies with all applicable provisions of the land development code  including but not limited to provisions related to zoning and parking 7 an applicant has been convicted of a crime a involving i any felony or ii any misdemeanor offense of ch 784 florida statutes assault  battery  culpable negligence  ch 787 kidnapping  false imprisonment  luring or enticing a child  custody offenses  ch 790 weapons and firearms  ch 794 sexual battery  ch 800 lewdness  indecent exposure  ch 812 theft robbery and related crimes  ch 827 abuse of children  ch 837 perjury  ch 856 drunkenness  open house parties  loitering  prowling  desertion  ch 562 selling serving or giving alcoholic beverages to a minor  ch 859 poisons  adulterated drugs  ch 870 affrays  riots  routs  unlawful assemblies  ch 874 street terrorism enforcement and prevention  ch 877 miscellaneous crimes  and ch 893 drug abuse prevention and control as said chapters currently exist or may be amended from time to time or iii any violation of the rave club or dance hall regulations of any other city county state or other government  and b for which i less than five 5 years have elapsed since the date of conviction or the date of release from confinement imposed for the conviction whichever is the later date  if the conviction is for an abovelisted misdemeanor offense  ii less than ten 10 years have elapsed since the date of conviction or the date of release from confinement for the conviction whichever is the later date if the conviction is for a felony offense  or iii less than ten 10 years have elapsed since the date of the least conviction or the date of release from confinement for last conviction whichever is the later date if the convictions are of two 2 or more abovelisted misdemeanor offenses or combination of abovelisted misdemeanor offenses occurring within any twentyfourmonth period 8 an applicant has been convicted of a felony involving any sexual crime against a minor b the fact that an applicant is appealing a conviction shall have no effect on the disqualifications of the applicant under subsection a above c an applicant who has been convicted of an offense listed in subsection a7 above may qualify for a rave club business tax receipt only when the time period required by subsection a7b has elapsed d upon receipt of an application the administrator shall distribute copies to the police department fire marshal and the specified city departments the police chief fire marshal and the specified city departments shall review the application for compliance with the provisions of this section and forward their respective comments to the administrator for consideration in determining whether to issue or deny the business tax receipt in accordance with the provisions of this article e the administrator upon approving issuance of a rave club business tax receipt shall send the applicant by certified mail return receipt requested written notice of such action the business tax receipt fee shall be nonrefundable in the amount of two hundred sixtytwo dollars and fifty cents $26250 the administrator shall inform the applicant where he or she must pay the business tax receipt fee and obtain the business tax receipt f the administrators approval of the issuance of a business tax receipt does not authorize the applicant to operate a rave club until the applicant has paid the business tax receipt fee and obtained possession of the business tax receipt g the business tax receipt shall state on its face the name of the person to whom it is granted the expiration date and the street address of the rave club h the business tax receipt shall be posted at the rave club in a conscious place at or near the entrance so that it may be easily read by any individual at any time    6909 rave club manager a a business tax receipt shall designate an individual or individuals as the rave club manager or managers and shall register his her or their names with the administrator furthermore whenever the business tax receipt holder wishes to add the name of a different rave club manager he shall register the new managers name with the administrator b an individual may not be designated as a rave club manager if the individual would otherwise be disqualified under subsections 11608a7a and b and a8 from obtaining a rave club business tax receipt c no rave club may be operated unless a rave club manager is on the premises of the rave club during all hours of operation and until at least thirty 30 minutes after closing to ensure that the rave club is operated in accordance with the requirements and restrictions of this article    6909 person under eighteen prohibited in adult rave club a no person under the age of eighteen 18 years may enter an adult rave club unless accompanied by a parent or guardian b no person shall falsely represent himself or herself to be either a parent or guardian of another person under the age of eighteen 18 years for the purpose of gaining the other persons admission into an adult rave club c no permittee or employee of an adult rave club shall knowingly allow a person under the age of eighteen 18 years to enter or remain on the premises of an adult rave club d no permittee of an adult rave club shall maintain or operate the premises without posting a conspicuous sign at each entrance to the business that reads it is unlawful for any person under eighteen 18 years of age to enter this premises without a parent or guardian  person age eighteen and over prohibited in juvenile rave clubs a no person age eighteen 18 and over may enter a juvenile rave club b no person shall falsely represent himself or herself to be under age eighteen 18 for the purpose of gaining admission to a juvenile rave club c no permittee or employee of a juvenile rave club shall knowingly allow a person age eighteen 18 or over to enter or remain on the premises of the juvenile rave club d no permittee of a juvenile rave club shall maintain or operate the premises without posting a conspicuous sign at each entrance to the business that reads it is unlawful for any person age eighteen 18 or over to enter this premises e it is a defense to prosecution under this section a and c that the person is 1 a permittee or employee of the rave club  2 a parent or guardian of a person inside the rave club  or 3 a governmental employee in the performance of official duties  hours of operation  reentry by customer a no person my operate a juvenile rave club during any hours other than  pm to  pm on any sunday monday tuesday wednesday thursday and from  pm on friday to  am on the following day and from  pm saturday to  am of the following day b no person may operate an adult rave club during any hours other than  pm to  am of the following day c all customers patrons members guests invitees and others not employed by the rave club shall vacate the premises including the parking areas no later than thirty 30 minutes after the designated closing time d when the rave club allows admission by payment of a charge or fee any customer or patron who leaves the rave club shall be required to pay the charge or fee again whenever he or she reenters the rave club  security paramedic a whenever a rave club is open to the general public the rave club business tax receipt holder shall have on the premises at the business tax receipt holders expense the greater of either i three 3 offduty sworn law enforcement officers or three 3 private security officers having either a class d or class ms license as set forth in ch 493 florida statutes or ii one 1 offduty sworn law enforcement officer or one 1 private security officer having a license described above per one hundred fifty 150 of the persons allowed under the maximum occupancy load for the structure in which the rave club is operated the police chief may require a license to increase the number of offduty law enforcement officers or licensed private security officers when a special event or limited engagements are scheduled to take place at a premises holding a business tax receipt nothing in this subsection shall be construed to mean that the police chief must require law enforcement officers to serve in an offduty capacity at a premises holding a business tax receipt b whenever a rave club is open to the public at a minimum at least one 1 state licensed paramedic with radio communication directly to the 911 public safety answering point shall be present at the expense of the business tax receipt holder depending on the event in the discretion of the fire chief a statelicensed advanced life support ambulance with crew and transport capabilities may be required to be present at the expense of the business tax receipt holder    6909 inspections a application for and issuance of any rave club business tax receipt shall constitute consent by the business tax receipt holder for authorized employees of the city and authorized law enforcement officers building inspectors and code enforcement officers to enter and inspect the premises of the rave club at any time it is open or occupied for the purpose of verifying compliance with these rave club regulations b no business tax receipt holder rave club manager or employee of the rave club shall refuse to permit a lawful inspection of a rave club by an authorized employee of the city or any authorized law enforcement officer at any time it is open or occupied    6909 expiration of business tax receipt  renewal a a business tax receipt for a rave club shall expire one 1 year from the date of issuance b a business tax receipt may be renewed only by making application as provided in section 11608 an application for renewal should be made at least fortyfive 45 days before the date of expiration when made less than fortyfive 45 days before the date of expiration the expiration date shall not be extended by virtue of the fact that a renewal application is then
