to service charges the exemption of property from taxation under state law will not relieve the owner of any such real property located within a designated stormwater management system benefit area from the provisions of this article or from the imposition by the city council of the annual stormwater utility assessment applicable to such real property as specified in the rate resolution adopted under the provisions of section 21273 except as provided in this section no public or private property shall be exempt from stormwater management utility service charges or receive a credit or offset against such service charges no exemption or reduction in the stormwater service charge shall be granted based on the age tax or economic status race or religion of the property owner or other condition unrelated to the cost of providing stormwater services and facilities the following exemptions and credits shall be allowed 1 undeveloped lands shall be exempt from stormwater service charges 2 developed publicly owned roadways and airport runways which are available for use in common by the general public for transportation shall be exempted from stormwater service charges these properties may include public road rightsofway and airport runways owned by the city county state or federal government this exemption shall not include public lands used for offices airports excluding runways maintenance yards water and wastewater treatment plants water reservoirs and storage facilities parking lots park and recreation facilities libraries schools colleges universities social service centers public housing public hospitals or convalescent centers and similar public properties nor shall the exemption apply to internal site roadways within such public facilities all of which shall be charged in a manner consistent with that applied to comparable nonpublicly owned properties this exemption shall not apply to private roads or drives or to internal roads drives and parking areas in privately owned properties regardless of the degree of access to those sites roads and drives allowed to the general public 3 retention areas 4 waterbodies such as lakes ponds and rivers without impervious bottoms 5 notwithstanding the above existing school facilities owned and operated by the brevard county school board shall be exempt from stormwater management utility service charges this exemption shall not apply to charter schools 21a13 111390   31108   82217 secs 2127721279  reserved article vi  reclaimed water division 1  generally definitions for the purpose of this article the following terms shall have the meaning set forth in this section when consistent with the context words used in the present tense shall include the future words of the future tense shall include the present words in the plural shall include the singular words in the singular shall include the plural words of the male gender shall include the female gender and the word shall is always mandatory and not merely directive administrator shall mean the city manager of the city of titusville or his designee billing shall mean the charge made for reclaimed water service the charge may be made on a separate invoice or may be include on the monthly utility bill city shall mean the city of titusville florida and its utility service district customer shall mean the actual user of the reclaimed water cross connection shall mean any physical connection or arrangement which could allow the transfer of waters between the citys portable water supply and distribution system or any other nonpotable water source development shall mean any proposed change in land use which alters the demands for water andor wastewater services director shall mean the city manager or his designee of the city of titusville discontinuation of service shall mean cessation of a service by physical separation from the systems service lines to ensure that no service can be received distribution main shall mean a conduit used to supply reclaimed water from transmission mains to service lines effluent shall mean treated wastewater flowing out of any treatment facility fdep shall mean the florida department of environmental protection or its successor in function public eating drinking or bathing facility shall mean water fountains picnic tables swimming pools spas and food service facilities such as tables and beverage counters that are open to and provide service for the public reclaimed water shall mean effluent from city owned and operated wastewater treatment plant which effluent has been treated to advanced secondary treatment standards in compliance with the requirements of the florida department of environmental protection includes the term treated effluent reclaimed water reuse system shall mean those reclaimed water mains lines fittings valves and appurtenances installed in public rightofway or utility easements which are owned by the city of titusville reuse service area reuse service area shall be defined as the area permitted in the citys current fdep domestic wastewater facility permits as the reuse service area reuse service district shall be geographically defined as the area of critical concern see section 63105 as designated by resolution of the city council where the installation of a reclaimed water system shall be required as provided in this article transmission mains shall mean those mains together with the storage and pumping facilities transmit the reclaimed water to the distribution systems and other points of use of the reclaimed water this transmission delivery system has been provided by the city  101194   31197   101403 purpose the purpose of this article is to establish a reclaimed water use program the establishment of a reclaimed water system is a vital ingredient in a program for conserving potable water as the general welfare health safety and convenience of the titusville community are directly affected by the use of reclaimed water it is in the interest of the public that the reclaimed water system be designed and developed in accordance with sound rules and proper minimum standards  101194 promulgation and enforcement of reclaimed water service procedures regulations a this article hereby establishes that the citys existing water resources division is expanded to include reclaimed water with services and responsibilities for reclaimed water facilities owned and operated by the city of titusville b the administrator or his designee shall have the power to promulgate procedures and regulations with respect to the following matters 1 application procedures forms and requirements and allowable uses other than irrigation all uses must be in accordance with applicable fdep regulations 2 installation requirements including specification of acceptable materials devices and regulations to prevent backflow or crossconnections with other systems 3 procedures for enforcement of the ordinances and regulations pertaining to reclaimed water including procedures for inspection of the customers system 4 procedures for the orderly expansion of the reclaimed water system 5 procedures and regulations for the efficient operation of the reclaimed water system 6 procedures to ensure that all wells located on the property receiving reclaimed water will be completely disconnected from irrigation systems on the property wells may be maintained and used for other purposes providing there is no potential physical connection to the water reclamation system 7 the rendering of bills for service and the collection of charges for all services rendered 8 collection of all fees and charges and recording in the public records and liens agreed to by customers of the system c notwithstanding the foregoing the water resources director may when necessary for the efficient operation of the reclaimed water system or for the health or safety of the general public or the customer establish regulations regarding the following matters which regulations shall become effective at the time of promulgation without the need for city council approval 1 the maximum number and type of users of the reclaimed water 2 crossconnection noncomplying devices prohibited for reclaimed water customers of the city the use of water from a reclaimed water system for other than landscape irrigation is prohibited between 10 am and 4 pm daily and is allowed only in accordance with the contractual agreements in place between the customer and the city or as determined by the water resources director in accordance with system limitations d no person shall construct operate maintain or allow to remain present on property owned or controlled by him any device or system which is connected to or which controls a device or system connected to the citys reclaimed water system and which is not in compliance with all provisions of fdep regulations and this to reclaimed water and with all procedures and regulations promulgated pursuant to this section reclaimed water shall not be directed conveyed or piped into any residence or building used as a dwelling unit the person who owns or controls the property upon which such a noncomplying device or system is found shall be liable to the city for the amount by which the costs associated with the securing andor removal of the noncomplying device or system exceeds the cost of a normal discontinuance of service these excess costs shall constitute a lien against the property upon which the noncomplying device or system is located e any customer whose reclaimed water system is in violation of any city ordinance regulation or procedure shall be subject to immediate discontinuance of reclaimed water service such discontinuance of service shall not relieve any person of liability for civil actions or for criminal or municipal ordinance violation prosecution f system responsibility the administrator will be responsible for the training of city personnel in crossconnection control and inspection to see that the adopted rules are followed g home ownerchange of ownership where reclaimed water is in use or available on the premises notification of any change of ownership or control of the property shall be given to the city administrator and to the wastewater treatment facility or designees as to the change failure to do so will result in discontinuance of service h inground irrigation and prohibited attachments all irrigation systems shall be permanently installed and consist of low trajectory water droplet spray heads of inground irrigation design hose bibbs or hose connections are not allowed except as provided herein hose bibbs shall be located in locked vaults service boxes or compartments which shall be clearly labeled as being of nonpotable quality hose bibbs which can be only operated by special tools may be placed in nonlockable vaults service boxes or compartments clearly labeled as nonpotable water vaults service boxes and compartments meeting the requirements of this rule may be located above or below grade i owners reuse control a hand control valve must be installed and accessible on the users side of the city curbstop service line  101194   102897   51209 areas embraced all territory within the city of titusville and the city reuse service district served by the city of titusville reclaimed water system shall be governed by this division to the extent permitted by law  101194 public easement requirements reclaimed water service mains and lines shall be provided for properties located within the designated reuse service district at the same time that water or sewer service lines and mains are installed all development constructed within the reuse service district shall have a reclaimed water distribution system designed and installed for irrigation the administrator may exempt parcels requiring no irrigation reclaimed water service shall comply with all provisions of such service as set forth in this article 1 no facilities will be installed under the provisions outlined herein and accepted by the city for maintenance unless it is in dedicated public rightofway or dedicated public easement any new easement shall be adequately sized as approved by the city to accommodate construction and maintenance of any reclaimed system component no obstruction of whatever kind shall be planned built or otherwise created within the limits of the easement or rightofway without written permission of the city 2 reclaimed water system extensions and improvements shall be accepted by the city only upon receipt of the proper dedication documentation and the acceptance of ownership by the administrator or his designee  101194   101403 ownership all reclaimed water facilities and appurtenances within dedicated public easements when constructed or accepted by the city shall become and remain the property of the city no person shall by payment of any charges provided herein or by causing any construction of facilities accepted by the city acquire any interest or right in any of these facilities or any portion thereof other than the privilege of having their property connected thereto for the reclaimed water service in accordance with this article and any amendments thereof  101194 secs 2128621289  reserved division 2  reclaimed water service connection required a where available the owner of every lot or parcel of land within the city reuse service district developed for public commercial office industrial warehousing andor multifamily uses shall connect or cause to be connected with the reclaimed water distribution system b new single family subdivision developments within the reuse service district constructed after  shall include reclaimed water distribution mains and shall connect to the system when reclaimed water service becomes available c connection to the system is voluntary for all existing single family homes and new homes not within the new single family subdivision developments as referenced in section 21290b d all connections shall be made in accordance with policies and regulations adopted by the council this provision shall not be construed to entitle any person to cross the property of another to make such connection e for purposes of this chapter the term available or availability shall mean a reuse line exists in a public easement or right of way which abuts the property or where a reuse line is within one hundred 100 feet of the property as accessed via public easements or rights of way f at such time as reclaimed water service becomes available required connection shall be made within ninety 90 days of notification by the city g existing subdivisions may petition the city for installation of reclaimed water within a subdivision upon the receipt of a petition signed by at least fiftyone 51 percent of the subdivision property owners the city may initiate a program to install reclaimed water service within a subdivision upon completion of the installation the city will determine the capital cost and will prorate the cost over the lots that could be served in the subdivision and require repayment to the city of the capital cost over a thirtysixmonth period until repaid to the city h the city council may determine at its discretion that the extension of a reuse transmission main shall be for the common good of protecting and benefiting the citys water supply source and that the extension of the transmission main will increase reclaimed water application to the reuse service district by providing various areas or lands abutting the main with reclaimed water service the costs of the extension of the reuse transmission main may be shared by the city and those properties receiving benefits of the main by the establishment of a connection fee as determined and established by city council upon finding that an area would be benefited by installing a reuse transmission main a connection fee may be established based upon the following procedures 1 city council may initiate a connection fee for a subdistrict and shall adopt a resolution declaring the necessity for the proposed improvement describing the nature and extent of the work the general description of the materials to be used the estimated costs of the improvements the estimated connection fee and the location of the area in which such improvements are to be installed the resolution shall establish a date when the city council shall meet which shall not be less than twelve 12 days after the adoption of the resolution for the purposes of hearing any objections or comments concerning the proposed improvements a notice of the time of hearing the objections shall be published once per week for two 2 consecutive weeks the first publication not less than ten 10 days prior to the date fixed for the hearing a copy of the notice shall be mailed to the property owners of record reflected on the brevard county property appraisers assessment rolls for lands within the subdistrict which will be benefited by the improvement 2 the city council will meet and hear objections and comments concerning the proposed improvement after consideration of the objections or comments the city council in its discretion shall determine whether or not to proceed with the improvements and the estimated costs of the improvements together with the proposed connection fee at the hearing the city council shall adopt a resolution disclosing the description of the subdistrict the proposed total costs and expenses of improvements and the portion to be paid as a connection fee for connection to the reclaimed water system 3 after the improvements have been installed and cost of the improvements finally determined the city council may by resolution impose a connection fee within the subdistrict for all connections to the reuse transmission main after the completion of said list of property owners benefited by the improvement is delivered to the city clerk of the city of titusville he shall thereupon give notice by publication in two 2 issues at least seven 7 days apart in some newspaper published in said municipality that the list has been delivered to him and is open for inspection at his office and that at a time and place therein mentioned not less than ten 10 days from the first publication the city council will meet and hear any objection or defenses to the proposed connection fee and if approved by the city council a copy of the proposed connection fee established within the subdistrict shall be incorporated in a resolution adopted by the city council 4 as provided for in section 21290a b all new singlefamily subdivision developments shall at the time reclaimed water service is connected and approved for use pay the connection fee established within the subdistrict in addition all public commercial offices industrial warehouses andor multifamily uses shall connect to the reuse line when available and pay the required connection fee the city shall provide each owner of public commercial etc properties at least one hundred twenty 120 days notice to connect and pay the fee any existing single family homes within the subdistrict who voluntarily connects to the reuse transmission main shall pay the required connection fee at the time of connection to the system or repay the amount as allowed in paragraph g above  101194   101403 reclaimed water user classification there is hereby established a uniform classification of water users as follows 1 class a detached singlefamily residential units meters not required 2 class am multifamily residential facilities master meter required 3 class b office commercial industrial and warehousing facilities meter required 4 class c public bodies parks rightsofway 5 class cm community irrigation systems reclaimed connections serving more than one 1 property meter required  101194   12301 reclaimed water rates and charges there is hereby established a uniform schedule of rates and charges by classes for the use or availability of the citys reclaimed water system and a maintenance and replacement fee for inside and outside the city including bulk water sales to other private utilities as follows 1 class a am b c and cm users a no standby charge or user charge will be paid by class a am b c or cm users who are on the sanitary sewer system class a am b and cm shall pay a maintenance and replacement fee of eight dollars $800 per month per erc to be billed monthly on the utility bill the erc shall be determined based upon the servicemeter size as follows 1inch meterservice equals 1 erc 1inch meterservice equals 5 erc 2inch meterservice equals 8 erc 3inch meterservice equals 15 erc 4inch meterservice equals 25 erc 6inch meterservice equals 50 erc 8inch meterservice equals 80 erc the maintenance and replacement fee shall take effect with the first billing cycle in october 2010 class a am b and cm who are not connected to the city of titusvilles sanitary sewer system shall pay nine dollars $900 per month per erc for standby or user charge in addition to the maintenance fee for a total of seventeen dollars $1700 per month any class user that discharged reclaimed water back into the sanitary sewer shall be billed at the rate for sanitary sewer contained within this chapter and shall pay maintenance fee and reuse charges eight dollars $800 and nine dollars $900 respectively class c users shall not be required to pay the maintenance and replacement fee all funds generated by the maintenance and replacement fee shall be utilized only for the maintenance and replacement or expansion of the reclaimed water system b class a am b c or cm users shall pay all costs associated with the reclaimed water service connection including but not limited to tapping into the distribution main the connection pipe the citys shutoff valve the meter and the backflow prevention device c the city may enter into such agreements as it deems appropriate for public utilization of reclaimed water 2 each quarterly billing for reclaimed water installation charges shall include a customer service charge of twentyfive cents $025 per bill 3 a customer whose service has been discontinued may resume reclaimed water service by payment of installation charges and a reconnection fee of twentyfive dollars $2500 provided however that where service has been discontinued for violation of the policies and relating to the use of reclaimed water system service will not be reconnected until the city receives in its opinion reasonable and sufficient guarantee that the violation will not occur  101194   92998   12301   92503   92804   92710 payment required a bills for the installation charge shall be submitted by the city and shall be paid by the users quarterly a customers quarterly account shall be considered delinquent if any portion remains unpaid thirty 30 days after the date of the bill for such service b all other charges including connection and reconnection charges if not paid in full within thirty 30 days of the billing date shall be considered delinquent any customers accounted which is disconnected shall pay a twenty dollar $2000 reconnect fee prior to reconnection c the utility service to a customer shall be discontinued unless otherwise provided by law when the reclaimed water charges becomes delinquent and shall not be reconnected until all past due charges penalty charges and reconnection charges shall have been fully paid d in the event the customers account is more than ninety 90 days past due the city may record a lien against the benefitted property and all costs the city incurs for collection including legal fees and other costs shall be paid by the customer andor property owner and shall be superior to all other liens except for taxes  101194 right to refuse service a no connection shall be made to the reclaimed water system unless specifically approved by the administrator or his designee b no payment of any costs submittal of any petition or any other act to receive reclaimed water reuse service shall guarantee such service the city shall have the right at all times to refuse to extend services on the basis that a use is detrimental to the system  or there is an inadequate supply of reclaimed water  or lack of payment of required service charges  or for any other reason which in the judgment of the administrator will cause the extension not to be in the best interests of the city  101194 service interruption the city reserves the right to temporarily discontinue service to any portion of or the entire reclaimed water system as deemed necessary by the administrator the administrator shall have the authority to establish schedules to control the use of the water reuse system in order to reduce maximum pressure demands on the system and to regulate usage of reused water to balance with supply and storage availability  101194 secs 2129621299  reserved division 3  installation and use of the reclaimed water system policies and regulations adopted  compliance required the city adopts by reference the policies and regulations governing the installation and use of the reclaimed water system dated ________ compliance with the policies and regulations is hereby required  101194 use of reclaimed water a reclaimed water may be used for the irrigation of crops not intended for human consumption  residential lawns golf courses cemeteries  parks  landscaped areas  highway medians and rightsofway  or for any other purpose specifically approved by the administrator b reclaimed water may be used for fire protection  toilet flushing in nonresidential buildings  and for irrigation of edible commercially marketed crops requiring vegetables that are peeled cooked thermally processed before human consumption only with the written permission of the administrator c reclaimed water may not be used inside of any residential dwelling or to fill swimming pools hot tubs spas or wading pools d the use of reclaimed water shall be restricted so that no wetted surfaces are located within one hundred 100 feet of any public eating drinking or bathing facility e reclaimed water shall not be applied to impervious surfaces that allow drainage to surface waters reclaimed water shall not be applied to properties containing subsurface drainage tiles or plates f all uses of reclaimed water shall require a reuse permit issued by the administrator following procedures established by the administrator g all areas using reclaimed water shall be clearly marked as required by applicable dep st johns or other regulatory agencies  101194 maintenance by the customer the property owners and customer shall be responsible for the maintenance of all facilities including irrigation lines and appurtenances on property serviced by the city the city reserves the right to disconnect the service to any property that does not maintain its system in addition should the customer require reclaimed water service at different pressures or in any way different from that normally supplied by the city that customer shall be responsible for the necessary devices to make these adjustments and for obtaining approval from the administrator to make these adjustments  101194 inspections a duly authorized employees of the city bearing proper credentials and identification shall be permitted to enter any building structure or property serviced by a connection to the reclaimed water system of the city for the purpose of inspecting the piping system or systems backflow preventer valves andor all devices installed by the customer which connect to or control the reclaimed water distribution system or use of reclaimed water on such property b consent to such access shall be obtained from a person of a suitable age and discretion therein or in control thereof the refusal of such information of refusal of access when requested shall be deemed evidence of the presence of violation of the policies and regulations adopted herein c inspections shall be at reasonable times and reasonable frequency where there exists cause to believe that a violation is committed the city may cause the property to be inspected as necessary to prevent or terminate the occurrence of such violations  101194 discontinuance of service the administrator or his designee is hereby authorized and directed to discontinue reclaimed water service to any property after notice where any violation of this chapter exists and to take such other precautionary measures deemed necessary to eliminate any danger of contamination of the public potable water supply system reclaimed water service to such property shall not be restored until the violation has been eliminated in compliance with the provisions of this chapter  101194 unlawful works or connections to the reclaimed water system a no person shall be allowed to work on the reclaimed water distribution system without written consent of the city and then only under the direction and supervision of the city no person shall tamper with alter damage cut into or make connection with the reclaimed water system or damage a city reclaimed water facility b no person shall open or close valves to the system turn on hydrants or cause water to flow from the reclaimed water system without prior written notice consent of the city c any person found violating this chapter shall upon conviction be subject to the penalties provided in sections 21307 and 21308 of this chapter  101194 exemptions and variances exemptions and variances shall be approved or denied by the city council of the city titusville after public hearing based upon the recommendation of the director and upon consideration of the following conditions 1 alternate reuse sites properties being developed under the provisions of planned unit developments or developments of regional impact may be exempted from the requirements of reuse connection if a binding contract is executed for the provision of alternate reuse sites and lines that otherwise would not require the installation of reuse lines for each acre of wetted surface to be exempted from the reuse requirement one and onehalf 15 acres of alternate reuse wetted surface will be provided including all lines and sprayheads necessary to irrigate the area any site considered as an alternate site shall be ready to receive reclaimed water no later than one 1 year after the issuance of the first certificate of occupancy in the exempted area for the purpose of this exemption golf courses are normally required to utilize reuse and therefore are not considered as an alternate site 2 low income housing subdivisions those housing projects receiving federal housing subsidies and other similar financial assistance may be exempted upon recommendation of the director after submittal of information documenting that the future residents of the project will be unable to purchase and maintain the necessary inground irrigation equipment  101194 division 4  enforceability violation liability a any person or customer found guilty of violating any of the provisions of this chapter or any written order of the city pursuant thereto shall be punishable in accordance with section 115 of the city addition such person or customer shall pay all costs and expenses involved in this case including attorneys fees notice of such violation shall be given by delivering the same to the premises and a copy thereof mailed to the billing address as it appears on the citys billing records each day upon which a violation of this chapter occurs shall constitute a separate and additional violation b any person or customer in violation of any of the provisions of this chapter shall become liable to the city for any expenses loss or damage incurred by the city by reason of such violation including attorneys fees and costs of correcting unauthorized work tampering or damage to the system c in addition to any penalty provided by law for the violation of any provisions of this chapter the city may bring suit in the appropriate court to enjoin restrain or otherwise prevent the violation  101194 board authority as an additional means of ensuring compliance with the provisions of this chapter the titusville board shall have jurisdiction and authority to hear and decide alleged violations occurring in the corporate limits of the city of titusville proceedings before the code enforcement board shall be governed by its rules and procedures  101194 liability  public employees no provisions of this chapter designating the duties of any city officer or employee shall be construed as to make such officer or employee liable for any fine or penalty for failure to perform such duty  101194 vehicles for hire article i  in general secs 2212226  reserved article ii  taxicabs footnotes  1  cross reference licenses and business regulations ch 11  traffic and motor vehicles ch 20 division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning business tax receipt shall mean a business tax receipt issued by the city in accordance with section 1131 of the ordinances permit shall mean the permission granted by the city manager or his designee to a person to drive a taxicab upon the streets within the city rate card shall mean a card printed by the owner or operator of the taxicab and signed by the city manager or designee for display in each taxicab which contains the rates of fare then in force taxicab shall mean a motor vehicle regularly engaged in the business of carrying passengers for hire having a seating capacity of less than nine 9 persons and not operated on a fixed route    6909 definitions and rules of construction generally  12 enforcement the police department of the city is hereby given the authority and is hereby instructed to watch and observe the conduct of holders and drivers operating under this chapter upon discovering a violation of the provisions of this chapter the police department shall report the same to the city manager who will order or take appropriate action  business tax receipt required it shall be unlawful for any person to engage in or carry on the business of operating motor vehicles for transportation of passengers for hire either with or without drivers within the city other than buses operating on regularly scheduled routes under franchise from the city without first obtaining a business tax receipt from the city    6909 liability insurancerequired it shall be unlawful for any owner operator driver or chauffeur of any taxicab to drive or operate the same or to permit the same to be driven or operated upon the streets of the city unless such owner operator driver or chauffeur shall have first procured and filed with the administrator a liability insurance policy issued by an insurance company authorized to do business in the state or a surety bond issued by a good and responsible surety company authorized to do business in the state and must be acceptable to and approved by the administrator    6909 liability insuranceamount the amount of liability insurance or surety bond for each taxicab shall be as required by state law    6909 liability insurancefleet policy the policy of insurance or surety bond required by this chapter may be in the form of a separate policy or separate surety bond for each taxicab or may be in the form of a fleet policy covering all taxicabs operated by such owner operator driver or chauffeur which such policy of insurance or surety bond shall provide the same liability for each taxicab operated in service as specified above    6909 liability insurancenotification of cancellation no policy of insurance or surety bond required by this chapter shall be cancelled by the insurer or by the insured until the expiration of five 5 days after notice of intended cancellation thereof has been given in writing to the building official by registered mail or personal delivery of such notice and a provision therefore shall be embodied in such policy or surety bond    6909 designation of taxicabs every taxicab shall bear on the outside of the front or rear door on each side in painted letters not less than two 2 inches nor more than six 6 inches in height the name of the owner or name in which the business tax receipt is registered with the city  and in addition may bear an identifying design    6909 rates of farerate card required a every taxicab operated under this chapter shall have a rate card setting forth the rates of fare displayed in such a place as to be in view of all passengers b rate cards shall list each individual rate which may be charged to a person including but not limited to hour rates mileage rates waiting time trunk and baggage fees and applicable costs for each additional passenger  rates of farerefusal of passenger to pay posted fare a it shall be unlawful for any person to refuse to pay the posted fare of any of the vehicles mentioned in this chapter after having hired the same it shall be unlawful for any person to hire any vehicle with the intent to defraud the person from whom it is hired of the value of such service b for the purpose of this section a passenger shall not be deemed to have hired a vehicle as set out above until such person has been advised of the rates as shown on the rate card posted in the vehicle    6909 passengerstaking on additional passengers no driver shall permit any other person to occupy or ride in a taxicab unless the persons first employing the taxicab shall consent to the acceptance of an additional passenger or passengers  passengersrestriction on number of passengers no driver shall permit more persons to be carried in a taxicab as passengers than the normal seating capacity for which the vehicle was constructed at no time shall such number exceed four 4 persons in the rear seat nor three 3 including the driver in the front seat where the driver is located a child in arms shall not be counted as a passenger    6909 passengersrefusal to carry orderly passengers prohibited no driver shall refuse or neglect to carry any orderly person upon request unless previously engaged or unable or forbidden by the provisions of this chapter to do so    6909 secs 22402255  reserved division 2  taxicab drivers permit required no person shall operate a taxicab for hire upon the streets within the city and no person who owns or controls a taxicab shall permit it to be so driven and no taxicab holding a business tax receipt by the city shall be so driven at any time for hire unless the driver of such taxicab shall have first obtained and shall have then in force a taxicab drivers permit issued pursuant to the provisions of this article    6909 application an application for a taxicab drivers permit shall be filed with the administrator on forms provided by the city such application shall be verified under oath and shall contain the following information 1 the full name permanent address current address birth date and citizenship of the applicant 2 the experience of the applicant in the transportation of passengers 3 the educational background of the applicant 4 a concise history of his employment 5 current state drivers license number applicable to forhire drivers with date of expiration 6 the names and addresses of three 3 people who have known the applicant for a period of at least one 1 year and who will vouch for the sobriety honesty and general good character of the applicant 7 the name and address of the liability insurance carried or surety company providing liability coverage on the taxicab to be driven by the applicant    6909 application fee photograph at the time the application for a taxicab drivers permit is filed the applicant shall pay to the administrator the sum of fifteen dollars $1500 which sum shall be nonrefundable and attach thereto two 2 passportsize photographs of a good likeness of the applicant    6909 police investigation of applicant the applicant for a taxicab drivers permit shall be required to report to the police department to submit to being fingerprinted on one 1 applicant fingerprint card to be supplied by the police department the applicant shall also submit two 2 passportsize photographs of a good likeness of the applicant to be attached to the fingerprint card    6909 investigation the administrator shall forward the completed application for a taxicab drivers permit to the police department who shall with the aid of the completed fingerprint card conduct an investigation of the applicant a report of such investigation and a copy of the traffic and police record of the applicant if any shall be attached to the application which shall then be returned to the administrator    6909 consideration of application a the administrator shall upon receipt of the application for a taxicab drivers permit and investigation from the police department forward the same to the administrator for consideration b the city manager is hereby given authority to reject any application for a taxicab drivers permit to operate a motor vehicle for the transportation of persons for hire within the city when the applicant is incapacitated by reason of infirmities due to age physical defects or is addicted to the use of narcotics or the habitual use of intoxicating liquors which would render such person unfit to operate a motor vehicle for hire within the city and the city manager in determining whether such person is addicted to the habitual use of intoxicating liquors may consider any applicants reputation for sobriety as reflected by the record of the applicants convictions before any court having jurisdiction in the city as disclosed by the records of such court c the city manager shall also have the authority to reject any such application when it appears to him as reflected in the police investigation and court records of the applicant that the applicant has been convicted of any crime which would be considered hazardous to any prospective passenger who may be transported in a taxicab driven by the applicant d if the application is rejected the applicant may request a personal appearance before the city council in appeal of the city managers decision to offer evidence why his application should be accepted the city manager shall after the city councils decision upon the appeal act in concurrence therewith and issue the permit if so decided by the city council    6909 issuance duration and annual fee a upon approval of an application for a taxicab drivers permit the administrator shall issue a permit to the applicant which shall bear the name address age signature and photograph of the applicant b such permit shall be in effect after issuance and shall be due and payable on september 30 of each year and shall expire on september 30 of the succeeding year any permit that is issued on or after april 1 of the current receipt year shall be required to pay onehalf  of the amount of the permit for the applicable classification under the provisions of this chapter and shall expire on september 30 of the current year unless the permit for the preceding year has been revoked or suspended if september 30 falls on a weekend or holiday the tax shall be due and payable on or before the first working day following september 30 c such permit shall be issued andor renewed by the administrator upon the payment of fifteen dollars $1500    6909   121118 suspension or revocation a the city manager is vested with the power and authority to suspend the taxicab drivers permit of any operator who shall have been convicted before any court of competent jurisdiction for the offense of operating a vehicle negligently or at a speed or in such a manner as to endanger or to be likely to endanger the life limb or property of a person or driving while under the influence of intoxicating liquor the permit of any persons so suspended or revoked by the city manager by reason of conviction of the offenses named in this subsection shall be suspended for a period not exceeding six 6 months b the city manager is further vested with the power and authority to suspend or revoke the permit of any operator who shall have been convicted before any court of competent jurisdiction for any crime which would be considered hazardous to any prospective passenger who may be transported in a taxicab by the operator the permit of any persons so suspended or revoked by the city manager by reason of such conviction for the offenses described in this subsection shall be suspended or revoked for a period of not less than six 6 months such period of suspension or revocation shall be set by the city manager who shall have discretion in the same as the nature of the crime shall dictate c the city manager is further vested with the power and authority to suspend and reject for a period of six 6 months the permit of any persons granted for the operation of a motor vehicle for the transportation of persons for hire within the city upon the conviction of such person before any court having jurisdiction in the city of the violation of any of the provisions of this chapter or of any of the ordinances of the city regulating the operation of motor vehicles for hire d a permit may not be suspended or revoked unless the driver has received notice and has had an opportunity to present evidence in his behalf  article iii  horsedrawn vehicles or carriages definitions applicant means any person who makes an application to the city of titusville for a horsedrawn vehicle for hire permit business tax receipt shall mean a business tax receipt issued annually by the city in accordance with section 1131 of the ordinances the business tax receipt shall apply to the operation of the horsedrawn vehicle business and each horsedrawn vehicle for hire shall obtain an individual permit in accordance with this article city manager shall mean the city manager or hisher designee horsedrawn vehicle shall mean any vehicle or carriage which is drawn or pulled by a horse mule or any other beast of burden which may be hired for the transportation of passengers and which is operated within the limits of the city of titusville operate or operation shall include operation by the business owner or any agent of the business owner or by any person with the business owners knowledge consent or permission expressed or implied permit means the grant by the city to operate an individual horsedrawn vehicle upon the streets of the city of titusville person shall include an individual a firm a copartnership a corporation a company or any others whatsoever owning controlling or having charge or possession of a horsedrawn vehicle for hire in the city of titusville  41415 permit required a it shall be unlawful for any person to operate or drive a horsedrawn vehicle in or upon any street in the city of titusville unless and until such person shall have first obtained a horsedrawn vehicle permit issued pursuant to the provisions of this article and from the state of florida a drivers license b an individual permit is required for each horsedrawn vehicle under this section in addition to a business tax receipt required in accordance with section 1131 of the ordinances said permit shall be of a type provided by the city manager shall be affixed to the horsedrawn vehicle in a manner prescribed by the city manager and shall be nontransferable from the vehicle for which the same was issued except as may be authorized by the city the city manager is hereby authorized to establish a fee for each transfer  41415 business tax receipt required it shall be unlawful for any person to engage in or carry on the business of operating a horsedrawn vehicle or carriage for transportation of passengers for hire either with or without drivers within the city without first obtaining a business tax receipt from the city  41415 application for permit  approval denial of application  appeal  permit fee  lost destroyed permits  renewal of permit a any person desiring to obtain a permit to operate a horsedrawn vehicle in the city of titusville shall submit to the city a written application which shall contain the following information 1 the name address telephone number drivers license number with date of expiration and form of business of the applicant the trade name if any under which the applicant has been issued a business tax receipt by the city of titusville 2 the business tax receipt for owning and operating the business of horsedrawn vehicles 3 at the time the application for a horsedrawn vehicle drivers permit is filed the applicant shall pay to the administrator the sum of fifteen dollars $1500 which sum shall be nonrefundable and attach thereto two 2 passportsize photographs of a good likeness of the applicant 4 a thorough description including photographs of the proposed horsedrawn vehicle business to be operated  the manner in which the applicant proposes to operate the business  the proposed hours of operation  proposed location from which the business is to be operated  the proposed route or routes to be served or utilized together with a map or maps describing the proposed routes  the type of animal or beast of burden to be used to draw any vehicle  the kind make and model of the vehicles to be used in the business city approval of proposed routes shall not substitute any required owners authorization 5 a thorough description of the proposed manner and location in which the applicant proposes to feed shelter quarter and stable and otherwise care for the animal to be used in the business and the method to be used in transporting the animals within and without the city 6 an individual certificate of soundness identifying each animal that will be pulling a permitted vehicle that is issued by an equine veterinarian licensed in the state of florida the certificate of soundness must specify that the inspected animal is free from infectious disease and is fit for service each animal shall thereafter be reinspected at intervals of no more than twelve 12 months and a certificate of soundness shall be issued by such veterinarian and filed with the city in order for each such animal to remain in service no animal shall be used to draw a horsedrawn vehicle without such certificate of soundness certified and dated within any preceding sixmonth period from the date of permit application 7 an insurance certificate proving that the applicant has met the insurance requirements of section 2269 8 a notarized statement acknowledging the applicants familiarity with and eligibility under the provisions of this section and any rules and regulations promulgated hereunder and the applicants intention to abide by the same 9 a thorough description of the proposed manner and location in which the applicant proposes to dispose of animal waste together with the safety and sanitation devices and methods to be employed 10 a sworn written statement as to whether or not the applicant has been either charged or convicted of any crime misdemeanor or violation of any municipal ordinance the nature of the offense and the disposition or penalty assessed therein 11 a copy of an equine infectious anemia eia laboratory test form issued by an equine veterinarian licensed in the state of florida for each individual horse to be used in a horsedrawn vehicle service and which form indicates a negative test result within the past six 6 months 12 any such supplementary information the city shall at any time demand in order to reasonably determine whether the request for a permit should be granted b upon receipt and acceptance of a complete application for a permit city staff shall evaluate the application for public health safety and welfare concerns as pertains to his or her area of regulation if the applicants plan for service meets with the approval of the reviewing official the official shall report said approval in writing to the city manager if said plan or application does not meet the approval of the reviewing official the official shall report said disapproval to the city manager with reasons for disapproval listed in writing if the application is disapproved by the city manager the application for permit shall be denied and no permit to operate horsedrawn vehicles shall be issued to the applicant c once the application is approved the city shall issue an operating permit to the applicant in accordance with this article said permit shall be renewed or expire annually in accordance with the associated business tax receipt d if the application is denied or if the permit is revoked under the enforcement of this article an appeal may be taken to the city manager by any applicant or individual affected by any decision of the city such appeals shall be made within thirty 30 days after a decision by the city by filing in writing with the city a notice of appeal and specifying the grounds thereof e if a permit issued under this section is lost or destroyed the permit holder may obtain a duplicate upon payment of ten dollars $1000 administrative charge f any person to whom a permit has been issued under the provisions of this article shall be entitled to renew such permit from year to year  provided however that such person shall fully comply with the provisions of this article and such other ordinances rules and regulations as shall be enacted or adopted from time to time by the city  provided further renewal of said permit shall be issued by the city manager upon payment of the annual fifteen dollar $1500 permit fee  41415 adherence to plan submitted in application permittees must adhere to the routes and vehicle number and design as specified in their application for permits any deviance from said application without the approval of the city shall be a violation of this article  41415 liability and indemnification a a permittee shall pay and by its acceptance of a permit specifically agrees to pay any and all damages or penalties which the city may be legally required to pay as a result of the permittees operation or maintenance of a horsedrawn vehicle under this article whether or not the acts or omissions complained of are authorized allowed or prohibited by the city b a permittee shall also pay all expenses incurred by the city in defending itself with regard to any and all damages and penalties mentioned in subsection 1 above the expenses shall include all outofpocket expenses including a reasonable attorneys fee and the reasonable value of services rendered by any employee of the city c the permittee shall maintain throughout the term of the permit liability insurance insuring the city and the permittee with regard to all damages mentioned in subsection 1 above caused by the grantee or its agents in the minimum amounts of 1 workers and unemployment compensation insurance as provided by the laws of this state 2 one hundred thousand dollars $10000000 for bodily injury or death to any one 1 person within the limit and five hundred thousand dollars $50000000 for bodily injury or death resulting from any one 1 accident and fifty thousand dollars $5000000 for property damage resulting from any one 1 accident d the insurance policies obtained by a permittee in compliance with this section shall be insured by a company or companies acceptable to the city and a current certificate or certificates of insurance along with written evidence of payment of all required premiums shall be filed and maintained with the city during the term of the permit the policies shall name the city as an additional insured and shall contain a provision that written notice of cancellation or reduction in coverage of the policy shall be delivered by registered mail to the city at least thirty 30 days in advance of the effective date thereof  41415 compliance with traffic regulations a a permittee having been issued a permit under this article to engage in the business of operating horsedrawn vehicles shall be subject to all traffic provisions of this all other ordinances rules and regulations now in effect in the city or the state of florida and all traffic ordinances and rules and regulations which may pertain to the operation of horsedrawn vehicles hereafter enacted or adopted by the city or the state of florida and such rules and regulations formulated and promulgated under authority of this article and as set forth in chapter 20 of the ordinances b it shall be unlawful for the operator of a horsedrawn vehicle to take on or discharge passengers while the vehicle is in motion  41415 sanitation all permittees shall comply with the following sanitation requirements a all horses mules and other animals shall be equipped with adequate devices to prevent manure and other excrement from falling upon the streets of the city any excrement which remains upon the streets of the city shall be removed at the expense of permittee b all animal waste for disposal shall be promptly transported to a site designated for waste disposal the city reserves the right to approve or disapprove sites taking into account routes within the city and the rules and regulations of the governmental body having jurisdiction over said sites or facilities c a permittee shall further comply with all applicable health and sanitation provisions of the sanitary florida and all rules and regulations promulgated thereunder  41415 condition and inspection of horsedrawn vehicles a each horsedrawn vehicle shall be kept in a safe and sanitary condition at all times the city shall have the right to inspect or cause to be inspected any horsedrawn vehicle as often as may be necessary for the purpose of ascertaining and causing to be corrected any unsafe or unsanitary conditions or any violations of this article or any other rule regulation ordinance or law relating to the operating of such horsedrawn vehicles b the city manager is hereby authorized to establish a fee for each such inspection and is further authorized to establish and promulgate rules and regulations and minimum standards for the inspection and condition of horsedrawn vehicles c if any horsedrawn vehicle shall fail to pass such inspection it shall be removed from service on the day of inspection and shall remain out of service until it has passed inspection d all horsedrawn vehicles used by a permittee shall have conspicuously displayed on the exterior of the vehicle the name of the business under which such permittee operates a copy of the permit shall be displayed inside the vehicle or carriage at all times e equipment and safety requirements 1 every animaldrawn vehicle in service shall have the following equipment on the vehicle which equipment shall be maintained in good repair a body condition b reflectors front and rear c grab handles d traces e harness f seats g rubber surfaced wheels h horn i shafts j steps k lights on any vehicle licensed to operate at night l brakes m sign located on the rear of the vehicle indicating that the vehicle is slow moving n equine emergency supplies 2 an animaldrawn vehicle shall be maintained in a clean wellpainted manner and provide a generally good appearance 3 failure to comply with this section of the be considered a violation subject to penalty  41415 animal safety a animals shall not engage in work with harnesses or bits which harm or are unsafe to the animal b harnesses bridles bits and padding shall be properly fitted and kept oiled clean and in good repair c harnesses shall be kept free of makeshift materials like wire rope and rusty chain d trace chains shall not put pressure on the collar and shoulders of the animal when it starts pulling the vehicle or carriage resulting in a jolting start versus a smooth start with a snug collar already in place e breeching shall fit so that it will not rub or hinder the hind leg movement of the animal f service with horsedrawn vehicles shall terminate during adverse weather conditions when either the ambient temperature reaches ninetyfive 95 degrees fahrenheit or the heat index reaches one hundred five 105 degrees fahrenheit as determined by the weather station at the titusville weather station kfltitus13 the operators and drivers shall discontinue working their animals and pull them off the street until the temperature decreases below the abovestated temperatures as directed by the city manager or the fire department g permittee is responsible for seeing that the animals used shall be adequately cared for and are not overworked any abuse or neglect of these animals shall be grounds for the revocation of permits adequate records to determine the hours the animal worked must be maintained by each permittee  41415 revocation of permits whenever there is reasonable cause to believe that a person holding a permit to operate a horsedrawn vehicle is violating the provision of this article the city manager may upon written certified notice of said violation to the permittee suspend the permits issued to such person until such time as the violations are corrected to the satisfaction of the city or within a period of thirty 30 days whichever is less if said violation is not corrected within thirty 30 days the permit will be automatically revoked any permittee whose permits have been revoked under this subsection may within thirty 30 days after said revocation appeal to the board of adjustments and appeals  41415 enforcement  penalties a any person who violates this article shall be punished as provided in section 115 each day the violation exists shall constitute a separate violation for the purposes of this article and shall be punishable as such andor said violation may be processed as a code violation pursuant to fs ch 162 and the municipal code enforcement board b the city of titusville city attorneys office is authorized to pursue temporary or permanent injunctive relief or any other legal or equitable remedy authorized by law in courts of competent jurisdiction to cure remove or end any activity which violates this article c permittees shall have a private right of action to pursue all legal and equitable remedies necessary to ensure full compliance with this article against any other permittee including but not limited to injunctive relief  41415 conflict with state law nothing in this article is intended to conflict with the provisions of the florida constitution or the state uniform traffic control law ch 316 fs in the event of a direct and express conflict between this article and either the florida constitution or fs ch 316 then the provisions of the florida constitution or fs ch 316 as applicable control city clerk granted date granted expiration dateterm enacted by city gas company of florida 112762 112792 tci cable television 92282 102292 florida power and light 11183 30 years southern bell cablevision of central florida code of ordinances city of titusville florida volume ii ____________ land development regulations ____________ published in 1992 republished in 2017 ____________ > adopting ordinance1990 code ordinance no 201990 an ordinance of the city of titusville florida amending the code of ordinances by adopting volume ii of the code entitled city of titusville land development regulations providing for authority purpose definitions administration of regulations establishment of committees and boards providing procedures and processes for filing for permits site plans subdivision approval zoning conditional uses variances appeals enforcement fees and other processes establishing performance standards for removal of trees landscaping stormwater management protection of natural topography flood damage wetlands threatened and endangered plants and wildlife  establish performance requirements for streets sidewalk bikeways parking utilities signs architectural control hazardous and toxic management concurrency management and others  establishing zoning districts and classifications for residential commercial industrial governmental and other districts  establishing overlay districts of pud pip community redevelopment titusville shoreline  airport impact conservation area of critical concern flood plains historic preservation public uses and conditional uses establishing requirements for subdivisions processing and procedures adopting certain appendixes illustrations and exhibits  providing for an effective date  providing vested rights establishing procedures for submitting claims procedures for challenging development regulations and otherwise providing for an effective date whereas the city of titusville florida is a municipal corporation organized and existing pursuant to laws of florida special acts of 196 of the constitution of the state of florida and florida statutes  and whereas the city of titusville possesses certain governmental corporate and proprietary powers to conduct and perform municipal functions  and whereas the city of titusville pursuant to its home rule powers possesses full governmental authority to manage and determine growth within its corporate limits subject to and only limited by applicable law  and whereas the legislature of the state of florida has enacted the local government comprehensive planning and land development regulation act commonly referred to as florida statutes 1989  and whereas the city of titusville pursuant to its governmental and proprietary powers and home rule powers and pursuant to florida statutes prepared a comprehensive plan together with certain elements and maps  and whereas the city of titusville on  adopted a comprehensive plan to preserve promote protect and improve the public health safety and welfare of its citizens  and whereas the city of titusvilles comprehensive plan was adopted pursuant to consisting of certain elements capital improvements element future land use element traffic circulation element sanitary sewer solid waste drainage potable water and natural groundwater aquifer recharge element conservation element recreation and open space element coastal management element intergovernmental coordination element and housing element  and whereas the city of titusville desires to implement said comprehensive plan by adopting certain land development regulations as authorized by florida statutes and as authorized by constitution of the state of florida and florida statutes and laws of florida special acts of 1963  and whereas the city of titusville has provided for public participation in the formulation and development of these regulations and has received input from the local planning agency and a special committee known as ldr ad hoc committee and the general public  and whereas the planning and zoning commission on  has made a recommendation to the city council as to the consistency of the land development regulations with the comprehensive plan  and whereas the city council pursuant to chapters 163 and 166 florida statutes held a public hearing on said land development regulations on  and  after due public notice and received public input  and whereas the city council desires to adopt the attached land development regulations with the effective date specified in this   whereas the city council finds the regulations to be consistent with the city of titusville comprehensive plan now therefore be it enacted by the city of titusville florida as follows authority this being adopted pursuant to constitution of the state of florida  florida statutes  laws of florida special acts of 1963  florida statutes  and florida statutes entitled local government comprehensive planning and land development regulation act purpose and intent the city hereby declares that the purpose and intent of this to provide for the city of titusville land development regulations which will guide future growth and development  encourage the most appropriate use of land water and other resources consistent with the public interest  preserve promote and protect the public health safety comfort good order appearance convenience and general welfare  preserve the residential or historical character of neighborhoods prevent the overcrowding of land avoid undue concentration of population  provide adequate and energyefficient transportation water sewage drainage fire protection law enforcement schools parks recreation facilities housing and other services facilities and resources  enhance the aesthetic appeal of the community  and conserve and protect natural resources within the city of titusville while protecting private property rights adoption of land development regulations that the ordinances of the city of titusville florida is hereby amended by adopting by reference as volume ii of the ordinances the attached city of titusville land development regulations which reads as set forth in said volume effective date that general provisions  procedures and process  environmental protection and conservation  general performance requirements   53 57 zoning  10 6220 64 and 65 30 6740 6750 6760 6770 6780 6790 subdivisions   and appendixesillustrationsexhibits  10 8320 8330 8340 8350 8360 8370 8371 8372 8373 8374 84 8410 8420 8430 8460 8470 8480 and 8490 is hereby adopted effective  all other remaining parts or expressly adopted as of  shall become effective on  all future development shall comply with these regulations in accordance with the above effective date provisions unless said development is entitled to vested rights  12291   52891 grandfather provision all lawful existing development to the extent of any conflict with these regulations shall be entitled to be continued as provided for in of the land development regulations vested rights in the event any provision of these regulations would limit or modify the rights of any person to complete any development that has been previously authorized then in that event the city may recognize said right to complete said development as provided herein the city hereby recognizes the right of any person to complete the following development a development that has received a building permit  b development that has received final plat approval or final site plan  c development that has received preliminary plat approval preliminary subdivision approval preliminary pud approval or preliminary site plan approval provided said development has secured a permit to construct all or any phase of said development and is continuing said development in good faith  d any development that has on file with the city completed application for building permit and required exhibits and continues to process and obtain a building permit within sixty 60 days any person who has a right to complete said development and has secured a building permit final plat approval final site plan approval or preliminary approval as provided above shall lose its right to complete said development if said development does not maintain a current building permit or current site plan or development approval as provided for by the ordinances of the city once a development has lost its current approval then in that event future development shall comply with applicable regulations the city may recognize other applications for vested rights in accordance with the following procedure 1 any property owner who claims to have vested rights based upon a prior approval from the city other than as provided above may submit to the city manager within one hundred twenty 120 days after the effective date of this a written request for recognition of said vested rights 2 the applicant shall submit such information as he deems appropriate to demonstrate his claim of vested rights including legal description of property dates of any recent rezoning preparation of any plans approval of any plans any action of the city upon which applicant has relied facts showing substantial reliance or change in position 3 within ninety 90 days after receipt of said application the city council shall either recognize or reject the applicants claim of vested rights in reviewing the application the city council shall be guided by the case of hollywood beach hotel v city of hollywood  329 so2d 10 fla 1976 and other applicable law if this city fails to act upon said request within ninety 90 days then said application shall be deemed to be denied no suit shall be filed by the applicant unless prior thereto the applicant has made a request of the city prior to said litigation constitutional claims in the event any person claims that any provision of the land development regulations constitute a taking of the land owners property without due process of law and the payment of just compensation as provided for in the florida constitution and the constitution of the united states of america then in that event said person shall first present said claim to the city of titusville any person claiming said taking shall 1 submit said claim in writing identifying the name and address of the property owner 2 the present use of the property 3 the present land use designation and zoning classification 4 the particular provision of the ldr that said person believes to have constituted a taking 5 the remedy requested 6 documentation or other evidence demonstrating the economic deprivation 7 case law or authority if any which demonstrates the taking 8 such other information demonstrating how said ldr constitutes a taking after the city has received said request it shall have ninety 90 days to review and act upon said request due public notice as required by chapters 163 and 166 shall be provided prior to granting any relief under this city reserves its full legislative function to act upon requests under this said actions shall be presumed to be fairly debatable administrative revisions of ldr the city hereby adopts by reference the provisions of florida statutes 1989 all challenges to any land development regulations by any substantially affected person shall first be presented to the city of titusville and reviewed and acted upon in accordance with said statutes prior to any court action repeal 1 the following the ordinances are hereby repealed simultaneous with the adoption of comparable provisions in the land development regulations to 243 to 4b15 to 586 to 6c8 to 8a8 landscaping to 8a15 to 8a43 to 8a52 to 12b28 to 12c15 to 195 to 2212 and 2214 to 2336 to 2934 and 2950 2 in the event any the repealed and said section is referenced in another section of the then for purposes of that section not repealed the referenced section shall remain in full force and effect 3 these land development regulations shall supersede any other regulations or codes of the city to the extent of any conflict in the event of any doubt as to which regulation prevails the more restrictive regulation shall prevail effective date this take effect immediately upon adoption passed and adopted this 22nd day of january 1991  12291 s thomas r mariani thomas r mariani mayor attest s janet r camacho janet r camacho city clerk adopting ordinance1992 code ordinance no 71992 an ordinance of the city of titusville
