as unsafe and dangerous and to cause a notice to be served on the owner of the building to which such a structure may be attached his agent in charge or the tenant thereof and such owner agent or tenant shall within three 3 days from receipt of such condemnation notice or within such shorter time as the emergency in the judgment of the city manager may require after the service of such notice remove such structure cross reference sign regulations public liability  property damage insurance all persons erecting marquees canopies or any projection over the public rightofway of the city shall be required to post a cash bond with the city or to secure public lability insurance against damage occasioned to any person or property as a result of any defect herein andor falling thereof every such insurance policy shall be of form and substance approved by the city attorney shall be executed by an insurance company or companies authorized to do business in the state and acceptable to the city council and shall be in the penal sum of fifty thousand dollars $5000000 for injury or death to any one 1 person in the penal sue of one hundred thousand dollars $10000000 for injury or death to all persons caused by any one 1 accident and in the penal sum of ten thousand dollars $1000000 for damage to property resulting from any one 1 accident each of such penal sums shall remain in full force and shall be undiminished during the effective period of such insurance every such insurance policy shall contain a provision whereby every company executing the same shall obligate itself to notify the city clerk in writing at least thirty 30 days before any alteration modification or cancellation of such policy is to become effective no permit shall be issued for the erection of any marquee canopy or any other projection extended over the sidewalks or public liability of the city unless and until such bond or liability insurance policy is filed with the city clerk cross reference sign regulations secs 3015630160  reserved division 3  open space intent common open space is any portion of land within a site designated with an intent to design for the recreational use or enjoyment of residents and visitors and to assure proper internal buffering of land uses all common open space shall be improved to the extent necessary to complement the development and may contain compatible and complementary structures applicability this section shall apply to all developments outside of the dmu zoning district open space standards a required minimum open space table 302 primary purpose of the open space is to assist in maintaining a parklike setting preserve natural vegetation and assure proper internal buffering of land uses d highway industrial infill m3 1 open space design landscaped and usable open spaces should be designed as integral parts of the site and building design the location and configuration of usable open space should be designed to encourage social interaction maximize its utility and facilitate maintenance a buffers and berms should be incorporated for grade density separation and noise control additionally pedestrian walkways bike paths and seating arrangements should be created when feasible and practical b existing natural features including topography and vegetation should be preserved and incorporated into site design c plant minimum standards for fenceswalls the intent is to allow fenceswalls where appropriate for security or screening purposes these regulations will increase public safety and security of personal property b within the downtown mixeduse land use district fences walls andor screens exceeding thirty 30 inches in height shall be prohibited forward of the front or street side facade of the principal structure see special districts and overlays c fences shall be measured on the exterior surface and include any berm retaining wall or other manmade improvement which would artificially circumvent the intent of this section d all walls and fences shall be constructed so that all support postspolesmembers are facing the interior of the yard on which the wallfence is placed the good side ie side with no bracing or support members shall be required to face the neighboring property andor rightsofway abutting the property where a fence is being erected except as follows 1 abutting conservation or open recreation lands 2 abutting bodies of water including retention ponds 3 abutting commercial uses 4 abutting public lands e fences and walls shall be fabricated from wood aluminum wrought iron vinyl brick or other approved materials manufactured specifically for fences and walls nontraditional fence materials such as tires muffler hubcaps galvanized roofing and corrugated metal are prohibited f except as specifically noted in this article no wall or fence shall be constructed either wholly or in part of barbed wire razor wire electrified wire glass shards or other similarly dangerous material g barbed wire may be used in conjunction with or accessory to a permitted agricultural use h no fence shall encroach into a visibility triangle at an intersection or a driveway as determined by the city  72418 height and location requirements a singlefamily residential uses 1 front yard the maximum height of a fence or wall in any required front yard setback shall be four 4 feet 2 side or rear yard the maximum height of a fence or wall in any required side or rear yard setback shall be six 6 feet 3 side corner yard the maximum height of a fence or wall in any required side corner yard setback shall be six 6 feet within the side corner yard of a corner lot a fence in excess of four 4 feet in height shall be set back a minimum of thirtyfive 35 feet from the property line to ensure adequate visibility for pedestrian and vehicle traffic the graphic below illustrates this regulation any side corner yard setback abutting a collector or arterial roadway shall be limited to a maximum of four 4 feet within the minimum side corner yard setback established by the zoning district 4 no high security fence or wall may be permitted with a singlefamily residential use sections of this article a high security fence may be permitted by the administrator allowance of these types of fenceswalls shall be on a casebycase basis and allowance of a high security fencewall at one 1 location shall not be considered as precedence for the allowance of such a fencewall at any other location 1 all high security fenceswalls shall be subject to review by the citys site plan review committee and the community redevelopment agency within the downtown mixeduse dmu zoning district to ensure compatibility with the surrounding buildings andor walls 2 use of high security fenceswalls shall only be considered at locations where the citys land development regulations permit the outdoor storage and display of goods and materials or as required by a federal or state regulation or program where high security fenceswalls are used around outdoor display areas said fencewall does not have to be one hundred 100 percent opaque high security fenceswalls used around outdoor storage areas must be one hundred 100 percent opaque 3 high security fenceswalls shall be defined as follows a high security fences a substantially built fence including any gates in said fence not less than six 6 feet nor more than eight 8 feet in height above grade such fence may be chainlink or woven wire fencing materials with or without slats there may be three 3 strands of barbed wire on barbed wire arms on top of these fences as long as the barbed wire arms are angled fortyfive 45 degrees of the fence and do not extend beyond the property line b high security walls a constructed barrier of concrete stone brick tile wood or similar type of material not less than six 6 nor more than eight 8 feet in height above grade barbed wire may be used in conjunction with a high security wall as long as the barbed wire meets the requirements detailed in a3a above the barbed wire arms must be installed on the property side of the wall said walls do not have to be one hundred 100 percent opaque as long as physical access to the attendant property is prevented 4 wherever a high security fencewall is used the following landscape elements are required exceptions to this section may be granted on a casebycase basis by the administrator for those properties that do not front on roadways classified by improvements division 7 streets of this article as either a principal or minor arterial roadway a all high security fences shall be located in a landscape strip that is ten 10 feet in width a continuous hedge shall run along the entire length of the fence said secs 3018430190  reserved division 5  lighting intent the purpose of this article is to provide minimum standards for site lighting improvements the intent is to allow lighting within parking lots secured areas walkways and site features while protecting neighboring properties from intrusive lighting projections these regulations will increase public safety and security for personal property site lighting standards a lighting shall not be directed onto another lot or obscure drivers vision on public streets all freestanding and building mounted light fixtures shall be downlit b no lighting fixture shall create more than two 2 footcandles of light density at the property line c no freestanding light fixture shall be higher than forty 40 feet d offstreet parking areas shall be illuminated to a minimum of one 1 footcandle at eye level over the entire surface of the parking area during operating hours other site lighting standards a light timerscutoff switches are required for all outdoor nonsecurity lighting fixtures b low voltage low intensity walkway light ie bollard lighting are permissible and are not required to be downlit c the city encourages all developments to utilize low power consumptions fixtures ie led in the sites lighting design all site lighting permit fees will be waived as an incentive for developments to utilize low power consumption fixture lighting designs other site fees and all buildings fees applicable to the projects are still enforced d lighting directed upward may be permitted when directed toward flag poles fountains building facades landscaping or like items and directed away from adjacent properties andor rightsofway as approved by the administrator planned industrial development pid lighting standards a artificial lighting utilized to illuminate the premises shall be directed away from adjacent properties and streets shining only on the subject site b no freestanding light fixtures shall extend higher than twentyfive 25 feet such fixtures shall be approved by the administrator to assure design compatibility with principal buildings and the planned industrial business park c although parking lot lighting is encouraged for the protection of employees that work afterhours parking lot lighting is only required if multiple shifts are proposed between the hours of  pm and  am if multiple shifts are not proposed then an afterhours lit parking area may be designated to address employee security required lighting should be brought up to code standards if necessitated by a change of use secs 3019530200  reserved division 6  stormwater management and aquifer protection subdivision 1  stormwater management and erosion control intent a it is the intent of this section to protect and enhance surface and groundwater resources by ensuring that stormwater runoff peak rates and volumes after development are no more than predevelopment conditions  that groundwater tables are not artificially lowered  and that precautions are taken to prevent erosion sedimentation flooding and water pollution it is the further intent of this section to 1 provide additional protection for the freshwater resources within and in the proximity of the existing and proposed well fields in the city of titusville 2 protect andor enhance the quality of ground and surface waters including the indian river lagoon st johns river fox and south lakes 3 ensure that there is no erosion after development 4 maintain and enhance groundwater levels and groundwater recharge 5 protect the beneficial functioning of wetlands such as swamps bogs marshes estuaries sloughs and floodplains for the natural storage of surface waters and the biological reduction and assimilation of pollutants 6 minimize saltwater intrusion by adhering to applicable best management practices 7 minimize injury to vegetation fish and wildlife habitat and otherwise help to attain the objectives of this section stormwater management permit a the following activities alter or disrupt existing stormwater runoff patterns or affect aquifer recharge areas and will require a permit prior to the initiation of any project except as exempted in 1 filling clearing andor drainage of land as an adjunct to construction 2 clearing filling andor draining of nonagricultural land for agricultural purposes 3 converting agricultural lands to nonagricultural uses 4 subdividing land 5 replatting recorded subdivisions and the development of recorded and unrecorded subdivisions 6 changing the use of land andor the construction of a structure including the construction of parking areas or impervious surfaces or a change in the size of one 1 or more structures 7 altering the shoreline or bank of any surface water body 8 altering of any ditches dikes terraces berms swales or other water management facility 9 removal of earth or moving of earth on a parcel for all activities that require a permit 10 construction or size modification of a structure including parking areas or impervious surfaces 11 site and subdivision development requiring city approval of all new construction including buildings parking new impervious area accessory structures b site and subdivision development requiring city approval all new construction including buildings parking new impervious area accessory structures etc stormwater management permitexemptions a the following activities shall be exempt from formal stormwater permitting procedures 1 singlefamily residences additions and accessory structures upon determination by the administrator that such construction will not adversely impact the aquifer or the stormwater management system 2 bona fide agricultural pursuits except where an artificial drainage system will be used to increase the flow of surface water from the applicants land or the land is in the area of critical concern 3 maintenance work performed by a public or established private utility on drainage canals for the purpose of public health and welfare 4 any construction or improvement to an existing parcel not exceeding one thousand 1000 cumulative square feet of new impervious area and not changing or affecting the quality rate volume or location of stormwater discharge as determined by the administrator 5 repaving or resurfacing of existing impervious surfaces 6 any development within a subdivision if each of the following conditions has been met a stormwater management provisions for the subdivision were previously approved and remain valid as part of a final plat b the development is conducted in accordance with the stormwater management provisions submitted with the final plat c the impervious coverage per lot does not exceed the maximum impervious area as defined in the final plat if the final plat does not specify the maximum impervious area these regulations will apply stormwater management plan process a the ownerapplicant of any project as defined in shall submit a stormwater management plan as part of the development approval process as set forth in procedures subdivision and site plan of the land development regulations b upon receipt the administrator shall review said stormwater management plan based upon the criteria and performance standards identified in this article and in accordance with the time provisions for review of projects in accordance with other appropriate sections of the land development regulations stormwater management plan required information and exhibits a stormwater management plan shall be submitted per the requirement set forth in the stormwater management technical manual stormwater management criteria stormwater management systems and erosion control measures shall adhere to the criteria set forth in the stormwater management technical manual subdivision 2  area of critical concern area of critical concern performance a for properties any portion of which is located within the area of critical concern see special districts and overlay no certificate of occupancy building permit development permit clearing permit site plan approval or any other permit or development approval shall be issued by the city unless the land use or permit shall comply with the following performance standards in addition to the other requirements of this section 1 primary stormwater management facilities are to be designed as dry bottom facilities 2 retention and discharge requirements a for a development site located above twentyfive 25 feet mean sea level msl the postdevelopment runoff volume resulting from the tenyeartwentyfourhour storm event shall be retained on site the retention area required for the tenyeartwentyfourhour storm shall be based on the percentage of impervious surface on the site the rate of discharge over the retained tenyeartwentyfourhour storm volume shall be restricted to the predevelopment rate of discharge for a twentyfiveyeartwentyfourhour storm event onehalf 12 foot of freeboard shall be required above the overflow elevation the area needed for the freeboard is extra above the area calculated above engineering calculations using approved methods showing that the tenyear twentyfourhour storm retention requirements have been met shall be required b for development sites below twentyfive 25 feet msl retention and discharge requirements shall be as provided in for developments located outside the area of critical concern this includes the use of wet detention c for development sites having elevations both above and below twentyfive 25 feet msl those portions of the site which are above twentyfive 25 msl shall conform to the performance in paragraph a1 of this section and all required retention ponds and improvements shall be located in the areas above twentyfive 25 feet msl 3 removal of soil from a development site within the area of critical concern shall be prohibited unless otherwise approved by the administrator importing clean fill on a site for the purpose of creating additional recharge shall be encouraged 4 reduction of natural topography shall be minimized the reduction of natural topography shall be limited eight 8 feet above the seasonal high water table with the exception of drainage conveyances or retention ponds or eight 8 feet below existing land surface whichever is more restrictive this section shall not apply to excavation beneath a structure for the purpose of providing a basement except that in no case shall such excavation be within eighteen 18 inches of the seasonal high water table the limitations on the extent of the above cut of the natural topography shall not be construed as an automatic authorization to alter the natural topography the project shall be designed to minimize the change in natural topography 5 within the area of critical concern the total of all impervious surfaces shall not exceed forty 40 percent of the total area of a development excluding publicly dedicated rightofway and jurisdictional wetlands if pervious concrete pavement is used in the development of the site a credit for the use of pervious concrete pavement will be as stated in see of the stormwater technical manual for performance calculations 6 for sites adjacent to existing municipal potable water wells total impervious surfaces shall not exceed the following see stormwater technical manual for performance calculations a twenty 20 percent if the site is within three hundred 300 feet of an active municipal production well site b twentyfive 25 percent if the site is between three hundred 300 feet and seven hundred fifty 750 feet of an active municipal production well site c thirty 30 percent if the site is between seven hundred fifty 750 feet and fifteen hundred 1500 feet of an active municipal production well site 7 impervious parking lot requirements may be waived for uses located within the area of critical concern provided that erosion control measures are approved by the administrator however any accessway onto a public rightofway shall be paved a minimum distance of twenty 20 feet into the property in order to provide for public safety and drainage 8 development shall be designed to minimize the reduction of recharge to the surficial aquifer the groundwater level and fluctuations shall be no worse than under predevelopment conditions 9 for private wells in excess of two 2 inches in diameter licensed well drillers installing private wells in the area of critical concern shall first notify the administrator and supply information concerning owners name address property locations depth and diameter of well and pumping capacity 10 only one 1 black water septic tank permitted per acre not to exceed one thousand two hundred 1200 gallon capacity shall be allowed 11 home fuel oil storage tanks are prohibited within the area of critical concern 12 the minimum lot size for all future singlefamily developments shall be ten thousand 10000 square feet excluding retention ponds a conservation subdivision as specified in development options conservation subdivision design may be utilized to allow lots less than ten thousand 10000 square feet in area provided all conditions of the conservation subdivision design are met 13 preservation of predevelopment topography grades soils and vegetation shall be encouraged 14 that each sitesubdivision must calculate the maximum impervious area for each lots this information must be included on site plan andor plat  121217 pervious pavement standards in the area of critical concern pervious pavement standards in the area of critical concern are set forth in of the stormwater technical manual exemptions in the area of critical concern a the following properties located within the area of critical concern shall be exempt from the provisions of this section except for a9 and 10 to the extent provided herein 1 all singlefamily lots in existing platted singlefamily subdivisions and those for which preliminary plat approval was obtained prior to  effective date 2 any existing parcel or lot which is onehalf 12 acre in size or less regardless of the zoning classification shall be exempt from the impervious surface limitations prescribed in a5 to be entitled to this exemption the property in question must have been deeded subdivided or otherwise created prior to  effective date subdivision 3  hydraulic maintenance and enforcement hydraulic design criteria stormwater conveyance system this section of the city of titusvilles stormwater design criteria manual shall be utilized in the design of the collection and conveyance portion of any stormwater management facility to be constructed and to be maintained by the city and shall be designed per city of titusville specifications conflicts with other ordinances and codes in case of conflict between this article or any part thereof and the whole part of any other existing or future ordinance or code the most restricted in each case shall apply review fees review fees shall be in accordance with procedures fees of the   maintenance and inspections a the installed systems required by this article shall be maintained by the owner b the owner shall maintain the installed systems required by this article c at the time of issuance of a development order the city can inspect all erosion control measures to ensure effective control d inspection fees shall be paid at the time of issuance of a stormwater construction permit the applicant shall schedule with the administrator the following inspections 1 erosion and sediment control inspections as necessary to ensure effective control of erosion and sedimentation 2 burial inspections prior to the burial of any underground drainage structure 3 final inspection upon completion of work the enforcement officer shall either approve the completed work or notify the applicant in writing in that there has been a failure to comply with the requirements of the approved permit enforcement and penalties a when work for which a permit is required by this article is commenced prior to obtaining said permit the fees herein specified shall be double but the payment of such double fee shall not relieve any persons from fully complying with the requirements of this article in the execution of the work nor from any other penalties prescribed in the land development regulations b the applicant shall be required to adhere strictly to the plan as permitted any changes or amendments to the plan must be approved by the administrator enforcement officials shall be granted inspection rights and rightofway privileges in order to ensure compliance with the requirements of this article c if the enforcement official determines that the project is not being carried out in accordance with the approved plan or if any project is being carried out without a permit he is authorized to 1 issue written notice to the applicant specifying the nature and location of the alleged noncompliance  with a description of the remedial actions necessary to bring the project into compliance within three 3 working days 2 issue a stopwork order directing the applicant or persons in possession to cease and desist all or any portion of the work which violates the provisions of this article if the remedial work is not completed within the specified time the applicant shall then bring the project into compliance or be subject to immediate revocation of their permit and penalties 3 the persons named in 1 or 2 above may request in writing a hearing before the board no later than fourteen 14 days after the date of such action any order issued in 1 or 2 above shall remain in effect until a final decision of the board d any person who violates or causes to be violated any provision of this article or permits any such violation or fails to comply with any of the requirements hereof shall be punished by a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 or by imprisonment in the county jail for a period not to exceed sixty 60 days or by both such fine and imprisonment each day upon which such violation occurs shall constitute a separate offense in addition to any other remedies whether civil or criminal the violation of this article may be restrained by injunction including a mandatory injunction and otherwise abated in any manner provided by law e all persons and entities shall maintain private stormwater management systems in full compliance with applicable codes and ordinances any person or entity that fails to maintain the stormwater management systems shall be considered as a violation of this code and enforcement action may be initiated and enforced municipal board fines and liens may be imposed as authorized by florida statutes as amended from time to time and applicable codes and ordinances if any entity has been dissolved or no longer owns said private stormwater management systems then in that event the property owners utilizing said stormwater management systems or properties that are benefited by said stormwater management systems shall be financially responsible for the upkeep and maintenance of said stormwater management systems for example if stormwater management systems are to be owned and maintained by a homeowners association and the homeowners association has been dissolved and is no longer active or functioning then in that event the lot owners utilizing said stormwater management systems or benefited by said systems shall be pro rata responsible for the upkeep and maintenance of said systems the city may initiate an action municipal board for said violation and appropriate fines and liens may be imposed and recorded against benefited properties the liens may be foreclosed and collected in the same manner as code liens including the citys costs and a reasonable attorneys fees emergency exemption a this section shall not be construed to prevent the doing of any act necessary to prevent material harm to or destruction of real or personal property as a result of a present emergency including but not limited to fire infestation by pests or hazards resulting from violent storms or hurricanes or when the property is in imminent peril and the necessity of obtaining a permit is impractical and would cause undue hardship in the protection of the property b a report of any such emergency action shall be made to the administrator by the owner or person in control of the property upon which emergency action was taken as soon as practical but no more than thirty 30 days following such action remedial action may be required by the administrator subject to appeal to the city council in the event of dispute vested rights any existing previously approved preliminary plat plat site plan planned unit development or other project that has secured approval or possess a building permit shall be entitled to develop and continue to be developed in accordance with the existing development approval failure to develop in accordance with the previous approved development permit or a substantial deviation shall cause the project to lose any vested rights to the previous approval and shall be required to develop in accordance with this article secs 3021730225  reserved division 7  streetssidewalksbikes access to arterial streets a whenever a development or subdivision that involves the creation of one 1 or more new streets borders or contains an existing or proposed arterial street no direct driveway access may be provided from the lots within said development or subdivision onto said arterial street b backout parking shall not be allowed onto any arterial street  however this section shall not apply to those lots platted at the time of the effective date of this subsection where said lots abut the said arterial streets and which must by design utilize backout parking c no person shall subdivide any parcel fronting on an arterial street without making adequate provision for frontage roads or marginal access roads the city may deny a permit for development if this provision is violated where possible the distance between curb cuts on large parcels fronting arterial streets shall be six hundred and sixty 660 feet street entrances a all driveway entrances and other openings onto streets shall be constructed as follows 1 vehicles shall be able to enter and exit from the lot in question without posing any substantial danger to themselves pedestrians or vehicles traveling in abutting streets 2 interference with the free and convenient flow of traffic in abutting or surrounding streets shall be minimized b projects for which a site plan is required shall be considered on an individual basis and may deviate from these requirements in the interest of traffic safety as approved by the administrator c cross access between adjacent nonresidential parcels is required for arterial street locations to minimize potential conflicts and preserve the level of service unless waived by the administrator with just cause examples of just causes are site constraints such as redevelopment or inability to physically connect to adjacent sites a cross access easement agreement may be required for site plan approval coordination with surrounding streets a when there is no street shown in the roadway classification map or future traffic circulation map for the area to be developed or subdivided the arrangement of streets in said development or subdivision shall either 1 provide for the continuation or appropriate projection of existing principal streets in surrounding areas  or 2 conform to a plan for the neighborhood approved or adopted by the city council after recommendation by the planning and zoning commission which responds to a particular situation where topographical or other conditions make continuance or conformance to existing streets impracticable relationship of streets to topography and site conditions a streets shall be designed to facilitate drainage and storm water runoff and street grades shall conform as closely as practicable to the original topography b streets shall be constructed with grades which conform to standards set forth in the transportation infrastructure technical manual c in no case may streets be constructed with grades that in the professional opinion of the administrator create a substantial danger to the public safety d the arrangement character extent width grade and location of all streets shall conform to all official plans and shall be considered in their relation to the following 1 pattern of existing and planned streets 2 topographical conditions 3 public convenience and safety 4 proposed uses of land to be served by such streets 5 minimization of encroachment on woodlands wetlands and groundwater recharge areas attention to handicapped in street construction a when curb and gutter construction is used on public and private streets wheelchair ramps and depressed curbs shall be constructed in accordance with the fdot standard index  latest addition b in unsubdivided developments sidewalk construction for the handicapped shall conform to the requirements of the architectural barriers act 42 usc 4514157 as well as florida statutes and the ansi specifications for making buildings and facilities accessible to and usable by physically handicapped people utilities utilities installed in public rightsofway or along private roads shall conform to the requirements set forth in division 7 utilities of this chapter street width and drainage requirements in subdivisions street rightsofway are designed and developed to serve several objectives a to carry motor vehicle traffic and in some cases allow onstreet parking  b to provide a safe and convenient passageway for pedestrian and bicycle traffic  and c to serve as an important link in the citys drainage system in order to fulfill these objectives all public and private streets shall be constructed to meet the standards set forth in the following subsections and specified in roadway requirements of the transportation infrastructure technical manual general layout of streets a the general layout of streets are set forth in of the transportation infrastructure technical manual b no existing platted or dedicated culdesacs or platted lots or flag lots shall be utilized as access for a new subdivision or public street without the express concurrence and permission of the city council of the city of titusville that it is the intention and purpose of this provision to protect existing culdesacs and not have said existing lots be utilized as access for future subdivisions and future public streets without the express permission of the city council of the city of titusville the city council shall consider the street design criteria as set forth in the land development regulations traffic safety and engineering and the public health safety and general welfare of the city in approving new public streets or subdivisions street intersections street intersections are set forth in  99 of the transportation infrastructure technical manual street alignment and curvature a horizontal curvature horizontal curvature is set forth in  910 street alignment of the transportation infrastructure technical manual b tangents as set forth in  910 street alignment of the transportation infrastructure technical manual construction standards and specifications construction design standards and specifications for streets sidewalks and curbs and gutters are administrative regulation and adopted by reference in the transportation infrastructure technical manual public streets and private roads in subdivisions a in all districts except residential districts rdistricts no building or structure shall be erected on a parcel of land which does not abut a public street a minimum width of twentyfive 25 feet the use of an easement for purposes of abutting a lot with a public street shall not comply with this regulation b in all residential districts rdistricts no dwelling except those located in a planned development or in an approved lot split or smallscale plat shall be erected on a lot which does not abut at least one 1 public street for at least fifty 50 feet except that a minimum street abutment distance of twentyfive 25 feet shall apply to properties of an irregular shape provided that a minimum building line width of fifty 50 feet is met at the required front yard setback line measured from the street rightofway line a singlefamily dwelling may be erected on a flag lot as defined herein and permitted within the lot split and smallscale plat process procedures subdivisions division 2 lot split and division 4 smallscale plat where the width of such lot does not entirely abut a dedicated public street the use of an easement for purposes of abutting a lot with a public street shall not comply with this requirement c residential development may be developed with private roads that meet the private street standards of this chapter so long as 1 the proposed development having direct access onto a private street shall be connected to a public street and such private road shall be improved to public local street standards at a minimum 2 no road intended to be private is planned to be extended to serve property outside that development 3 the standards set forth in thru 30230 are complied with 4 the subdivider demonstrates to the satisfaction of the planning and zoning commission and city council that the private roads will be properly maintained at a minimum a provision for same shall be incorporated in the articles of the maintenance association see division 3 operating and maintenance of this chapter 5 no final plat that shows lots served by private streets may be recorded unless the final plat contains the following notations a further subdivision of any lot shown on this plat as served by a private street shall be prohibited b all owners of land included by this plat shall be subject to any assessment of costs required to correct deficiencies caused by substandard construction and hold the city of titusville harmless for any accident or injury to persons or property that may result therefrom 6 the recorded plat of any subdivision that includes a private road shall clearly state that such road is a private road further the initial purchaser of a newly created lot served by a private road shall be furnished by the seller with a disclosure statement outlining the maintenance responsibilities for the road d the following general requirements shall apply to all subdivision streets within the corporate limits of the city 1 paving road base and paving shall be installed in accordance with the specifications and standards set forth in the transportation infrastructure technical manual the developer shall be responsible for all construction costs for all streets within and abutting the proposed subdivision necessitated by said subdivision 2 curbs and gutters curbs and gutters shall be installed in all streets in accordance with the transportation infrastructure technical manual f streets within apartments townhouses etc may be private provided they meet the construction standards adopted by road and sidewalk requirements a sidewalks shall be constructed along any lot or parcel of ground abutting any public or private street on which a permit for new construction is granted except as provided herein such sidewalks shall be of concrete and shall be inspected by the city no building permits shall be issued by the administrator nor shall a certificate of occupancy be issued unless such sidewalks are shown with elevations on the plans for construction unless the requirement for sidewalks is specifically waived by the administrator based upon the following criteria 1 there are future plans for widening or improving the abutting road rightofway within five 5 years and the construction of the sidewalk would be currently imprudent 2 the lot or parcel is located on a local street within an existing unplattedplatted subdivision where over seventyfive 75 percent of the lots are developed and no sidewalks exist adjoining the developed lots 3 when the construction of the required sidewalk is programmed within the proposed capital improvements program or funds have been appropriated for its construction assessment program or other funding mechanisms 4 no certificate of occupancy shall be issued by the administrator until required sidewalks are constructed or the requirements for sidewalks are waived or delayed as provided herein when the requirements for sidewalks are deemed by the administrator to be not practical monetary contributions to the sidewalk trust fund shall be made required as described in paragraph c below prior to the issuance of a certificate of occupancy the provision of payment into the sidewalk trust fund shall not be eligible for a variance before the board of adjustment and appeals b sidewalk standards as set forth per the transportation infrastructure technical manual c sidewalk trust fund 1 there is hereby established a sidewalk trust fund to be used for the deposit maintenance and distribution of all monetary contributions made in lieu of constructing a sidewalk pursuant to of this or a trail pursuant to of this sidewalk trust fund shall be administered by the citys public works department and shall be appropriated within the citys roads and streets capital improvement fund and approved by the city council annually or as contributions are made to the trust fund all contributions made pursuant to of this be monetary payments into the sidewalk trust fund all contributions made to and interest derived from the sidewalk trust fund shall be used solely for the purpose of constructing upgrading or improving sidewalks along or on public streets within the city limits 2 if a sidewalk is required by this but the construction of the sidewalk is determined to be not practical then the property owner or permit applicant shall make a contribution to the sidewalk trust fund 3 the administrator shall make the decision as to whether the construction of a sidewalk is not practical the following factors shall be utilized in making such a decision a the project does not meet the waiver requirements in paragraph b above  b there is no connectivity for the required sidewalk  and c the required sidewalk will provide functional pedestrian access when connectivity is created 4 the sidewalk trust fund fee shall be established by city council resolution the fees shall be set on per linear foot of street frontage basis and shall be calculated as one hundred 100 percent of the average of the sidewalk construction costs on a per linear foot of street frontage basis as established by the city d appeals appeals of the administrators determination as to the practicality of installing required sidewalks shall be processed as described in b if the appeal is granted by the board of adjustment and appeals the applicant shall make the required payment into the citys sidewalk trust fund  22817 bicycle facilities a all developments are required to construct those bicycle facilities designated in the titusville trailways plan that abut their project in lieu of construction developments may complete all engineering and site work to construct the bicycle facility including dedication of the required easement to the city of titusville if necessary and make a monetary contribution to the sidewalk trust fund equivalent to a sidewalk as described in c of this facilities shall at a minimum meet the standards adopted by fdot for bicycle facilities and the transportation infrastructure technical manual the provision of payment into the sidewalk trust fund shall not be eligible for a variance before the board of adjustment and appeals b if it is contemplated that state controlled roads will provide bicycle paths within the road pavement area then pedestrian sidewalks only will be required the administrator shall make the final determination c lighting curbouts slope vertical clearance as set forth per the transportation infrastructure technical manual  22817 street names and house numbers a street names proposed streets which are obviously in alignment with existing streets shall bear the assigned name of the existing street in no other case shall the name for proposed streets duplicate or be phonetically similar to existing street names new street names within a subdivision are named as part of the plat approval process renaming of existing streets shall require the approval of the city council upon recommendation of the planning and zoning commission and shall comply with the provisions below 1 street renaming a proposed street renaming may be initiated by either the city on its own initiative or by the filing of a complete application with the city in accordance with the procedures set forth herein all street name changes shall be for the entire length of the street however a segment of a street may be renamed if that segment is created by the intersection of a collector or arterial street a application to be deemed complete an application for a street renaming shall include the following information in addition to any other information that the administrator may generally require for a street renaming application 1 a signed notarized consent to change street name form executed by at least seventy 70 percent of the owners of those properties abutting the segment of the street to be renamed the consent to change street name form shall be in a format provided by the city no consent shall be valid if it is executed more than one hundred twenty 120 days prior to the date of submission of the application the applicant shall submit a complete list of all owners of property abutting the street to be renamed this requirement shall not apply to a city initiated application 2 any request to rename a street for a person shall include a biography and explanation of the persons importance or relevance to the street city region state or nation any request for any other street name change shall include information and an explanation of the importance or relevance of the proposed name to the street 3 letters from brevard county e911 administration address assignment the titusville public works department and the titusville fire department indicating their recommendationsconcerns regarding the street renaming request shall be included 4 no application shall be processed unless the application is complete all documentation required by this subsection is provided and the application fee is paid b review process 1 the city shall hold two 2 public meetings on the street renaming proposal one 1 public meeting shall be before the planning and zoning commission and one 1 public meeting before the city council a courtesy notice of the public meetings shall be sent by city staff to all owners of property abutting the street to be renamed the courtesy notice shall be mailed to those owners listed on the latest ad valorem tax rolls prepared by the county at the time of mailing at the address listed thereon the notification shall be sent at least ten 10 days prior to the first public meeting and shall include a description of the street to be renamed the proposed name change and the dates for the public meetings notice shall be deemed to have been given when the courtesy notice is deposited in the us mail 2 the street renaming application shall be submitted to the planning and zoning commission for its review and recommendation to the city council 3 naming guidelines in addition to any other information deemed appropriate by council the following information as applicable shall serve as guidelines in consideration of a street renaming application a recognized geographic names b natural historic features c significant historic contributions to the city state or united states d persons of historic service to the city e persons of outstanding civic service to the city f documented community support for the name g emergency 911 and public safety considerations h the cost that the renaming will have on the city or any other person that is or could be materially affected by the name change 4 the namingrenaming of streets is a legislative action of the city council and shall be determined in the councils sole and absolute discretion nothing herein shall be construed as a delegation of any authority to name a street to any other person or entity or to otherwise infringe upon councils legislative authority in this regard c honorary street naming 1 in lieu of renaming a street the council may consider any application submitted pursuant to this section as an application for designation of an honorary street name authorizing an honorary street designation and the appropriate memorial marker to be placed along a street or segment thereof in order to honor a distinguished person place or event 2 streets carrying an honorary designation are not officially renamed but carry a honorary name b uniform numbering system adopted 1 a uniform system of numbering properties and principal buildings as shown on the map known as the property numbering map titusville florida and filed in the office of the administrator and all explanatory matters on said map are hereby adopted and incorporated herein 2 in order to promote more responsive public safety and postal services the following uniform system of assigning street names shall apply a avenue shall be assigned to linear streets aligned on a northsouth axis b street shall be assigned to linear streets aligned on an eastwest axis c road shall be assigned to linear streets aligned on a diagonal axis d drive shall be assigned to curvilinear streets e boulevard shall be assigned to streets on which a vegetated median exists on at least fifty 50 percent of its length f court shall be assigned to streets which terminate in a culdesac g circle shall be assigned to streets which form a connected loop h way or lane shall be assigned to marginal access streets c assignment of numbers 1 all properties parcels of land and principal buildings within the corporate limits of the city of titusville florida shall be identified and numbered by the owners and occupants thereof in conformity with the uniform numbering system adopted in b above provided that all owners and occupants of properties parcels of land and buildings that are not numbered in conformity with said system shall have ninety 90 days from the effective date of these regulations in which to conform 2 each principal building shall exhibit its assigned number on the frontage in which the front entrance of said building is located if a principal building is a multiplefamily structure comprised of four 4 or more dwelling units the principal building shall bear a separate number and each dwelling unit therein shall affix a letter suffix or apartment number suffix to the building number 3 numerals indicating the official numbers for each principal building or each front entrance to such buildings shall be posted in a manner as to be clearly visible and distinguishable from the street on which the property is located such numerals shall be a minimum of three 3 inches in height and onehalf 12 inch in width and of a contrasting color with the building d enforcement generally if the owner or occupant of any building required to be numbered by this article shall neglect for the period of thirty 30 days to duly attach and maintain the proper number on such building the building inspector shall serve upon him a notice requiring such owner or occupant to properly number same and if he neglects to do so for ten 10 days after the service of such notice he shall be deemed to have violated this article each day that a violation continues to exist shall constitute a separate offense street requirements street design requirements are set forth in transportation infrastructure technical manual required access points a residential development shall have one 1 or more means of access as described below the design of the collector or arterial roadways providing access to the subdivision shall be constructed in accordance with the manual of uniform minimum standards for design construction and maintenance for streets and highways florida greenbook as determined by the city number of households lots or units number of access routes 1100 one 1 101200 two 2 except as described below 201600 two 2 601 + three 3 except as described below residential developments between one hundred one 101 and two hundred 200 households lots or units may be approved by the authority having jurisdiction ahj defined as the fire chief or designee with only one 1 point of access if in the opinion of the ahj equivalent safety measures consistent with nfpa standards are implemented subdivisions with six hundred one 601 or more lots or units shall have three 3 means of egress and ingress unless in the opinion of the ahj equivalent safety measures consistent with nfpa standards are implemented secs 3024330250  reserved division 8  utilities subdivision 1  utility requirements utility ownership and easement rights a in any case in which a developer installs or causes the installation of water sewer electrical power telephone or cable television facilities and intends that such facilities shall be owned operated or maintained by a public utility or any entity other than the developer the developer shall transfer to such utility or entity the necessary ownership or easement rights to enable the utility or entity to operate and maintain such facilities b utility and other easements shall be provided as follows 1 utility easement not less than twenty 20 feet in total width centered on rear or side lot lines where deemed necessary by the city 2 contingency easements centered on side lot lines of every lot at least ten 10 feet in width contingency easements shall be for the purpose of repair extension or maintenance of public facilities and utilities by public agencies and may be shown on the plat by note c storm drainage sanitary sewer and water distribution systems shall be designed by an engineer installed by the developer or subdivider and approved by the city prior to formal acceptance of ownership by the city ordinances reference connection to the sewage disposal system  2179 sewage disposalwater supply facilities required a the cost of trunk line extensions for either water or sewer when required for the development of a site or a subdivision shall be paid by the developer thereof in the event the council should determine in its sole discretion that the extension of a water or sewer trunk line shall be for the common good of various areas or lands abutting thereon or capable of being served thereby and it shall be determined by council that the extension provides specific benefit to said lands areas or lots to be served the economic cost of providing said extension shall be shared on an equal basis by all of such properties receiving said benefits in no event shall the city be required to extend any such trunk line or pay the cost thereof except upon its own volition and after appropriate action of the council b sanitary sewer and water distribution systems shall be designed by an engineer installed by the developer or subdivider and approved by the city c the city shall have the sole and absolute discretion to determine if the distribution shall be owned by the city or maintained by the developer electric power every principal use and every lot within a subdivision shall have available to it a source of electric power adequate to accommodate the reasonable needs of such use and lot within such subdivision telephone service every principal use and every lot within a subdivision must have available to it a telephone service cable adequate to accommodate the reasonable needs of such use and every lot within such subdivision underground utilities all utility lines telephone cable tv power shall be placed underground with the exception of major transmission corridors utilities to be consistent with internal and external development a whenever it can reasonably be anticipated that utility facilities constructed in one 1 development will be extended to serve other adjacent or nearby developments such utility facilities eg water or sewer lines shall be located and constructed so that extensions can be made conveniently and without undue burden or expense or unnecessary duplication of service b all utility facilities shall be constructed in such a manner as to minimize interference with pedestrian or vehicular traffic and to facilitate maintenance without undue damage to improvements or facilities located within the development asbuilt drawings required whenever a developer installs or causes to be installed any utility line in any public rightofway the developer shall as soon as practicable after installation is complete and before acceptance of any water or sewer line furnish the city with a reproducible drawing that shows the exact location of such utility lines such drawings must be verified as accurate by the utility service provider compliance with this requirement shall be a condition of the continued validity of the permit authorizing such development fire hydrants a the number and location of fire hydrants shall be approved by the city and shall meet the requirements of fire insurance underwriters or similar formula b the following amendments to the standard fire hereby adopted 1 the standard fire herein repealed and replaced with the following fire hydrants shall be installed and operational prior to the issuance of a building permit for the construction of a building for all development including singlefamily subdivisions multifamily subdivisions townhouses condominiums apartments office complexes shopping centers industrial development marinas mobile home parks and subdivisions and other similar development this requirement shall be deemed to be satisfied when an operational fire hydrant capable of delivering the necessary flow is located within the prescribed distance measured along a paved rightofway or inspected and approved private road or driveway the prescribed distance for fire hydrant spacing is two hundred fifty 250 feet between hydrants in compact commercial industrial and multifamily areas and not more than five hundred 500 feet in detached singlefamily district maximum deadend distance shall not exceed two hundred 200 feet 2 a new subsection is herein added to b which reads fire department connections shall be sited at the discretion of a fire official all plans and specifications for any fire suppression system shall be designed and sealed by a florida registered engineer or approval approved factory built systems permits for these systems will only be issued for a florida licensed contractor in accordance with state statutes the fees for permits shall be based on valuation of the installation of the system in accordance with appendix k of the standard building the administrative fee outlined in the fee schedule for construction permits no installation of fire suppression systems including underground piping from the municipal water supply stand pipes and sprinkler systems can be contacted contracted or subcontracted to any company or individual not licensed in accordance with applicable statutes ordinances reference fire code adopted  91 screening of dumpsters refuse facilities shall be located only in the side yards or rear yards except when such yard is adjacent to a collectorarterial street as designated in the citys roadway classification map such facilities must be constructed of an architectural surface similar to that of the principal buildings and screened from view secs 3026030165  reserved subdivision 2  water and sewers sewage  sewer connections compulsory  connection required a it shall be the duty of the owner or agent of all improved property located within the city upon which property there is situated a building or structure from which liquid human sewage may be generated and there is an available city sanitary sewer line to connect to city sewer system b for purposes of this regulation subdivision available shall mean 1 the city sewage system is not under a moratorium  2 the city sewage system has adequate hydraulic capacity to accept the quantity of sewage to be generated by the proposed establishment  3 for all singlefamily residences or for establishments with estimated sewage flows of six hundred 600 or less gallons per day a sewerage system shall be considered available if a sewer line exists in a public easement or rightofway which abuts the property and if gravity flow can be maintained from the building drain to the sewer line  4 for estimated sewage flows exceeding six hundred 600 gallons per day with the exception of singlefamily residences a sewerage system shall be considered available if a sewer line force main or lift station exists in a public easement or rightofway which abuts the property or within one hundred 100 feet of the property as accessed via rightsofway or easements 5 for areas zoned or used for industrial or manufacturing purposes or its equivalent a sewer line existing within onequarter 14 mile of the development as accessed via easements or rightsofway shall be considered available for repair or modification purposes an available sewer is any sewer line within five hundred 500 feet of the building sewer stub out as accessed via rightsofway or easements c in the event the owner or agent has failed to connect to the sewer line after notification that a city sewer line is available the city shall charge and collect a sewer service charge even though the building or structure is not connected to the city sanitary sewer line in the total amount established in of the of ordinances d every building or structure from which human waste may be generated is hereby required to have a sanitary water closet connected with the city sanitary sewage system where a city sanitary sewage system is available and if none is available the owner or agent of said building or structure shall have a sanitary method of human waste disposal namely have an approved type of septic tank or a sanitary privy and obtain a permit therefor from the county health department or such other applicable agency e the city of titusville hereby encourages the conservation of energy and resource and hereby authorizes the owner or agents of residential property to install a gray water system which is defined as a sewage system which retains waste from showers bathtubs laundries lavatories clothes washers laundry tubs and bar sinks onsite in a drain field or in a recirculating retention tank or other approved type of disposal system approved by the brevard county health department other waste generated from toilets dishwashers floor drains kitchen sinks latrines etc would continue to be disposed city sanitary sewage system the provisions of this subsection shall not apply to industrial business commercial office buildings or other nonresidential users f every new subdivision regardless of distance shall be required to connect to the city sewage system unless expressly waived as provided in the subdivision regulations g any existing improved property upon which there is a building or structure from which liquid human sewage may be generated and not currently connected to the city sewage system shall be required to connect to the city sewage system within three hundred sixtyfive 365 days of notification that a sewer line is available as defined above and located within a public easement or rightofway which abuts the property and pay all applicable fees 1 any existing building or structure which applies for a plumbing permit or increases its sewage flow because of modification or expansion of said building or structure shall be required to connect to the city sewage system if the building or structure meets the available criteria specified in 3 above h in the event any new development is required to connect to the city sewage system and the city does not have currently available plan capacity or line capacity or currently is under a moratorium prohibiting the issuance of additional wetline sewage connection system permits or building permits then in that event the city will process a dry line permit in accordance with of the land development regulations and application fder regulations provided the new development complies with all applicable city codes and regulations and department of health and rehabilitative services regulations applicable to onsite sewage disposal system if an onsite sewage disposal system permit is granted the new development shall be required to install all of the necessary dry lines and associated equipment to connect to the city system when the city system is available at the time of the development 1 the city shall within fortyfive 45 days connect the development to the city sewage system after written notification to the owner that the city system is available 2 the city shall require any new development receiving an onsite sewage disposal system permit to escrow such funds or monies with the city to cover the cost of connection of said system to the city sewage system and applicable connection and tapon fees water and sewer utility construction site plan review and permit review fees water resources utility construction site plan review and permit review service fees may be imposed by the city and shall be included with the land development regulations and permit review fees of the ordinances secs 3026830270  reserved division 9  parkingloadingstorage subdivision 1  general requirements purpose in addition to the requirements of this article all developments shall adhere to the parking and dimensional standards set forth in the transportation infrastructure technical manual number of parking spaces required the number of parking spaces are set forth in transportation infrastructure technical manual number of parking spaces required credit for required parking spaces a for industrial and office purposes only a reduction may be given to the number of required parking spaces provided the following conditions are met 1 applicant must submit a transportation plan for their operation detailing how employees will be utilizing different modes of transportation to and from work 2 applicant must demonstrate a reasonable number of their employees will be utilizing bus service ride share van pooling or any combination thereof 3 applicant must submit a site plan which will maintain sufficient land available to reinstate all required parking if applicants transportation plan should not be implemented or subsequently terminated parking space dimensions the parking space dimensions are set forth in transportation infrastructure technical manual parking design standards required widths of parking area aisles and driveways parking drive aisle and driveway widths are set forth in transportation infrastructure technical manual parking design standards general design requirements a unless no other practical alternative is available vehicle accommodation areas shall be designed so that without resorting to extraordinary movements vehicles may exit such areas without backing onto a public street the requirement does not apply to parking areas consisting of driveways that serve one 1 dwelling unit although backing onto highway major arterial or minor arterial streets is not allowed b vehicle accommodation areas of all development shall be designed so that sanitation emergency and other public service vehicles can serve such developments without the necessity of backing unreasonable distances or making other dangerous or hazardous turning movements c every vehicle accommodation area shall be designed so that vehicles cannot extend beyond the perimeter of such area onto adjacent properties or public rightsofway such areas shall also be designed so that vehicles do not extend over sidewalks or tend to bump against or damage any wall vegetation or other obstruction d circulation areas shall be designed so that vehicles can proceed safely without posing a danger to pedestrians or other vehicles and without interfering with parking areas e impervious parking lot requirements in the area of critical concern as set forth per division 6 stormwater area of critical concern performance standards joint use of required parking spaces a to the extent that developments that wish to make joint use of the same parking spaces operate at different times the same spaces may be credited to both uses in order to be eligible for this credit a parking analysis of the uses included must be provided to and accepted by the administrator b if the joint use of the same parking spaces by two 2 or more principal uses involves satellite parking spaces then the provisions of are also applicable satellite parking a if the number of offstreet parking spaces required by this chapter cannot reasonably be provided on the same lot where the principal use associated with these parking spaces is located then spaces may be provided on adjacent or nearby lots in accordance with the provisions of this section these offsite spaces are referred to in this section as satellite parking spaces b all such satellite parking spaces must be located within four hundred 400 feet of a public entrance of a principal building housing the use associated with such parking or within four hundred 400 feet of the lot on which the use associated with such parking is located if the use is not housed within any principal building such satellite spaces shall be utilized or assigned to employees of the building served c the developer wishing to take advantage of the provisions of this section must present satisfactory written evidence of ownership or lease for at least ten 10 years the developer must also sign an acknowledgment that the continuing validity of his permit depends upon his continuing ability to provide the requisite number of parking spaces curbing curbing requirements are set forth per parking lot curbing and tire stops of the transportation infrastructure technical manual loading and unloading areas a the general application of this section requires that whenever the normal operation of any development requires that goods merchandise or equipment be routinely delivered to or shipped from that development a sufficient offstreet loading and unloading area must be provided in accordance with this section to accommodate the delivery or shipment operations in a safe and convenient manner loading and unloading area requirements are set forth per loading and unloading areas of the transportation infrastructure technical manual b whenever i there exists a lot with one 1 or more structures on it constructed before the effective date of this chapter and ii a change in use that does not involve any enlargement of a structure is proposed for such lot and iii the loading area requirements of this section cannot be satisfied because there is not sufficient area available on the lot that can practically be used for loading and unloading then the developer need only comply with this section to the extent reasonably possible excessive parking required offstreet parking areas for all uses shall be required to have all spaces covered in an impervious allweather hard surface with the remainder to be in a clearly defined approved stabilized area to accommodate overflow parking  shall be marked to indicate driving lanes parking spaces and if appropriate direction of vehicular movement  and shall be maintained in good condition and clearly marked at all times impervious parking in excess of one hundred twentyfive 125 percent of that required by this section shall be prohibited unless approved by the administrator onstreet parking regulations onstreet parking regulations including the travel trailers campers or boat trailers wrecker trucks emergency parking of disabled vehicles and construction related parking are set forth per traffic and motor vehicles of the ordinances onstreet parking credit a the following zoning districts may utilize onstreet parking allowance parking strategy located in of the transportation infrastructure technical manual 1 downtown mixed use dmu 2 urban mixed use umu  111417 secs 3028430290  reserved subdivision 2  downtown mixeduse dmu parking requirements parking standards in the downtown mixeduse dmu zoning district a it is the intent of this section to provide parking requirements for any and all areas covered by the downtown mixeduse dmu zoning district guidelines the purpose of these regulations is to provide flexibility within the dmu zoning district and create a pedestrian oriented core within the city b downtown mixeduse dmu zoning district boundaries the boundaries of the downtown mixeduse zoning district dmu are the same as the boundaries of the downtown community redevelopment area with the exception of the residential historic preservation zoning district see zoning downtown mixeduse smart  c parking requirements including the number of spaces required aisle and space dimensions loading requirements queuing for drivevisibility and access to offstreet parking are set forth per in transportation infrastructure technical manual downtown mixeduse parking requirements secs 3029230300  reserved division 10  landscaping subdivision 1  landscaping requirements intent the intent of this section is to establish standards that enhance the citys appearance and encourage sustainable practices this section establishes sustainable landscaping practices that will maintain a healthy landscape for a prolonged period of time with extremely low water usage and lowminimal maintenance requirements applicability the standards set forth herein prescribe the regulations applicable to all development in the city additional standards applicable to the downtown mixeduse dmu zoning are specified in subdivision 8 of this division where there is a conflict the most restrictive regulation shall apply standards a landscape areas include buffers subdivision 3 buffers and screening streetscape landscaping subdivision 4 streetscape landscaping building landscaping subdivision 5 building landscaping and parking lot landscaping subdivision 7 parking lot landscaping of this article this article applies to the applications described in the applicability of standards table to ensure that the landscaping provided is adequate to meet the intent of this article the following items shall be addressed with labels and notation on the landscaping plan where appropriate 1 native vegetation is preferred and encouraged to be drought tolerant newly installed plant materials are encouraged to be drought tolerant species areas to be preserved in their natural state shall meet the requirements of the regulations for other areas a listing of said species is available for reference in the landscape technical manual 2 all other areas all property except for land utilized for principal structures accessory structures offstreet parking areas other vehicular use areas and required landscaped areas shall be landscaped with grass ground cover shrubs or trees other areas 3 clearing clearing of development sites shall not be allowed prior to the issuance of a site clearing permit and shall be consistent with these regulations within the area of critical concern see special districts and overlays area of critical concern overlay an approved phased clearing plan showing cut and fill quantities to be moved onsite is required 4 installation all landscaping shall be installed in a sound workmanlike manner and according to accepted good planting practice including mulched areas around appropriate species so as to protect and present a finished appearance with the quality of plant materials as hereinafter described a qualified representative of the city of titusville or designated qualified agent shall inspect all landscaping and no certificates of occupancy or similar authorization will be issued unless the landscaping meets the requirements provided herein 5 materials subdivision 2 of this division 6 yards subdivision 3 of this division 7 streetscape where applicable subdivision 4 of this division 8 building landscaping subdivision 5 of this division 9 maintenance subdivision 6 of
