of division 3 landscape yard bufferscreening maintenance and inspections a the health and viability of all required landscape materials on the site whether preserved or newly planted must be maintained care or replacement in perpetuity after issuance of the certificate of occupancy certificate of completion or restoration as may be required to resolve a code violation b for multifamily residential subdivisions commercial institutional public and industrial projects failure to have viable landscape materials or preserved areas consistent with the approved landscape plan after the issuance of the certificate of occupancy or certificate of completion shall constitute a violation failure to remove nonnative invasive plants and control regrowth prior to the final landscaping inspection is a violation and shall be enforced the city reserves the right to enter property to make the necessary inspections c an onsite inspection shall be conducted prior to the approval of the land clearing permit continuing maintenance required a any person owning or occupying the site shall have the continuing duty and obligation to maintain or cause the maintenance of all landscaping required pursuant to this article by the approved site plan landscape plan or this compliance with the following minimum maintenance standards 1 all landscaping and landscape areas shall be maintained so as to present a neat and orderly appearance 2 all dead plant material shall be promptly replaced with plant material meeting the requirements of the approved site plan and landscape plan 3 trees and palms that are removed excessively pruned dead or beyond recovery shall be replaced redevelopment all property where there is redevelopment proposed or where an addition or an increase in impervious surface to an existing development is proposed shall be required to comply with this division to the greatest extent possible as determined by the administrator the administrator shall also utilize the criteria specified in general provisions division 2 administrative exceptions standards for administrative exceptions when addressing the redevelopment provision of this section interpretation of terms where necessary to interpret the precise meaning of technical landscaping terms used in this division reference shall be made to definitions landscape plan a all developments shall have a landscaping plan prepared by a licensed landscape architect or certified nursery professional and shall be installed in accordance with the requirements of this article and shall include 1 location and size of each landscape yard public private and service areas 2 a table that includes the landscape materials the table should include the following  genus species and common name of plants  number of each plant type existing and size  number of each plant type removed and size  number of each plant type installed and size  species of each plant removed or installed  locations of each plant type and size and  type of sod groundcover shrub and trees 3 an irrigation plan with the identification of wateruse zones including building perimeter yards buffers screens parking and streetscape where applicable a high or oasis wateruse zones areas requiring regular watering this zone is highly visible high maintenance areas of the landscape such as the area closest to the property structure where plants are watered regularly in the absence of rainfall b moderate or droughttolerant wateruse zones landscape areas requiring occasional watering plants established in this zone requires watering only when they wilt or show other symptoms of moisture stress c low or tolerant wateruse zones wateruse zones landscape areas requiring low or natural rainfall watering and would not require irrigation 4 location and size of areas to be preserved in a natural state landscaping and screening landscaping and screening standards are set forth per subdivision 3 landscape yard bufferscreening of this division secs 3031030320  reserved subdivision 2  landscape materials plant materials a quality plant material used in conformance with the provisions of this article shall be good healthy and sturdy plants all plant material shall be florida #1 grade or better plant materials which are known to be intolerant of paving environments or whose physical characteristics may be injurious to the public or which produce a quantity andor quality of debris so as to present maintenance difficulties shall not be specified for use under this article b native vegetation the applicant is encouraged to utilize plant material native to brevard county in meeting these landscaping requirements the existing vegetation that is native to brevard county with the exception of that listed in d shall be preserved and utilized except when removal is justified and determined to be acceptable by the enforcement official see landscape technical manual c ground cover ground covers other than grass shall be planted in such a manner so as to present a finished appearance and reasonably complete coverage within six 6 months after planting see landscape technical manual d lawn grass grass areas shall be planted in species normally grown as permanent lawns in brevard county seeding and sprigging may be used if grass cover is complete within six 6 months or sodding will be required see landscape technical manual e hedges hedges where required shall be planted in sufficient number and maintained so as to form a continuous unbroken solid screen within a maximum of six 6 months after time of planting see landscape technical manual f synthetic plants prohibited synthetic or artificial material in the form of trees shrubs ground covers vines or artificial turf shall not be used in lieu of the plant requirements in this section g overstory trees overstory trees shall be species having an average mature spread of crown of greater than twenty 20 feet and reach a mature height of at least sixty 60 feet and having a trunk which can be maintained in a clean condition with over five 5 feet of clear wood no branches trees including palms having an average mature spread of crown less than twenty 20 feet may be arranged in groupings so as to create the equivalent of twentyfoot crown spread and shall count as one 1 required tree invasives shall not be used to fulfill the requirements of this article see landscape technical manual h caliper plant materials required by this section shall comply with the minimum size requirements of table 305 minimum landscape planting specifications at the time of installation plant height shall be measured from the average grade level of the immediate planting area to the top horizontal plane of the shrub at planting  for singletrunk trees the measurement shall be taken six 6 inches above grade level  for multitrunk trees the tree shall be measured from the average grade level of the immediate planting area i planting areas and shrubs planting areas shall consist of permeable surface areas only the permeable surface areas for shrubs may be included with permeable surface areas required for trees j pavement edges each overstory coniferous understory tree or shrub shall be planted at least twelve 12 inches from the edge of any paved surface k irrigation irrigation must be indicated on the landscape plan any landscape area must be shown by water tolerant usage area minimum size of plantingsgrading of planting a in the case of multistory buildings tree caliper shall increase at twentyfive 25 percent per floor up to four 4 floors above ground level b in the event a site plan layout does not have adequate open space to accommodate required plant quantities such quantities per species can be combined into less quantities per species provided total required height or caliper is maintained and approved by the administrator c all newly installed plants shall meet the requirements established in table percent of the required landscape area for a commercial development shall utilize low and moderate tolerant water usage mixed vegetation native trees and shrubs are preferred the city can supply the applicant with a list of approved mixed low and moderate tolerant water usage vegetation upon request see landscape technical manual c industrial development 1 ten 10 percent of the required landscape area for an industrial development shall utilize low and moderate tolerant water usage mixed vegetation native trees and shrubs are preferred the city can supply the applicant with a list of approved mixed low and moderate tolerant water usage vegetation upon request see landscape technical manual 2 industrial development may consolidate all required landscaping between the public rightofway and the building for example the required planting materials in a building perimeter landscape strip for the entire perimeter of the proposed structure may be consolidated along the front edge of the building as the minimum plant materials will be consolidated along the front of the building the remainder of the perimeter will not require a building perimeter landscape strip this consolidation can be applied to required building perimeter landscape strips and required landscape yards except as noted below this regulation shall not be construed to not require landscaping between the building and any public rightofway 3 required landscape yards may only be consolidated between the building and public rightofway for property lines that abut other industrial development or zoning districts for each tree secs 3032530330  reserved subdivision 3  landscape yard bufferscreen applicability a this section applies to any of the following 1 provides landscaped separation between landuse intensities where appropriate  2 screens from view certain land uses that may create visual clutter and distraction  and 3 provides for increases in the width and opacity of the landscape buffer yard as the landuse intensity of the new or expanded development increases b landscape yard landscaped area measured from the property line to a depth as prescribed in the code the term includes landscape strip landscape buffer buffer yard and landscape screen in a platted subdivision the required landscape yard shall be located in a separate tract or common area to be maintained by the homeowners area of the parking facilities to be provided 4 interior finish work or remodeling in a portion of a building unless the work results in an increase in the paving area of the parking facilities within the street yard or in an enlargement of the exterior dimensions of an existing building 5 any use building or structure for which only a change of use is requested and which requires no structural modifications that increase its volume or scale 6 singlefamily dwellings located on an existing lot of record 7 residential lots all residential lots shall provide a minimum of one 1 boulevard tree planted between the curb and lot line and one 1 front yard tree planted between the lot line and the front building line  121118 reduction in required landscape yards any landscape areas reduced in required landscape yard type table are met the applicant shall retain as much of the existing native vegetation towards the buffer or landscape yard requirement visual buffer and screening requirements a a screen refers to a visual barrier designed to separate differing land use intensities and to remove service bays outdoor storage and handling areas and trash receptacles from public view 1 a screen shall be a continuous hedge or a solid wood or masonry wall fence an earth berm may be used in concert to achieve a portion of the required height 2 said screen shall be a minimum of six 6 feet in height in the case of a hedge it must reach the required height and provide a continuous one hundred 100 percent opaque screen within six 6 months from installation note said hedge shall not be credited against the requirements established in the landscape yard standards table b fences and walls used for visual buffer and screening shall meet the following standards 1 fences and walls shall be a minimum of six 6 feet in height 2 fences and walls shall be solid and one hundred 100 percent opaque 3 fence materials shall be a minimum of a onehalfinch thick and shall be made of wood precast concrete or other similar materials 4 corrugated andor galvanized steel or metal sheets are not permitted 5 walls may be concreted concrete block with stucco finish masonry stone or a combination of these materials 6 support posts shall be placed on and face toward the inside of the developing property so that the surface of the wall or fence is smooth on the abutting property side c berms used for visual buffer and screening shall meet the following standards 1 berms shall have a slope not greater than the slope created in three 3 horizontal feet with a one 1 foot vertical rise 2 the surface of the berm that is not planted with trees and shrubs shall be covered with grass perennial ground cover vines and woody and herbaceous perennials with mulch 3 grass or other coverings shall be maintained in conformance with applicable city of titusville codes d parking stalls shall be screened from the view of neighboring uses and from the street screening for parking stalls shall meet the following standards 1 the screen shall be a minimum of thirty 30 inches in height 2 the screen shall be an architecturally compatible solid masonry wall earth berm or shrubbery hedge planted three 3 feet on center or any combination thereof 3 if shrubbery is used it shall meet the minimum height within six 6 months and the shrubbery shall not be credited towards any other required landscaping e dumpster enclosures shall be required to meet the following standards 1 dumpsters shall be screened with a fence or wall that meet the standards of subsection b above 2 enclosures shall have a perimeter landscape strip clear of all doors and accessways five 5 feet wide and shall be planted with shrubs three 3 feet on center grass andor ground cover 3 dumpster enclosures shall be oriented such that the opening is not exposed to public view or shall be screened as provided for above f offstreet loading spaces refuse and outdoor storage areas antennas satellite dishes and mechanical equipment shall be screened from all public streets the screening shall be a minimum of six 6 feet in height or a height sufficient to obscure the area or equipment requiring the screening whichever is less the screening may be provided by plants a fence or wall that meets the standards in b or a combination of walls and plants the height of plants shall be based on reaching their size of maturity within five 5 growing seasons g planned industrial development pid in addition to the requirements of no offstreet loading area shall be located in a required front yard or within ten 10 feet of a side or rear property line such loading facilities that are visible only to another lot shall be screened to fifty 50 percent opaqueness using a combination of berms shrubs trees fencing andor architectural design utilities utility companies shall provide landscape yards for electrical substations water pumpingstorage sites and wastewater treatment plants the buffer shall comply with the requirements for a public row per exhibit a described in the required landscape yard type table secs 3034130350  reserved subdivision 4  streetscape streetscape a streets classified as boulevards shall have boulevard trees planted at an interval of at least one 1 per one hundred 100 feet between the edge of pavement and the property line these trees shall not be credited to the required minimum landscaping under c minimum landscape planting specifications table b b2e uniform numbering system adopted states that boulevards are defined as streets on which a vegetated median exists on a least fifty 50 percent of its length secs 3035230360  reserved subdivision 5  building landscaping applicability this section applies to any commercial industrial mixeduse or multifamily structure that has a building footprint that exceeds one thousand 1000 square feet standards a building landscaping shall abut the building and shall be used or installed in such a manner as to screen mechanical equipment attached to or adjacent to the building provide direction to and enhance entrances and enhance walkways and provide visual breaks along blank building facades building landscaping is required on all building sides except those sides facing an alley openings for overhead or loadingarea doors motor vehicle bays or entrances to the building or the perimeter of attached or detached canopies landscaping buffering and screening for loading areas vehicle bays service areas are set forth in visual buffer and screening requirements b all development except residential all buildings shall have a fivefoot wide perimeter landscape strip adjacent to the building clear of all doors and accessways c this area shall be planted with shrubs three 3 feet on center grass andor ground cover d variations to this requirement may be approved by the administrator providing that the original intent and purpose of this section is met and there are unusual circumstances provided to the administrator at a minimum an equal area shall be set aside within the development for any building perimeter landscape reduction e note native vegetation is preferred and encouraged to be drought tolerant a listing of said species is available for reference in the landscape technical manual as updated regularly by the administrator see k irrigation secs 3036330370  reserved subdivision 6  plant area maintenance maintenance the owner tenant and their agent if any shall be jointly and severally responsible for the maintenance of all landscaping which shall be maintained to present a healthy neat and orderly appearance at all times and shall be kept free from refuse and debris the property owner tenant or their agent shall provide weeding mowing of grass irrigation fertilization prevention of pests pruning and other maintenance of all plantings as needed the pruning of trees shall be to establish a central leader except for multitrunk species and minimize codominant stem growth all landscape material shall be maintained so as to provide for access for utilities emergency services and vehicles maintenance shall include the immediate replacement of all dead plant material the maintenance area also includes adjacent public andor private streets and rightsofway this section shall also apply to all existing landscaped nonresidential areas throughout the city planting standards a plant areas must be protected from vehicular traffic use of concrete curbs wheel stops or other permanent barriers each large tree small tree or large shrub shall be planted at least twelve 12 inches from the edge of any paved surface trees of species whose roots are known to cause damage to public roadways or other public works shall not be planted closer than twelve 12 feet to such public works b soil in all planting areas is to be of suitable quality with adequate ph value and no large aggregates so as to support healthy plant life c trees all newly planted trees shall be planted in a mulched area of at least twentyfive 25 square feet with the minimum dimensions of five 5 feet d landscape islands are to be free of base material or pavement hardpan material should be removed to a depth of four 4 feet irrigation a irrigation a hose bib or other source of irrigation shall be provided within one hundred 100 feet of any landscaped area all proposed commercial industrial and multifamily developments shall provide an irrigation plan as part of the site plan review process outlined in procedures site plan of these regulations this plan shall detail the layout head type coverage area pipe size and water source for the irrigation system the system shall be controlled by an automatic timer with a rain sensor the high moderate and low wateruse zones be labeled on the on the greenspace landscape plan for irrigation purposes this requirement may be waived by the administrator for areas utilizing low water tolerant mixed vegetation b in the planned industrial development pid zoning district underground irrigation shall be required for all front yards corner side yards and rear yards if adjacent to sr 405 us #1 or grissom parkway  or any collectorarterial street as designated in the citys future traffic circulation map such irrigation shall extend to include the public boulevard and into general parking islands except natural areas to be preserved see development options for development standards overhead power lines large species trees shall not be planted under or within fifteen 15 feet of overhead power lines where existing or proposed overhead electric lines conflict with tree canopies required overstory trees may be placed elsewhere within the development to avoid overhead infrastructure secs 3037530380  reserved subdivision 7  parking area landscaping applicability a shading is required for any parking area excluding driveways or garages overstory trees as identified on the approved plant list shall provide shade for parking areas a parking lot does not include an area used exclusively for the display of motor vehicles for sale as part of an automobile dealership b these regulations shall apply to any construction of a new parking lot or expansion of an existing parking lot design a landscape island landscape islands shall be required to break up long continuous rows of parking spaces landscape islands shall meet the following standards 1 landscape islands shall be a minimum of fifteen 15 feet in width 2 landscape islands shall be a minimum of two hundred seventy 270 square feet in total area 3 in no instance shall a parking bay contain more than fifteen 15 continuous parking spaces or extend more than one hundred fifty 150 feet whichever is more restrictive without being broken up by a landscape island 4 these landscape islands must have one 1 overstory tree with a minimum diameter of three 3 inches caliper twelve 12 feet high at the time of planting 5 the remaining landscape island shall contain ten 10 shrubs andor ground cover and be completely covered within six 6 months 6 the required landscaping in these areas shall not be counted towards any other landscaping required by these regulations landscape islands which do not form a peninsula from other landscaped areas shall be planted with trees shrubs andor ground cover the use of grass in these isolated islands is discouraged unless the applicant can demonstrate to the administrators satisfaction that adequate maintenance thereof can be provided 7 sites containing two 2 acres or less may be given consideration for the reduction of the above requirements in a and b by the administrator in no case shall landscaping area be less than ten 10 feet wide and one hundred eighty 180 square feet b terminal island terminal islands shall be required for each row of interior parking spaces to terminate the row of parking terminal islands shall meet the following standards 1 terminal islands shall be a minimum of fifteen 15 feet in width 2 terminal islands shall be a minimum of two hundred forty 240 square feet 3 terminal islands must have one 1 tree of a minimum diameter of three 3 inches caliper twelve 12 feet high at time of planting 4 no shrubs or other landscaping material shall block the visual access between thirty 30 inches and eight 8 feet and shall be maintained as such 5 landscaping areas that terminate two 2 rows of parking in a corner or angle formation shall be required to provide a minimum twenty 20 feet  twenty 20 feet area 6 the required landscaping in these areas shall not be counted towards any other landscaping required by these regulations 7 sites containing two 2 acres or less may be given consideration for the reduction of the above requirements in a and b by the administrator in no case shall a landscape area be less than ten 10 feet wide and one hundred eighty 180 square feet c wherever a row of parking spaces does not face another row of parking spaces or a required landscape area then a landscape strip shall be provided said landscape strip shall have a minimum depth of five 5 feet and shall form a continuous strip between landscape islands and meet the requirements in d d an optional landscape area to separate two 2 rows of headon parking may be provided in cases where parking stalls are allowed to overhang optional landscape islands the administrator may approve a reduction in the required minimum parking stall length dimension not to exceed a minimum dimension of eighteen 18 feet secs 3038330390  reserved subdivision 8  downtown mixeduse dmu landscape standards intent a it is the intent of this section to provide guidelines for the installation of landscape plant material on any and all development and redevelopment sites within the downtown community redevelopment area dcra and covered by the downtown mixeduse zoning district guidelines dmu the design of plantings and irrigation shall be done with the intent of minimizing the use of potable or well water for irrigation landscape plans submitted for projects within the dcra shall be prepared by a landscape architect or a certified nursery professional registered to practice in the state of florida b downtown mixeduse dmu zoning district boundaries the boundaries of the downtown mixeduse zoning district dmu are the same as the boundaries of the downtown community redevelopment area with the exception of the residential historic preservation zoning district see zoning downtown mixed use smart  c plant material shall be selected based on its appropriateness for use on and around the property a percentage of the total cumulative landscape plant material used to meet the provisions of this section shall be moderately or very drought tolerant as classified and listed in the most recent edition of waterwise florida landscapes published by floridas water management districts and as amended as shown in table 3010 landscape requirements d for the purposes of this section open space and landscape areas shall be defined as follows and as specified in division 3 open space of this chapter 1 open space any area of a development site not covered with buildings or vehicular use areas utility equipment pads and other nonaccessible spaces outside of a building shall not be considered open space areas of a site partially covered by trellises loggias pergolas or other commonly used outdoor structures may be counted as open space e the following table governs landscape requirements for developments within the dmu table 3010 landscape requirements in the dmu subdistrict trees overstory and understory hedgeshrubs ground cover minimum planting areas as percentage of total site area unless otherwise noted 1 open space requirements as percentage of total site area irrigation special conditions waivers allowed xeriscape materials civic waterfront equivalent of 2 overstory trees per 100 lineal feet of entire property  6 understory trees per 100 lineal feet of entire property shall not be higher than 3 feet for visibility y 25% 30% y y y 80% uptown equivalent of 3 overstory trees per 50 lineal feet of entire property  6 understory trees per 100 lineal feet of entire property shall not be higher than 3 feet for visibility y 20% 30% y y y 75% downtown decorative planters sidewalk cutouts or window boxes shall be used to provide landscaping and beautification since all of the buildings will be at the edge of the sidewalk na na 5% of front building face planters apply to this requirement na na na only where the distance between the building and roadway is less than 5 feet in width na midtown equivalent of 2 overstory trees per 50 feet of entire property  6 understory trees per 100 lineal feet of entire property shall not be higher than 3 feet for visibility y 10% 10% y y y 50% miscellaneous standards for all landscaping parking lot landscaping where onsite parking is required to be installed by an applicant owner or change of use there shall be 1 landscaped island for every 20 parking spaces to include minimum of 1 overstory tree a minimum of 12 feet in height at the time of planting surrounded by hedge materials and ground cover the landscape island shall be a minimum of 8 feet in any direction measured from back of curb and contain a minimum of 125 square feet other vehicular use area planting areas shall have a minimum dimension of 3 feet in any direction these areas shall be planted with any combination of plant material turf planting is not permitted in vehicular use areas in sites where an island cannot be placed for topographic or other environmental reasons only an alternative of adding 2 additional trees to the front or perimeter landscaping requirements may be permitted by the drc andor cra tree preservation when feasible existing specimen trees should be preserved in place or relocated on site use of tree wells as well as adaptation and variations of siting in order to conserve native vegetation is encouraged crime prevention design principles cpted cpted design principles shall be used to assure safety visibility clear zones and welllighted spaces perimeter area guidelines where required perimeter planting areas shall be a minimum of 7 feet in any direction measured from back of curb and shall be landscaped in accordance with the requirements above streetscape area guidelines the required landscaping may take the form of sidewalk cutouts where possible or use freestanding pots window boxes or raised planters where possible sidewalk cutouts should be a minimum of 16 square feet 4 feet  4 feet generally and should contain 1 street tree or palm the location of any sidewalk cutout or freestanding planter shall be located so as to not obstruct the pedestrianway along the street a minimum 8foot wide pedestrianway should be maintained between any building and the street or parking area where possible planter requirements where planters are used a minimum requirement of 1 planter on each side of the entryway must be met the planters must be at least 10 wide and 10 in depth and constructed in concrete ceramic clay or like material and should be designed to compliment the building colors and architecture tree credits per notes 1 all landscaped areas shall be within required open space areas spacing requirements a plantings are measured as equivalent to the number per linear feet however plantings are required to be clustered rather than placed in a rightofway tree and plant spacing and size specifications shall be as follows 1 overstory trees clusters are to be spaced no less than twentyfive 25 feet and no more than fifty 50 feet apart overstory trees shall constitute at least fifty 50 percent of the required trees 2 palm trees palms shall be clustered in groups of at least three 3 and spaced no less than eight 8 feet apart and no more than fifteen 15 feet apart palm clusters may count as one 1 overstory tree 3 understory trees no less than eight 8 feet and no more than fifty 50 feet between trees or groups of trees 4 shrubsunderstory grasses planted on twentyfour 24 to thirty 30 inch centers 5 ground cover shall be planted at spacing appropriate to achieve full coverage within six 6 months of planting 6 turf use of turf is discouraged  however where it is used it shall be located to facilitate efficient irrigation with a minimum dimension of four 4 feet in any one direction turf may not be used in vehicular use areas b required distances from walls buildings or sidewalk for inground plantings landscape material size requirements at time of planting a landscape material size requirements table 3011 landscape material size requirements at time of planting full spread overstory trees 12 feet in overall height 3inch diameter at 05 feet above grade 45foot crown spread narrow upright overstory trees 12 feet in overall height 2inch diameter at 05 feet above grade 35foot crown spread at 3 feet above ground level understory trees 6 feet in overall height 15foot diameter at 05 feet above grade shrubs min 3 gallon size  18 inch high minimum ground cover min 1 gallon size  full b multitrunk understory trees shall have a combined one and onehalfinchcaliper for all trunks at six 6 inches above grade palm trees used as understory trees shall have an overall height of four 4 feet and may not comprise more than onethird  of the total understory tree requirement c note specimen palms such as canary island bismarck or sylvester with a clear trunk of at least three 3 feet and an overall height of at least twelve 12 feet may count as one 1 overstory tree such a palm may count as two 2 overstory trees if it has a clear trunk of at least eight 8 feet and an overall height of at least eighteen 18 feet specimen palms may comprise no more than fifty 50 percent of the total overstory tree requirement on a site tree preservation credits existing trees preserved or relocated on site that have been determined to be in good health by a certified arborist or by qualified city staff may be credited towards the minimum tree planting requirements existing sustainability alternative energy and green programs the city encourages the use of alternative energy design measures in all sign design incorporating energy efficient lighting solar energy for energy sources recycled materials for cabinetry and other appropriate technologies and techniques the city may utilize and create an incentive program which would allow for enhanced sizes heights coverage areas offpremises or nontypical signage systems when an applicant proposes to incorporate such practices secs 3040230410  reserved article iv  concurrency development orders approval and conditional approval a rezoning applications and annexation requests may be approved  however such approval shall be conditional in nature and shall not entitle the applicant to proceed with the development unless the public facilities are available concurrent with the impacts of development as provided in the citys transportation infrastructure technical manual b preliminary plats preliminary plans and nonresidential site plans may be conditionally approved  however such approval shall be conditional in nature and shall not entitle the applicant to proceed with the development unless the public facilities are available concurrent with the impact of development as provided in the citys transportation infrastructure technical manual c building permits and final plats may be approved if a deficient public facility is scheduled for improvement in the annual capital improvements budget or is under construction or is under contract for construction or is a part of a binding developers agreement requiring the construction of the public facility concurrent with the impacts of the proposed development and the improvements will provide a level of service sufficient to accommodate the potential impact of the proposed development as set forth in the titusville comprehensive plan as further provided in the citys transportation infrastructure technical manual levels of serviceminimum levels of service established level of service used from concurrency reviews are adopted for traffic circulations potable water sanitary sewer recreation and open space solid waste stormwaterdrainage law enforcement and fire protection in the capital improvements element of the city of titusville comprehensive plan the minimum levels of service requirements and calculation methodologies are contained in of the citys concurrency technical design manual annual concurrency report a at least once per year during the initiation of the capital improvement programbudget process a concurrency management report will be drafted by the administrator and forwarded to the planning and zoning commission acting as the local planning agency and the city council the report will serve as a summary of the current status of the concurrency management system and the capital improvement program and provide for recommendations from the lpa and policy direction from the city council at a minimum the report shall contain 1 update of capacities demands and existing levels of service for the public facilities and services set forth in the citys transportation infrastructure technical manual of these regulations 2 summary and projections of expected development activities and their impact on capital improvement needs 3 the fiscal resources to be utilized to support identified needs and the feasibility of implementing new sources 4 recommended changes modifications or amendments to the schedule of improvements in the capital improvements element of the comprehensive plan and the capital improvements program of the city city of titusville proportionate fairshare program impacts of development on transportation facilities may be mitigated proportionate share program the intent methodology submittal requirements and review and approval procedures are in of the citys concurrency technical design manual the process and procedures in the technical design manual can be used to apply for the proportionate fairshare program secs 3041530420  reserved agencies and boards article i  city council composition and authority the city council of the city of titusville is composed of a mayor and four 4 councilmen and is the legislative body of the city and has the authority to adopt the comprehensive plan future land use map future traffic circulation map and amendments thereto the city council also has the authority to approve annexations enact zoning changes approve site plans and conditional uses as set forth therein the city council also has the authority to designate boards and commission as required by federal state or other law and local need including the local planning agency lpa the city council reserves all powers unless specifically delegated legislative powers and duties the city council when considering proposed changes in the text of these regulations or in amending future land use map the future traffic circulation map or the zoning map or rezoning property or changing land use designation acts in the legislative capacity and will proceed in accordance with the requirements of florida statutes fs whichever is applicable and procedures site plans and variances and appeals division 2 appeals to the board of adjustment and nonconforming usesstructures and vested rights of these land development regulations all actions of the council shall be deemed fairly debatable and the burden of proof shall be on those challenging the actions of the council judicial powers and duties the city council acts in a quasijudicial capacity during public hearings where variances appeals conditional use permits sitespecific zoning changes or other sitespecific development orders are considered quasijudicial does not include comprehensive rezoning or any comprehensive plan changes of any size special powers and duties pursuant to florida statutes 1989 the city council is designated as the community redevelopment agency for the city of titusville the community redevelopment agency shall have all powers and duties as authorized by florida statutes this provision hereby ratifies and reaffirms that previous ad hoc and advisory committees a the city council may from time to time based upon a majority vote of the membership establish ad hoc committees to assist the council in carrying out its responsibility said ad hoc committee shall be limited to a particular subject area and serve only in that capacity for a specific period of time b nothing in this section shall prevent the city council from establishing independent temporary or ad hoc advisory groups committees or commissions to make recommendations on any issue directly to city council appeal of council decisions all decisions of the city council whether zoning annexation conditional use cpa or other approvals required by these land development regulations shall be presumed correct and shall be final any substantially effected person may appeal the decision of the city council to the circuit court in and for brevard county florida all appeals must be filed within thirty 30 days after the decision is rendered all appeals shall be based upon the record before the city council and not a trial de novo all appeals shall be processed in accordance with the procedure set forth in the florida rules of appellate procedure for appeals from the county court to the circuit court secs 3173115  reserved article ii  administratorenforcement officer the administrator the administrator of these land development regulations shall be the city manager or his designee the enforcement officer the enforcement officer and administrator may be the same individual or the enforcement officer or inspector may be such other member of city staff as designated by the administrator city staff consultants in addition to the above powers and duties the administrator is responsible for allocation of city staff resources to the boards and commissions required by these land development regulations any necessary research data and analysis comprehensive planning current planning land use review regulatory reviews and other administrative services related to development orders and the enforcement thereof administrative powers and duties specific duties of the administrator are normally performed by the community development department or such other department that may be designated by the city manager such duties include the processing and recommendations related to the following a the comprehensive plan  b land development regulations and codes including 1 the zoning ordinance  2 zoning map changes  3 subdivision plats  4 site plans  5 conditional land use requests  6 engineering improvements  7 concurrency management  c capital improvements program  d engineering inspections  e building inspections  f inspections  g occupational license inspections  h issuance of development orders  i issuance of building permits  j issuance of certificates of occupancy  k issuance of engineering permits  l administration of development fees and violation fines  m administration of city construction projects  n coordination of development activities with other agencies  o other projects as assigned by the administrator secs 31203130  reserved article iii  the planning and zoning commission powers and duties a the commission shall act in an advisory capacity to city council in all matters affecting the comprehensive plan and serve as the local planning agency lpa pursuant to florida statutes the local government comprehensive planning and land development regulation act b the commission shall recommend the study of resources and possibilities and needs of the city and shall review and recommend to city council plans and maps for the systematic future development and betterment of the city and recommend such changes as are deemed advisable  and may recommend to the city council the division of the city into districts or zones or the preparation of maps and plans of same specifying and governing the height area and manner of construction of buildings to be erected altered or reconstructed in such zones c before any new street is opened or any existing street extended widened relocated closed or vacated or corrected within the corporate limits or planning jurisdiction of the city or before any new subdivision within the corporate limits of the city for residence business or industrial uses is made the person opening such street or proposing such new subdivision for residence business or industrial purposes shall submit a detailed plan with blueprints and other necessary data to the commission it shall be the duty of the commission to examine carefully the plans for such subdivision as regards their nature and purpose the number width character and location of streets and alleys and the size material and manner of laying of water and sewer lines and shall transmit such application with all data to the city council with its recommendations in writing d the commission shall have the duty of recommending the purposes for which buildings and premises therein may be used and establishing rules governing building lines and shall submit same to the city council for its approval approval with condition or denial e other duties that may be assigned by the city council in furtherance of its legislative powers and in procedures of these land development regulations and the specific needs of the city including but not limited to the following 1 review recommend amendments to and monitor the comprehensive plan  2 evaluate land development regulations and codes  3 review and update the land use and zoning designations in the city including interpretation of boundary lines and applicable areas  4 evaluate rezoning requests and requests for changes in the future land use mapfuture traffic circulation map  5 review proposed subdivisions  6 interpretation of uses permitted  7 review proposed master plans  8 review plans that affect the shoreline district the conservation district the areas of critical concern the flood plain areas as provided for in these land development regulations  and 9 hear site plan appeals f in addition to the above it shall be the duty of each member of the commission if funds are made available by the city council to 1 attend one 2 local regional or state planning conference during each two 2 years served  2 attend one 1 staff sponsored field trip within the first year of each term served  3 join a planning organization  4 attend one 1 city council meeting every three 3 months regardless of funds  5 attend workshop session conducted by the city staff for orientation of new members and other such workshops that may be called as necessary  and 6 familiarize themselves with the comprehensive plan and these land development regulations and other sections of the city to the commission g none of the powers duties or prerogatives of the commission shall be construed to be in any way a limitation upon the duties powers and prerogatives of the city council but in every case shall be subordinate and subject to the approval of the city council appointment and terms of office a the planning and zoning commission shall be composed of seven 7 regular members and two 2 alternates each of which shall be a resident of the city of titusville appointed by city council in addition to the council appointments one 1 nonvoting member shall be appointed by the brevard county school board four 4 regular members and one 1 alternate member shall be appointed at the last regular meeting of the city council in january of each evennumbered year and three 3 regular members and one 1 alternate member shall be appointed at the last regular meeting of city council in january of each oddnumbered year b the terms of all members appointed shall commence on january 31 and shall be for a period of two 2 years the city council shall fill any vacancy occurring on the commission by appointment and such appointment shall be for the unexpired term of the vacancy any vacancy occurring during the unexpired term of office of the nonvoting member shall be filled by appointment of the brevard county school board for the remainder of the term members may be appointed to successive terms without limitations all members shall be residents of the city of titusville for at least one 1 year shall be at least eighteen 18 years of age and a registered voter in the city c members of the planning and zoning commission may be removed by majority vote of the city council d members of the commission shall be appointed by city council and whenever possible shall represent a wellbalanced cross section of community interests members shall be appointed to represent environmental development and general public interests based upon education andor experience in these areas e during the month of february of each year the commission shall elect a chairman vice chairman and secretary from among its membership standing committees the commission may establish a standing committee from its membership for environmental issues and such other issues or concerns that the commission deems necessary organization and meetings a the commission shall meet twice a month on the wednesday proceeding the second and fourth tuesday of the given month when there is business to conduct the chairman may with due notice cancel any meeting due to a lack of business b the commission shall prescribe such rules of procedure and adopt such bylaws as may be necessary to carry into effect the duties and powers hereby granted and may prescribe penalties for the nonattendance or disorderly conduct of its members and enforce the same c a majority of the commission or standing committee ie four 4 members shall be necessary to constitute a quorum for the transaction of business in the event more than seven 7 members regular member and alternates attend the meeting no more than seven 7 members may sit and act on items presented to the commission the chairman will determine which alternate members shall fill in for an absent regular member or when a regular member abstains from voting on an item due to a conflict of interest the nonvoting member may participate in discussions  however nonvoting members shall not make motions and may not be used to constitute a quorum d the affirmative vote of a majority of the sitting commission at a meeting shall be required to pass any action of the commission if a majority vote in the affirmative is not made the action shall be deemed to be denied e minutes shall be kept of all commission meetings f all commission meetings as well as the commission members individually shall be subject to the requirement of fs the open meeting or sunshine law g agendas for each meeting shall be available to the public at least twentyfour 24 hours prior to any meeting of the commission h whenever the commission is called upon to make recommendations concerning an annexation a comprehensive plan amendment cpa conditionaluse permit or a zoning amendment the planning staff shall send written notice to adjoining property owners consistent with state law but in any case no less than five hundred 500 feet from the subject property the applicant shall be required to provide the names and addresses of all such property owners on mailing labels most recently listed in the brevard county tax rolls staff shall also place a conspicuous sign on said property stating the action requested and the date of the public hearing failure of a property owner within five hundred 500 feet to receive written notice shall not invalidate the action of the commission or council i any standing committee created pursuant to shall meet prior to the commission meeting in order to expedite the review and recommendation to the commission on matters charged to said committee j members of the commission may be reappointed to successive terms without limitation secs 31353150  reserved article iv  board of adjustments and appeals footnotes  1  ordinances reference enforcement of the standard code for the elimination or repair of unsafe buildings by the board of adjustments and appeals  6117 powers and duties a the board of adjustments and appeals shall have the power to hear and decide appeals of any decision order requirement or an interpretation of an administrative official of these land development regulations including but not limited to the following 1 zoning of land and water use zoning  2 subdivision regulations procedures  3 protection of potable water well fields the regulation of areas subject to seasonal and periodic flooding drainage and stormwater management and the protection of environmentally sensitive lands development standards  4 signage  5 the provision of public facilities and service concurrent with the impacts of development and  6 the provision of safe and convenient onsite traffic flow including vehicle parking development standards b the board shall also hear and decide appeals and variances regarding the following 1 building code electrical code fire prevention code gas code housing code mechanical code motion picture theaters ordinance plumbing code streets regulations swimming pool regulation as provided for in the ordinances volumes i and ii 2 hear and decide requests for variance from these regulations in accordance with the procedures set forth in of these land development regulations 3 hear and decide conflicts between the minimum building code and minimum safety code as authorized by florida statutes 1989 including any conflicts between the local building official and local fire official concerning the application or interpretation of the minimum building code and minimum safety code c appeals variances and interpretations shall not extend to decisions of an administrative official relating to public projects  or public policy decisions made by the city council appointment and terms of office a the board of adjustments and appeals shall be composed of five 5 regular members and two 2 alternates all members shall be residents of the city of titusville for at least one 1 year and be a registered voter members of the board shall consist of the following 1 at least three 3 of the regular members of the board shall be persons with the following expertiseexperience in at least one of the following disciplines a a licensed architect engineer landscape architect or surveyor  b a general or building contractor  c a person associated with the building trades industries  d a person having an education degree bachelor or master degree in urban planning or with a current american institute of certified planner certification  e a person with a minimum of ten 10 years experience in land development or urban planning field 2 the other two 2 remaining members of the board and the two 2 alternates may be appointed from the city citizenship at large b all five 5 regular members and the two 2 alternates of the board shall be appointed by the city council for twoyear terms there shall be appointed at the second regular meeting in july of each oddnumbered year three 3 regular members and one alternate for twoyear terms and in each evennumbered year two 2 regular members and one alternate for twoyear terms the term of the members appointed shall commence on august 1 and shall be for a period of two 2 years or until their successors are appointed c the city council shall fill any vacancy occurring on the board and such appointment shall be for the unexpired term of the vacancy the alternate members may serve on the board in lieu of a regular member when said regular member is unable to attend an official meeting of the board or when a regular member has a conflict of interest on any item and said alternate shall serve for the entire meeting d members of the board may be reappointed to successive terms without limitation e members of the board may be removed at the discretion of the city council if any member of the board is convicted of a felony his position on the board shall be forfeited immediately and his seat vacated the seat of any member who is absent from three 3 or more meetings during any period of six 6 successive months shall be vacated unless such absences are officially excused by a majority of the board members organization and meetings a the board shall establish rules and regulations of its own procedure not inconsistent with the provisions of these land development regulations the board shall meet on the fourth wednesday of every month or in any event frequent enough so that business of the board may be expeditiously completed b minutes shall be kept of all board meetings c the board shall conduct its meetings in accordance with the quasijudicial procedures set forth in procedures articles v variances and appeals division 1 variances and division 2 appeals to the board of adjustment of these land development regulations d all meetings of the board shall be open to the public and the agenda for same shall be available to the public at least twentyfour 24 hours prior to the meeting e board members shall be subject to florida statutes the open meetings law f four 4 members of the board shall constitute a quorum in varying the application of any of the provisions of any city ordinance or in modifying any order of any administrative city official concurring votes of four 4 members of the board shall be necessary if four 4 concurring votes cannot be reached the subject matter before the board shall be considered denied g the procedure for a member to withdraw abstain or be excused from voting is in accordance with florida statutes board of adjustments and appeals officers and staff a at its first regular meeting in august the board shall by majority vote of its membership excluding vacant seats elect one 1 of its members to serve as chairman and preside over the boards meetings and one 1 member to serve as vicechairman who shall preside in the absence or withdrawal of the chairman b the chairman shall sign all correspondence for the board and shall sign all opinions of the board c the chairman or any member temporarily acting as chairman may administer oaths to witnesses coming before the board d the chairman and vicechairman may take part in all deliberations and vote on all issues e an official in the employ of the city shall be appointed by the administrator to act as secretary to the board and shall be responsible to supply the board with the proper facilities agendas minutes evidence and information which the board may request in the performance of their duties said secretary shall receive and schedule for hearings all appeals filed notify the board of same and coordinate the advertisement of the boards agenda with the city clerk as required in a locally circulated newspaper f the board with the prior approval of the city council is authorized and empowered to employ such clerks and subordinates including technical and expert advisors and to incur such expenses as in its judgment may be necessary provided that the total expense shall not exceed the amount set apart in the budget of the city for such purpose g the board may if it is deemed necessary call upon any city official in the employ of the city or upon other appointed city boards for technical advice information or recommendations prior to acting on any appeal which may be brought before it appeal to decision of the board of adjustment and appeals any person substantially effected as defined in florida statutes by the decision of the board of adjustment and appeals may appeal such decision to the circuit court of brevard county florida said decision must be appealed within thirty 30 days after rendered the decision shall be presumed correct and the appeal shall be a review of the record before the board of adjustments and appeals the appeal shall not be a trial de novo the clerk shall prepare the record in accordance with the florida rules of appellate procedure the time periods set forth in the florida rules of appellate procedure for processing appeals from the county court to the circuit court shall govern appeals from the board of adjustments and appeals to the circuit court secs 31563165  reserved article v  code enforcement board footnotes  2  ordinances references enforcement of the building standards  6102  enforcement of the standard code for the elimination or repair of unsafe buildings by the board of adjustments and appeals  6117  enforcement of the occupation license tax
