overall sign plan i onsite signage shall use a consistent theme without neon flashing electronic electronic reader board or other reactive background lighting j open space shall provide for quality recreational amenities including fountains benches and lighting k projects shall provide urban amenities such as structured automobile parking facilities for bicycle users and public meeting areas l reserved 3 external compatibility a the proposed development should not negatively impact the quality of life for any adjacent residential uses negative impacts can include a decrease in property values and any substantial increase in noise or traffic any traffic impacts shall be demonstrated with a traffic analysis and the impacts shall be mitigated by the developer in accordance with the comprehensive plan and the applicable land development regulations b the proposed development should provide bikeway and trails to be consistent and compatible with the brevard metropolitan planning organizations overall greenways and trails program and the greater titusvilles ecoheritage trail plan c access and street patterns of the development shall compliment and be compatible with the existing street system of the surrounding development and allow for connection to commercial uses d nonresidential uses within the development shall be adequately screened from any adjacent residential uses e reserved 4 parks and open space a the minimum percentage of parks and open space required for the urban village is twentyfive 25 percent of the total gross acreage of the urban village the open space shall meet the minimum standards set forth per development standards improvements division 3 open space b all parks open space and civic plazas shall be preserved for its intended purpose as expressed in the master plan the developer shall choose a method of administering open space as specified in development standards general provisions division 2 operations and maintenance  102417 procedure for securing approval of an urban village mixeduse a submission of plans and action thereon 1 procedure for securing approval of a master plan in the uv zoning district shall follow the master plan approval process set forth per the procedures legislative and quasijurisdiction 2 the development plan of the uv shall meet the requirements of professional land planning services  promote public health safety and general welfare  provide adequate light air privacy and convenience  conserve the values of surrounding property  and protect against nuisances and hazards 3 development plans for all master plans shall be submitted in accordance with the citys general site plan andor subdivision specific development plan requirements contained in development standards and procedures secs 33583360  reserved article vi  neighborhood village purpose and intent the purpose of a neighborhood village is to provide unique opportunities to create commercial developments at a scale that is compatible with surrounding residential development and create a comfortable environment for pedestrians these areas allow residents in the area to receive basic services without leaving the neighborhood these centers reduce the reliance on automobiles by allowing residents to walk or bike to nearby services by creating spaces that allow residents to gather these centers add to the identity of a neighborhood and increase safety as more people are active within the community applicability a neighborhood village is permitted in any zoning district shown in the zoning table with the exception of the downtown mixeduse dmu provided uses are governed by the applicable underlying zoning district regulations submittals a conceptual plan must be submitted in compliance with the master plan procedures set forth per the procedures   minimum neighborhood village standards a urban design  the overall design of a neighborhood village and associated residential development shall be consistent in architectural styles infrastructure such as lighting bike racks and benches shall be similar in design in the neighborhood village and any residential uses within the redevelopment proposal pedestrianscale lighting shall be required within the development buildings within the neighborhood village shall reserve the ground floor for commercial establishments to create an active pedestrian environment b frontage a neighborhood village may be located on an arterial or collector street if a new public or private street is created then at least one 1 street shall be considered a collector or for purposes of meeting these standards building facades shall not exceed twohundred 200 feet in length along any one 1 street or exceed the maximum footprints established in e below without being separated with a plaza c plaza a neighborhood village shall incorporate plazas courtyards or forecourts to provide public open space and areas for outdoor seating plazas shall be a minimum of thirty 30 feet in width while not exceeding sixty 60 feet in width and shall be as deep as the adjacent buildings to serve as pathways between parking areas and building entrances plazas shall include at a minimum one ornamental fountain or art installation to serve as a focal point ornamental lighting arbors trellises planted beds drinking fountains and awnings or canopies d street setback along all street frontages buildings should be flush with the sidewalk except for entries courtyards or outdoor seating areas this is to engage pedestrian activity and encourage drivers to slow down and watch for pedestrians and parking cars the maximum setback along any street frontage shall be zero 0 feet if a courtyard or outdoor seating area is provided along the sidewalk a setback up to ten 10 feet may be provided e massing buildings shall be oriented towards and provide all principal access to a public sidewalk in order to ensure compatibility with adjacent residential developments building footprints shall be limited as follows 1 frontage along one 1 roadway maximum twelve thousand 12000 square feet 2 frontage along two 2 roadways maximum twenty thousand 20000 square feet 3 for the purposes of this section footprint shall be defined as the area of the foundation of the ground floor of a building any floor area above the ground level will not be counted towards footprint f doors and entrances all buildings shall have their principal entrance opening to a sidewalk or plaza entrances at building corners may be used to satisfy this requirement the principal entrance shall not open onto or face towards a parking lot pedestrian access to the principal structure shall be provided improved surface g windows and entryways the ground floor of all buildings shall be designed to encourage and to complement pedestrian scale activity by arranging windows and doors so the uses within buildings are visible andor accessible from the street on at least fifty 50 percent of the length of the first floor street frontage between two 2 and eight 8 feet in height these windows shall be clear and free of glazing or other treatments to create a mirrored effect from the exterior of the building solid walls shall not exceed twenty 20 feet in length doors shall be recessed into the face of the building to provide a sense of entry and to add variety to the streetscape all upper floors of buildings within the neighborhood village shall have windows of smaller size as compared to the ground floor and repeat in rhythms to mimic that of a traditional main street this difference in window forms and rhythms of placement will create the appearance of vertical mixeduse buildings with residential dwellings above commercial uses building elevations shall be required as part of the master plan submittal requirements h required parking parking within the neighborhood village shall adhere to the parking requirements established in the downtown mixeduse zoning district development standards improvements division 9 parkingloadingstorage subdivision 2 downtown mixeduse parking requirements parking shall be located at the rear of any principal building or in a midblock location onstreet parking may count toward the parking requirement parking shall be set back ten 10 feet from the property line the area between any parking and the property line shall be landscaped to screen the parking area from the adjacent street and sidewalks access to the parking area shall be provided by a sidewalk a minimum of six 6 feet in width but no more than ten 10 feet in width i signage signage in the neighborhood village shall be pedestrian in scale and shall be limited to the following types of signs fin menu board wall under canopy and groundmounted monument signs as provided for below allowable signs shall meet the regulations established in signs of these regulations changeable copy signs are strictly prohibited one 1 groundmounted monument sign may be installed per neighborhood village this monument sign shall be no more than six 6 feet in height and shall be limited to two 2 faces in a backtoback configuration each sign face shall be no more than sixteen 16 square feet in area j mechanical equipment electrical meter and service components similar utility devices whether groundmounted wallmounted or roofmounted shall be screened from view at the property line parapets shall be required along the perimeter of all buildings utilizing a flatroof system review criteria the proposal shall meet the intent of the underlying zoning district set forth per zoning and criteria of the master plan procedures set forth per procedures approval process a a site plan is required for the development of a neighborhood village any subdivision of land shall conform to the standards and procedures set forth in the procedures subdivision 1 a neighborhood village shall be developed in accordance with the procedures set forth per procedures subdivisions of these regulations if areas for common use of occupants of the development are shown on the plat satisfactory arrangements shall be made for the maintenance of the common open space and facilities within the proposed development upon approval the neighborhood village shall be identified on the official zoning atlas by a nv designation and the applicable plat book and page 2 procedures for securing approval of a neighborhood village as a planned development pd shall require a master plan as set forth in procedures legislative and quasijudicial secs 33673380  reserved article vii  cluster subdivision purpose and intent the purpose of this section is to provide flexibility in site design for large lot development in order to allow developers to preserve common open space and natural resources applicability notwithstanding conditional use and zoning design standards provisions of zoning in the residential estate re zoning district an applicant for an re category and district shall be encouraged to voluntarily apply for cluster development in order to preserve appropriate wetlands and upland habitat an applicant may apply for cluster style development and open space incentive as a part of an application for zoning or at the time of subdivision plat review and approval provided the following criteria are met criteria and standards a parks and open space 1 the minimum percentage of parks and open space required for a cluster subdivision is fifty 50 percent of the total gross acreage of the cluster subdivision the open space shall meet the minimum standards set forth per development standards improvements division 3 open space the fifty 50 percent open space and conservation area may consist of wetlands and uplands with not less than twentyfive 25 percent of the set aside of the total lands consisting of upland vegetation 2 as a part of the open space requirement a thirtyfoot buffer of preserved native upland or wetland vegetation along adjacent public roadways and twentyfoot buffer between adjacent parcels shall be required to qualify for the cluster development the buffer open space area may count towards the fifty 50 percent open space for conservation areas parks and open space shall be preserved for its intended purpose as expressed in the master plan the developer shall choose a method of administering open space as specified in development standards general provisions division 2 operations and maintenance 3 in the event the parcel and subdivision qualifies and meets the above criteria then in that event the height yard and area requirements shall be as follows cluster subdivision development standards a purpose a cluster subdivision is a development option that may be utilized within the re zoning districts to create a unique subdivision that offers varying lot sizes and allows for the protection of vegetation topography or other desirable features b use standards typical lot pattern see c intensity and dimensional standards lot area minimum sq feet  10000 lot width average at building line minimum feet  100 density maximum unit per acre 1 1 floor area per dwelling unit minimum sq feet  2000 building coverage maximum % of lot area 40 lot coverage maximum % of lot area na height maximum feet  35 front yard setback minimum feet  25 2 side corner setback minimum feet  25 interior side yard setback minimum feet  15 rear yard setback minimum feet  25 accessory use development standards see notes 1 the overall maximum residential density for any development including uplands and wetlands shall not exceed 1 unit per gross acre ie 80 acres 80 units 2 at least 50% of the lots must have a 35 minimum front yard setback typical development configuration for illustrative purposes only 4 the overall maximum residential density for any development including uplands and wetlands shall not exceed one 1 unit per gross acre ie eighty 80 acres eighty 80 units 5 to the extent possible the open space area shall be a contiguous parcel in order to preserve the nature habitat for wildlife 6 the stormwater management system shall be designed to preserve to the extent practical and possible the native vegetation and may be located within the fifty 50 percent open space and conservation area provided compliance is achieved in accordance with other applicable land development regulations 7 native vegetation and florida friendly landscaping shall be encouraged within the subdivision 8 the open space area shall be set aside in a conservation easement dedicated for the benefit of the residents of the subdivision or to the public approval process a a cluster subdivision shall be developed in accordance with the procedures set forth in procedures subdivisions of these regulations if areas for common use of occupants of the development are shown on the plat satisfactory arrangements shall be made for the maintenance of the common open space and facilities in the park upon approval the cluster subdivision shall be identified on the official zoning atlas by a cs designation and the applicable plat book and page b procedures for securing approval of a cluster subdivision as a planned development pd shall require a master plan as set forth in this chapter c all land included within the proposed subdivision shall be under the legal control of the applicant the applicant shall agree to proceed with the proposed subdivision according to the provisions contained herein and such conditions may be attached to the plat secs 338533100  reserved article viii  conservation subdivision design purpose and intent a the purpose of this section is to provide flexibility in site design for residential developments in order to allow developers to preserve common open space and natural resources the specific purposes of this section are to 1 protect the public health safety and general welfare by avoiding surface and groundwater pollution contaminated runoff air quality contamination and urban heat islands that result from pavement and the clearing of natural vegetation  2 protect and preserve natural resources such as wetlands streams lakes steep slopes woodlands and water recharge areas  3 reduce infrastructure and housing costs by reducing conventional subdivision design which requires more pavement wetland crossings grading of trees and natural areas and maintenance of lawn and landscaping  4 protect property values by allowing open space design features that enhance the marketability of development  5 protect design flexibility  and 6 promote development on soils that are most suitable for urban densities while preserving soils that are primarily adaptable to their uses such as woodlands wildlife habitat and agriculture applicability conservation development is a technique used to promote the preservation of environmentally sensitive areas agricultural lands and common open space the term conservation subdivision shall refer to a residential subdivision in which development is guided to and clustered on the most suitable portions of a tract in order to allow key environmental resources and open spaces to be protected and preserved for the benefit and enjoyment of the community placed together into one 1 or more groupings within defined areas on a parcel and are separated from other groupings andor from adjacent developments by the protected open space to achieve this type of development the guidelines contained in this ordinance provide an alternative to traditional subdivision standards allowing flexibility in lot dimensions configuration and development standards the guidelines also provide for density bonuses to encourage the utilization of conservation subdivisions standards a a conservation subdivision is permitted in any residential zoning district shown in the zoning table with the exception of the downtown mixeduse dmu commercial and industrial zoning districts zoning table permitted zoning district a district b maximum density rural area re 1ac rr 15ac urban area r1a 10000 square feet r1b 7500 square feet r1c 6500 square feet r2 9ac r3 15ac a conservation subdivision design may be incorporated into mixeduse zoning districts with a master plan b the subdivision shall utilize only the types of dwellings permitted by the propertys zoning c permitted uses are governed by the applicable zoning district regulations d minimum lot size no minimum lot size shall be required e dedication and construction of public rightsofway upon recommendation from the administrator city council may additionally require a time schedule and appropriate surety for dedication and construction of public rightsofway at time of need within and surrounding the proposed conservation subdivision open space a the following open space regulations shall be required in addition to the development and dedication standards set forth in development standards improvements division 3 open space and development standards general provisions division 2 operations and maintenance the more restrictive standard shall apply 1 any unencumbered space park or public or private spaces otherwise committed to preservation or recreation active or passive but not including areas required for stormwater management retention or detention unless expressly permitted herein may be counted towards the minimum open space requirements 2 the minimum percentage of open space required for a conservation subdivision is fifty 50 percent of the total gross acreage of the development 3 all common open space shall be preserved for its intended purpose as expressed in the master development plan of a pd the developer shall choose one 1 or a combination of the following methods of administering common open space a establishment of an association or nonprofit corporation of all individuals or corporations owning property within the planned development to ensure the maintenance of all common open space as provided by the development order b retention of ownership control and maintenance of all or a portion of all common open space by the developer as provided by the development order 4 land designated as open space will be restricted by appropriate legal instrument satisfactory to the city attorney as open space perpetually such instrument shall be binding upon the developer its successors and assigns and shall constitute a covenant running with the land such instrument shall be in recordable form 5 all common open space as well as public and recreational facilities shall be specifically included in the development schedule and be constructed and fully improved by the developer at an equivalent or greater rate than the construction of residential structures or the development order will be in default 6 should the developer elect to administer common open space association or nonprofit corporation said organization shall conform to the following requirements a the developer must establish the association or nonprofit corporation prior to the sale of any lots b membership in the association or nonprofit corporation shall be mandatory for all residential property owners with the planned development and said association or corporation shall not discriminate in its members or shareholders c the association or nonprofit corporation shall manage all common open space and recreational and cultural facilities that are not dedicated to the public shall provide for the maintenance administration and operation of said land and any other land within the planned unit development not publicly or privately owned and shall secure adequate liability insurance on the land should the developer elect an association or nonprofit corporation as a method of administering common open space the title to all residential property owners shall include an undivided fee simple estate in all common open space as approved by the development order size and location of site there is no minimum or maximum size for a conservation subdivision however the minimum open space requirement may limit the number of residential units connectivity the conservation subdivision shall include a pedestrian circulation system all sidewalks shall connect to other sidewalks or with trail sidewalks and trails shall connect to potential areas qualifying as conservation areas on the development parcel adjoining undeveloped parcels or with existing conservation areas density bonus a the gross density of a conservation subdivision shall not exceed the maximum density shown in the zoning table a for the propertys zoning a density bonus may be allowed provided the following are included on the conservation subdivision 1 gross density shall be calculated in the manner described by the future land use element of the comprehensive plan 2 reserved approval a a conservation subdivision shall be developed in accordance with the procedures set forth in procedures subdivisions of these regulations and the submittal requirements set forth per the procedures manual if areas for common use of occupants of the development are shown on the plat satisfactory arrangements shall be made for the maintenance of the common open space and facilities in the park upon approval the conservation subdivision shall be identified on the official zoning atlas by a cs designation and the applicable plat book and page b procedures for securing approval of a conservation subdivision as a planned development pd shall require a master plan as set forth in procedures legislative and quasijudicial c all land included within the proposed subdivision shall be under the legal control of the applicant the applicant shall agree to proceed with the proposed subdivision according to the provisions contained herein and such conditions may be attached to the plat secs 3310933110  reserved article ix  transfer of development rights transfer of development rights a purpose and intent this section is intended to provide greater flexibility in the pattern of development and redevelopment by allowing for the transfer of residential development rights unused residential density from one 1 parcel or site to another parcel or site where the community redevelopment agency herein referred to as the cra and city council determines that 1 such transfers will assist in the renewal rehabilitation and creation of the economic environmental physical and historical resources of the community redevelopment area as well as the renewal rehabilitation preservation and creation of public space in the downtown mixeduse land use district and more specifically the downtown mixeduse dmu zoning district  and 2 such transfers will further the goals objectives and policies of the comprehensive plan the community redevelopment plan and the downtown master plan b definitions as used in this section the following terms shall have the meaning indicated receiving sites areas within the downtown mixeduse dmu zoning district of the downtown mixeduse land use district of the land development regulations and adopted comprehensive plan sending sites any areas within the downtown mixeduse dmu zoning district as set forth within the citys adopted land development regulations as authorized by the downtown mixeduse land use district as set forth in the citys adopted comprehensive plan provided that such site shall be deemed by the city council to be appropriate for use as public open spaces public parks urban park spaces and amenities public recreational facilities stormwater facilities historic preservation  or other approved public purpose and private development that is consistent with the downtown master plan sever the removal of a development right from property rights possessed by an owner of real property the term describes and connotes a removal or separation in perpetuity as distinguished from a restriction or limitation which may be overridden deleted or is subject to a time frame tdr bank the record maintained by the city for the deposit and withdrawalpurchase of cityowned tdrs and the record of all tdr transactions within the cra privately transferred tdrs are considered a private transaction but the approval of sending and receiving sites for all tdrs must comply with the regulations set forth in this section and shall be recorded as part of the tdr bank transferable development rights a development right is an appurtenant right of land ownership that has economic value separate from the land itself subject to reasonable regulation by the local government under its police power and that may be transferred from the land from which the right is severed sending site to another piece of land receiving site once severed all cityowned tdrs are technically deemed deposited into the tdr bank but thereafter if only a portion of the development rights attributable to a sending site are transferred to a receiving site the remaining development rights remain deposited in a tdr bank in accordance with the provisions of this section for cityowned tdrs private tdrs are considered a private transaction per the regulations set forth in this section transferable development rights means the maximum density dwelling units exclusive of variances or conditional use permits that would be permitted to be transferred by the propertys zoning on the date of the transfer approval which will be calculated and allocated by a formula developed by the city these rights are sometimes referred to herein as tdrs establishment of sending sites  transfer of tdrs a establishment of sending sites any property in the downtown mixeduse zoning district upon recommendation of the cra and the approval of the city council in its sole discretion after a public hearing may be eligible as a sending site subject to the terms conditions and limitations of this section b tdrs transferred from cityowned sending sites the city council in its sole discretion and after the required public hearings as described herein shall deposit all development rights in terms of dwelling units from its sending sites as they are defined herein in the tdr bank for distribution and transfer in accordance with all of the procedures and limitations of this section and specifically as limited by the following 1 a public hearing is held to determine the merits of the cityowned site as a tdr sending site for the recommendation of the cra a second and final public hearing is held by city council to determine the approval of the sending site tdr transfer all public hearings shall be held and advertised in accordance with the conditional use permit process as provided for in procedures legislative and quasijudicial division 4 conditional use permits with the city as the applicant 2 all monies received by the city in connection with the transfer of development rights shall be deposited into the community redevelopment agency trust fund for the purpose of capital improvement construction of projects specifically listed in the adopted capital improvements program of the community redevelopment agency and the related capital improvements element of the comprehensive plan c privately owned sending sites 1 application process for sending sites the owner of a prospective sender site or designated representative by means of notarized signature shall submit a complete application to the planning department a complete application shall include the following a applicable fee b names addresses and signatures of the owners of the prospective sending site c current survey of the property d a copy of the deed or other instrument evidencing the legal ownership of the property e for sender sites conveyed to the city title information or evidence satisfactory to the city attorney that the conveyance will be free and clear of all liens or encumbrances and not a default of any lien or mortgage for sender sites which will continue to be privately owned title evidence listing all lien holders mortgages or other encumbrances affecting the sending sites f a statement from the supervisor stating all outdoor code enforcement regulations are in compliance all application submittals must be provided in a form acceptable to the planning department prior to scheduling for public hearings 2 establishment of tdrs a the city staff shall determine the total amount of undeveloped residential density on the proposed site based on the existing zoning regulations excluding any density bonuses that have been approved conditional use process that are in effect at the time the application is filed this determination shall be provided in the form of a determination letter to the applicant within fifteen 15 working days of the application submittal date and shall include all supporting documentation the applicant if objecting to the aforementioned determination by the city staff may submit a letter to the planning department describing the objection which will be provided to the cra and city council for their consideration but may not be considered a legally binding letter in any manner but only providing information to the cra and city council with additional information to inform their decision pursuant to this section 3 public hearings after a public hearing the cra shall recommend to the city council whether the proposed privately owned sending site is acceptable in accordance with the intent expressed by this section the city council shall then hold a second public hearing to determine in its sole discretion whether the proposed sending site is acceptable in accordance with the intent expressed by this section all public hearings shall be held and advertised in accordance with the conditional use permit process as provided for in procedures legislative and quasijudicial division 4 conditional use permits 4 conveyance of privately owned sending sites to the city upon approval by the city council the sending sites may be conveyed to the city unencumbered free and clear of any and all liens and mortgages after correction of title defects and payment of any outstanding fines or fees owed to the city unless otherwise authorized by the city council after title to the approved sending site has been conveyed to the city in the manner described in this section the city shall authorize the release of the tdrs and shall record such release in its records and in the public records of brevard county should the property owner agree to convey the property to the city the property owner shall convey the property with all rights including those other than the residential density associated with the transfer of the development rights 5 development limitations on sending sites the approved sending sites shall then be used only as a public open space public parks public urban park spaces and amenities public recreational facilities public parking facilities regional stormwater improvements historic preservation or other public purpose and private approved development approved by the city council those sending sites that are proposing commercial redevelopment andor retention rather than historic preservation or public purpose improvements must demonstrate consistency with the community redevelopment plan and the downtown master plan and the following review criteria also applies a the applicant of commercial redevelopment andor retention must provide a conceptual site plan and elevations for the redevelopment of the site if redevelopment of the site is proposed b the city shall review the site based on the future viability of the site as a nonresidential site exclusively also considering the existing nonresidential development current code compliance and consistency with the downtown mixeduse zoning regulations c areas for nonresidential redevelopment andor retention for sending sites shall be limited to the following subareas as provided for in the downtown master plan 1 the town center subarea with the exception of properties along hopkins and washington avenue  2 the civic center area  and 3 the southern gateway subarea d the city council may require a sending site that is proposed for nonresidential retention to provide a percentage of the funds generated by the sale of the tdrs to the cra trust fund for public capital projects 6 development limitations on privately owned sending sites as a condition to the approval of any privately owned sending sites the city council shall require that the owner of the privatelyowned sending site record a restrictive covenant or other instrument in a form approved by the city attorney restricting the privately owned sending site from any future residential development consistent with 5 above no tdrs approved for use from a privately owned sending site shall be approved on any site plan for the receiving site until the requirements of this subsection have been complied with to ensure the orderly redevelopment of properties within the downtown mixeduse land use district and the downtown mixeduse dmu zoning district the city shall maintain a record of any transfers from privately owned sending sites the sending site shall be labeled tdr on the official zoning map definitions a eligible receiving sites all property within the dmu zoning district is established as receiving sites receiving sites must be developed as permitted by the land development regulations as may be amended from time to time in combination with the development rights available to the site maximum allowable density and intensity as set forth in the adopted comprehensive plan 1 development limitations on receiving sites a the development rights accepted on a receiving site shall be limited to the maximum allowable density and intensity as set forth in the comprehensive plan b parking and all other requirements of the land development regulations of the city of titusville shall be in accordance with any additional density acquired transfer of development rights unless otherwise granted variance process set forth in procedures variances and appeals division 1 variances c the transfer of development rights shall not cause the development or redevelopment of any site to exceed the rights provided to that site by the land development regulations d the transfer of development rights shall not cause any harm or negative impacts on adjacent property e the transfer of development rights shall not cause harm or negative impacts on public facilities unless such impacts are mitigated developers agreement provided for in this section and approved by city council f fees application fees for transfer of development rights shall be in accordance with procedures fees division 1 land development fees the applicant shall be responsible for all application fees the applicant shall also be responsible for all consulting fees regarding planning engineering legal appraisal technical environmental and other issues related to this section unless otherwise authorized by the city council calculation and costs a calculation of density for the tdr bank calculation the transferable development right for a development unit shall be calculated and determined as provided in the section below only whole residential units may be purchased and transferred to the receiving site b cost of transferable development rights from cityowned sites 1 appraisal at the time of approval of the tdrs the city council shall consider the acceptance of the appraised land value for the sending site as follows the cost for a dwelling unit of development right shall be determined by the market value of the sending site as determined by a current real estate appraisal updated by no more than three 3 months from the date application is heard at a public hearing prepared for the city by an appraiser selected by the city manager but paid for by the applicant the appraisal amount also based on the permitted floor area ratio of allowable commercial space shall then be divided by the permitted residential units currently allowed under the land development regulations the city council may reduce the perunit cost to be competitive with other sending site tdrs 2 nonrefundable deposit approval of a receiving site shall be subject to payment of a nonrefundable deposit of ten 10 percent of the cost of the cityowned tdrs which shall be paid within ninety 90 working days of the city council approval of the application failure to make such a deposit within this time frame shall result in an automatic voiding of the city council approval full payment for the cityowned tdrs shall be made within thirty 30 working days of site plan approval for the receiving site c cost of transferable development rights issued by private owners from privately owned sending sites the price of tdrs from approved privately owned sending sites shall be determined by the private owners the city shall be notified of the negotiated price of all tdr transactions and shall be given the option of offering the sale of any cityowned tdrs to the receiving site property owner at the negotiated price the city shall exercise any option provided by this subsection within thirty 30 days of the date of any application received by the city for approval of a privately owned sending site procedures pertaining to the approval of development rights on a potential receiving site a application 1 no receiving site or site plan on a receiving site may be approved by the cra or city council unless a sending site has first been identified and approved by the cra and city council and the owner of the receiving site commits to purchase the tdrs already deposited in the tdr bank from a privately or publicly owned sending site the formal approval by the cra and city council of the transfer of tdrs whether from cityowned tdrs or from a privately owned sending site shall occur concurrently with the approval of the receiving sites conceptual site plan as defined in procedures division 4 although the actual transfer may only occur with the final site plan approval from the city manager or designee as provided in procedures   but in no event may site or building permits on a receiving site be issued until such transfer has actually occurred and been documented as provided herein 2 an applicant for the transfer of development rights to a potential receiving site shall file a complete application with the planning department this application shall include but not be limited to the following a the names addresses and signatures of all fee simple owners of all properties included in the receiving site fee simple owner for the purpose of this requirement shall be defined as all parties having a financial interest either direct or indirect in the subject matter of the application such disclosure shall include but not be limited to disclosure of all persons having an ownership interest direct or indirect in all properties involved in the application  b the street addresses and surveys of the properties involved legal description of each property or parcels involved  c a conceptual site plan for the receiving site as defined in procedures legislative and quasijudicial division 4 conditional use permits  d a general description of the densities intensities height and other aspects of the development of the proposed receiving site including parking facilities stormwater retention and any other applicable improvements  e a description of the proposed developments compliance with the comprehensive plan community redevelopment plan and the downtown master plan  f a rendering describing the architectural characteristics of the project from the perspective all adjacent roadways  g a description of any expected or granted variances conditional use permits development agreement andor publicprivate partnership agreements with the community redevelopment agency  h a letter confirming a preapplication meeting with the community development department as provided in procedures site plans  i any other requirements as deemed necessary by the administrator all of the aforementioned documents must be described summarized and agreed upon in a developers agreement pursuant to procedures development agreements of the citys land development regulations b review by the administrator 1 the administrator shall review the application and the developers agreement and schedule the application for public hearing with the community redevelopment agency the planning and zoning commission and the city council 2 the notice requirements shall be the same as the developers agreement process as provided in procedures development agreements of the citys land development regulations c review by the community redevelopment agency and city council the cra and city council after reviewing the application may in its sole discretion approve with modifications or conditions or approve less than the full amount of requested tdrs in which case the applicant shall return to the cra and city council with a revised site plan and developers agreement for its further consideration or deny the application of tdrs 1 it is understood and recognized by any and all applicants as well as any property owners within the approved sending and receiving site district that until a transfer of development rights is so approved by the city council said tdrs have no intrinsic or inherent value and cannot be considered as a matter of right in the valuation of any potential sending site or receiving site it is solely the final approval by the city council in its sole and complete discretion and based on the criteria set forth herein that gives rise to any value of and for tdrs 2 it is understood by any and all applicants that until a receiving site obtains final site plan approval from the city manager or designee no receiving site tdr transaction shall be recorded or recognized pursuant to this section 3 a resolution authorizing the withdrawal and transfer of tdrs from the tdr bank must be adopted prior to such transfer but once adopted shall automatically change the tdr bank statement to reflect the approved transaction subsequent to the mandatory recording of resolution by the city in the official records of brevard county florida 4 the cra and city council shall review the application for tdrs based on the following criteria  provided however that approval of the application in whole or in part is solely within the city councils discretion a the project is consistent with the comprehensive plan  b the project is consistent with the community redevelopment plan  c the project is consistent with the downtown master plan  and d the project meets all requirements of the land development regulations visibly shown in the conceptual site plan notwithstanding requirements related to engineering review in the site plan review process as stated in procedures site plans of the citys land development regulations unless otherwise permitted variance process 5 recording of documents prior to issuance of a site andor building permit documentation evidencing the transfer shall be recorded against the titles to both the receiving and sending sites as may be applicable in the public records of brevard county florida and an irrevocable covenant running with the land which shall include all conditions imposed by the city council and the land development regulations shall be recorded against the title to the receiving site in the public records of brevard county florida the covenant and all other documents recorded pursuant to this section for receiving sites of cityowned tdrs shall include a notification that the approval of the tdrs shall be extinguished in the event that no building permit has been issued for the receiving site within twentyfour 24 months from the date of the resolution rendered unless an extension is granted for twelve 12 months as provided by this section and shall contain a statement by which the owners of the receiving site shall agree to bind itself its successors and assigns with regard to all conditions restrictions and obligations contained therein developers agreement adopted pursuant procedures development agreements of the citys land development regulations all documents must be submitted to the planning department and must be in a form acceptable to the planning department the receiving site shall be labeled tdr on the official zoning map establishment of the tdr bank  deposits and withdrawals from the tdr bank  limitations a tdr bank the city council by the adoption of this section in the land development regulations hereby establishes the tdr bank which shall be maintained and operated by the city manager or designee for the deposit and withdrawalpurchase by private or nonprofit developers of developments and shall be retroactive to all tdr transactions involving cityowned tdrs 1 a tdr bank statement labeled as exhibit a shall be attached to each city council resolution authorizing the tdrs and the deposit or withdrawal of development rights shall be amended administratively and dated each time transfers are made in accordance with this section 2 the tdr bank statement will also indicate all approved transfers from privatelyowned sending sites the total tdrs transferred and an identification of the receiving site the tdr bank statement shall be amended administratively and dated each time transfers are made in accordance with this section secs 3311733130  reserved procedures article i  general provisions applicability a this chapter sets forth the general application and review procedures required for obtaining development orders and development permits this article also specifies the procedures for appealing or requesting reconsideration of decisions rezonings conditional use permits variances and legislative action the following procedures provide for the orderly review of permits and development orders in the florida statutes 1 generally the administrator is authorized and directed to prepare a development review procedures manual drpm containing supplemental administrative regulations and procedures forms applications submittal requirements internal review procedures charts and related materials consistent with the intent and content of this necessary to facilitate the efficient effective and equitable administration of this 2 format and publication the development review procedures manual shall be drafted in plain english shall have a table of contents and index and shall be published and made available to the general public at a cost not exceeding the actual cost of duplication 3 approval by city council the development review procedures manual shall be completed and submitted to the city council for approval by resolution amendments to the manual shall be presented to the city council for approval by resolution 4 resubmission no person may resubmit a rezoning comprehensive plan amendment cpa annexation or conditional use permit request within one 1 year after the first denial of said request by city council or two 2 years after the second denial a resubmittal is considered to be a request for identical zoning cpa annexation or conditional use a submittal with a significant change in either zoning cpa annexation or conditional use will not be considered identical establishment of the development review procedures manual drpm a procedures manual is hereby established the development review procedures manual provides additional standards criteria and submittal requirements for specific development order standards the applicant applications for a development order or permit approval will be accepted only from persons having the legal authority to take action in accordance with the permit or the development order approval sought applications shall be made by the owners or lessees of property or their agents or persons who have contracted to purchase property contingent upon their ability to acquire the necessary permits under this chapter or the agents of such persons who may make application in the name of such owners lessees or contract vendees the administrator may require an applicant to submit evidence of his authority to submit the application whenever there appears to be a reasonable basis for questioning this authority applications must be complete to form and content a applications shall be made on forms provided by the community development department and must be complete including all plans and attachments required by these regulations before the administrator is required to consider said application b of the development review procedures manual establishes additional application requirements that shall be met for all applications c a preapplication meeting shall be conducted with staff prior to the submittal of an application d application shall be made available to the public either in the community development department or city clerks office required information and forms the administrator shall provide necessary applications and other supplemental information as described in of the development review procedures manual reference to standards detailed or technical design requirements and construction specification relating to various types of improvements streets sidewalks etc are set forth in the city of titusville design and technical requirements manual further information regarding references to standards are established in of the development review procedures manual these regulations require a certain element of a development to be constructed in accordance with the detailed requirements set forth in one 1 or more of these regulations then no construction work on such element may be commenced until detailed construction drawings have been submitted to and approved by the administrator failure to observe this requirement may result in permit revocation denial of final subdivision plat approval or other penalty applications to be processed expeditiously applications shall be processed pursuant to of the development review procedures manual public hearing approvals required a the following actions require the approval of city council after review and recommendation by the planning and zoning commission and approval from the community redevelopment agency when required 1 annexations  2 amendments to the adopted comprehensive plan of the city of titusville including a amendments to the adopted goals objectives and policies of the comprehensive plan  b amendments to the future land use map comprehensive plan amendment or cpa  3 land development regulations  4 conditional uses in the districts where so designated see zoning  5 community redevelopment district activities acting as the community redevelopment agency cra  6 planned development planned industrial development planned office park regional mixeduse and urban village applications a master plan 7 subdivision approval for a sketch plat b final plat 8 other actions as directed by the city council administrative approvals required a the following activities require approval or the issuance of a development order permit by the community development department and are under the implementation authority of the administrator 1 all site plan approvals 2 building permits in compliance with these land development regulations 3 sign permits 4 interpretation of land uses where deemed appropriate 5 determination of consistency with the comprehensive plan and the concurrency management system as an individual determination or as part of the issuance of a development order 6 determination of compliance and issuance of a certificate of occupancy co 7 issuance of occupational licenses 8 application and collection of fees permits required no use of property or change to same including clearing grubbing grading or excavation shall be commenced nor shall buildings or other structures be constructed erected moved or altered without first obtaining a permit or approval as set forth in above permits applicable to land all development orders or permits shall be issued in the name of the applicant but shall apply to the land lot parcel or site described in said permit except for business tax receipts which apply to the individual as well as to the site burden of presenting evidence  burden of persuasion a the burden of presenting a complete application to the permitissuing body shall be upon the applicant the administrator shall determine if an application is complete before processing same b once a completed application has been submitted the burden of presenting evidence that the applications should be denied for any reason shall be upon the party or parties urging this position c the burden of persuasion on the issues of whether the development will comply with the requirements of this chapter remains at all times on the applicant the burden of persuasion on the issue of whether the application should be denied rests on the party or parties urging that the requested permit should be denied secs 34133420  reserved article ii  legislative and quasijudicial division 1  comprehensive plan amendment text amendment and map amendments both follow the same process below intent this division is intended to establish the procedure for adoption of a comprehensive plan amendment which takes approximately eight 8 months from application submittal to the final adoption hearings if approved for transmittal comprehensive plan amendments include text amendments and map amendments text amendments can modify add or delete the text of the citys comprehensive plan a map amendment can change the land use category on the citys future land use map the applicant shall supply all necessary data and analysis to support a request for a comprehensive plan amendment in addition the applicant must demonstrate that the proposed amendment is consistent with the elements of the comprehensive plan and the application shall contain the general requirements listed in this section below any provision of applicable law which is in conflict with these regulations shall control over these regulations and follow the procedures as set forth in of the florida statutes as amended required informationexhibits for any proposed amendment to the future land use map land use changes and annexations the applicant shall provide the submittals specified in the development review procedures manual the application shall provide information as set forth in the development review procedures manual discouragement of urban sprawl a the city will require a mixture of housing types and uses as a means to discourage urban sprawl reduce greenhouse gases and achieve energy efficient land use patterns the city shall control urban sprawl characterized by leapfrog development strip development and low density residential over a large area 1 the city shall only issue development orders or development permits consistent with the provisions of the city concurrency management system as provided in the land development regulations 2 all comprehensive plan amendments shall provide justification for the need for the proposed amendment and demonstrate how the proposed amendment discourages urban sprawl and not adversely impact natural resources in evaluating proposed amendments the city shall consider each of the following a the extent to which the proposed amendment is contiguous to an existing development area which has developed in a manner providing a compact contiguous development pattern with the proposed amendment  b the extent to which population growth and development trends warrant an amendment including an analysis of vested and approved but unbuilt development  c the extent to which adequate infrastructure to accommodate the proposed amendment exists or is programmed and funded adopted capital improvement schedule or will be privately financed binding executed agreement or will otherwise be provided at the time of development impacts as required by law  d the extent to which the amendment will result in an efficient use of public funds needed for the provision of new infrastructure and services related to it  e the extent to which the amendment will not result in a sprawl development pattern as determined by florida statutes and will not discourage infilling of more appropriate areas available for development within existing development area boundaries  and f the extent to which the amendment will result in a sustainable development pattern balance of land uses that is internally interrelated demonstrates an efficient use of land ensures compatible development adjacent to agriculture lands protects environmental qualities and characteristics provides interconnectivity of roadways supports the use of nonautomobile modes of transportation and appropriately addresses the infrastructure needs of the community g the extent to which the amendment results in positive market economic and fiscal benefits of the area as demonstrated market demand analysis economic impact analysis and fiscal impact analysis 3 the extension or expansion of utilities and roads should promote compact contiguous development patterns 4 the city shall encourage urban and suburban growth only in areas where public facilities and services exist and will not require expansion or increases in capacity as compared to existing facilities 5 comprehensive plan amendments to add development area shall be discouraged unless the applicant demonstrates the amendment provides economic development job creation preservation of the natural environment or other public benefit 6 the city shall encourage infill development infill development is development on a vacant parcel or parcels of land within areas that are surrounded by an existing built area compatibility of the infill development shall be considered with the development review process 7 the city shall encourage redevelopment of already developed properties so as to utilize existing public facilities and revitalize existing neighborhoods procedures for processing a comprehensive plan amendment comprehensive plan amendments shall be processed pursuant to of the florida statutes in addition to the procedures set forth in of the florida statutes the planning and zoning board shall make recommendations to the council as the local planning agency lpa pursuit to of the florida statutes transmittal public hearings a a transmittal public hearing shall be held by the city council pursuant to of the florida statutes b in addition to the advertising and notice required by of the florida statutes in the event the city initiates a comprehensive plan amendment that changes the permitted uses of land or changes land use categories the city shall mail to the property owners affected by the plan amendment a courtesy notice to the property owners within five hundred 500 feet of the property as shown on the latest ad valorem tax roles at least ten 10 days in advance of the meeting of the city council the failure to receive the courtesy notice shall not be grounds to invalidate the plan amendment request reapplication no person may resubmit a comprehensive plan amendment request within one 1 year after the first denial of said request by city council or two 2 years after the second denial a resubmittal is considered to be a request for identical comprehensive plan amendment a submittal with a significant change in the zoning land use will not be considered identical secs 34273435  reserved division 2  rezonings and text amendments zoning amendments and rezoning rezoning the city council and any property owner may request that their property be rezoned by filing with the city a written rezoning application rezoning applications shall be submitted and hearing dates established in accordance with the application deadline and meeting schedule published by the city and available in the community development department and the city clerks office all applications shall be accompanied by a fee as set forth in the land development fee schedule found on the city of titusville website under community developmentdevelopment servicesfee schedule as adopted amendments to land development regulations the city council and any property owner or his duly authorized agent may request an amendment to any section or requirement contained within these land development regulations amendments include changes additions and deletions and shall be processed in the same manner as a rezoning request any such proposal that affects the provisions of the comprehensive plan shall also be considered a comprehensive plan amendment and be processed pursuant to this chapter preapplication meeting a preapplication meeting shall be held with staff prior to the submittal of an application for a rezoning or text amendment submittals a the applicant shall provide the submittals specified in the procedures manual as set forth in the development review procedures manual b in the event the requested rezoning is to a classification which is inconsistent with the city of titusville comprehensive plan andor the future land use map then the application shall be returned to the applicant for resubmittal and processing as a comprehensive plan amendment cpa pursuant to division 1 comprehensive plan amendment if the zoning request is consistent the application shall be processed as set forth in these regulations criteria a the application shall be forwarded to the planning and zoning commission for their review and recommendation to the city council the application shall be reviewed by the planning and zoning commission and the city council based upon the following criteria 1 whether the application is consistent with the adopted comprehensive plan and associated elements a public facilities as required by the comprehensive plan and land development regulations will be available and concurrent with the development b adequate existing improved public streets are available andor the applicant has made provisions for installation of said improvements c the land will support the proposed development and will not be subject to flooding or other physical constraints so as not to support the development d the environmental impact of the proposed rezoning 2 the existing zoning if deemed consistent with the comprehensive plan shall be presumed correct unless substantial change in the area has occurred since the original zoning 3 the density or intensity of the proposed rezoning and use shall be consistent with a the development in the area  and b not likely to cause a depreciation of property values in the area 4 that the application is consistent with zoning in the area 5 that the application will protect the public health safety morals or welfare of the general public 6 whether the applicant has sufficiently protected adjacent land uses and zoning districts by adequate buffering and screening 7 there are substantial reasons why the property cannot be used in the existing zoning district advertising and notice a the required public hearings shall provide for all parties in interest to be heard the procedure for publication of notice for the public hearing on any request shall be in accordance with chapters 163 166 or 171 florida statutes whichever is applicable and at least ten 10 days notice of the time and place of such hearing shall be published in a newspaper of general circulation in the city in addition a courtesy notice will be sent to the property owners as shown on the latest brevard county property appraisers ad valorem tax roll located within five hundred 500 feet of the property in addition the city will post a notice on subject property at least ten 10 days prior to the public hearing the failure to deliver a courtesy notice or the failure of an adjacent property owner to receive a courtesy notice or failure to post the property shall not be grounds to invalidate the request b approval of a rezoning request shall be granted based on a positive vote by a majority of city council three 3 members a rezoning request shall be deemed denied when three 3 members of the city council vote against a motion to approve the request or when three 3 members vote for approval of the motion to deny the request in the event of a tie vote or in the event of a two 2 to one 1 vote the action of the city council shall be considered to be denial of the rezoning request reapplication no person may resubmit a rezoning request within one 1 year after the first denial of said request by city council or two 2 years after the second denial a resubmittal is considered to be a request for identical zoning a submittal with a significant change in the rezoning will not be considered identical secs 34433450  reserved division 3  master plans master plan a master plan is a landuse plan focused on one 1 or more sites within an area that identifies site access and general improvements and is intended to guide growth and development over a number of years or in several phases applicability a a master plan adopted prior to the effective date of this ordinance shall continue to be governed by the terms of such plans unless expired all master plans shall be indicated on the zoning atlas b a district wide master plan is required with the submittal of a planned development pd rezoning c a district wide master plan is required prior to development in the regional mixeduse rmu urban village uv and planned industrial development pid zoning districts planned development districts rezoning a planned development pd is a special district used to establish a zoning category to facilitate unique development within an established future land use designation the purpose of a pd district is to provide flexibility in the planning and construction of development projects by allowing a combination of uses developed in accordance with an approved plan that protects adjacent properties  provide an environment within the layout of a site that contributes to a sense of community and coherent living style  encourage the preservation and enhancement of natural amenities and cultural resources and to provide for a minimum amount of open space  provide for a more efficient arrangement of land uses buildings circulation systems and infrastructure  and encourage infill projects and the development of sites made difficult for conventionally designed development because of shape size abutting development or natural features a pd district is intended to assure that a project is developed to the highest aesthetic standards of the city of titusville and all uses shall be consistent with the designated future land use unified control a all land included in a master plan shall be under the legal control of the applicant whether the applicant is an individual partnership corporation or group of individuals the applicant shall state agreement to 1 proceed with the proposed development according to the provisions of this chapter  2 provide agreements contracts deed restrictions and sureties acceptable to city council for completion of the development according to the approved plans and maintenance of such areas functions and facilities as are not to be provided operated or maintained at public expense  and 3 bind their successors in title to any commitments made under 1 and 2 aforementioned b all such agreements and evidence of unified control shall be examined by the city attorney a master plan shall only be approved after review by the city attorney to confirm that agreements and evidence of unified control meet the requirements of this district master plan submittal a master plan submittal a master plan is required for determination as to the internal relationship between uses activities proposed and their supporting systems and facilities the master plan shall also address the relation to surrounding uses activities systems and facilities the master plan shall at a minimum contain the following information as set forth in the development review procedures manual 1 application and fee  2 name of the proposed development name or names of the developers name of owner architect landscape architect surveyor engineer andor land planner  3 location map showing the relationship of the proposed development to the existing and any proposed streets and any other property owned by the subdivider in that vicinity 4 survey of the parcel showing boundaries total acreage parcel numbers legal description and all encumbrances such as easements rightsofway etc 5 site data including parcel size current zoning and future land use classification lands to be dedicated to public use proposed easements rightsofway 6 existing site characteristics including general information on site conditions and characteristics including adjacent developments wooded areas location of major trees existing utilities ditches swales wetlands and water bodies flood zoned topography soils types and areas of critical concern note any variances or conditional use permits that have been granted for the site 7 proposed plan illustrating streets lots and other features such as common areas retention areas parks etc street layouts shall indicate the type of street and proposed rightsofway lot layouts shall identify the proposed number of lots and proposed lot sizes 8 the general layout of water sewer and storm water systems including proposed connections for water and sewer and the legal positive outfall location for the storm water management system summary should include estimate of water allocation permit quantities total average daily water demand  gallons 9 proposed phasing if any with projected buildout date 10 an analysis of the proposed project relative to the citys concurrency management standards 11 development plan identifying the location and acreage of each component and district of the project including the location and placement of proposed land uses by type and density 12 additional submittal requirements as set forth per the development review procedures manual deviations from approved plans deviations from approved development concept plans or failure to comply with any requirement condition or safeguard imposed by the city council during the approval or platting process shall constitute a violation of these land development regulations master plan approval a following review and administrative approval of the master plan the applicant shall submit the master plan to the planning and zoning commission for their recommendation and to the city council for final approval the master plan shall include the internal road network of all collector and arterial road rightsofway and their ingressegress points into the development alteration of collector or arterial road rightsofway or ingressegress points into the development shall require an amendment to the master plan at the discretion of the administrator consistent with the modification classification table in the development review procedures manual alterations to the internal road network with a local street designation which does not involve ingressegress points into the development may be approved administratively without revising the master plan conditions may be imposed as part of the approval process b upon review of the plan by the city a public hearing shall be held to obtain input on the proposed master plan in accordance with the applicable state statutes and city ordinances the required public hearing notice shall be provided in accordance with division 2 rezoning and text amendments advertising and notice c following receipt of the recommendations of the city manager or designee and the planning and zoning commission and upon consideration of public input obtained at the public hearing and review of the planned development rezoning ordinance the city council shall adopt adopt with conditions or deny the application at the public hearing any and all conditions of the rezoning ordinance shall be reviewed by the city council at the public hearing prior to final adoption the adopted rezoning ordinance shall establish the planned development zoning classification on the specified parcel resolution and ordinance structure all master plan resolutions and planned development rezoning ordinances shall follow the standard format specified in the development review procedures manual 62 resolution and  exceptions to this requirement are planned developments in the urban village uv regional mixeduse rmu and planned industrial development pid zoning districts these zoning districts establish allowable uses and development standards approved master plan amendment to a current approved master plan that does not involve a change of use may be processed as a master plan per the approval process established within this division conceptual plat a conceptual plat may be submitted with a master plan and approved as part of the rezoning all information required to review and approve a master plan shall be submitted per procedures subdivisions division 4 plat subdivision 1 sketch plat of the land development regulations the master plan procedures shall not preclude the need for a recorded plat or approved site plan prior to the first lot conveyance or certificate of occupancy phasing a phasing schedule for any development proposal to be completed in more than one 1 phase shall be submitted for approval with the master plan a development agreement may be submitted and approved with a master plan all information required to review and approve a development agreement shall be submitted amendment to the master plan amendments to an approved master plan shall follow the procedures in the development review procedures manual secs 34633470  reserved division 4  conditional use permits cup intent conditional use permits cup are uses that would not generally be appropriate to a zoning district without compliances to more stringent development standards or conditions the list of cups are those listed in use table procedure for obtaining a conditional use permit a in addition to the following the cup shall require the submittals specified in the development review procedures manual 1 the property owner or authorized agent shall meet with the administrator to explain the proposal learn the procedures and obtain an application form 2 the applicant shall file the completed application form together with the required exhibits with the administrator and shall pay the required fees all applications for a conditional use permit must be received by the city by the application deadline date established in the application deadline and meeting schedule available at the city 3 the administrator shall transmit the application to the planning and zoning commission and shall notify all property owners within five hundred 500 feet of the outer boundaries of the property in question failure of an adjacent property owner to receive notice shall not invalidate the city councils final action 4 the planning and zoning commission shall meet and determine compliance with these regulations and possible adverse effects of the proposed conditional use and determine what additional requirements may be necessary to reduce such adverse effects and recommend to the city council one 1 of three 3 actions  approval denial or conditional approval 5 after transmittal of the planning and zoning commission recommendation the city council takes official action on the request generally a each conditional use shall be reviewed for application to the zoning district it may be applied to and the criteria and requirements contained in these regulations the city council shall take appropriate action on the request for conditional use permit after considering the recommendations by the planning and zoning commission the city council shall review the request in accordance with the criteria set forth in these regulations if it grants a conditional use permit the city council may impose conditions including time limits it considers necessary to protect the public health safety and welfare b conditional use permits issued to properties which subsequently are divided into two 2 or more lots or parcels shall be retained only on those parcels that still meet the conditions of the conditional use permit which are in effect at the time the land is subdivided required exhibits a no request for a conditional use permit will be accepted for processing until a complete application packet has been submitted by the applicant for the purpose of this section a complete application packet shall consist of the information as set forth in the development review procedures manual b in addition to the exhibits required per of the development review technical manual additional exhibits may be required other information which may be requested by the staff the planning and zoning commission or city council relative to a specific conditional use permit application must be provided at least one 1 week prior to the time of the applicable public hearing c in stating grounds in support of an application for a conditional use permit it is necessary to show how the request fulfills both the general and specific standards for review the applicant must show the effect the granting of the conditional use permit will have on adjacent and nearby properties including as appropriate but not limited to traffic and pedestrian flow and safety curbcuts offstreet loading and parking offstreet pickup of passengers odor glare and noise particulates smoke fumes and other emissions refuse and service areas drainage screening and buffering for protection of adjacent and nearby properties and open space and economic impact on nearby properties the applicant at his discretion may choose to present expert testimony where necessary to show the effect of granting the conditional use permit design requirements the granting of a conditional use permit does not eliminate the need for the proposed development to meet all appropriate land development regulations prior to the approval of required development orders or business tax receipts in addition the city council may require additional design standards based upon the proposed use and impacts on neighboring properties review criteria a before any conditional use is granted city council shall apply the standards set forth herein and shall determine that satisfactory provisions and
